585.description: An Act To Create The Revised Mississippi Dairy Industry Stabilization Act For The Purpose Of Revitalizing The Dairy Industry And Increasing Output Of Dairy Products In The State By Providing Financial Assistance To Dairy Producers; To Require The Commissioner Of Agriculture And Commerce To Establish The Minimum Price For Fluid Milk; To Prescribe The Process By Which The Commissioner Shall Determine The Minimum Price Using The Southern Average Cost Of Production; To Require The Commissioner To Announce And Publish The Minimum Price For Fluid Milk For The Next Calendar Year By November 1 Of Each Year And To Adjust The Price At Certain Other Times During The Year Using The Most Currently Available Southern Average Cost Of Production; To Require The Commissioner To Estimate The Quantity Of All Milk To Be Produced In The State And Marketed By Producers For Commercial Use During The Next Year By November 1 Of Each Year; To Require The Commissioner To Determine The Total Quantity Of All Milk Produced By Each Producer Or Farming Operation During The Preceding Calendar Year By February 1 Of Each Year; To Permit The Commissioner To Contract With Certain Nongovernmental Or Not-for-profit Organizations For The Purchase Of Any Surplus Fluid Milk Or Milk Products In Excess Of The State's Demand If Certain Conditions Are Met; To Permit The Commissioner To Implement A Reduction In The Minimum Price If The Commissioner Is Not Able To Contract With Those Organizations For The Purchase Of Surplus Fluid Milk Or Milk Products Capable Of Sustaining The Minimum Price, Subject To Limitation; To Authorize The Commissioner To Impose An Annual Pound Limit Upon The Amount Of Fluid Milk Allowed To Be Unloaded By Dairy Farmers Or Producers During The Calendar Year; To Authorize The Commissioner Of Agriculture And Commerce To Cooperate With And Enter Into Agreement With The Commissioner Of Corrections To Establish, Implement And Manage Dairy Production And Processing As A Component Of Prison Agricultural Enterprises; To Create The Revised Mississippi Dairy Industry Stabilization Fund; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Administer Such Fund For The Purpose Of Making Loans To Dairy Producers To Assist In Completing Certain Projects To Restore Hurricane Katrina Damaged Dairies, Upgrade Equipment And Refinance Debt; To Authorize The Issuance Of $10,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Dairy Industry Stabilization Fund; To Amend Section 47-5-355, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Bring Forward Sections 69-2-13, 69-2-15, 69-2-17, 69-2-19, 69-2-21, 69-2-23, 69-2-25, 69-2-27, 69-2-29, 69-2-30, 69-2-31, 69-2-33, 69-2-35, 69-2-37, 69-2-39, 69-2-40 And 69-2-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establish The Emerging Crops Fund, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

586.title: Dairy Stabilization Grant Program; create to provide grant assistance to certain milk producers.
586.description: An Act To Provide For The Creation Of The Dairy Stabilization Grant Program; To Provide That The Dairy Stabilization Grant Program Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Provide That Recipients Of Grant Funds Shall Be Limited To Milk Producers Who Have Previously Received A Milk Producers Transportation Cost Assistance Loan; To Establish The Minimum Application Requirements For Milk Producers Applying For A Dairy Stabilization Grant; To Provide That The Maximum Grant Amount Received By A Milk Producer Shall Not Exceed The Amount Of The Original Loan; To Impose Certain Restrictions On The Use Of Grant Funds; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Dairy Stabilization Grant Fund; And For Related Purposes.

587.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize issuance to supporters of Simpson Academy.
587.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Simpson Academy; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

588.title: History and social studies curriculum; require use of textbooks and teachings to include greater instruction on the nation's founding documents.
588.description: An Act To Require The State Board Of Education To Revise The History And Social Studies Curriculum And Textbooks Requirements To Include Greater Instruction On The Nation's Founding Documents, To Be Implemented Beginning With The 2012-2013 Academic School Year; To Provide That Local School Boards Shall Require That The Instructional Materials Used And Lesson Components Adhere To The Curriculum Adopted By The State Board Of Education; To Require That The Curriculum Be Based On Relevant Evidentiary And Historical Facts, Data And Documentation; To Prohibit The Inclusion Of Historical Revisionism And Evidence Of Bias In Instruction; And For Related Purposes.

589.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize issuance to supporters of The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society.
589.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

590.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize issuance to supporters of Mississippi filmmakers.
590.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of Filmmakers In Mississippi; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

591.title: Justice court judges; sitting judges exempt from education requirements.
591.description: An Act To Amend Sections 9-11-3 And 9-11-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Certain Justice Court Judges From The Competency Examination Enacted In The Justice Court Reform Act Of 2008; And For Related Purposes.

592.title: Electric power associations; provide jurisdiction of right-of-way matters to be under PSC.
592.description: An Act To Create New Code Section 77-5-257, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Grant The Public Service Commission Jurisdiction Over Electric Power Associations When The Associations Condemn To Obtain Rights-of-way; To Provide That Associations Must Petition The Commission For A Hearing Concerning Rights-of-way Matters; To Provide That The Property Owners And The Associates Must File Certain Statements With The Commission, Which Shall Serve As Pleadings; To Provide The Appeals Process For Any Final Order Of The Commission; To Amend Section 77-5-231, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

593.title: Department of Corrections; require release of offender's medical records to certain individual if certain conditions met.
593.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Corrections To Allow A Designated Individual To Access The Medical Records Of An Offender If The Offender Has Provided Advanced Written Consent For Such Access And If The Designated Individual Pays Certain Required Photocopying Fees; And For Related Purposes.

594.title: Bonds; increase amount that may be issued for the Local Governments and Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan Fund.
594.description: An Act To Amend Sections 6 Through 20, Chapter 521, Laws Of 1995, As Last Amended By Section 47, Chapter 533, Laws Of 2010, To Increase From $26,143,000.00 To $28,843,000.00 The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued For The Local Governments And Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan Fund; And For Related Purposes.

595.title: Medicaid; provide for an optional arbitration hearing for a provider to resolve a dispute regarding a reimbursement decision.
595.description: An Act To Give Medicaid Providers The Option Of Having An Arbitration Hearing To Resolve A Dispute With The Division Of Medicaid About A Decision Of The Division That Adversely Affects The Provider's Medicaid Reimbursement; To Provide For The Appointment Of The Arbitrator; To Provide That The Final Decision Of The Arbitrator Shall Be Binding On Both Parties; And For Related Purposes.

596.title: Driver's license suspension, cancellation or revocation; require Commissioner of Public Safety to notify by certified mail at least 30 days before.
596.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-52, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Notice Of Suspension, Cancellation Or Revocation Of A Person's Driver's License Or Driving Privileges Shall Be In Writing By Certified Mail, Personal Service Or Personal Notice Instead Of By First Class Mail For A Suspension, Cancellation Or Revocation Of A Person's Driver's License Under The Mississippi Commercial Driver's License Law, The Youth Court Law And Certain Other Laws; To Require That The Notice Of Suspension, Cancellation Or Revocation Of A Person's Driver's License Or Driving Privileges Shall Include The Jurisdiction, Docket And Page Of The Docket Where The Cause For Suspension, Revocation Or Cancellation Is Assigned; To Require That The Notice Of Suspension, Cancellation Or Revocation Of A Person's Driver's License Or Driving Privileges Shall Be Given At Least Thirty Days Before The Suspension, Cancellation Or Revocation; And For Related Purposes.

597.title: Sales tax; delete repealer on tax imposed on sales of machinery and construction services at certain refineries.
597.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Repealer On The Provision Of Law Which Levies A Tax On The Sale Of Manufacturing Or Processing Machinery Installed Or Used At A Refinery In This State And On Construction Activities Performed At Or In Regard To A Refinery In This State, Requires The Owner Of A Refinery Holding A Direct Pay Permit Issued By The Department Of Revenue To Furnish The Permit To The Seller Or Person Performing The Construction Activity Unless Otherwise Authorized By The Commissioner Of Revenue, And Provides That After Being Furnished The Direct Pay Permit, The Seller Or Person Performing The Construction Activity Will Be Relieved Of The Duty To Collect The Tax And The Owner Of The Refinery Will Pay The Tax; To Amend Section 27-65-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Reverter On The Provision Of Law That Exempts Construction Activities Performed At Certain Refineries From The Tax Imposed By This Section; And For Related Purposes.

598.title: Uniform Real Property Electronic Recording Act; enact.
598.description: An Act To Create The Uniform Real Property Electronic Recording Act; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide For The Validity Of Electronic Documents; To Provide For The Recording Of Electronic Documents; To Create The Mississippi Electronic Recording Commission; To Provide For Administration And Standards; To Provide For Uniformity; To Clarify The Relation Of This Act To Electronic Signatures In Global And National Commerce Act; To Amend Sections 89-3-1, 89-5-1 And 89-5-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

599.title: Real property; require increased font size and certain identifying information for all instruments presented for recording.
599.description: An Act To Amend Section 89-5-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Minimum Font For Certain Legal Typed Instruments To Be Presented For Recording Be Increased From 8-point To 10-point Font Size; To Clarify The Content Of The Recording Information To Be Placed On The First Page Of The Document; And For Related Purposes.

600.title: Emergency medical services and statewide trauma care system; reenact and extend repealer on certain provisions regarding.
600.description: An Act To Reenact Section 41-59-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Definitions For The Emergency Medical Services Act; To Reenact Section 41-59-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Directs The State Board Of Health To Establish And Maintain An Emergency Medical Services Program And A Uniform Statewide Trauma Care System And Assess Fees For Hospitals That Choose Not To Participate In The Trauma Care System; To Reenact Section 41-59-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Creates An Emergency Medical Services Advisory Council; To Reenact Section 41-59-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes The Mississippi Trauma Care Systems Fund And The Mississippi Trauma Care Escrow Fund; To Reenact Section 27-19-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Issuance Of License Tags And Decals For Motor Vehicles And Imposes A Registration Fee For The Issuance Of Those Tags And Decals; To Reenact Section 41-9-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes Hospitals To Charge The Patient For The Reasonable Cost Of Activating Trauma Care Services Under Certain Circumstances; To Reenact Section 63-17-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Levies A Point-of-sale Fee On Retail Sales Of All-terrain Vehicles And Motorcycles For Deposit Into The Mississippi Trauma Care Systems Fund; To Reenact Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Standard State Monetary Assessments For Certain Violations, Misdemeanors And Felonies; To Amend Section 9, Chapter 549, Laws Of 2008, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On Those Reenacted Sections; And For Related Purposes.

601.title: Legal holiday; set last day of February (African American Day) as.
601.description: An Act To Amend Section 3-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Last Day Of February (african American Day) Shall Be Declared To Be A Legal Holiday; To Clarify That When A Legal Holiday Falls On A Saturday Or Sunday, Then The Next Following Monday, Or Other Day Fixed By Proclamation Of The Governor As The Day To Celebrate The Holiday, Shall Be A Legal Holiday; And For Related Purposes.

602.title: Orthotists and prosthetists; allow those certified by Board for Orthotist/Prosthetist Certification to practice in Mississippi.
602.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-22-1 And 73-22-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Orthotists And Prosthetists Who Have Been Certified By The Board For Orthotist/prosthetist Certification To Practice In Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

603.title: Sex offenders; clarify notification to volunteer organizations regarding status.
603.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-33-32, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Duty Of A Sex Offender To Notify A Volunteer Organization Regarding Offender Status; And For Related Purposes.

604.title: Nursing; delete requirement that advanced practice nurses must practice within collaborative relationship with a physician.
604.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-15-5 And 73-15-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Requirement That Advanced Practice Registered Nurses Must Practice Within A Collaborative Or Consultative Relationship With A Physician Or Dentist; And For Related Purposes.

605.title: Driver's license; provide for 8-year license as option to 4-year license during fiscal year 2012.
605.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For An 8-year Driver's License As An Option To A 4-year License; To Amend Section 63-1-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Amount Of The Fee For An Eight-year License; To Amend Section 63-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Punishment For Driving Without A Driver's License To The Punishment For Driving With A Suspended Driver's License; And For Related Purposes.

606.title: Social workers and marriage and family therapists; reenact and revise licensure laws and extend repealer on.
606.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 73-53-3, 73-53-8, 73-53-10, 73-53-11 And 73-53-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Definitions For The Social Worker Licensure Law, Create The Board Of Examiners For Social Workers And Marriage And Family Therapists, Set Out The Powers Of The Board, And Prescribe The Licensure Requirements For Social Workers, And 73-54-1 Through 73-54-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Licensure And Regulation Of Marriage And Family Therapists; To Amend Section 73-53-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Statement Of Purpose Of The Social Worker Licensure Law; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-53-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Definitions For Additional Terms For The Purpose Of The Social Worker Licensure Law; To Amend Section 73-53-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify A Reference; To Amend Section 73-53-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Use Of Certain Titles Or Letters Indicating Or Implying That A Person Is A Social Worker Unless The Person Holds A Valid Social Worker License; To Delete Certain Grandfather Provisions For Licensure; To Increase The Penalties For Violations Of The Social Worker Licensure Law; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-53-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Period During Which Marriage And Family Therapists Appointed To The Board Must Have Been Actively Engaged In Practice Immediately Before Appointment To The Board; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-53-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Monetary Penalties Imposed By The Board Shall Be Deposited Into The Board's Special Fund Instead Of Into The State General Fund; To Revise Who Is Authorized To Sign Requisitions For Expenditures Of Monies In The Board's Special Fund; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-53-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Additional Powers To The Board; To Amend Section 73-53-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Type Of Examination That Applicants Must Pass For Social Worker Licensure; To Require Applicants For Social Worker Licensure To Complete Criminal History Records Checks; To Amend Section 73-53-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe The Procedure For Application For Licensure As A Social Worker Or Marriage And Family Therapist; To Authorize The Board To Change The Amount Of Fees Through Its Rulemaking Authority; To Authorize The Board To Charge Examination Fees To Applicants; To Authorize The Board To Issue Temporary Licenses During A Declared Disaster Or Emergency; To Amend Section 73-53-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Additional Grounds For Disciplinary Action Against Licensees And Applicants; To Amend Section 73-53-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Complaints Filed With The Board Against A Licensee Must Contain The Name Of The Complaining Party; To Amend Section 73-53-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Person Whose Application For A License Is Denied Is Entitled To A Hearing Before The Board Upon Written Request; To Amend Section 73-53-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Types Of Sanctions Available To The Board For Disciplinary Action Against Licensees Or Applicants; To Amend Section 73-53-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Provision That A Circuit Court May Order The Attendance Of Witnesses And The Production Of Documents In Any Hearing Before The Board; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-54-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define "marriage And Family Therapy Associate" For The Purposes Of The Marriage And Family Therapy Licensure Law; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-54-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Persons Who Do Not Hold A Valid And Current License Issued By The Board From Practicing Marriage And Family Therapy; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-54-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete A Term That Marriage And Family Therapy Interns Were Authorized To Use; To Amend Reenacted Sections 73-54-11, 73-54-13, 73-54-37 And 73-54-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Licensure Of Marriage And Family Therapy Associates; To Repeal Section 73-54-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribes The Qualifications For Marriage And Family Therapist License Applicants On Or Before September 1, 2000; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-54-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Educational And Experience Qualifications For Licensure As A Marriage And Family Therapist; To Prescribe The Qualifications For Licensure As A Marriage And Family Therapy Associate; To Require Applicants For Either License To Complete Criminal History Records Checks; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-54-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Provisions Relating To Administration Of The Licensure Examination; To Provide That The Cost Of The Examination Shall Be Paid By The Applicant; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-54-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Marriage And Family Therapists Licensed In Other States Who Apply For Licensure By Reciprocity Must Have Passed The National Examination In Marital And Family Therapy; To Repeal Section 73-54-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Directs The Board To Charge An Application Fee And Examination Fee To Applicants For Licensure As A Marriage And Family Therapist; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-54-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Amount Of The License Renewal Fee; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-54-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add Continued Practice With A Lapsed License As A Ground For Disciplinary Action Against A Licensee; To Amend Section 73-54-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Reenacted Sections; And For Related Purposes.

607.title: State Longitudinal Data System; develop to establish a multiagency database.
607.description: An Act To Provide For The Development Of A State Longitudinal Data System (slds) To Establish A Multiagency Database To Track Education And Student Outcomes In The Workforce; To Provide For Interagency Cooperation With The State Longitudinal Data System; To Establish A State Longitudinal Data System Governing Board And Provide For Its Composition; To Prescribe The Powers And Duties Of The Board; To Require That The Data Provided To The State Longitudinal Data System Be Provided In Accordance With All Applicable Laws Governing The Protection And Sharing Of Data; And For Related Purposes.

608.title: Uniform Prudent Management of Institutional Funds Act; enact.
608.description: An Act To Create The Uniform Prudent Management Of Institutional Funds Act; To Enact A Short Title; To Create Definitions; To Set The Standard Of Conduct In Managing And Investing Institutional Funds; To Enact Default Rules Of Construction; To Provide For The Delegation Of Management And Investment Functions; To Provide For The Release Or Modification Of Restrictions On Management, Investment Or Purpose; To Specify In What Way Compliance With The Act Will Be Determined; To Make Transition Provisions; To Provide For The Relationship Of The Act To Certain Other Laws; To Provide For Uniformity Of Application And Construction; To Repeal Sections 79-11-601 Through 79-11-617, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Constitute The Uniform Management Of Institutional Funds Act; And For Related Purposes.

610.title: Dropout Prevention and Student Re-engagement Act; create.
610.description: An Act To Be Known As The "dropout Prevention And Student Re-engagement Act"; To Provide The Legislative Intent And Goal Benchmarks For This Act To Decrease The High School Dropout Rate And Increase The Graduation Rate By The 2018-2019 School Year; To Define Terms Used In This Act; To Amend Section 37-13-80, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Office Of Dropout Prevention To Use Certain Funding To Implement This Act; To Require The Office To Collaborate With Local Educational Agencies To Reduce The Statewide And Local Student Dropout Rates And To Increase The Statewide And Local Graduation And Completion Rates In The State; To Require The Office To Take Certain Actions With Regard To The Evaluation And Implementation Of Policies Used By Local Educational Agencies In Analyzing Dropout Rates And Graduation And Completion Rates; To Require The Office To Identify Local Educational Agencies Failing To Meet Their Established Graduation And Completion Rate Expectations; To Require The Department To Provide Technical Assistance To Certain Local Educational Agencies; To Require The Office To Review The Existing Research And Data And Compile A Report Of Effective Dropout Prevention And Student Engagement And Re-engagement Policies And Strategies Implemented By Local Educational Agencies Within This State And In Other States; To Amend Section 37-13-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Office Of Compulsory School Attendance Enforcement To Analyze Data Collected By The Local Educational Agencies For Purposes Of Compiling A Report To Be Submitted To The Board And The Legislature; To Require High Priority And Priority Local Educational Agencies To Conduct A Practices Assessment; To Require High Priority Local Educational Agencies To Adopt A Student Graduation And Completion Plan And Prescribe Its Required Components; To Require Local Educational Agencies To Notify A Student's Parent If The Student Drops Out Of School; To Establish The "student Re-engagement Grant Program Fund" In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Providing Grants To Local Educational Agencies For Use In Providing Educational Services And Supports To Students, And To Provide For Its Funding; And For Related Purposes.

612.title: Elementary school counselors; allocate funds under the Mississippi Adequate Education Program for.
612.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Allocation Of Funds Under The Adequate Education Program For The Purpose Of Employing Elementary School Counselors; To Require The Funds To Be Allocated To Those School Districts Having The Highest Documented Need For Counselors; To Provide An Additional Allocation Of Funds In Each Later Fiscal Year Until Each Elementary School Has Employed At Least One Counselor; To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Employ A Supervisor Of Counselors; To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

613.title: School curriculum; require students to receive additional instruction in healthy living.
613.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-134, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Public School Students To Receive Twenty Hours Per School Year Of Healthy Living Instruction And To Require The Health Education Curriculum In The Public Schools To Promote The Making Of Healthy Choices In Nutrition, Exercise And Behavior; And For Related Purposes.

614.title: Sickle cell disease; create task force to study growing incidence and available treatment options.
614.description: An Act To Create The Concern For Children With Sickle Cell Disease Task Force; To Provide For The Membership Of The Task Force; To Set Forth The Duties Of The Task Force; And For Related Purposes.

615.title: Mental Health, Board of; two members shall be appointed to represent the regional mental health centers.
615.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-4-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Governor Shall Appoint Members To The State Board Of Mental Health To Represent The Regional Mental Health/intellectual Disability Centers At The Expiration Of The Terms Of The Board Members Appointed From Congressional Districts Whose Terms Expire In 2011 And 2012; And For Related Purposes.

616.title: School buses; authorize use for mass transportation needs at military air show.
616.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-41-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Local School Boards To Permit School Buses To Be Used For The Mass Transportation Of Spectators At Military Air Shows; And For Related Purposes.

617.title: Appropriation; Joint Code Committee, additional for FY11.
617.description: An Act Making An Additional Appropriation To The Joint Code Committee For The Purpose Of Paying The Cost Of Mississippi Code Products For State And Local Officials And Agencies As Required By Statute And Contract For The Fiscal Year 2011.

618.title: Kindergarten enrollment; require SDE to survey school districts on feasibility of changing date to July 1 for five-year-olds.
618.description: An Act To Direct The State Department Of Education To Conduct A Survey Of Each Public School District To Determine The Feasibility Of Enrolling Children In Public School Kindergarten Who Attain Five Years Of Age On July 1, As Opposed To September 1; To Require That A Report Of The Department's Findings Be Presented To The Legislature For Consideration By January 1, 2012; And For Related Purposes.

619.title: Public Safety Verification and Enforcement Act; create.
619.description: An Act To Create The Public Safety Verification And Enforcement Act; To Require The Department Of Public Safety, In Cooperation With The Commissioner Of Insurance And Department Of Revenue, To Create An Accessible Common Carrier-based Motor Vehicle Insurance Verification System; To Provide For Law Enforcement Use Of The System; To Allow Insurers To Provide Certain Information To Be Used In The System; To Require The Department Of Public Safety To Administer And Enforce The Provisions Of This Act And Require The Department To Make Rules Necessary For The Administration Of The Motor Vehicle Insurance Verification System Created Under This Act; To Require Compliance With The Motor Vehicle Safety-responsibility Act Before Receiving A Motor Vehicle License Tag; To Require The Owner Of The Motor Vehicle To Maintain Continuous Coverage Throughout The License Period; To Authorize Suspension Of Driving Privileges If A Motor Vehicle Owner Fails To Have The Required Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance; To Authorize The Commissioner Of Public Safety To Impose Civil Penalties Because Of Such Failure; To Provide The Requirements For Reinstatement Of A Suspended License; To Provide That Monies From The Commissioner's Civil Penalties Shall Be Deposited Into A Special Fund In The State Treasury To Be Known As The Motorist Identification Database Fund; To Provide That Monies In The Special Fund May Be Used By The Department Of Public Safety, Upon Appropriation By The Legislature, For The Purpose Of Defraying Expenses And Costs For The Motor Vehicle Insurance Verification System; To Provide That Monies In The Special Fund In Excess Of The Amount Needed To Defray The Expenses And Costs Of The Verification System Remaining In The Fund At The End Of A Fiscal Year Shall Be Transferred To The Motor Vehicle Ad Valorem Tax Reduction Fund; To Amend Section 63-15-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

621.title: School curriculum; require voter education as a component of the United States government course.
621.description: An Act To Require Each Public High School To Include Within Its United States Government Class Not Less Than One-half Hour Of Voter Education; And For Related Purposes.

622.title: Public school students; authorize community service as an alternative to suspension or expulsion.
622.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-11-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require School Districts To Allow Any Public School Student Who Has Never Been Subject To Disciplinary Action Who Commits An Act Or Engages In Conduct For Which The Student Otherwise Would Be Suspended Or Expelled Under The School District's Discipline Plan, At The Election Of The Student, To Participate In A Community Service Program As An Alternative To Suspension Or Expulsion; To Provide That While Participating In The Program, The Student Shall Receive Youth Peer Counseling Deemed Appropriate By The School District; To Provide That Upon Satisfactory Completion Of The Community Service Program, The Student Record Of The Student's Offensive Act Or Conduct Shall Be Expunged; And For Related Purposes.

623.title: Task force to study and report on the funding and implementation of universal pre-kindergarten programs; create.
623.description: An Act To Create The Task Force To Study And Report On The Funding And Implementation Of Universal Pre-kindergarten Programs In Mississippi; To Prescribe The Membership Of The Task Force And Its Duties; And For Related Purposes.

624.title: School district employees; authorize voluntary dues deductions for membership in professional organizations.
624.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Local School Boards To Permit The Local Superintendent Of Education To Deduct From The Salary Of Certain Employees Of The School District Certain Dues For Membership In Professional Organizations; To Provide That The Dues Deduction Be Made Only Upon Receipt Of Written Authorization From The Employee Requesting The Deduction; To Require Local School Boards Authorizing Such Deduction To Adopt Policies And Procedures Implementing The Dues Deductions Process Before Any Dues Are Deducted; And For Related Purposes.

626.title: School nurses; require school districts to grant same leave allowances as allowed teachers.
626.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Licensed School Nurses Employed In School Districts In The Definition Of The Term "licensed Employee" As That Term Is Used In Provisions Regulating School Districts' Sick, Personal And Professional Leave Policies In Order To Grant Those Nurses The Same Leave Allowance As Allowed Teachers And Other Licensed Employees; And For Related Purposes.

627.title: Income tax refund checkoff; authorize for Mississippi Council for Economic Education.
627.description: An Act To Authorize Resident Individual Income Taxpayers To Designate Any Portion Of Their Tax Refund For Distribution To The Mississippi Council For Economic Education; And For Related Purposes.

628.title: Law enforcement officers and personnel; prohibit active or retired from serving on grand or petit jury.
628.description: An Act To Prohibit Law Enforcement Officers, Staff Or Personnel From Serving On Any Duly Convened Grand Jury Or Petit Jury; To Provide Penalties; To Amend Sections 13-5-1 And 13-5-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

629.title: Joint Permanent Legislative Oversight Committee on Crime and Corrections; create.
629.description: An Act To Create The Joint Permanent Legislative Oversight Committee On Crime And Corrections And To Provide The Membership And Duties Of The Committee; And For Related Purposes.

630.title: Middle School Grades Reform Act; create to implement a rigorous reading requirement for low-performing students.
630.description: An Act To Create The "middle School Grades Reform Act"; To Provide The Legislative Purpose And Intent For Its Enactment; To Define Certain Terms Used In This Act; To Require The State Department Of Education To Review Certain Elements Of Middle School Grades' Reading And Language Arts Programs; To Require The State Superintendent Of Public Education To Make Recommendations Regarding Those Programs; To Require The State Board Of Education To Promulgate Rules For The Implementation Of This Act; To Require Certain Public Middle Schools To Incorporate A Rigorous Reading Requirement For Those Programs As The Primary Component Of Their School Improvement Plan; To Prescribe The Components That Must Be Included In The Rigorous Reading Requirement; To Establish The Procedures To Be Followed By Middle Schools Implementing The Requirement; To Require The Department To Conduct A Study On Methods Of Improving The Academic Performance Of Middle School Students And Schools; To Require The State Superintendent To Make A Legislative Report On The Findings Of That Study By December 1, 2011; To Require Principals Of Middle Schools To Designate A Certified Staff Member To Develop And Administer A Personalized Middle School Success Plan For Certain Students; To Establish What Must Be Included In The Success Plan; To Require That The Success Plan Be Incorporated Into Certain Other Individual Student Plans Required By Federal Or State Law; To Require The Department To Provide Technical Assistance To Certain School Entities For The Implementation Of The Rigorous Reading Requirement And Development Of Personalized Middle School Success Plans; To Provide That This Act Shall Not Be Construed To Abrogate Or Affect The Reading Sufficiency Program; To Amend Sections 37-3-97, 37-9-213, 37-18-5 And 37-23-195, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

631.title: Joint legislative study committee on children and family issues; reestablish for further study and reporting purposes.
631.description: An Act To Amend Section 1, Chapter 555, Laws Of 2009, Which Create A Joint Legislative Study Committee That Addresses Children And Family Issues, To Reestablish The Study Committee And To Extend The Time Period From The 2010 Regular Session To The 2012 Regular Session Of The Legislature That The Committee Must Report To The Legislature Regarding Its Findings And Recommendations; And For Related Purposes.

632.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize issuance to supporters of Presbyterian Christian School in Hattiesburg.
632.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Presbyterian Christian School In Hattiesburg, Mississippi; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

633.title: Historic property tax credit; expand use to franchise tax and insurance premium tax liability, allow refund of excess amount of credit.
633.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-22.31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Income Tax Credit Allowed For Costs And Expenses Incurred In The Rehabilitation Of Certified Historic Structures To Be Utilized By A Taxpayer Against His Corporation Franchise Tax Liability And Insurance Premium Tax Liability As Well As Income Tax Liability; To Provide That If The Amount Of The Credit Exceeds The Taxpayer's Tax Liability For The Year, The Taxpayer May Claim A Refund In The Amount Of 90% Of The Excess To Be Paid From Current Tax Collections; To Extend The Repeal Date On This Section Until December 31, 2014; And For Related Purposes.

634.title: School district conservator or financial advisor; remove from requirements of Personal Service Contract Review Board.
634.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Contracts For A School District Conservator Or Financial Advisor From The Rules And Regulations Of The Personal Service Contract Review Board; And For Related Purposes.

635.title: Home schooled students; to be tested for grade assignment prior to transferring into public school district.
635.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-15-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Homeschooled Students To Be Tested Prior To Transfer Into A Public School District For Grade Assignment Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

636.title: Parental choice for assignment of twins or other multiples to class; delete repealer.
636.description: An Act To Reenact Section 37-11-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, And To Amend Section 2, Chapter 484, Laws Of 2009, To Delete The Automatic Repealer On The Provision Allowing Parental Choice For The Placement Of Twins In The Same Or In Separate Classrooms; To Amend Section 37-43-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Local School Boards To Offer Surplus Inventory Textbooks To Parents Or Guardians Of Students Residing In The School District; And For Related Purposes.

637.title: School districts serving students placed in youth detention centers; require State Board of Education to issue policy on financial reimbursement to.
637.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-321, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Issue Policies Regarding Financial Reimbursements To Sponsoring School Districts For Services To Students Placed In Youth Detention Centers; And For Related Purposes.

638.title: Student participating in GED programs; clarify funding for.
638.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That A Student Participating In A General Educational Development (ged) Option Program Under A School District Agreement With A Community College Or Other Local Entity Shall Not Be Deemed A Dropout For Funding Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

639.title: Compulsory school attendance law; delete authority to disenroll kindergarten student and prohibit automatic failure for absenteeism.
639.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Authority For A Parent Or Guardian To Disenroll A Child From A Public Kindergarten Program, And To Prohibit A School District From Automatically Failing A Student Due To Absenteeism If The Student Is Otherwise Making Satisfactory Academic Progress; And For Related Purposes.

640.title: School teacher and administrator licensure; provide penalties for sexual involvement of school employees with students.
640.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Specific Grounds For Revocation Or Suspension Of A Teacher Or Administrator's License For Sexual Misconduct; To Clarify The Requirements For Issuing A Standard License Based Upon Reciprocity; To Amend Sections 97-5-24 And 37-11-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Legal Duty For School Superintendents To Report Incidences Of Sexual Involvement Of School Employees With A Student And To Provide Criminal Penalties For Failure To Report; And For Related Purposes.

641.title: Reading Sufficiency Program of Instruction; repeal specific components.
641.description: An Act To Repeal Section 37-13-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Components For The State Department Of Education Reading Sufficiency Program Of Instruction; And For Related Purposes.

642.title: School textbooks; clarify procedure for executing and distributing publishing contracts.
642.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-43-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Procedure For Executing And Distributing School Textbook Publishing Contracts; And For Related Purposes.

643.title: Schools At-Risk; revise certain procedures and sanctions imposed under school district conservatorship law.
643.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Department Of Education May Take Certain Corrective Action In School Districts Where An Emergency Has Been Declared Due To The Majority Of Schools In The District Under At-risk Status For Any One Year; To Amend Sections 37-18-3 And 37-18-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Responsibilities Of The State Department Of Education Relative To Evaluating School At-risk Data And To Delete The Specific Membership Requirements For A Local Parent/citizen Advisory Council As Part Of The At-risk School Evaluation Process; To Amend Section 37-18-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Sanctions To Be Imposed By The Conservator In Schools Under At-risk Status; To Delete The Requirement That Professional Development Plans Be Developed For Certain Teachers, Principals, School District Administrative Office Personnel, And Superintendents In Need Of Improvement Based Upon The Length Of Time The School Has Been Under At-risk Status; To Delete The Authority Of The State Board Of Education To Request The Removal Or A Referendum To Remove The Members Of The School Board Of A School District Which Has Been Under At-risk Status For Three Years; To Delete The Requirement That The State Department Of Education Make A Semiannual Report To The State Board Of Education On Schools At-risk; To Delete The Requirement That The State Board Of Education Provide Staff Development Training; To Delete The Requirement That The State Board Of Education Provide A Legislative Report On Schools At-risk; And For Related Purposes.

644.title: Sales tax; correct a reference regarding diversion to the Telecommunications Ad Valorem Tax Reduction Fund.
644.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Correct Paragraph References Regarding Certain Sales Tax Revenue That Is Required To Be Deposited, Without Diversion, Into The Telecommunications Ad Valorem Tax Reduction Fund; And For Related Purposes.

645.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of firearms, ammunition and hunting supplies during Second Amendment Weekend Holiday.
645.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Retail Sales Of Firearms, Ammunition And Hunting Supplies When Sold During The Annual Mississippi Second Amendment Weekend Holiday Beginning At 12:01 A.m. On The First Friday In September And Ending At 12:00 Midnight On The Following Sunday; And For Related Purposes.

648.title: Real estate; allow covenants to prohibit sale or lease of property to registered sex offenders.
648.description: An Act To Allow Real Estate Covenants To Prohibit Registered Sex Offenders From Purchasing Or Leasing Certain Residential Property; To Amend Section 45-33-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

649.title: Counties; revise procedure to clean certain property.
649.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Authority Of The Board Of Supervisors To Clean Property Determined To Be A Menace To The Health, Safety And Welfare Of The Community Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

650.title: Medicaid; direct the division to establish a medical home program.
650.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Division Of Medicaid To Establish A Medicaid Medical Home Program; To Require The Division To Restructure Its Payment System To Support Primary Care Providers That Participate In A Medical Home Model; To Require The Division To Develop A System To Support Primary Care Providers In Developing A Program Organizational Structure Necessary To Provide A Medical Home; To Require The Division To Provide For The Development Of A Network Of Primary Care Providers For Participation In The Program That Provide Care To Their Patients Using The Medical Home Model; And For Related Purposes.

651.title: MS Organic Certification Program; revise to promote continued viability of if USDA accreditation is lost by the MDAC.
651.description: An Act To Revise The Mississippi Organic Certification Program To Remove The Requirement That The Mississippi Department Of Agriculture And Commerce Certify Producers And Packing Facilities Under That Program; To Provide For The Designation Of Other Persons To Act As Certifiers Under The Program; To Amend Section 69-47-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Meaning Of Certain Defined Terms; To Repeal Section 69-47-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Department To Adopt Rules And Regulations For The Enforcement Of The Mississippi Organic Certification Program; To Amend Section 69-47-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Certain Producers To Be Organically Certified In Accordance With The Provisions Of This Law; To Require Documentation Of Certification To Be In A Format Acceptable Under The Standards Prescribed By The United State Department Of Agriculture's National Organic Program (usda-nop); To Prohibit The Certification Of Certain Fields As Organically Managed Unless Certain Conditions Are Met; To Remove The Authority Of The Department To Use A Certification Rating System In Application Evaluations; To Amend Section 69-47-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Permit, Rather Than Require, The Department To Sample Certain Organic Commodities And Processed Food Products; To Amend Section 69-47-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Certifier To Certify A Crop As Organic; To Bring Forward Section 69-47-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendments; To Amend Section 69-47-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Copies Of Questionnaires Devised By The Certifier Be Kept On Record For Farms And Processors; To Remove The Requirement That The Department Conduct A Minimum Of One On-site Inspection For Every Farm Or Processing Facility; To Authorize The Certifier To Conduct Unannounced Inspections; To Repeal Section 69-47-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribes The Audit Requirements For The Mississippi Organic Certification Program; To Amend Section 69-47-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That An Application Submitted For Certification Be In A Form Acceptable To The Standards Prescribed By The Usda-nop; To Require Those Applications To Be Submitted To The Appropriate Certifier; To Delete The Requirement That The Department Authorize The Use Of The Mississippi Certified Organic Mark Upon Approval Of An Application Form; To Delete The Inspection Requirement Imposed Upon Applicants Entitled To Use The Mark; To Amend Section 69-47-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Authority Of The Department To Allow A Certified Retailer To Use The Mark; To Amend Sections 69-47-21 And 69-47-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 69-47-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Prohibition On The Use Of The Certified Organic Mark Without Application And Approval By The Department; To Repeal Section 69-47-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Permits The Department To Establish An Organic Certification Program For Poultry And Seafood; And For Related Purposes.

652.title: Agritourism; provide certain exemptions to persons who engage in.
652.description: An Act To Require Agritourism Professionals To Register With The Commissioner Of Agriculture And Commerce; To Require The Commissioner To Maintain A List Of All Registered Agritourism Professionals And Certain Other Information Related To Agritourism Activities Conducted By Those Persons; To Authorize The Commissioner To Define Certain Activities As Agritourism Activities And To Add Or Remove Activities To Or From The List Of Agritourism Activities As Deemed Necessary; To Prescribe The Procedure By Which Interested Persons May Have The List Revised; To Establish The List Of Agritourism Activities; To Provide An Exemption From Liability To Persons Engaged In Agritourism Activities; To Require Agritourism Professionals To Post And Maintain Signage Containing Certain Warning Notice Provisions; To Require The Agritourism Professional To Provide A Written Description Of Any Agritourism Activity Conducted At That Location For Which That Person's Liability Is Limited; To Require Persons Seeking To Avail Themselves Of The Limited Liability Afforded Under This Act To Submit An Agritourism Plan Of Operation To The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Be Approved By The Commissioner; And For Related Purposes.

653.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize issuance to supporters of Farm Families of Mississippi.
653.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Farm Families Of Mississippi; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

654.title: Justice court judges; increase jurisdictional amount to $10,000.00.
654.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-11-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Justice Court Jurisdiction Amount To $10,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

655.title: Abortion; felony to transport minor to another state to receive without parental consent.
655.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-41-53 And 97-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That It Shall Be A Felony To Transport An Unemancipated Minor To Another State For An Abortion Without Parental Consent; And For Related Purposes.

656.title: Counties; authorize to dig graves and bury livestock without need for epidemic or contagious disease.
656.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Need For The Existence Of An Epidemic Or Contagious Disease As Authority For A Board Of Supervisors To Dig Graves For The Burying Of Livestock; And For Related Purposes.

657.title: Smoking by inmates; prohibit.
657.description: An Act To Prohibit The Use Of Tobacco Products By County Prisoners While Such Prisoners Are Incarcerated; To Amend Section 47-1-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Use Of Tobacco Products By Municipal Prisoners While Such Prisoners Are Incarcerated; To Amend Section 47-5-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Department Of Corrections Shall Prohibit The Use Of Tobacco Products By Any Person Who Is In The Custody Of The Department Of Corrections; And For Related Purposes.

658.title: License tag; tax collector not to issue to person illegally in the United States must show proof of residence.
658.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit A County Tax Collector From Issuing A Motor Vehicle License Tag Or Decal To A Person Who Is In The United States Illegally; To Require Every Applicant For A License Tag Or Decal To Present Documentation Of His Legal Presence In The United States; To Amend Section 27-19-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

659.title: Drug testing; authorize for persons receiving public assistance benefits.
659.description: An Act To Provide That Recipients Of Public Assistance Benefits Who Are 13 Years Of Age Or Older Shall Be Subject To Taking A Drug Test On A Random Basis To Determine Their Eligibility To Continue Receiving The Benefits; To Provide That If A Recipient Of Public Assistance Benefits Is Given A Drug Test And He Or She Tests Positive For Any Prohibited Drug, The Recipient Shall Not Be Eligible To Receive The Benefits For A Period Of Not Less Than 90 Days; To Provide That After That Period, A Person May Reapply To Receive Public Assistance Benefits, And Will Be Eligible To Receive The Benefits Again If The Person Passes Another Drug Test; To Provide That The State Department Of Health Shall Perform The Drug Tests Authorized By This Act, And The Cost Of The Drug Tests Shall Be Paid By The Department; To Amend Sections 43-13-115 And 43-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act And To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On Section 43-17-5; And For Related Purposes.

660.title: Tax collector; prohibit from issuing license tag to person without valid driver's license.
660.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit A County Tax Collector From Issuing A Motor Vehicle License Tag Or Decal To A Person Without A Valid Driver's License; To Require Every Applicant For A License Tag Or Decal To Present His Or Her Valid Driver's License To The County Tax Collector; To Amend Section 27-19-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

661.title: Lobbyist; may not give anything of value to any official unless certain action taken.
661.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-8-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Lobbyist May Not Provide Anything Of Value To An Executive, Legislative Or Public Official Or Public Employee, Unless The Same Thing Of Value Is Offered To The Entire Membership Of The Mississippi State Legislature And All Statewide Elected Officials; To Amend Sections 5-8-9 And 5-8-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

662.title: Seat belt and booster seat laws; remove criminal penalties for violation of.
662.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-2-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Criminal Penalties For Violation Of The Seat Belt And Booster Seat Laws; And For Related Purposes.

663.title: Traffic-control signals; require only flashing lights at certain times.
663.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-309, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That, From 11:00 P.m. Until 7:00 A.m. Each Day, Flashing Yellow Lights Shall Be Displayed On Traffic-control Signals On Primary Roads And Flashing Red Lights Shall Be Displayed On Traffic-control Signals On Secondary Roads; To Define The Terms "primary Road" And "secondary Road" For The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

664.title: Jurors; revise selection.
664.description: An Act To Amend Sections 13-5-1, 13-5-4 And 13-5-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Selection Of Jurors Using Persons With Valid Driver's Licenses; To Require The Department Of Public Safety To Provide Circuit Clerks With A Copy Of All Licensed Drivers In The Counties; And For Related Purposes.

665.title: Motor vehicle liability insurance; revise time for owner cited for lack of to show proof necessary for waiver of fine.
665.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-15-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Time Within Which A Motor Vehicle Owner Cited For Failure To Have A Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance Card May Present Proof Of Liability Insurance In Order To Have The Fine And Court Costs For The Offense Waived; And For Related Purposes.

666.title: Law enforcement; prohibit issuing moving violation tickets while using an unmarked vehicle.
666.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-9-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Law Enforcement Officers From Issuing Traffic Tickets For Moving Violations While Such Officer Is Using An Unmarked Vehicle; To Amend Section 19-25-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

667.title: Emergency telephone calls; authorize release to Ethics Commission under certain conditions.
667.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-319, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Release Of Certain Emergency Telephone Calls To The Mississippi Ethics Commission Upon Issue Of An Order From The Commission; And For Related Purposes.

668.title: Pawnbrokers; revise several provisions relating to licensure and regulation of.
668.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-67-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Exemptions From The Definition Of The Term "pawnbroker" As Used In The Mississippi Pawnshop Act; To Amend Section 75-67-305, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Information Required To Be Recorded On Pawn Tickets At The Time Of Making A Pawn Or Purchase Transaction For Firearms; To Amend Section 75-67-321, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fee For A Pawnbroker License; To Amend Section 75-67-323, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Applicant Shall Not Have Been Convicted Of A Felony To Be Eligible For A Pawnbroker License; To Amend Section 75-67-327, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Application Process For The Transfer Of Existing Licenses; To Amend Section 75-67-333, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Notice And Hearing Requirement Before Imposing A Civil Penalty Against Licensees; To Deposit Civil Penalties Into The Consumer Finance Fund Of The Department Of Banking And Consumer Finance; To Amend Section 75-67-341, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Banking To Charge An Examination Fee; To Create A New Section To Provide Liability Protections For Licensees For Acts Done Or Omitted In Conformity With Rules Or Regulations Of The Commissioner Of Banking Or Any Other State Or Federal Agency; To Repeal Section 75-67-339, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides A Time Limit For Existing Pawnbrokers In Business On July 1, 1993, To Apply For And Receive A License; And For Related Purposes.

669.title: Banking Commissioner; authorize to disclose certain regulatory information to additional government agencies.
669.description: An Act To Amend Section 81-1-89, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance To Disclose Certain Regulatory Information To Additional Government Agencies; To Amend Section 81-18-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Correct An Incorrect Reference In The Exemptions To The Mississippi Mortgage Consumer Protection Law; And For Related Purposes.

670.title: Banking Commissioner; authorize to require consumer industry licensees to participate in multistate licensing system.
670.description: An Act To Authorize The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance To Require Consumer Industry Licensees Regulated By His Agency To Participate In A Multistate Licensing System; And For Related Purposes.

671.title: Money transmission; revise license and examination fees for persons engaging in business of.
671.description: An Act To Amend Sections 75-15-15 And 75-15-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The License And Examination Fees For Persons Engaging In The Business Of Money Transmission; And For Related Purposes.

672.title: Student athlete; require those at public univ./coll. to repay athletic scholarship monies if turn pro or terminated for discipline early.
672.description: An Act To Require A Student Athlete At A Public University Or College In This State To Repay Any Athletic Scholarship Monies Received If The Student Athlete Signs A Professional-sports-services Contract Or Is Terminated From Participation In The Intercollegiate Sport By The University Or College Due To Discipline Problems Prior To Graduating From Either That University Or College Or Any Other University Or College; And For Related Purposes.

673.title: Immigration; enact Support Our Law Enforcement and Safe Neighborhoods Act of 2011.
673.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Support Our Law Enforcement And Safe Neighborhoods Act Of 2011; To Set Forth Legislative Intent; To Require Cooperation And Assistance In Enforcement Of Immigration Laws And To Indemnify Law Enforcement Officers For Implementation Of This Act; To Create The Offense Of Willful Failure To Complete Or Carry An Alien Registration Document; To Amend Section 97-3-54.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Law Enforcement Officer To Stop Any Person In Violation Of Traffic Laws In The Enforcement Of The Mississippi Employment Protection Act; To Create The Offense Of Unlawful Stopping To Hire And Pick Up Passengers For Work; To Create The Offense Of Unlawful Transport, Concealment Or Harboring Of Unlawful Aliens; To Provide For The Arrest Without Warrant Of A Person Reasonably Believed To Have Committed Any Public Offense That Makes The Person Removable From The United States; To Amend Section 71-11-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Retention Of E-verify Confirmations For At Least 3 Years And To Provide To An Employer The Affirmative Defense Of Entrapment; To Require The Immobilization Or Impoundment Of A Vehicle Operated In Furtherance Of Violations Under This Act; To Create The Special Fund To Be Known As The Gang And Immigration Intelligence Team Enforcement Mission Fund; And For Related Purposes.

674.title: Family child care homes; require registration and training of operators, and transfer administration of registration to DHS.
674.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-20-51, 43-20-53, 43-20-55, 43-20-59 And 43-20-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer The Administration Of The Family Child Care Home Registration Law From The State Department Of Health To The Mississippi Department Of Human Services; To Require Persons Who Maintain Family Child Care Homes To Register With The Department; To Increase The Amount Of The Registration Fee; To Require Each Person Who Is Registered To Receive Six Hours Of Basic Training Relating To Providing Child Care In A Family Child Care Home From The Mississippi State University Extension Service; And For Related Purposes.

675.title: Severed mineral rights; provide process for land owner to redeem.
675.description: An Act To Establish A Process Whereby Landowners May Redeem Severed Mineral Rights; To Require Certain Owners Of Severed Mineral Interests To Pay A One-time Surveying Fee And An Annual Assessment Per Acre For Any Severed Mineral Interest That Exists; To Provide That Such Assessment Shall Not Be Over A Certain Amount; To Provide That Such Assessment And Surveying Fee Shall Be Paid To And Collected By The County; To Provide That All Proceeds Of The Assessment And Surveying Fee Shall Be Retained By The County And If A Community Mental Health Center Is Located In Such County, Then Half Of The Proceeds Shall Be Distributed To Such Center; To Provide That If The Owners Of A Severed Mineral Interest Fails To Pay The Assessment Or Surveying Fee Then The Interest Shall Be Sold In The Same Manner As Prescribed By State Law For The Sale Of Lands For Nonpayment Of Taxes; To Provide A Redemption Process For Severed Mineral Interests Sold For Nonpayment Of The Assessment Or Surveying Fee; To Require That Chancery Clerks Provide Certain Notice During The Redemption Process; To Provide That The Owners Of The Surface Estates Under Which The Severed Mineral Interests Were Located Shall Have The Right, Secondarily Only To The Owners Of The Severed Mineral Interests, To Redeem Such Interests; To Require Chancery Clerks To Conduct Title Searches For Severed Mineral Interests For Every Owner Of Fee Simple Interests Existing In The County; To Require Chancery Clerks, After Locating A Severed Mineral Interest, To Record In The Land Records Where Such Interest Is Located; To Amend Sections 27-41-79 And 27-41-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require County Tax Collectors To Transmit To Clerks Of The Chancery Court Any Lists Of Any Severed Mineral Interests That Were Sold For Nonpayment Of The Assessment Or Surveying Fee; To Amend Section 9-55-137, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Chancery Clerks To Keep Records Of All Severed Mineral Interest Registrations; To Bring Forward Sections 27-25-501, 27-25-503, 27-25-507, 27-25-509, 27-25-511, 27-25-513, 27-25-517, 27-25-521 And 27-25-523, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To Certain Severance Taxes For Oil, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 27-25-701, 27-25-703, 27-25-705, 27-25-707, 27-25-709, 27-25-711, 27-25-715, 27-25-719 And 27-25-721, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To Certain Severance Taxes For Natural Gas, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 27-25-303, 27-25-305, 27-25-307 And 27-25-309, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To Certain Severance Taxes For Salt, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-31-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relates To A Certain Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-35-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relates To The Assessment Of Certain Minerals For Ad Valorem Taxes, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-31-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relates To Certain Property Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxes, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 27-41-79 And 27-41-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Collection Of Ad Valorem Taxes, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

676.title: Mineral interest; revert to surface owner after certain period of nonproduction.
676.description: An Act To Provide That Mineral Estates Separated From The Surface Estate Shall Revert To The Owner Of The Surface Estate After Ten Years Of Nonproduction; To Define Nonproduction; And For Related Purposes.

677.title: Justice court judge; require to be compensated when duties are performed in other counties.
677.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Justice Court Judge Who Performs Duties As Justice Court Judge In A County That Is Not The County For Which The Judge Was Elected To Serve, Shall Be Compensated By The Board Of Supervisors Of The Other County For The Number Of Days Served In That County In An Amount Equal To A Portion Of The Salary Of The Justice Court Judge For That County Prorated For The Number Of Days Served By Such Justice Court Judge; And For Related Purposes.

678.title: Mineral rights, certain; revert to surface owner after certain period of time.
678.description: An Act To Provide That Certain Mineral Estates Separated From The Surface Estate Shall Revert To The Owner Of The Surface Estate After Ten Years Of Nonproduction; And For Related Purposes.

679.title: Failure to obey mandatory evacuation orders and tampering of certain warning signs; create certain policies and penalties regarding.
679.description: An Act To Authorize Certain Law Enforcement To Compel An Individual Located In Area Stricken Or Threatened By A Disaster To Leave The Area When A Mandatory Evacuation Order Has Been Issued; To Provide That Such Law Enforcement May Use Reasonable Force To Remove The Individual From Such Area; To Provide That Such Individual Shall Be Civilly Liable To A Governmental Entity That Conducts A Rescue On Behalf Of The Individual Who Fails To Heed A Mandatory Evacuation Order; To Prohibit The Tampering Of Certain Warning Signs And To Provide Certain Penalties For Such Tampering; To Provide That An Individual Commits An Offense If An Individual Disobeys Certain Warning Signs And To Provide Penalties For Such Offense; To Provide That An Individual Shall Be Civilly Liable For The Cost Of A Rescue If He Or She Causes An Individual To Be Rescued Due To The Tampering Of Such Signs By The Individual; To Amend Section 33-15-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Chief Executive Of A County Or Municipality Or The Governor To Compel An Individual To Leave An Evacuated Area Once An Evacuation Order Has Been Issued; And For Related Purposes.

680.title: Law enforcement officer; provide for reporting and penalties for unlawful conduct by.
680.description: An Act To Create The Law Enforcement Officer Discipline Commission That Shall Hear Complaints Regarding Officer Misconduct; To Provide For The Membership Of The Commission; To Provide For The Powers And Duties Of The Commission; To Provide For Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

681.title: Gaming; create state lottery to fund higher education after statewide election on issue.
681.description: An Act To Provide For A Statewide Special Election For The Purpose Of Allowing The Electorate To Vote On The Issue Of Establishing A State Lottery As A Form Of Legalized Gaming In The State Of Mississippi; To Set The Date Of November 1, 2011, For The Statewide Special Election; To Require The Secretary Of State To Provide The Ballots To The Election Commissioners Of Each County; To Require That Any Individual Or Political Committee Making Certain Contributions Or Expenditures In Support Of A State Lottery Must File Certain Reports Disclosing Those Contributions And Expenditures; To Establish The "mississippi Lottery For Education" If The Election Allows It; To Create A State Lottery To Fund The Mississippi Hope Scholarship Trust Fund; To Provide That The State Lottery Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission Regarding The State Lottery; To Create The Mississippi Hope Scholarship Trust Fund To Provide That A Percentage Of The Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Within A County Shall Be Distributed To That County; To Provide That, After Deducting Certain Administrative And Prize Expenses, The Remainder Of The Net Proceeds Shall Be Deposited Into The Mississippi Hope Scholarship Trust Fund; To Amend Sections 23-15-351, 23-15-355, 23-15-805, 37-106-5, 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

682.title: Gaming; create state lottery to fund higher education.
682.description: An Act To Establish The "mississippi Lottery For Education"; To Create A State Lottery To Fund The Mississippi Hope Scholarship Trust Fund; To Provide That The State Lottery Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission Regarding The State Lottery; To Create The Mississippi Hope Scholarship Trust Fund To Provide That A Percentage Of The Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Within A County Shall Be Distributed To That County; To Provide That, After Deducting Certain Administrative And Prize Expenses, The Remainder Of The Net Proceeds Shall Be Deposited Into The Mississippi Hope Scholarship Trust Fund; To Amend Sections 37-106-5, 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

683.title: Crimes; create for using cell phone without hands-free accessories while driving.
683.description: An Act To Prohibit The Use Of Cellular Telephones Without Using Hands-free Accessories While Operating A Motor Vehicle; To Provide Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

684.title: Wireless interactive communication; prohibit use of by a person operating a motor vehicle.
684.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Use Of Wireless Telephones Or Electronic Communication Devices To Engage In Wireless Interactive Communication By A Person Operating A Motor Vehicle; To Provide Exemptions From Compliance With The Requirements Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

685.title: Ancillary Probate Procedure Act; create.
685.description: An Act To Create The Ancillary Probate Procedure Act; To Provide That An Application May Be Filed By A Nonresident For Letters Testamentary Or Of Administration; To Provide That Judges Of Probate May Appoint A Nonresident As An Executor; To Require That Before A Judge Of Probate May Issue Letters Testamentary To A Nonresident Certain Requirements Must Be Fulfilled; To Provide That A Nonresident May Be Appointed When A Nonresident Dies In This State; To Provide For The Collection Of Debts And Deposits By A Nonresident Personal Representative; To Provide That A Nonresident Executor Or Administrator Has A Right To Maintain A Civil Action; To Provide That Service Of Process May Be Made Upon A Nonresident Executor Or Administrator If He Or She Is Found Within This State; To Provide That A Foreign Executor Or Administrator Has The Right To Maintain A Civil Action And Recover Or Receive Property Within This State; To Provide A Definition For The Term "foreign Executor Or Administrator"; To Amend Sections 91-7-33, 91-7-257 And 91-7-259, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

686.title: Qualifying deadline for county offices; extend deadline.
686.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-299, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Qualifying Deadline For County Offices; To Provide That Such Revision Shall Stand Repealed On July 1, 2012; And For Related Purposes.

687.title: State bid law requirements; revise process for awarding contracts for renovation and restoration of certain historical buildings.
687.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Contracts For Renovation, Restoration Or Both Renovation And Restoration Projects Of Certain State- Or Locally-owned Facilities From Lowest And Best Bid Requirements; To Require That The Awarding Of Contracts For Those Projects Be Based On A Qualifications-based Selection Procedure In Accordance With The Provisions Of Section 31-7-13.2; To Bring Forward Sections 31-7-13.2 And 39-7-22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

688.title: Guardian ad litem; clarify duties and weight of testimony.
688.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-21-121 And 93-11-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Duties Of A Guardian Ad Litem And The Weight That The Testimony Of A Guardian Ad Litem Shall Be Afforded; And For Related Purposes.

689.title: Weapons; prohibit discharge near petroleum products.
689.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Discharge Of Firearms Near Property Where Petroleum Products Are Located; And For Related Purposes.

690.title: Business improvement districts; reduce vote necessary to implement.
690.description: An Act To Amend Sections 21-43-117 And 21-43-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Amount Of The Vote Necessary To Adopt, Implement Or Reauthorize A Business Improvement District Plan Or Modify The Boundaries Of A Business Improvement District To Written Ballot Approval Of Sixty Percent Of The Eligible Property Owners; And For Related Purposes.

691.title: Collection of criminal fines; authorize garnishment and liens.
691.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Court To Place A Lien Or Garnishment Against A Defendant To Collect A Fine; And For Related Purposes.

692.title: Municipal annexation; require 60% approval by electors in territory to be annexed.
692.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-1-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For An Election On The Question Of Municipal Annexation In Both The Municipality And The Territory Proposed To Be Annexed When The Governing Authorities Of A Municipality Desire To Enlarge Its Boundaries; To Amend Sections 21-1-29, 21-1-31, 21-1-33, 21-1-35, 21-1-37 And 21-1-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Question Of Municipal Annexation From Chancery Court Proceedings; And For Related Purposes.

693.title: Eminent domain; revise compensation provisions.
693.description: An Act To Amend Sections 11-27-19, 11-27-85 And 11-27-89, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Party Exercising Eminent Domain And Immediate Possession To Pay The Costs Of The Party Whose Property Is Being Taken; And For Related Purposes.

695.title: Private roads; allow counties to levy those benefited when repaired or replaced by county.
695.description: An Act To Amend Sections 65-15-1 And 19-3-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Governing Authorities To Levy Owners Of A Subdivision For Repair Or Replacement Of Roads; And For Related Purposes.

696.title: Handicap Parking; reserve space for ramp-equipped vans.
696.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Where There Are Five Or More Handicapped Parking Spaces On Public Or Private Property, One Of Those Spaces Shall Be Set Aside And Marked For The Use Of A Ramp-equipped Van Only; And For Related Purposes.

697.title: Bail agents; require to have a principal office and to revise certain licensing requirements and fees pertaining to.
