697.description: An Act To Require Professional Bail Agents To Maintain At Least One Office Location To Serve As The Principal Place Of Business Operation And To Register That Office With The Department Of Insurance; To Require The Professional Bail Agent To Report Any Changes In Location, Removal From State Or Cessation Of Business To The Department Of Insurance; To Amend Section 83-39-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Provisions Prohibiting The Writing Of Bonds By Relatives Of Certain Individuals Employed In Law Enforcement Or Judicial Capacities; To Require That Proof Of Prelicensing Education Be Submitted To The Department Of Insurance; To Exempt Those Individuals Of Sixty-five Years Of Age With Twenty Years Of Continuous Professional Bail Agent Experience From Continuing Education Requirements; To Prohibit The Licensing Of Professional Bail Agents Except The Person Was Licensed Before July 1, 2011, And Unless The Person Applying Licensure Has Three Years Of Continuous Experience As A Soliciting Bail Agent Immediately Before Applying For Licensure As A Professional Bail Agent; To Amend Section 83-39-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Applicants For Licensure To Include The Address Of The Principal Place Of Business Operations To Be Used As The Primary Office Location On The Original Application Form For Licensure Or The Renewal Application Form; To Amend Section 83-39-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Distinguish The Fee Charged By A Professional Bail Agent For Certain Additional Services Provided From The Premium Received By The Bail Agent; To Amend Section 83-39-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Payment Of A Fee Or Promise Of Benefit By A Bail Agent For The Purpose Of Procuring A Bail Bond; To Amend Section 99-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Parole Board To Order Appearance Bonds As A Condition Of Parole Or Early Release; And For Related Purposes.

698.title: Bond; revise conditions.
698.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Posting Of Bond As A Condition Of Parole Or Early Release; To Amend Section 47-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

699.title: Sureties on bond; revise exception from officer approval.
699.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-5-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Exception From Officer Approval Of Sureties On Bond; And For Related Purposes.

700.title: Gasoline products; prohibit the retail sale of ethanol-blended gas for use in vehicles and certain other equipment and devices.
700.description: An Act To Create A New Section Of Law Prohibiting The Retail Sale Of Ethanol-blended Gasoline For Use In Vehicles On The Public Highways, Roads And Streets Of This State, And In Certain Other Equipment And Devices; To Provide That The New Section Of Law Shall Be Codified In Chapter 55, Title 75, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Amend Sections 75-55-22, 75-55-27, 25-1-77 And 27-55-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Bring Forward Sections 75-55-3, 75-55-5 And 75-55-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Administration And Enforcement, Definition Of Terms And Penalties Imposed Under The Petroleum Products Inspection Law Of Mississippi, For Purpose Of Possible Amendments; And For Related Purposes.

701.title: Rural water systems or associations; include under Open Meetings Act and Public Records Act.
701.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-41-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "public Body" To Include Rural Water Associations, Rural Water Systems Or Certain Nonprofit, Nonshare Corporations Under The Open Meetings Act; To Amend Section 25-61-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "public Body" To Include Such Associations, Systems Or Corporations Under The Mississippi Public Records Act; To Amend Section 7-7-211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Auditor To Audit And Investigate Such Associations, Systems Or Corporations; And For Related Purposes.

702.title: Retail businesses; those that accept credit cards for payment shall have cameras to record persons using the cards.
702.description: An Act To Require Owners Of Retail Businesses That Accept The Use Of Credit Or Debit Cards For Payment For The Consumer Goods Or Services Sold By The Business To Have Cameras Located At The Card Processing Equipment To Record The Persons Who Use The Credit Or Debit Cards With That Equipment; And For Related Purposes.

703.title: Public records; fees charged for are restricted to actual costs.
703.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-61-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fees For Costs Incident To Providing Public Records; And For Related Purposes.

704.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize issuance to commemorate the New Orleans Saints World Football Champions for the 2009 season.
704.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Commemorating The New Orleans Saints World Football Champions For The 2009 Season; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

705.title: Municipalities; authorize certain municipalities to borrow money from date of incorporation.
705.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-33-325.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of A Municipality, Which Was Formerly A Census-designated Place Before Incorporation, To Borrow Money For The Current Expenses Of The Municipality From The Date Of Incorporation Of The Municipality In Anticipation Of The Ad Valorem Taxes To Be Collected For The Then Current Fiscal Year And The Next Succeeding Fiscal Year; And For Related Purposes.

706.title: Students of military personnel residing on base; allow parent or legal guardian to choose school or school district of enrollment.
706.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-15-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Parents Or Legal Guardians Who Are Active Members Of The United States Armed Forces Or Civilian Military Personnel And Who Reside On A Military Base To Enroll Their Children In Any School Of The Parent's Or Legal Guardian's Choosing, Subject To Certain Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

707.title: State assessments; increase amount for Vulnerable Persons Fund.
707.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Criminal Assessment For The Vulnerable Persons Training, Investigation And Prosecution Trust Fund And The Cyber-crime Unit Fund; To Repeal Section 9, Chapter 549, Laws Of 2008, Which Repeals Sections 41-59-3, 41-59-5, 41-59-7, 41-59-75, 27-19-43 And 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, On July 1, 2011; And For Related Purposes.

708.title: Power of attorney; revise certain provisions pertaining to the Uniform Durable Power of Attorney Act.
708.description: An Act To Revise Various Provisions Of The Uniform Durable Power Of Attorney; To Provide That A Natural Person Having The Capacity To Contract May Execute A Power Of Attorney; To Prescribe The Components Of A Legally Sufficient Power Of Attorney; To Require That The Execution Of Power Of Contract Be Attested To By At Least Two Credible Witnesses; To Amend Sections 87-3-105, 87-3-107, 87-3-109 And 87-3-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

709.title: Implied consent law; delete requirement that machines used in chemical analysis be tested and certified.
709.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Requirement That Methods, Machines Or Devices Used In Chemical Analysis Be Tested And Certified Periodically; And For Related Purposes.

710.title: Manslaughter; differentiate between voluntary and involuntary.
710.description: An Act To Amend Sections 97-3-25, 97-3-35 And 97-3-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Differentiate Between Voluntary And Involuntary Manslaughter; And For Related Purposes.

711.title: Sex offender registration; require for individuals found guilty of sexual motivation if special allegation made by prosecutor.
711.description: An Act To Require Prosecution Attorneys To Include A Special Allegation Of Sexual Motivation In Felony Criminal Cases When Sufficient Evidence Exists To Justify A Finding Of Sexual Motivation; To Require An Accused Defendant To Register Under The Mississippi Sex Offender Registration Law If Found Guilty Of Sexual Motivation; To Amend Section 45-33-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include The Definition Of Sexual Motivation Within The Terms Associated With Mississippi Sex Offender Registration Law; And For Related Purposes.

712.title: Vehicle Management System; require Board of Trustees of State IHL to develop for each institution.
712.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-101-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Implement A Vehicle Management System For The Individual State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Set Out The Board's Powers With Respect To The Implementation Of The System; And For Related Purposes.

713.title: MS Health Information Network (MS-HIN); require annual report to Legislature and PEER performance evaluation.
713.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-119-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Mississippi Health Information Network (ms-hin) Board To Make An Annual Report To The Legislature; To Amend Section 41-119-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Peer Committee To Conduct A Performance Evaluation Of The Ms-hin Board By December 31, 2013; To Amend Section 25-53-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish Certain Oversight Standards For Procurements Of Information Technology Or Service Contracts Exempted From Department Of Information Technology Services Procurement Policies; And For Related Purposes.

714.title: Unfair Cigarette Sales Law; repeal.
714.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 75-23-1 Through 75-23-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The "unfair Cigarette Sales Law," Establish Definitions, And Provide For The Enforcement Of The Article By The Department Of Revenue; And For Related Purposes.

715.title: Children's Health Insurance Program; prescribe process for taking bids to provide coverage and services under.
715.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-86-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That The Administering Agency Of The Children's Health Insurance Program Follow A Specified Process In Soliciting Bids For Insurance Coverage; And For Related Purposes.

716.title: State Board of Pharmacy; clarify law enforcement authority of agents of under Controlled Substances Law.
716.description: An Act To Amend Sections 45-6-3 And 41-29-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Agents Of The State Board Of Pharmacy May Only Carry Out Functions Of Law Enforcement Officers Under The Controlled Substances Law If They Are Certified By The Board Of Law Enforcement Training And Standards; And For Related Purposes.

717.title: Drug Enforcement Coordinating Committee; create.
717.description: An Act To Create New Code Section 41-29-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Drug Enforcement Coordinating Committee; To Establish The Committee's Membership And Define Its Duties; To Amend Section 41-29-168, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Committee To Develop Reporting Forms Used By Law Enforcement In Reporting Information To The Bureau Of Narcotics; To Require The Department Of Public Safety To Continue To Operate The Mississippi Analysis And Information Center; And For Related Purposes.

718.title: PEER Committee; provide civil and criminal penalties for contempt of inquiries by.
718.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-3-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Criminal Penalty For Contempt Of Inquiries By The Joint Legislative Committee On Performance Evaluation And Expenditure Review And To Establish Proper Venue In Cases Arising Under This Provision; To Create New Code Section 5-3-70, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish An Alternate Civil Penalty For Contempt Of The Committee; To Amend Section 25-61-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Committee From The Scope Of Protective Orders Regarding Trade Secrets Or Confidential Commercial Or Financial Information; And For Related Purposes.

719.title: Legislative records; clarify confidential and privileged status of certain.
719.description: An Act To Describe Those Legislative Records That Are Confidential And Privileged Pursuant To The Inherent Authority Of The Legislature To Regulate Public Access To Its Records; And For Related Purposes.

720.title: State personnel system; create Personnel Strategic Planning Council for.
720.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Personnel Strategic Planning Council For The Statewide Personnel System; To Establish The Duties Of The Council And Its Reporting Responsibilities; And For Related Purposes.

721.title: MS Small Business Assistance Act; delete requirement of minimum rate of interest for loans under.
721.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-10-513, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Requirement That Loans Made By Planning And Development Districts To Small Businesses Under The Mississippi Small Business Assistance Act Bear An Interest Rate Of At Least 5% Per Annum; And For Related Purposes.

722.title: Real property; revise acknowledgment requirement for recorded instruments.
722.description: An Act To Amend Section 89-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Acknowledgment Requirement For Instruments Pertaining To Real Property; To Prescribe An Additional Acknowledgment Form For Multiple-layer Representative Capacity Execution By Legal Entities; To Clarify The Dates Of Documents Relative To The Acknowledgment Date; To Amend Sections 89-3-1 And 89-5-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By House Bill No. 599, 2011 Regular Session, To Require That All Instruments Pertaining To Real Property To Be Recorded Shall Have An Acknowledgment; And For Related Purposes.

723.title: Correctional facility; authorize to purchase prescription medication in amounts to dispense to.
723.description: An Act To Authorize A Correctional Facility To Purchase Prescription Medication In Amounts That Will Allow Such Correctional Facility To Dispense Prescription Medication From A Single Container To Inmates Diagnosed With A Health Condition Which Requires The Same Medication; To Amend Section 47-5-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Section; And For Related Purposes.

724.title: Mississippi Court Corruption Act; enact.
724.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Court Corruption Act; To Prohibit Certain Acts By Judges, Prosecutors And Attorneys; To Provide Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

725.title: Mississippi Small Business Assistance Act; delete requirement of minimum rate of interest for loans under.
725.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-10-513, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Requirement That Loans Made By Planning And Development Districts To Small Businesses Under The Mississippi Small Business Assistance Act Bear An Interest Rate Of At Least 5% Per Annum; And For Related Purposes.

726.title: District attorneys and certain legal assistants; increase salaries of.
726.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of District Attorneys And Legal Assistants Who Have Been Licensed To Practice Law For At Least 20 Years; And For Related Purposes.

727.title: Mississippi Police Brutality Law; enact.
727.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Police Brutality Act; To Provide A Method Whereby Citizens May File Complaints Against Law Enforcement Officers Regarding Police Misconduct; To Provide For A Hearing For Such Complaints; To Provide Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

728.title: Counterfeit goods; remove disclosure requirement to purchaser.
728.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-21-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Selling Or Vending Of Counterfeit Goods Is Prohibited Whether Disclosure Is Made To The Purchaser Or Not; And For Related Purposes.

729.title: Bastardy; replace references to in Mississippi Code with more appropriate terms.
729.description: An Act To Amend Sections 93-9-73 And 93-9-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Replace References To Bastardy In The Mississippi Code Of 1972 With More Appropriate Terms; And For Related Purposes.

730.title: Blunt wraps; prohibit.
730.description: An Act To Outlaw The Sale, Manufacture Or Distribution Of Blunt Wrap; And For Related Purposes.

731.title: Prescribed burns; provide no property owner is liable for damage or injury caused by unless gross negligence is proven.
731.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-19-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Burden Of Proof For Liability Of A Property Owner Or His Agent For Damage Or Injury Caused By Fire Or Resulting Smoke When Conducting A Prescribed Burn From Negligence To Gross Negligence; And For Related Purposes.

732.title: Public records; require public bodies to maintain certain information on websites.
732.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-61-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Public Bodies To Maintain Certain Public Records On Their Websites; And For Related Purposes.

733.title: Chancery court; provide additional chancellor for the 4th Chancery Court District.
733.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-5-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Additional Chancellor For The Fourth Chancery Court District; And For Related Purposes.

734.title: Uniform laws; enact Uniform Foreign-country Money Judgments Recognition Act.
734.description: An Act To Create The Uniform Foreign-country Money Judgments Recognition Act; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide For The Applicability Of This Act; To Provide Standards For Recognition Of Foreign-country Judgments; To Provide For Jurisdiction; To Provide Procedure For The Recognition Of Foreign-country Judgments; To Provide For The Effect Of A Judgment; To Allow A Stay Of Proceedings; To Provide For Limitation Of Actions; To Provide For Uniformity In Interpretation; To Bring Forward Sections 11-31-1, 11-31-2, 11-31-3, 11-31-5, 11-31-7, 11-31-9 And 11-31-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Amend Section 15-1-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

735.title: Hunting on certain private lands; require commission to establish seasons and regulate and allow hunter to use weapon of choice.
735.description: An Act To Create New Code Section 49-7-31.6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Set And Establish The Season For Hunting Deer On Certain Private Lands; To Require A Hunter On Those Lands To Have A Valid Hunting License; To Authorize The Commission To Establish The Bag Limit On Deer Taken On Those Lands; To Allow Hunters Hunting On Those Lands To Select Their Weapon Of Choice When Hunting; To Require Hunters To Wear Hunter Orange When Hunting On Those Lands; To Provide That The Commission's Authority To Regulate Hunting On Public Lands, Wildlife Management Areas And Certain Private Lands Not Abrogated; To Amend Sections 49-7-31 And 49-7-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

736.title: Sales under execution; reduce time period during which those sales may be had.
736.description: An Act To Amend Sections 11-5-99 And 13-3-169, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Time Period During Which Sales Of Real Estate By Court Order And Sales Under Execution May Be Held; And For Related Purposes.

737.title: Owners of nonproducing mineral estates and certain leasehold interests; require to pay certain portion of property taxes.
737.description: An Act To Require Owners Of All Nonproducing Mineral Estates And Leasehold Interests In Minerals Owned Separately And Apart From The Surface Estate To Pay A Certain Portion Of Property Taxes; To Provide That Where The Tax Becomes Delinquent The Mineral Estate Or Leasehold Interest Shall Revert To The Surface Owner; To Amend Section 27-31-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Repeal Sections 27-31-73 And 27-31-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Exemption Of Nonproducing Mineral And Leasehold Interests From Ad Valorem Taxes; And For Related Purposes.

738.title: State employees raises; require agencies and colleges to comply strictly with legislative direction.
738.description: An Act To Provide That Whenever The Legislature Authorizes Salary Increases For Employees Of State Agencies, Community And Junior Colleges, And State Institutions Of Higher Learning, The Salary Increases Must Be Awarded In Strict Compliance With The Legislative Intent Expressed And Any Formula Specified In The Respective Appropriation Bills; To Require The Executive Head Of Each Agency, Community Or Junior College, And State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Verify That The Salary Increases Are Awarded Consistent With Legislative Intent; To Provide That The Head Of Any State Agency, College Or Institution Who Expends Funds In Violation Of The Provisions Of This Act Shall Be Personally Liable To The State For The Amount Of Money Improperly Expended; To Prohibit The State Fiscal Officer From Issuing Any Warrants That Would Authorize Any State Agency, Community Or Junior College, Or State Institution Of Higher Learning To Expend Any Money In Violation Of The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

739.title: Headlights; require to be used whenever windshield wipers necessitated.
739.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Headlights Of Vehicles Shall Be Operated Whenever Conditions Necessitate The Use Of Windshield Wipers; To Prohibit The Use Of Only The Parking Lights Of Vehicles During Times When The Use Of Headlights Is Required; And For Related Purposes.

740.title: Franchise tax; provide temporary exemption for certain forestry industry enterprises.
740.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-13-5 And 27-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Temporary Corporation Franchise Tax Exemption For Forestry Industry Enterprises That Perform The Initial Processing Of Pine Logs Or Hardwood Logs In The Production Of Lumber Products Or Are Engaged In The Production Of Poles Or Timbers And That Have Employed An Average Of Not Less Than Fifteen Employees During The Most Recent Thirty-six-month Period Ending On December 31 Of The Immediately Preceding Calendar Year; To Amend Section 27-13-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

741.title: ETV; Legislature shall reduce general fund appropriations to by 20% for each of next five fiscal years.
741.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-63-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Legislature To Reduce The Amount Of General Funds Appropriated To The Authority For Educational Television By Twenty Percent For Each Of The Next Five Fiscal Years; To Provide That From And After Fiscal Year 2017, The Legislature Shall Not Appropriate Any General Funds To The Authority; To Authorize The Authority To Sell All Or Any Part Of The Operations And Equipment Of The Authority For Not Less Than The Current Fair Market Value; To Provide That The Proceeds From Any Sale Shall Be Deposited Into The Appropriate Special Fund In The State Treasury To The Credit Of The State Department Of Education, And Shall Be Appropriated By The Legislature For Special Education Programs Of The Department; And For Related Purposes.

742.title: ETV; Legislature shall reduce general fund appropriations to by one-third for each of next three fiscal years.
742.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-63-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Legislature To Reduce The Amount Of General Funds Appropriated To The Authority For Educational Television By One-third For Each Of The Next Three Fiscal Years; To Provide That From And After Fiscal Year 2015, The Legislature Shall Not Appropriate Any General Funds To The Authority; To Provide That Beginning With Fiscal Year 2012, The Legislature Shall Appropriate To The Mississippi Library Commission The Amount By Which The General Fund Appropriation To The Authority Is Less Than The Amount Of General Funds Appropriated To The Authority For Fiscal Year 2011; To Provide That Those Funds Shall Be Used By The Library Commission For Grants To Public Libraries Located In Municipalities Having A Population Of Less Than Two Thousand Five Hundred; To Authorize The Authority To Sell All Or Any Part Of The Operations And Equipment Of The Authority For Not Less Than The Current Fair Market Value; To Provide That The Proceeds From Any Sale Shall Be Deposited Into A Special Fund That Is Created In The State Treasury, Which Shall Be Appropriated By The Legislature For Payment Of The Principal And Interest On Any State General Obligation Bonds That Provided Any Money To Or Financed Any Projects For The Authority, And To The Mississippi Library Commission For Grants To Public Libraries Located In Municipalities Having A Population Of Less Than Two Thousand Five Hundred; And For Related Purposes.

743.title: Beer; increase by 3% the amount of alcohol that it may contain.
743.description: An Act To Amend Sections 67-1-5, 67-3-1, 67-3-3, 67-3-5, 67-3-7, 67-3-9, 67-3-13, 67-3-17, 67-3-28, 67-3-49, 67-3-53 And 27-71-509, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Permissible Alcoholic Content Of Beer From 5% Of Alcohol By Weight To Eight Percent Of Alcohol By Weight; And For Related Purposes.

744.title: Pharmacy benefit managers; require to inform plan sponsors of any rebates received from drug manufacturers.
744.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-155, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Pharmacy Benefit Managers To Regularly Inform The Entities For Which They Administer The Prescription Drug/device Portion Of A Pharmacy Benefit Management Plan Or Health Insurance Plan Of The Amount And Source Of Any Rebates Received From The Manufacturers Of Prescription Drugs Or Devices That Are Covered Under The Plan; And For Related Purposes.

745.title: Ad valorem tax, homestead property; exempt increase in assessed value above assessed value for preceding year for persons 65 or older.
745.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Homestead Property Owners Who Are Sixty-five Years Of Age Or Older Shall Be Allowed An Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes On The Amount Of The Increase In The Assessed Value Of The Homestead Property Above The Assessed Value Of Such Homestead Property For The Preceding Calendar Year; To Provide That The Ad Valorem Tax Exemption Provided By This Act Is In Addition To All Other Exemptions Provided By State Law; And For Related Purposes.

746.title: School attendance; authorize up to maximum of 5 excused absences for compulsory-school-age children of certain military personnel.
746.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include The Absences Of A Compulsory-school-age Child Whose Parent Or Legal Guardian Is Being Deployed Or Returning From Deployment On Leave Within The Category Of Excused Absences; To Require That Those Compulsory-school-age Children Be Granted Up To A Maximum Of Five Excused Absences Per School Year For Purposes Of Visiting With His Or Her Parent Or Legal Guardian Before The Parent's Or Legal Guardian's Extended Overseas Deployment Or During A Return On Leave From An Extended Overseas Deployment; And For Related Purposes.

747.title: Adequate Education Program; eliminate additional allocation to school districts having three years positive ADA growth.
747.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Manner In Which The Average Daily Attendance Of School Districts Is Calculated For Adequate Education Program Funding Purposes In Order To Eliminate The Additional Allocation To Those School Districts Experiencing Positive Growth In The Three Preceding School Years; And For Related Purposes.

748.title: CON; authorize psychiatric residential treatment facility beds and child/adolescent psychiatric beds at several locations.
748.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Department Of Health To Issue Certificates Of Need For Psychiatric Residential Facility Beds In The City Of Meridian, The City Of Flowood And The City Of Louisville; To Direct The Department To Issue Certificates Of Need For Child/adolescent Psychiatric Beds In The City Of Meridian And The City Of Flowood; To Direct The Department To Revise The Condition On Any Certificate Of Need That Was Issued To A Facility In The City Of Louisville Prohibiting The Facility From Participating In The Medicaid Program, To Allow The Facility To Have Five Child/adolescent Psychiatric Beds Participate In The Medicaid Program; And For Related Purposes.

749.title: Light wine and beer; Commissioner of Revenue may establish dates for expiration of permits and may issue temporary permits.
749.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Revenue To Establish Dates For The Expiration Of Permits Issued Under The Laws Governing The Manufacture And Sale Of Light Wine And Beer; To Authorize The Commissioner Of Revenue To Issue Temporary Permits Under The Laws Governing The Sale Of Light Wine Or Beer; To Provide That Such Permits Shall Contain Certain Information; And For Related Purposes.

750.title: Light wine and beer laws; remove repeal date on authority of Alcoholic Beverage Control Division officers to enforce.
750.description: An Act To Amend Sections 67-1-37, 67-3-31, 67-3-37 And 67-3-74, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The July 1, 2011, Repeal Date On The Provisions That Authorize The Enforcement Agents Of The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division Of The Department Of Revenue To Enforce Certain Provisions Of The Light Wine And Beer Laws; And For Related Purposes.

751.title: Income tax; delete repealer on credit for certain charges incurred at ports for import of cargo and on annual impact report.
751.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-7-22.23 And 27-7-22.24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Repealer On The Income Tax Credit Authorized For Certain Taxpayers That Incur Certain Charges At State, County And Municipal Ports On The Import Of Cargo And To Delete The Repealer On The Provision That Requires The Mississippi Development Authority To Report Annually To The Legislature Regarding The Impact Of The Tax Credit; And For Related Purposes.

752.title: Mississippi Business Finance Corporation; delete repealer on authority to issue bonds to finance economic development projects.
752.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 57-10-401 Through 57-10-445, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Issuance Of Bonds By The Mississippi Business Finance Corporation To Finance Economic Development Projects In Order To Induce The Location Or Expansion Of Certain Businesses Within This State; To Reenact Section 27-7-22.3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Credit Against State Income Taxes For Certain Companies For Debt Service Paid By Such Companies Under Financing Agreements Entered Into With The Mississippi Business Finance Corporation Under Section 57-10-409, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Repeal Section 57-10-449, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Repeal Date On Sections 57-10-401 Through 57-10-445 And 27-7-22.3, Mississippi Code Of 1972; And For Related Purposes.

754.title: Legal holiday; set August 26th (Women's Day) as.
754.description: An Act To Amend Section 3-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Twenty-sixth Day Of August (women's Day) Shall Be Declared To Be A Legal Holiday; To Clarify That When A Legal Holiday Falls On A Saturday Or Sunday, Then The Next Following Monday, Or Other Day Fixed By Proclamation Of The Governor As The Day To Celebrate The Holiday, Shall Be A Legal Holiday; And For Related Purposes.

755.title: Trucks; remove the requirement that visibility must be bad from the requirement to reduce speed during inclement weather.
755.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-505, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That Visibility Must Be Bad From The Requirement That All Trucks, Or Truck-trailer Combinations, And Passenger Buses Shall Be Required To Reduce Speed To Forty-five Miles Per Hour During Inclement Weather; And For Related Purposes.

756.title: Dept. of Agriculture and Commerce; authorize to make certain financial transactions for the benefit of the department.
756.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Accept, Budget, Receive And Expend Funds From Any Source For Improvements To Facilities And For Marketing And Promotion Programs Of The Department; To Create A Special Fund For Those Funds; To Authorize The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Allow Advertising On Department Property And In Its Publications; To Authorize The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Sell Certain Items In The Possession Of The Mississippi Agriculture And Forestry Museum After Reasonable Attempts Have Been Made To Contact The Donor Of Such Item And Are Unsuccessful; And For Related Purposes.

757.title: Inspection stickers; require minimum of twenty-five dollar fine to be imposed for failure to have.
757.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-13-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If An Operator Of A Motor Vehicle Charged With Failure To Have A Valid Vehicle Inspection Sticker Presents To The Court On Or Before The Hearing Date Or The Date Of Payment Of The Fine A Receipt Or Other Proof Sufficient To Show That The Vehicle Has Been Inspected And A Valid Inspection Sticker Has Been Issued For The Vehicle, The Fine May Be Reduced To An Amount Not Less Than Twenty-five Dollars, And Any Fees, Penalties, Assessments Or Court Courts May Be Reduced Or Waived; To Amend Section 63-13-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

759.title: Retirement; revise amount that PERS disability retiree may earn from gainful employment.
759.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Amount That A Disability Retiree Who Is Engaged In A Gainful Occupation May Be Paid Without A Reduction In His Disability Benefit; And For Related Purposes.

760.title: Public hearings for coastal wetland permits; revise procedure.
760.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-27-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Procedure Required To Object To A Coastal Wetlands Permit Application Related To Activities On Coastal Wetlands; And For Related Purposes.

761.title: Coastal wetlands permit application; revise review period of.
761.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-27-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Date Of Review For A Complete Coastal Wetlands Permit Application Begins On The Date Of The Last Amendment To The Application; To Amend Section 49-27-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Section; And For Related Purposes.

762.title: Commercial harvesting of seafood; revise location in which one may engage in.
762.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-315, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Location In Which A Person May Engage In Commercial Harvesting Of Crabs, Oysters, Shrimp, Bait Shrimp Or Saltwater Fish; And For Related Purposes.

763.title: Saltwater minnows; revise definition of.
763.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definition Of "saltwater Minnow"; And For Related Purposes.

764.title: Live bait camps; authorize and require inspection of.
764.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-64.4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Applications For Live Bait Camps To Be Submitted At Anytime; And For Related Purposes.

765.title: Shrimp; revise where can be taken and clarify personal consumption.
765.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-64.2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Shrimp That A Person May Take For Personal Consumption From Certain Locations; And For Related Purposes.

766.title: Distinctive license tag; reauthorize Dept. of Marine Resource's tag for supporters of seafood industry.
766.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Supporting The Department Of Marine Resources For Supporters Of The Mississippi Seafood Industry And To Require Fees Collected From The Issuance Of The License Tags To Be Deposited Into The Mississippi Seafood Marketing Program Account Rather Than The Artificial Reef Program Account; To Amend Section 49-15-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Section And To Create The Mississippi Seafood Marketing Program Account In The Seafood Fund; And For Related Purposes.

767.title: "Free Fishing Weekend"; designate and authorize exemption from saltwater sport fishing.
767.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-313, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate The First Weekend Of "national Fishing And Boating Week" In June Of Each Year As "free Fishing Weekend"; To Provide That Any Person May Saltwater Sport Fish Without A License During "free Fishing Weekend"; And For Related Purposes.

768.title: MS Highways 24 and 33; designate certain segments of.
768.description: An Act To Designate Certain Segments Of Mississippi Highway 24 And Mississippi Highway 33 As "camp Van Dorn Highway," "99th Infantry Division Highway" And "63rd Infantry Division Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

769.title: Homochitto National Forest lands; establish season for hunting deer with guns and with dogs.
769.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Open Season On The Hunting Of Deer With Guns And With Dogs On Homochitto National Forest Lands Shall Be From The First Saturday Before Thanksgiving Through December 1; To Provide That Only Legal Bucks May Be Harvested; To Prohibit The Hunting Of Deer On Homochitto National Forest Lands During Any Other Open Season Established For Hunting With Guns And With Dogs; And For Related Purposes.

770.title: Mississippi Wireless Communication Commission; revise membership of.
770.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The Mississippi Wireless Communication Commission By Adding The Executive Director Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To The Commission And By Removing A Representative Of Safecity Initiative From Such Commission; And For Related Purposes.

771.title: Support Our Law Enforcement and Safe Neighborhoods Act of 2011; create.
771.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Support Our Law Enforcement And Safe Neighborhoods Act Of 2011; To Set Forth Legislative Intent; To Require Cooperation And Assistance In Enforcement Of Immigration Laws And To Indemnify Law Enforcement Officers For Implementation Of This Act; To Create The Offense Of Willful Failure To Complete Or Carry An Alien Registration Document; To Amend Section 97-3-54.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Law Enforcement Officer To Stop Any Person In Violation Of Traffic Laws In The Enforcement Of The Mississippi Employment Protection Act; To Create The Offense Of Unlawful Stopping To Hire And Pick Up Passengers For Work; To Create The Offense Of Unlawful Transport, Concealment Or Harboring Of Unlawful Aliens; To Provide For The Arrest Without Warrant Of A Person Reasonably Believed To Have Committed Any Public Offense That Makes The Person Removable From The United States; To Amend Section 71-11-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Retention Of E-verify Confirmations For At Least 3 Years And To Provide To An Employer The Affirmative Defense Of Entrapment; To Require The Immobilization Or Impoundment Of A Vehicle Operated In Furtherance Of Violations Under This Act; To Create The Special Fund To Be Known As The Gang And Immigration Intelligence Team Enforcement Mission Fund; And For Related Purposes.

772.title: Judicial candidates; revise procedures for certain vacancies.
772.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-977, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Procedures To Be Followed If Only One Person Has Qualified As A Candidate For A Judicial Office And That Person Dies, Resigns Or Is Otherwise Disqualified From Holding That Office Before The General Election; To Amend Section 23-15-365, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude Nonpartisan Judicial Elections From The Provision Of Law Regarding Write-in Ballots; To Amend Sections 23-15-833 And 23-15-849, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise How Vacancies For Circuit And Chancery Court Judges Are Filled; To Provide A Procedure For Creation Of A Temporary County Executive Committee; And For Related Purposes.

773.title: Medicaid; require division to cooperate with Health Benefit Exchange and create Health Benefit Exchange Act.
773.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-13-115, 43-13-121 And 41-86-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Division Of Medicaid To Cooperate With The Mississippi Health Benefit Exchange Created By This Act In The Performance Of Its Duties, And To Accept The Enrollment Of Persons Who Are Determined To Be Eligible For Medicaid Or The Children's Health Insurance Program By The Exchange; To Create The Mississippi Health Benefit Exchange Act; To State The Purpose And Intent Of The Act; To Provide Definitions For The Purposes Of The Act; To Establish The Mississippi Health Benefit Exchange As An Office Within The Department Of Insurance; To Provide The General Requirements For And Specific Duties Of The Exchange; To Authorize The Exchange To Certify Health Benefit Plans As Qualified Health Plans; To Authorize The Exchange To Charge Assessments Or User Fees To Health Carriers To Provide Funding Necessary To Support Its Operations; To Authorize The Exchange To Promulgate Regulations To Implement The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

774.title: Nursing home administrators licensure law; revise educational and experience requirements and complaint procedure.
774.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-17-11 And 73-17-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Educational And Experience Requirements In Order To Be Eligible For A Nursing Home Administrator's License; To Require Criminal Background Checks For Applicants; To Prescribe The Fees Charged By The Board For Licensure And For Examinations; To Delete The Requirement That A Copy Of All Documentation Pertaining To An Investigation Be Provided To The Licensee Before A Hearing; To Authorize The Board To Assess The Reasonable Costs Associated With The Investigation And Disciplinary Proceeding Against A Licensee; To Amend Sections 73-22-1 And 73-22-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Orthotists And Prosthetists Who Have Been Certified By The Board For Orthotist/prosthetist Certification To Practice In Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

775.title: Legal holiday; provide that Columbus Day shall be.
775.description: An Act To Amend Section 3-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Second Monday In October (columbus Day) Shall Be A Legal Holiday; To Recognize And Commemorate The Last Day Of February As "african American Day," And To Recognize And Commemorate August 26 As "women's Day"; To Specifically Provide That These Days Shall Not Be Legal Holidays, But Shall Be Days Of Recognition And Commemoration At No Expense To The State; And For Related Purposes.

776.title: Medicaid; revise certain provisions regarding hearings on eligibility claims.
776.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-116, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That When The Division Of Medicaid Denies An Applicant's Claim Of Eligibility Or Denies, Reduces Or Terminates A Recipient's Benefits, The Division Shall Provide In Writing To The Applicant Or Recipient, And To All Physicians Involved In The Process On Behalf Of The Applicant Or Recipient, All Of The Criteria For Eligibility For Those Benefits And The Specific Reasons For The Denial Of Eligibility Or The Denial, Reduction Or Termination Of The Benefits, And Shall Provide The Applicant Or Recipient With The Phone Numbers Of Consumer Assistance Programs For Medicaid Benefits; To Provide That Administrative Hearings On Eligibility Claims By Medicaid Applicants Or Recipients Will Be Held In Person, Unless The Claimant Or Representative Requests To Have The Hearing Held By Telephone; To Provide That Claimants In Administrative Hearings On Eligibility Claims Shall Have The Right To Have The Physicians Of The Division's Quality Improvement Organization Review The Claimant's Case Before The Hearing, Upon The Request Of The Claimant, And The Right To Have Present At The Hearing A Physician Or Physicians Who Have Examined The Claimant To Present Evidence Concerning The Claimant's Eligibility For Benefits; And For Related Purposes.

777.title: Commercial mobile radio service providers; require to identify county of primary use of its wireless customers.
777.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-333, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Commercial Mobile Radio Service (cmrs) Providers To Furnish To The Cmrs Board Information Identifying The County Of Primary Use Of Each Cmrs Customer For Purposes Of Assisting In The Distribution Of Certain Monies Of The Cmrs Fund To Each Emergency Communications District; And For Related Purposes.

778.title: District attorney; authorize supplement for salary of.
778.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Supplemental Pay For A District Attorney In An Amount Not To Exceed $8,300.00 Which May Be Paid From Any Source, Other Than The State Treasury; And For Related Purposes.

779.title: Check cashers; reduce maximum rate of interest that may be charged for cashing checks.
779.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-67-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Check Cashers From Cashing A Delayed Deposit Check For Any Person Who Has An Outstanding Delayed Deposit Check With Another Check Casher That Has Not Been Repaid In Full; To Direct The Commissioner Of Banking To Provide For The Development Of A Database In Which Check Cashers Must Record Each Delayed Deposit Transaction In Order To Prevent Violations Of The Maximum Amount That May Be Outstanding; To Authorize The Commissioner To Charge A Fee To Check Cashers As Necessary To Maintain The Database System; To Provide That The Maximum Amount That Check Cashers May Charge For Cashing A Delayed Deposit Check Shall Not Exceed An Annual Percentage Rate Of 36% Per Annum On The Amount Of The Principal Amount That Remains Unpaid; And For Related Purposes.

780.title: Deceased persons; establish rights of others to control disposition of remains of.
780.description: An Act Relating To The Right To Control The Disposition Of The Remains Of Deceased Persons; To Provide That The Disposition Directions And Funeral Prearrangements Contained In A Preneed Contract May Be Revised Only Under Certain Conditions; To Establish The Rights Of Certain Persons, In Prescribed Order, To Control The Disposition Of The Remains Of A Deceased Person; To Specify Certain Conditions Under Which A Person Forfeits His Legal Right To Direct The Disposition Of Another's Remains; To Authorize The Chancery Court In The County In Which The Deceased Person Last Resided To Determine The Right Of Disposition In Certain Cases Where Those Sharing The Right Of Disposition Cannot Agree; To Prescribe The Rights And Responsibilities Of Funeral Homes When Disputes Relating To The Right Of Disposition Arise; To Amend Sections 73-11-58 And 75-63-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

781.title: Abandoned sections of county road system; revise procedures.
781.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-7-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors To Grant An Easement Of An Abandoned Section Of The County Road System To The Landowner Whose Property Adjoins An Abandoned Section Of The County Road System; To Bring Forward Section 65-7-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Require Notice Of The Public Hearing Regarding The Abandoned Section Of The Road System To Be Sent To All Landowners Whose Property Adjoins Such Abandoned Section Of The Road System; And For Related Purposes.

782.title: Insurance; revise uninsured motorist coverage law and require Commissioner of Insurance to establish homeowners bill of rights.
782.description: An Act To Require The Commissioner Of Insurance To Establish The Mississippi Homeowners Insurance Policyholder Bill Of Rights; To Provide That, In Any Action For Damages By The Policyholder Against An Insurer Under A Homeowners Policy, The Insurer Has The Burden Of Proof As To The Application Of Any Exclusion In The Policy And Any Exception To Or Other Avoidance Of Coverage By The Insurer; To Amend Section 83-11-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That An Insurer Of Automobile Liability Coverage Must Provide The Insured With Written Notice Stating That The Uninsured Motorist Limits May Be Increased Up To The Bodily Injury Liability Coverage Limits; To Provide That The Insurer Must Have The Insured Sign And Date That Written Notice When The Insured First Obtains Coverage, But Not Upon Renewal; And For Related Purposes.

783.title: Forfeiture; provide for assets involved in certain trademark and recordings violations.
783.description: An Act To Provide For The Seizure And Forfeiture Of Property Used In Trademark And Recordings Violations; To Provide For Seizure And Forfeiture Proceedings; To Provide For Notice To Lienholders And Parties With Security Interests; To Provide For The Disposition Of Property And Proceeds; To Amend Sections 97-21-53, 97-21-55, 97-21-57 And 97-23-89, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

784.title: Surplus lines insurance; revise provisions of law regarding.
784.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-21-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Provisions Of Laws Regarding The Eligibility Of Nonadmitted Insurers To Write Business In The State Of Mississippi; To Create A New Section Of Law To Be Codified As Section 83-21-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Insurance To Enter Into An Agreement With Other States To Establish Procedures For Allocating Premium Taxes; To Amend Section 83-21-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Licensing Provisions For Resident And Nonresident Surplus Lines Insurance Producers; To Amend Section 83-21-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Stamping Procedures May Apply To The Reporting, Payment, Collection And Allocation Of Premium Taxes For Nonadmitted Insurance Consistent With Any Agreement, Compact Or Procedures Entered Into By The Commissioner Of Insurance; To Amend Section 83-21-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That, When Placing Nonadmitted Insurance For An Exempt Commercial Purchaser, A Surplus Lines Insurance Producer Is Not Required To Make A Due Diligence Search To Determine Whether The Full Amount Or Type Of Insurance Can Be Obtained From Admitted Insurers; To Amend Sections 83-21-25, 83-21-27 And 83-21-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Certain Technical And Nonsubstantive Changes; To Amend Section 83-34-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Each Insured In This State Who Directly Procures Or Renews Insurance With A Nonadmitted Insurer On Properties, Risks Or Exposures Located In This State, Other Than Insurance Procured Through A Surplus Lines Licensee, Shall Be Subject To The Nonadmitted Policy Fee Which Shall Be Paid Pursuant To The Procedures Provided For Premium Taxes; And For Related Purposes.

785.title: Emergency communications districts; require identifying information for distribution of proceeds from emergency telephone charge.
785.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-313, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Board Of Supervisors Of A County To Utilize Information That Identifies The Zip Code And County Of Primary Use Of Each Service User When Distributing Excess Proceeds Generated By The Emergency Telephone Service Charge Within An Emergency Communications District; To Require Service Suppliers To Provide The Board Of Supervisors And The Board Of Commissioners With The Zip Code And County Of Primary Use Of The Service User; And For Related Purposes.

786.title: CON; suspend statutory restrictions on issuance of for certain health care facilities until July 1, 2012.
786.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Statutory Restrictions On The Issuance Of Certificates Of Need For Nursing Facilities, Psychiatric Residential Treatment Facilities, Child/adolescent Psychiatric Beds And Child/adolescent Chemical Dependency Beds In Hospitals, Psychiatric Hospitals And Chemical Dependency Hospitals, Intermediate Care Facilities For The Mentally Retarded, And Home Health Agencies Shall Be Suspended Until July 1, 2012; And For Related Purposes.

787.title: CON; exempt construction of ICF-MR facility on leased or transferred Columbia Training School property from requirement for issuance of.
787.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From The Requirement For The Issuance Of A Health Care Certificate Of Need The New Construction, Conversion Or Expansion Of An Intermediate Care Facility For The Mentally Retarded On Any Portion Of The Columbia Training School Property That Is Leased Or Transferred By The Department Of Human Services To Millcreek Of Columbia, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

788.title: Child custody, require court hearing before custodial parent may remove the child from the state.
788.description: An Act To Require A Court Hearing To Determine Whether A Parent Who Has Custody Or Joint Custody With Primary Physical Custody May Relocate Outside Of The State Or Move A Substantial Distance From The Noncustodial Parent Within The State Before The Child Is Removed; To Require The Custodial Parent To Provide The Noncustodial Parent With Notice; To Establish The Procedures To Be Followed In Petitioning The Court For A Hearing On The Matter Of Relocation By The Custodial Parent; To Prescribe The Factors To Be Taken Into Consideration By The Court When Making Its Determination; To Amend Sections 93-5-23, 93-5-24 And 97-3-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

789.title: Bastardy; change terminology in code.
789.description: An Act To Amend Sections 93-9-73 And 93-9-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove References To Bastardy; And For Related Purposes.

790.title: State Personnel System; remove officials and employees other than teaching staffs at colleges and universities from nonstate service.
790.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Academic Officials And Employees Who Are Not Part Of The Colleges' And Universities' Teaching Staffs From The Definition Of "nonstate Service" As That Term Is Used Under The Statewide Personnel System Law; And For Related Purposes.

791.title: Vulnerable persons; increase fine for failure to report abuse or neglect of patient or resident of care facility.
791.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-47-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Amount Of The Fine That May Be Imposed And Set A Minimum Fine For Conviction Of The Knowing Failure To Make A Required Report Of Abuse, Neglect Or Exploitation Of A Patient Or Resident Of A Care Facility; And For Related Purposes.

792.title: Bastardy; remove reference in code.
792.description: An Act To Amend Sections 93-9-73 And 93-9-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove References To Bastardy; And For Related Purposes.

793.title: Child custody; provide notice and procedure for relocating a child's residence.
793.description: An Act To Provide For The Relocating Of A Child's Residence When Such Child Is The Subject Of A Custody Order; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide For The Applicability Of This Act; To Provide Notice Requirements For Relocation; To Provide That Failure To Give Notice Of Relocation Or Relocation Without Court Authorization May Result In Certain Other Legal Ramifications; To Authorize Relocation Unless Objection Has Occurred; To Provide Objection Procedures; To Provide For Hearing Priority; To Provide For Temporary Orders; To Provide That Proposed Relocation Is Not A Basis For Modification; To Provide Factors To Determine Contested Relocation; To Provide A Burden Of Proof; To Authorize The Court To Require Security; To Require The Application Of Factors At The Initial Hearing If The Issue Of Relocation Is Presented; To Provide Sanction For Unwarranted Or Frivolous Proposals; To Provide Continuing Jurisdiction; To Amend Sections 93-5-23 And 93-11-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

794.title: Elevator Safety Act of Mississippi; enact.
794.description: An Act To Create The "elevator Safety Act Of Mississippi"; To Provide For The Scope Of The Act; To Define Certain Terms Used In The Act; To Establish The Elevator Safety Review Board And Provide For Its Membership; To Provide For The Board's Powers And Duties; To Provide For The Licensure Of Elevator Contractors, Elevator Mechanics And Elevator Inspectors, And To Establish Qualifications Therefor; To Provide For Biennial Renewal Of Licenses; To Provide That Licenses May Be Suspended, Revoked Or Subject To Civil Penalties Upon Certain Violations; To Require Registration Of Existing Elevators, Platform Lifts, Dumbwaiters, Escalators, Moving Walks And Any Other Conveyance; To Require Installations And/or Service And Maintenance To Be Performed In Compliance With The State Fire Prevention And Building Code; To Require Permits Before A Conveyance Is Erected, Constructed, Installed Or Altered Within Buildings Or Structures; To Provide Insurance Requirements For Licensees; To Require The Elevator Safety Review Board To Develop An Enforcement Program; To Provide Civil Penalties For Violations Of The Act; To Provide That The Provisions Of The Act Are Not Retroactive Unless Otherwise Stated; To Provide That The Owner Of All New And Existing Conveyances Located In Any Building Or Structure Shall Have The Responsibility Of Having The Conveyance Inspected Annually By A Licensed Elevator Inspector; And For Related Purposes.

795.title: Electric vehicles; impose annual tax on, based on mileage traveled each year.
795.description: An Act To Impose An Annual Tax On Electric Vehicles In Addition To Any Other Taxes For Which The Vehicle Is Liable; To Define "electric Vehicle"; To Provide That The Tax Shall Be Paid To The County Tax Collector At The Same Time And In The Same Manner As The Annual Highway Privilege Tax Is Paid; To Provide That The Amount Of The Tax Shall Be Equal To One-half Cent Per Mile For The Number Of Miles That The Electric Vehicle Has Traveled During The Preceding Year; To Provide That The Tax Collector Shall Remit The Proceeds Of The Tax To The Department Of Revenue; To Provide That The Department Shall Apportion The Proceeds Of The Tax Among The Various Purposes Specified For Gasoline And Diesel Fuel Taxes In The Same Proportion That Those Taxes Were Apportioned For Those Purposes During The Previous State Fiscal Year; And For Related Purposes.

796.title: Burn Center; repeal requirement for UMMC to establish and provide for reimbursement for certain other burn centers.
796.description: An Act To Repeal Section 37-115-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Directs The University Of Mississippi Medical Center To Establish The Mississippi Burn Center As A Separate Unit At The Medical Center For The Treatment Of Burn Victims; To Amend Section 41-59-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Joseph M. Still Burn Centers And The Mississippi Burn Center At Crossgates River Oaks Hospital Shall Receive A Reasonable Amount Of Reimbursement From The State Department Of Health For The Cost Of Providing Burn Care Services To Mississippi Residents Whose Treatment Is Uncompensated; To Provide That The Plan Developed By The State Board Of Health For The Delivery Of Services To Mississippi Burn Victims Shall Include Systems By Which Burn Patients Will Be Assigned Or Transferred To Any Certified Burn Center Designated By The Department, And Procedures For Allocating Funds Appropriated From The Mississippi Burn Care Fund To Certified Burn Centers Designated By The Department That Provide Services To Mississippi Burn Victims; To Amend Sections 7-9-70, 21-19-58, 27-19-44.3, 27-39-331 And 27-39-332, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

797.title: Personal care homes; require licensure and regulation if they provide living arrangements for one or more persons.
797.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-11-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Personal Care Homes Must Be Licensed And Regulated By The State Department Of Health If They Provide Individual Or Group Living Arrangements For One Or More Persons Who Are Unrelated To The Operator; And For Related Purposes.

798.title: Weapons; authorize investigators employed by the Real Estate Commission to carry.
798.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Investigators Employed By The Real Estate Commission To Carry Weapons; And For Related Purposes.

799.title: Wrongful death; damages distributed as provided in will if one exists.
799.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Wrongful Death Damages Shall Be Distributed According To The Deceased's Will If One Exists; And For Related Purposes.

801.title: Mississippi Department of Labor; create.
801.description: An Act To Establish A Mississippi Department Of Labor; To Set Forth And Prescribe The Functions Of Administrative Offices In The Department; To Provide For The Election Of The Commissioner Of Labor; To Amend Section 71-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Abolish The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security And Transfer The Duties, Powers And Funds Of The Department To The Office Of Employment Security In The Mississippi Department Of Labor; To Repeal Section 71-5-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Appointment Of The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security; To Empower The Department Of Labor To Administer And Coordinate Certain Federal And State-funded Job Training And Employment-related Education Programs; To Amend Sections 7-1-351, 7-1-355, 7-1-357, 7-1-361, 7-1-363 And 7-1-365, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Prescribe The Responsibilities Of The Office Of Industry Service And Industry Start-up Training, The Office Of Employee Relations And Job Discrimination And The Office Of Disabled Employee Assistance In The Department; To Amend Section 25-3-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set The Annual Salary Of The Commissioner Of Labor; To Amend Sections 23-15-193 And 23-15-297, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add The Commissioner Of Labor To The List Of Elected Officials; And For Related Purposes.

802.title: Affordable housing; create trust fund to assist in development, rehabilitation and preservation of.
802.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund Management Board; To Provide That Money In The Trust Fund Shall Be Made Available For Assisting The Development, Rehabilitation And Preservation Of Affordable Housing; To Provide That The Trust Fund Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Provide That The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund Management Board Approve Rules And Regulations Proposed By The Mississippi Development Authority, Oversee The Management Of Monies In The Trust Fund And Approve Awards Of Trust Fund Monies To Applicants; To Provide That The Board Shall Be Appointed By The Governor And Attorney General; To Create The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund Oversight Committee, A Joint Legislative Committee Appointed By The Speaker And The Lieutenant Governor; To Provide That The Committee Shall Serve Only In An Advisory Capacity To The Board And Shall Have No Vote On Any Matter Within The Jurisdiction Of The Board; To Amend Section 75-76-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of All Taxes, Fees, Interest, Penalties, Damages, Fines Or Other Monies Collected By The Department Of Revenue Under The Gaming Control Act Shall Be Deposited To The Credit Of The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund; And For Related Purposes.

803.title: Military; require leave of absence for family of active duty and revise other provisions.
803.description: An Act To Require Certain Employers To Allow Employees Who Have A Relative Ordered To Active Duty To Take A Leave Of Absence; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide Guidelines For Employees Desiring To Take A Leave Of Absence; To Require An Employer, At An Employee's Expense, To Continue The Employee's Health Care Benefits During A Leave Of Absence; To Prohibit The Refusal Of Public Accommodations To Persons On Active Duty Who Are Under The Age Of 21; To Amend Section 13-5-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Citizens Serving On Active Duty In The Armed Forces Of The United States Or The National Guard From Jury Service; To Amend Section 33-3-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Adjutant General To Assist In Carrying Out The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 33-4-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Use Of The Mississippi Military Family Relief Fund; And For Related Purposes.

805.title: Medicaid; provide state funding for regional mental health centers in division's appropriation, not Dept. of Mental Health's.
805.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That State Funding For Medicaid Reimbursement For Services Provided By Regional Mental Health/intellectual Disability Centers Shall Be Provided In The Appropriation To The Division Of Medicaid For That Purpose, Rather Than In The Appropriation To The Department Of Mental Health; And For Related Purposes.

806.title: Law enforcement Employment Procedures Act; create.
806.description: An Act To Create The Law Enforcement Employment Procedures Act; To Require Municipalities To Provide A Predisciplinary Hearing Prior To The Suspension Or Termination Of Any Law Enforcement Officer; To Establish A Minimum Level Of Written Due Process Procedures; To Specify What Notice Shall Be Provided To The Officer; To Provide That The Officer May Attend The Hearing, May Be Represented By Counsel, May Present Evidence On His Own Behalf And Question Witnesses; To Provide That The Evidentiary Phase Of The Hearing May Be Held In Executive Session; To Provide That Final Adjudication Shall Be Held In Open Meeting; To Exempt Municipalities That Have A Civil Service Commission Or Due Process Policy; And For Related Purposes.

807.title: Small Municipalities and Limited Population Counties Fund; authorize issuance of bonds for.
807.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $25,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Proceeds Of Certain Bonds May Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority To Reimburse Certain Costs Related To The Administration Of The Fund; And For Related Purposes.

808.title: S.A.F.E. Mortgage Act; exempt real property sellers who receive mortgages as security for purchase money obligations.
808.description: An Act To Amend Section 81-18-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From The Mississippi S.a.f.e. Mortgage Act Sellers Of Real Property Who Receive One Or More Mortgages Or Deeds Of Trust As Security For A Purchase Money Obligation; And For Related Purposes.

809.title: Judgments; clarify renewal.
809.description: An Act To Amend Section 15-1-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Renewal Of Judgments; And For Related Purposes.

810.title: Law enforcement officer; employers shall provide with body armor.
810.description: An Act To Require Employers Of Full-time Certified Law Enforcement Officers Who Are Routinely Engaged In Law Enforcement Actions In The Performance Of Their Duties To Provide The Officers With Body Armor To Protect Them From Injury, At The Expense Of The Employers; And For Related Purposes.

811.title: Law enforcement Officers; provide minimum due process rights for municipal.
811.description: An Act To Require Municipalities To Provide A Predisciplinary Hearing Prior To The Suspension Or Termination Of Any Law Enforcement Officer; To Establish A Minimum Level Of Written Due Process Procedures; To Specify What Notice Shall Be Provided To The Officer; To Provide That The Officer May Attend The Hearing, May Be Represented By Counsel, May Present Evidence On His Own Behalf And Question Witnesses; To Provide That The Evidentiary Phase Of The Hearing May Be Held In Executive Session; To Provide That Final Adjudication Shall Be Held In Open Meeting; To Exempt Municipalities That Have A Civil Service Commission Or Due Process Policy; And For Related Purposes.

812.title: Law enforcement officers and fire fighters; increase amount of death benefits payable to.
812.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Death Benefit Payable From The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund For Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Killed In The Line Of Duty; And For Related Purposes.

813.title: Election commissioner; require to be a nonpartisan office.
813.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Office Of Election Commissioner Shall Be A Nonpartisan Office; And For Related Purposes.

814.title: Justice court judges; increase jurisdictional amount to $5,000.00.
814.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-11-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Justice Court Jurisdiction Amount To $5,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

815.title: Liens; clarify where and when enforcement takes place.
815.description: An Act To Amend Section 85-7-141, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Where And When A Lien May Be Enforced; And For Related Purposes.

816.title: Department Information Technology Services; require agencies to virtualize servers through data center.
816.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services To Require All State Agencies Having More Than Ten Servers To Virtualize Their Servers And To Require All Agency Virtualization Services To Be Managed And Operated Through The State Data Center; And For Related Purposes.

817.title: Engineering; delete expert testimony from definition of practice of engineering.
817.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-13-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete Expert Testimony From The Definition Of Practice Of Engineering; And For Related Purposes.

818.title: Board of supervisors; revise number of days that notice must be given before a special meeting of.
818.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Decrease From Five To One The Number Of Days That Notice Must Be Given Before A Special Meeting Of The Board Of Supervisors Of Any County May Be Called; And For Related Purposes.

819.title: Trial and Appellate Court Judges; increase salaries of.
819.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of The Trial And Appellate Court Judges; And For Related Purposes.

820.title: Judges; provide additional chancellor for the Fourth Chancery Court District.
820.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-5-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Two Chancellors For The Fourth Chancery Court District; And For Related Purposes.

821.title: Perpetual care cemeteries; provide for appointment of maintenance committee for under certain circumstances.
821.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-43-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Whenever A Perpetual Care Cemetery Becomes The Subject Of A Court Order Of Receivership And The Receiver Determines That Insufficient Cash Flow Or Income Exists To Provide Maintenance And Upkeep, The Receiver Shall Notify The Local Governing Authorities Where The Cemetery Is Located, Who Shall Appoint A Cemetery Maintenance Committee; To Authorize The Committee To Solicit Donations And Raise Funds And Establish A Trust Fund To Supply Continuing Needs Over A Long Period Of Time; And For Related Purposes.

822.title: Hospitals; Department of Health may authorize to operate off-campus emergency departments.
822.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-9-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Adopt Rules, Regulations And Standards That Authorize Hospitals To Establish And Operate Off-campus Emergency Departments; And For Related Purposes.

823.title: Debt Management Services Act; exempt certain services provided by attorneys.
823.description: An Act To Amend Section 81-22-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From The Mississippi Debt Management Services Act Certain Services Provided By Attorneys In The Regular Course Of The Practice Of Law; And For Related Purposes.

824.title: State Board of Health; authorize to increase various licensure and regulatory fees.
824.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-9-9, 41-71-5, 41-75-7, 41-75-9, 41-77-9, 41-85-7, 43-11-7, 43-11-8, 43-11-13, 45-14-11 And 45-14-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Board Of Heath To Increase Licensure And Regulatory Fees For Hospitals, Home Health Agencies, Ambulatory Surgical Facilities, Birthing Centers, Hospices And Institutions For The Aged And Infirm And For Entities Under Radiation Protection Program; And For Related Purposes.

825.title: CON; provide for direct appeals to Supreme Court and for expedited review for certain expenditures.
825.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Appeals Of Orders Of The State Department Of Health Pertaining To Certificates Of Need For Health Care Facilities Shall Be Made Directly To The Mississippi Supreme Court; To Amend Section 41-7-205, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Request For Certain Expenditures By A Health Care Facility That Exceed The Capital Expenditure Minimum Shall Be Authorized For Expedited Review; And For Related Purposes.

826.title: Nonresident pharmacies; require that adult sign for Schedule II drugs shipped to private residence in Mississippi.
826.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-125, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Delivery Of Schedule Ii Controlled Substances By Mail Or Other Shipping Method Is To Be Made Only To A Person Over The Age Of 18 Who Must Sign For Receipt Thereof; To Amend Sections 41-29-129 And 73-21-106, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

827.title: Assistant teachers; require school districts to provide notice of nonreemployment at least five days before the school year ends.
827.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require School Districts To Give Assistant Teachers Notification Of Nonreemployment No Later Than Five Days Before The End Of The Academic School Year; And For Related Purposes.

828.title: Private adoptions; require licensed adoption agencies and attorneys to maintain certain records.
828.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-15-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Licensed Adoption Agencies And Attorneys Who Have Completed The Private Adoption Of A Child To Maintain Certain Information In An Adoption File; To Require Such Agencies And Attorneys To Have A Written Plan That Is To Be Submitted To The Department Of Human Services, Division Of Family And Children's Services, For The Transfer Of The Custody Of Adoption Records If The Agencies Or Attorneys Cease To Provide Adoption Services; To Bring Forward Section 93-17-205, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes The Centralized Adoption Records File That Must Be Maintained By The Bureau Of Vital Records Of The Mississippi State Board Of Health, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

829.title: Ad valorem taxation; revise procedure for appeal of decisions regarding objections to assessments of real or personal property.
829.description: An Act To Provide For A "mississippi Property Tax Bill Of Rights"; To Amend Section 27-4-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Tax Appeals To Hear Appeals From Taxpayers Regarding Decisions Of County Boards Of Supervisors Or Municipal Governing Authorities Regarding Objections To Assessments Of Real Or Personal Property On The County Or Municipal Assessment Rolls; To Provide That A Taxpayer May Appeal A Decision Of The Board Of Tax Appeals To The Circuit Court Of The District For The County In Which The Property Is Located; To Amend Sections 27-35-119, 27-35-157, 21-33-10 And 21-33-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Appeals To The Board Of Tax Appeals Regarding Decisions Of County Boards Of Supervisors And Municipal Governing Authorities Regarding Objections To Assessments Of Real Or Personal Property On The County And Municipal Assessment Rolls; To Bring Forward Section 11-51-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Appeal Of From The Assessment Of Taxes To Circuit Court, For The Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

830.title: Crimes against animals; enact "Mississippi Dog and Cat Pet Protection Law of 2011".
830.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact The "mississippi Dog And Cat Pet Protection Law Of 2011"; To Clarify And Revise The Crime Of Cruelty To A Dog Or Cat; To Specifically Describe Activities That Do Not Constitute The Crime Of Cruelty To A Dog Or Cat; To Amend Sections 97-41-1, 97-41-3, 97-41-5, 97-41-7, 97-41-9, 97-41-17, 97-41-21 And 97-41-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

831.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize issuance to supporters of Taylorsville High School.
831.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Taylorsville High School; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

832.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize issuance to supporters of Raleigh High School.
832.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Raleigh High School; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

833.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize issuance to supporters of Mize Attendance Center.
