1379.description: An Act To Levy An Additional Assessment Upon Every Insurance Premium For Which Insurance Premium Tax Revenue Is Collected Under The Provisions Of Section 27-15-103 Et Seq. Of One-half Of One Percent Of The Gross Amount Of Premium Receipts Received From, And On Insurance Policies And Contracts Written In, Or Covering Risks Located In This State; To Require Insurers To Remit This Additional Assessment To The Department Of Revenue At The Same Time As They Remit Insurance Premium Tax Revenue Collected Under The Provisions Of Section 27-15-103 Et Seq.; To Require The Department Of Revenue To Annually Deposit The Monies Received From The Additional Assessment Levied Under This Section Into The Mississippi Windstorm Underwriting Association Reinsurance Assistance Fund; To Bring Forward Sections 83-34-1 Through 83-34-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are Provisions Of Law Regarding The Mississippi Windstorm Underwriting Association, For The Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1380.title: Crimes; provide procedure for expunction of certain felonies of persons under 18 years of age at time of conviction.
1380.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Procedure To Expunge Certain Felony Convictions For Persons Who Were Under The Age Of 18 At The Time Of Conviction; And For Related Purposes.

1381.title: Child support; allow money seized for violations of the Uniform Controlled Substances Law to pay.
1381.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude Child Support Obligations From Forfeiture Of Loss As A Result Of Violations Of The Uniform Controlled Substances Law; To Amend Section 41-29-177, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Attorney General To Determine The Status Of A Child Support Order Against A Party From Whom Property Was Seized For Violations Of The Uniform Controlled Substances Law; To Amend Section 93-11-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act And To Delete The Repealer On That Section, Which Provides Procedures For The Collection Of Payments 30 Days Past Due And Establishing Paternity; And For Related Purposes.

1382.title: Birth certificates; tribal courts shall have same authority as chancery courts to correct birth certificates of tribal members.
1382.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-57-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Tribal Courts Shall Have The Same Authority As Chancery Courts To Make Changes Or Corrections In The Birth Certificates Of Tribal Members; And For Related Purposes.

1383.title: Board of supervisors; give option to extend qualifying deadline for county offices.
1383.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-299, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Option Of Extending The Qualifying Deadline For County Offices To Each County Board Of Supervisors; And For Related Purposes.

1384.title: Mississippi Building Code Council; revise authority.
1384.description: An Act To Amend Section 17-2-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The Mississippi Building Codes Council, And To Provide That The Council Shall Not Enact Any Ordinance, Bylaw, Order, Building Code Or Rule Requiring The Installation Of A Multipurpose Residential Fire Protection Sprinkler System In A New Or Existing One- Or Two-family Dwelling; And For Related Purposes.

1385.title: Tax collectors and assessor-collectors; revise provisions regarding travel expenses and examination fees.
1385.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Requirement That The Board Of Supervisors Preapprove Travel By Tax Collectors, Assessor-tax Collectors And Their Deputies To An Approved Certified Collection School, And To Require Expenses Associated With Attendance At The School To Be Charged Against The Tax Collector's Or Assessor-tax Collector's Budget; To Amend Section 27-1-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Exemption From Paying An Examination Fee For Tax Collectors And Assessor-tax Collectors Taking Certain Examinations For The First Time, And To Abolish The Tax Collector Training Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1386.title: Board of supervisors; revise time period in which notice of emergency meeting is required to be given.
1386.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Board Of Supervisors To Call An Emergency Meeting Upon Three Hours Notice Delivered To All Members Of The Board Of Supervisors; And For Related Purposes.

1388.title: Motor vehicles; provide certain regulations for selling untitled vehicles for parts.
1388.description: An Act To Require The Purchaser Of An Untitled Motor Vehicle Who Intends To Sell The Parts Of The Vehicle To Hold The Motor Vehicle For 30 Days And Provide Notice And Certain Information To The Local Police Or Sheriff's Department; To Amend Section 63-21-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

1389.title: Justice court; specify dates to hear motions.
1389.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-11-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Designated Days To Hear Motions In Justice Court; And For Related Purposes.

1390.title: Trial and appeals courts; increase certain filing fees.
1390.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The General Docket Fee Assessed By The Clerk Of The Supreme Court For Appeals In Civil And Criminal Cases; To Amend Section 25-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fees For Filing Complaints And Petitions In The Chancery Courts; To Amend Section 25-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fee For Filing Complaints In The Circuit Courts; To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Standard State Assessment Imposed For Certain Felony Violations; And For Related Purposes.

1391.title: Law enforcement; require pursuit policy of alleged crime perpetrator.
1391.description: An Act To Require County And Local Law Enforcement Agencies That Conduct Vehicular Pursuits To Adopt Written Policies That Set Forth The Manner In Which These Operations Shall Be Conducted; And For Related Purposes.

1392.title: Marriage license; remove blood test requirement before issuance of.
1392.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That A Medical Certificate Must Be Presented To The Circuit Clerk, Verifying That A Blood Test Has Been Obtained By The Applicant, Before A Marriage License Is Issued By The Clerk; And For Related Purposes.

1393.title: Driver's license; increase fee for reinstatement following suspension.
1393.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase Reinstatement Fees For Suspended Driver's Licenses; To Provide For The Disposition Of The Additional Revenue; And For Related Purposes.

1394.title: MS Real Estate Commission; revise maximum contract period allowed between commission and errors and omissions insurance carrier.
1394.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-35-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Real Estate Brokers License Law Of 1954 To Change The Maximum Contract Period Allowed Between The Mississippi Real Estate Commission And The Insurance Carrier Approved By The Commission To Provide A Group Policy Of Errors And Omissions Coverage To Licensees; And For Related Purposes.

1395.title: Law Enforcement Officers Death/Disability Benefits Trust Funds; expand coverage to include emergency management personnel.
1395.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel; To Amend Section 45-2-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Disability Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel; And For Related Purposes.

1396.title: Sheriff; provide supplement to salary in Tunica County.
1396.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, In Its Discretion, To Supplement The Annual Salary Of The Sheriff; And For Related Purposes.

1397.title: School boards; increase members' optional salary and remove prohibition on joining PERS.
1397.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-6-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Optional Annual Salary Of Local School Board Members And To Delete The Prohibition On Salaried School Board Members Being Members Of The Public Employees' Retirement System (pers); And For Related Purposes.

1398.title: Child Support Abuse Act; create.
1398.description: An Act To Create The Child Support Abuse Act; To Require A Promiscuous Pregnant Female To Reveal All Sexual Partners Who Could Possibly Be The Biological Father Of A Child As A Condition Of Awarding Child Support; To Require The Identity Of The Biological Father Within One Year Of The Birth Of A Child To Avoid Forfeiture Of A Child Support Claim; To Bring Forward Sections 43-19-31, 93-9-9 And 93-11-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1399.title: Unfair Claims Settlement Practices Act; create under authority of Commissioner of Insurance.
1399.description: An Act To Create The "unfair Claims Settlement Practices Act"; To Set Forth Standards For The Investigation And Disposition Of Claims Arising Under Policies Or Certificates Of Insurance; To Provide Definitions Of Unfair Claims Practices; To Provide Hearing Procedures; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1400.title: Homeowners insurance; prohibit cancellations of policies based solely on the presence of Chinese drywall.
1400.description: An Act To Prohibit Insurers From Cancelling Or Failing To Renew Any Homeowners Insurance Policy Based Solely On The Presence Of Installed Chinese Drywall In The Insured's Property; To Provide Penalties For Violations Thereof; And For Related Purposes.

1401.title: DFA Office of Shared Services; create to centralize business functions of state agencies.
1401.description: An Act To Establish An Office Of Shared Services (oss) In The Department Of Finance And Administration; To Provide That Beginning On July 1, 2011, The Office Of Shared Services Shall Establish A Central Business Office For All State Agencies In The State To Provide Shared Business Services; To Require The Office Of Shared Services To Develop A Transition Plan To Phase-in These Services Prior To July 1, 2015; To Require State Agencies To Comply With The Plan; To Authorize Fees For Services; To Amend Section 27-104-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 25-9-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Employees And Service Functions Of The Office Of Shared Services Shall Be Exempt From State Service Until July 1, 2015; And For Related Purposes.

1402.title: Dept. of Archives and History; authorize DFA to extinguish preservation easement deed on behalf of for certain historic properties.
1402.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Department Of Archives And History, To Extinguish The Preservation Deed Of Easement On The Historic Corinth Machinery Building, Located In The City Of Corinth, Alcorn County, Mississippi, Subject To Certain Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

1403.title: Implied consent law; revise penalties for felony offenses.
1403.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Penalties For Felony Offenses Of The Implied Consent Law; And For Related Purposes.

1404.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for costs of installing certain energy-efficient products in homes.
1404.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Certain Taxpayers For The Costs And Expenses Incurred For Purchasing And Installing Insulation, Energy-efficient Replacement Windows And High-efficiency Heating And Cooling Equipment On Property Upon Which Homestead Exemption Is Granted; To Limit The Amount Of The Credit; And For Related Purposes.

1405.title: Ad valorem tax; local governing authorities may grant exemption on homesteads of residents serving in military in Iraq or Afghanistan.
1405.description: An Act To Create New Section 27-33-76, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Any County And The Governing Authorities Of Any Municipality To Grant An Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes, Except Taxes For School District Purposes, On Homesteads Of Residents Of This State Who Are Serving On Active Duty Pursuant To Military Orders In Iraq Or Afghanistan; To Provide The Amount Of Such Exemption; To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Adopt And Promulgate Rules And Regulations To Administer And Implement Such Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1406.title: Ad valorem tax; revise manner of determining true value of affordable rental housing and exempt portion of true value.
1406.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-35-50, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provisions That Prescribe The Manner In Which The Appraisal Of Affordable Rental Housing Shall Be Made For The Purpose Of Arriving At The True Value Of The Property For Ad Valorem Tax Purposes; To Provide That Thirty-five Percent Of The True Value Of Affordable Rental Housing Shall Be Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation; And For Related Purposes.

1407.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for improvements to State Fire Academy.
1407.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of New Classrooms And Related Facilities At The State Fire Academy In Rankin County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1408.title: DeSoto County; authorize to extend the qualifying deadline for certain offices.
1408.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County To Extend The Candidate Qualifying Deadline For The Offices Of Election Commissioner, County Board Of Education, Constable, Justice Court Judge And Board Of Supervisors To June 1, 2011, If The 2010 Federal Decennial Census Has Not Been Received From The United States Secretary Of Commerce By The Governor Of The State Of Mississippi By January 1, 2011; To Provide A Date Of Repeal For Such Authority; And For Related Purposes.

1409.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for the Mississippi Existing Industry Productivity Loan Fund.
1409.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 For The Mississippi Existing Industry Productivity Loan Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1410.title: Bonds; increase amount authorized under MS Business Investment Act for loans/grants to cities/counties for infrastructure.
1410.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-61-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $323,100,000.00 To $328,900,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $32,500,000.00 To $37,500,000.00 The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Utilize Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act To Make Loans Or Grants To Counties And Municipalities Through An Equipment And Public Facilities Grant And Loan Fund To Aid In Infrastructure-related Improvements, The Purchase Of Equipment And In The Purchase, Construction Or Repair And Renovation Of Public Facilities; To Increase From $750,000.00 To $1,550,000.00 The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Utilize Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act For The Purpose Of Making Payments To Loan Loss Reserve Accounts Established At Financial Institutions That Participate In The Capital Access Program Established By The Authority; And For Related Purposes.

1411.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for the Rural Impact Fund.
1411.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $2,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Rural Impact Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1412.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for ACE Fund.
1412.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Ace Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1413.title: Cigarettes; impose a health impact tax on.
1413.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-70-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "tobacco Settlement Agreement" For The Purposes Of The Law Relating To Taxes Imposed On Certain Cigarettes; To Amend Sections 27-70-5 And 27-70-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose A Health Impact Tax On Cigarettes; To Provide That The Health Impact Tax Shall Not Apply To Cigarettes That Are Sold, Purchased Or Otherwise Distributed In This State For Sale Outside This State; To Provide That A Person May Not Transport From This State Certain Cigarettes For Sale In Another State Without First Affixing To The Cigarettes The Stamp Required By The State In Which The Cigarettes Are To Be Sold Or By Paying Any Other Excise Tax On The Cigarettes Imposed By The State In Which The Cigarettes Are To Be Sold Unless This Practice Is Prohibited In Such Other State; To Provide That The Health Impact Tax Shall Be Imposed, Levied And Assessed On Each Distributor Of Cigarettes And Shall Be Due And Payable On Or Before The Fifteenth Day Of The Month Next Succeeding The Month In Which The Cigarettes Are Sold, Used, Consumed Or Distributed In This State; To Provide That Cigarette Distributors Shall Be Eligible For A Credit Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide Penalties For Cigarette Distributors Who Violate The Provisions Of This Law; To Amend Section 27-69-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Information In Permits Issued Under The Tobacco Tax Law May Be Disclosed To The Holder Of A Wholesaler's Permit And To Law Enforcement Agencies Of The State Or Any Political Subdivision Of The State; To Amend Section 27-69-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If Any Wholesaler Subject To The Provisions Of The Tobacco Tax Law Shall Cease To Do Business In The State Of Mississippi, He Shall Be Allowed A Refund Of The Tax Paid On Cigarettes In His Possession; To Repeal Sections 27-70-7, 27-70-11, 27-70-13, 27-70-15, 27-70-17 And 27-70-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Impose A Fee On Nonsettling Cigarette Manufacturers, Provide For The Computation, The Rate Of Increase And Notice Of The Fee To Such Manufacturers, Require Such Manufacturers To Certify Their Compliance With The Fee Requirement, Provide For A Directory Of Certified Cigarette Manufacturers, Require Certain Cigarette Manufacturers To Prepay A Fee And Require Certain Cigarette Manufacturers To Register With The Attorney General; And For Related Purposes.

1414.title: Department of Rehabilitation Services; may borrow from financial institutions for capital improvements.
1414.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-33-157, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Rehabilitation Services To Borrow Money From The Mississippi Development Bank Or Other Financial Institutions For The Purpose Of Construction, Repair And Renovation Or Furnishing And Equipping Facilities Owned Or Under The Supervision Of The Department; To Provide That Prior To Entering Into Any Loan The Department Shall Certify The Available Revenue That The Department Intends To Utilize To Repay The Loan And That The Department Does Not Intend To Request An Additional Appropriation From State Source Funding To Pay Debt Service On Any Such Loan; To Amend Section 31-25-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Rehabilitation Services To Borrow Money From The Mississippi Development Bank In An Amount Not To Exceed $7,000,000.00 For The Purpose Of Construction At, And Repair And Renovation, Furnishing And Equipping Of, The Department's Office Building Located In Madison, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1415.title: Dept. of Rehabilitation Services; may borrow money from the Mississippi Development Bank for capital improvements.
1415.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-25-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Rehabilitation Services To Borrow Money From The Mississippi Development Bank In An Amount Not To Exceed $7,000,000.00 For The Purpose Of Construction At, And Repair And Renovation, Furnishing And Equipping Of, The Department's Office Building Located In Madison, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1416.title: Lauderdale County; extend the repeal date on the Lauderdale County Tourism Commission.
1416.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 991, Local And Private Laws Of 1997, As Amended By Chapter 936, Local And Private Laws Of 2001, As Amended By Chapter 957, Local And Private Laws Of 2005, As Amended By Chapter 957, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Law That Establishes The Lauderdale County Tourism Commission; And For Related Purposes.

1417.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for a portion of health insurance premiums paid by a small employer for employees.
1417.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Credit For A Portion Of The Premiums Paid By A Small Employer For Health Insurance For Its Employees And Any Dependents Of Such Employees; To Limit The Maximum Amount Of The Credit; To Provide That Any Unused Tax Credit May Be Carried Forward; And For Related Purposes.

1418.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for costs of purchase and installation of wind/solar energy systems.
1418.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Costs Incurred By A Taxpayer For The Purchase And Installation Of Wind Energy Systems And Solar Energy Systems In Property That Is The Primary Residence Of The Taxpayer Or That Is Owned By The Taxpayer And Rented To Others For Dwelling Purposes; To Provide For The Amount Of The Credit; And For Related Purposes.

1419.title: City of Ripley; extend repealer on hotel, motel and restaurant tax.
1419.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 956, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Act Authorizing The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Ripley, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Certain Restaurants For The Purpose Of Generating Revenue To Enhance Tourism, For Industrial And Economic Development And For The Provision Of Parks And Recreation Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1420.title: Bonds; authorize issuance of general obligation bonds for construction of a Highway Safety Patrol substation in Leflore County.
1420.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Constructing A New Highway Safety Patrol Substation In Leflore County In Highway Safety Patrol District 2; And For Related Purposes.

1421.title: City of Booneville; authorize to contribute funds to Booneville Hardware Cultural Arts Center, Inc.
1421.description: An Act To Authorize The Mayor And Board Of Aldermen Of The City Of Booneville To Contribute Funds To The Booneville Hardware Cultural Arts Center, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1422.title: City of Booneville; authorize to contribute funds to Rails and Trails Museum.
1422.description: An Act To Authorize The Mayor And Board Of Aldermen Of The City Of Booneville To Contribute Funds To The Rails And Trails Museum; And For Related Purposes.

1423.title: Income tax; authorize credit for portion of costs of college textbooks.
1423.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Credit To Taxpayers For A Portion Of The Costs Paid By The Taxpayer For Textbooks Used By The Taxpayer Or A Dependent Of The Taxpayer While Enrolled As A Resident Student In A Course Or Courses At A Public Or Private University, College, Community College Or Junior College In This State; To Limit The Period Of Time Within Which The Tax Credit May Be Claimed; To Limit The Maximum Amount Of The Credit; To Allow Any Unused Tax Credit To Be Carried Forward One Year; And For Related Purposes.

1424.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for certain railroad line improvements.
1424.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying A Portion Of The Costs Associated With The Repair, Rehabilitation, Construction, Reconstruction, Upgrading And Improvement Of The Existing Railroad Line And Related Facilities Running From Southaven, Mississippi, To A Point Near Canton, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1425.title: Ad valorem tax; exempt leases and improvements to property leased by United States to private entity for military housing purposes.
1425.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Leases, Lease Contracts And Lease Agreements And Leaseholds And Leasehold Interests With Respect To Property Owned By The United States And Leased By The United States To A Private Entity As Part Of An Agreement To Have The Private Entity Manage, Operate, Maintain And Construct Housing Facilities For Military Personnel Shall Be Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation; And For Related Purposes.

1426.title: City of Brandon; authorize a tax on sales of prepared food and drink at restaurants and bars.
1426.description: An Act To Authorize The Mayor And Board Of Aldermen Of The City Of Brandon, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Sale Of Prepared Food And Beverages In Restaurants And Bars In An Amount Not To Exceed Two Percent Of Gross Proceeds For The Purpose Of Promoting Tourism, Parks And Recreation; To Require The Tax, Before Its Imposition, Be Approved By Sixty Percent Of Qualified Electors Voting In A Referendum On The Question Of Levying The Tax; To Require The Tax Be Collected By The Department Of Revenue And Paid To The City Of Brandon; And For Related Purposes.

1427.title: Bonds; increase amount authorized under Economic Development Highway Act, extend reverter on negotiated sale provisions.
1427.description: An Act To Amend Sections 65-4-25, 65-4-29, 65-4-31 And 65-4-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $20,000,000.00 The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds Authorized To Be Issued Under The Economic Development Highway Act; To Extend The Reverter On Provisions That Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Bonds Issued Under The Economic Development Highway Act; And For Related Purposes.

1428.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds to acquire and improve property for Jackson State University, authorize property transfer.
1428.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Acquiring And Improving Property For The Campus Of Jackson State University; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, To Transfer And Convey Certain State-owned Real Property And Any Improvements Thereon Under The Possession And Control Of Jackson State University, Located In The City Of Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi, To The Jackson State University Development Foundation, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1429.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for improvements to Jackson Zoo.
1429.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Improvements To The Jackson Zoo; And For Related Purposes.

1431.title: Bonds; increase amount authorized to be issued for the Mississippi Museum of Art.
1431.description: An Act To Amend Sections 210 Through 226, Chapter 1, Laws Of 2004 Third Extraordinary Session, As Last Amended By Section 51, Chapter 533, Laws Of 2010, To Increase The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For Improvements To The Mississippi Museum Of Art In Jackson, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1432.title: Local System Bridge Replacement and Rehabilitation Fund; authorize issuance of bonds to provide funds for.
1432.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $20,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1433.title: Appropriation; Mississippi Development Authority to fund minority disparity study.
1433.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Development Authority For The Purpose Of Funding A Study To Determine If There Is A Statistical Disparity In The Number Of Minority Contractors Doing Business With The State Of Mississippi, For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1434.title: Bonds; increase amount authorized to provide funds for the Mississippi Industry Incentive Financing Revolving Fund.
1434.description: An Act To Amend Section 25, Chapter 533, Laws Of 2010, As Amended By Section 4, Chapter 30, Laws Of 2010 Second Extraordinary Session, As Amended By Section 1, House Bill No. 403, 2011 Regular Session, To Increase By $40,000,000.00 The Amount Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The Mississippi Industry Incentive Financing Revolving Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1435.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for upgrades to mechanical and fire suppression systems of the Alexander Center at Jackson State University.
1435.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Upgrading The Mechanical Systems And The Fire Suppression System Of The Alexander Center At Jackson State University; And For Related Purposes.

1436.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds to acquire and improve property for Jackson State University.
1436.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Acquiring And Improving Property For The Campus Of Jackson State University; And For Related Purposes.

1437.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for the replacement of Dansby Hall at Jackson State University.
1437.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Replacement Of Dansby Hall At Jackson State University; And For Related Purposes.

1438.title: Ad valorem taxation; exempt pollution control equipment mandated by federal or state law.
1438.description: An Act To Provide That Certain Pollution Control Equipment Mandated By Federal Or State Law Or Regulation Shall Be Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation, Except Ad Valorem Taxation For School District Purposes, For A Period Of Ten Years From The Date Of Installation Of The Equipment; And For Related Purposes.

1439.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of tangible personal property and services to Edwards Street Fellowship Center.
1439.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Sales Of Tangible Personal Property And Services To The Edwards Street Fellowship Center In Hattiesburg, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1440.title: Sales tax; exempt certain organizations operating long-term care facilities for adults with mental retardation.
1440.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property Or Services To Nonprofit Organizations That Operate Long-term Care Facilities Solely For Adults With Mental Retardation If The Organization Is Exempt From Federal Income Taxation Under Section 501(c)(3) Of The Internal Revenue Code; And For Related Purposes.

1441.title: Community colleges; authorize additional tax levy for improvements and general support.
1441.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-29-141, 37-29-437 And 37-29-513, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Counties And Municipalities To Levy Additional Taxes For Capital Improvements And General Support Of A Community College District; And For Related Purposes.

1442.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds to assist City of Jackson in making road and street improvements.
1442.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Incurred For Road And Street Repair, Construction, Reconstruction And Resurfacing Projects In Areas Within And In Close Proximity To Certain State Grounds And Lands In The City; And For Related Purposes.

1443.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for various programs administered by the Mississippi Development Authority.
1443.description: An Act To Amend Section 25, Chapter 533, Laws Of 2010, As Amended By Section 4, Chapter 30, Laws Of 2010 Second Extraordinary Session, As Amended By Section 1, House Bill No. 403, 2011 Regular Session, To Increase By $40,000,000.00 The Amount Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The Mississippi Industry Incentive Financing Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 57-61-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $323,100,000.00 To $328,900,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $32,500,000.00 To $37,500,000.00 The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Use Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act To Make Loans Or Grants To Counties And Municipalities Through An Equipment And Public Facilities Grant And Loan Fund To Aid In Infrastructure-related Improvements, The Purchase Of Equipment And In The Purchase, Construction Or Repair And Renovation Of Public Facilities; To Increase From $750,000.00 To $1,550,000.00 The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Use Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act For The Purpose Of Making Payments To Loan Loss Reserve Accounts Established At Financial Institutions That Participate In The Capital Access Program Established By The Authority; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $2,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Rural Impact Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 For The Mississippi Existing Industry Productivity Loan Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Ace Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Twenty Percent Of Any Monies Deposited Into The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund On Or After July 1, 2011, Shall Be Used To Make Grants To Small Municipalities With A Population Of 2,000 Or Less; To Provide That Grants Made To A Small Municipality From Such Monies Shall Not Exceed $50,000.00 During Any Grant Period Established By The Mississippi Development Authority; And For Related Purposes.

1444.title: City of Hattiesburg and Forrest County; grant additional powers for certain projects in industrial park.
1444.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 855, Local And Private Laws Of 1978, As Last Amended By Chapter 946, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, To Grant The City Of Hattiesburg, Forrest County And The Forrest County Industrial Park Commission Additional Powers Relating To The Funding Of Certain Projects In The Industrial Park; And For Related Purposes.

1445.title: Rental equipment; exempt from ad valorem taxation and levy a tax in lieu of ad valorem taxation.
1445.description: An Act To Create The Rental Fairness Act Of 2011; To Exempt Certain Rental Equipment From Ad Valorem Taxation; To Levy A Tax On Persons Engaged In The Business Of Renting Certain Equipment In Lieu Of Ad Valorem Taxes; To Provide That The Proceeds Of The Tax Shall Be Paid To The County Which Is The Situs Of The Equipment And Distributed By The County To The County, Municipality And The School District Of The Situs, As Appropriate, In The Same Manner That Ad Valorem Taxes On The Equipment Would Be Distributed; And For Related Purposes.

1446.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide for Mississippi Authority for Educational Television improvements.
1446.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Mississippi Authority For Educational Television With Making Improvements To Systems, Equipment And Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1448.title: Rankin County; authorize to enter into road project contracts even if contracts extend 30 days over term of office of current board of supervisors.
1448.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Rankin County, Mississippi, To Enter Into Certain Road Improvement Contracts Regardless Of Whether The Contracts May Extend Beyond Thirty Days From The Termination And End Of The Term Of Office Of The Members Of The Board Of Supervisors Awarding The Contracts; And For Related Purposes.

1449.title: Tunica County; authorize contribution to Aaron E. Henry Community Health Clinic, Inc.
1449.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Aaron E. Henry Community Health Clinic, Incorporated, And The G.a. Stover Health Clinic, P.a., For The Purpose Of Improving The Medical Care For The Residents Of Tunica County; And For Related Purposes.

1450.title: Tunica County; authorize contribution to Institute of Community Services, Inc.
1450.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County To Contribute Funds To The Institute Of Community Services, Inc., To Assist The Institute In Operating Head Start Classes For Children In Tunica County, To Acquire, Operate And Maintain New And Existing Vehicles To Be Used To Transport The Children To And From The Head Start Facility And To Provide Day Care Vouchers For Parents; And For Related Purposes.

1451.title: Tunica County; authorize to contract with and/or contribute to Mid-State Opportunity, Inc.
1451.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Contract With And Donate Funds To Mid-state Opportunity, Incorporated; And For Related Purposes.

1452.title: Washington County; authorize to impose a hotel/motel tax for purposes of funding a sports complex for youth.
1452.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Washington County, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Of Up To Two Percent To Be Levied On The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel And Motel Room Rentals Within The County, And To Expend The Proceeds Of The Tax To Establish A Sports Complex For Youth Within The County To Provide That This Act Shall Be Repealed From And After July 1, 2015; And For Related Purposes.

1453.title: Franklin County; authorize to construct jail anywhere in county.
1453.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Franklin County, Mississippi, To Construct A New County Jail Anywhere Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

1454.title: Tunica County; authorize direct negotiations with healthcare system for outpatient services in county.
1454.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County To Negotiate Directly With A Certain Healthcare System For The Provision Of Outpatient Healthcare Services; And For Related Purposes.

1455.title: Income tax; authorize five-year carryback for net operating loss attributable to Gulf oil spill.
1455.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If A Taxpayer Has A Qualified Oil Spill Loss That Is A Net Operating Loss Under The State Income Tax Laws, The Loss Shall Be A Net Operating Loss Carryback To Each Of The Five Taxable Years Preceding The Year Of The Loss; To Provide That If The Net Operating Loss For Any Taxable Year Is Not Exhausted By Carrybacks To The Five Taxable Years Preceding The Taxable Year Of The Loss, Then There Shall Be A Net Operating Loss Carryover To Each Of The Twenty Taxable Years Following The Taxable Year Of The Loss Beginning With Any Taxable Year After The Taxable Year Of The Loss; To Define The Terms "recovery Zone", "gulf Oil Spill" And "qualified Oil Spill Loss"; And For Related Purposes.

1456.title: Constitution; S.O.S. may make nonsubstantive correction in section number designation in proposed voter initiative.
1456.description: An Act To Provide That When An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 Is Proposed Under The State Voter Initiative Procedure, The Secretary Of State, With The Approval Of The Attorney General, May Make Certain Nonsubstantive Clerical Or Technical Corrections In The Section Number Reference Or Designation Of The Proposed Constitutional Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1457.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of certain home medical equipment and supplies when paid for under insurance policy or plan.
1457.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Certain Home Medical Equipment And Supplies When Payment For The Equipment And Supplies Is Made On Behalf Of Or For The Benefit Of An Insured Under An Insurance Policy, Contract Or Plan; And For Related Purposes.

1458.title: Income tax; authorize credit for taxpayers who maintain, support and care for dependent with diagnosis of developmental disability.
1458.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Any Taxpayer In This State Who Is Maintaining, Supporting And Caring For A Dependent With A Diagnosis Of Developmental Disability In His Home; And For Related Purposes.

1459.title: Income tax, jobs credit; aggregate jobs created by qualifying bus. in entertainment dist. for purposes of minimum jobs req.
1459.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-73-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "business Enterprise" For Purposes Of The Income Tax Jobs Credit To Include Entities That Are Qualifying Businesses Under The Mississippi Entertainment District Act; To Provide That For The Purposes Of Determining Eligibility For The Income Tax Jobs Credit, All Net Full-time Jobs Created Within An Entertainment District By Business Enterprises That Are Qualifying Businesses Under The Mississippi Entertainment District Act Shall Be Aggregated Within That Entertainment District And That All Qualifying Businesses In An Entertainment District Shall Be Eligible For Such Tax Credits When The Aggregate Number Of Net Full-time Jobs Created In That Entertainment District Meets The Required Minimum Number Of Jobs; And For Related Purposes.

1460.title: City of Jackson; extend repeal date on Jackson Convention and Visitors Bureau.
1460.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 909, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, As Amended By Chapter 941, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, As Amended By Chapter 958, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Extend The Repealer On The Provisions Of Law Which Create The Jackson Convention And Visitors Bureau And Impose A Tax On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants, Hotels And Motels For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Bureau; And For Related Purposes.

1461.title: City of Southaven; authorize to impose a tax on restaurants to fund promotion o tourism, parks and recreation.
1461.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Southaven, Mississippi, To Levy An Additional 1% Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants; To Provide That The Tax Shall Be Used To Promote Tourism, Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

1462.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for construction of Mississippi Civil Rights Museum and Museum of Mississippi History.
1462.description: An Act To Establish A Mississippi Civil Rights Museum Advisory Commission And Define Its Responsibilities; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi In The Amount Of $38,000,000.00 For The Purpose Of Providing Funding For Construction Of The Mississippi Civil Rights Museum, The New Museum Of Mississippi History And A Parking Garage; And For Related Purposes.

1463.title: College Private Research Incentive Act; create.
1463.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax And Franchise Tax Credit For Taxpayers That Make Expenditures Associated With The Use Of Technology, Including Fees Related To Patents, Copyrights, And Licenses, As Well As Payments Made Pursuant To Research Agreements With Colleges And Research Corporations; To Define Certain Terms For The Purposes Of This Act; To Provide For The Amount Of The Credit Authorized In This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1464.title: Appropriation; Tombigbee River Valley Water Management District.

1465.title: Appropriation; Public Employees' Retirement System and support for community and junior colleges.

1486.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Paying The Expenses And Providing Contingent Funds For The Legislature, The Expenses Of The Joint Legislative Budget Committee, The Expenses Of The Joint Legislative Committee On Performance Evaluation And Expenditure Review, The Expenses Of The Joint Legislative Reapportionment Committee, The Expenses Of The Joint Committee On Compilation, Revision And Publication Of Legislation, Paying The Monthly Expense Allowance Of The Members Of The Legislature, Paying The State's Share Of Various Assessments, And Related Purposes, For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1487.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Office Of The Attorney General For Fiscal Year 2012.

1488.title: Appropriation; District attorneys and staff.
1488.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Paying Salaries And Travel Expenses Of District Attorneys And Assistant District Attorneys Of The State And Paying Office Expenses Of District Attorneys For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1489.title: Appropriation; Supreme Court, Court of Appeals and trial judges services.
1489.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Supreme Court Which Is Comprised Of The Supreme Court, The Office Of The Supreme Court Clerk And The State Law Library And To Pay Expenses Of Special Judges, Chancellors And Circuit Judges, And For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Administrative Office Of Courts And Certified Court Reporters, Continuing Legal Education, Court Of Appeals And The Board Of Bar Admissions, For The Fiscal Year 2012; And For Related Purposes.

1490.title: Appropriation; Capital Defense Counsel, Office of.
1490.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Office Of Capital Defense Counsel Of The State Of Mississippi For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1491.title: Appropriation; Capital Post-Conviction Counsel, Office of.
1491.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Office Of Capital Post-conviction Counsel Of The State Of Mississippi For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1492.title: Appropriation; Indigent Appeals, Office of.
1492.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Office Of Indigent Appeals For The Fiscal Year 2012; And For Related Purposes.

1493.title: Appropriation; Education, Department of.
1493.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Funding K-12 And Other Related Educational Activities, Including Certain Agencies And Programs, In The State Of Mississippi, For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1494.title: Appropriation; Educational Television, Authority for.
1494.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Authority For Educational Television For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1495.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Library Commission For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1496.title: Appropriation; Wildlife, Fisheries and Parks, Department of.
1496.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1497.title: Appropriation; Environmental Quality, Department of.
1497.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Department Of Environmental Quality; And For Related Purposes, For The Fiscal Year 2012.
