1498.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Governor's Office - Division Of Medicaid For The Purpose Of Providing Medical Assistance Under The Mississippi Medicaid Law And Defraying The Expenses Of The Administration Of Such Law For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1499.title: Appropriation; Health, Department of.
1499.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Department Of Health For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1500.title: Appropriation; Forestry Commission.
1500.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The State Forestry Commission And For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Institute For Forest Inventory For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1501.title: Appropriation; Foresters, Board of Registration for.
1501.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Board Of Registration For Foresters For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1502.title: Appropriation; Soil and Water Conservation Commission.
1502.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Soil And Water Conservation Commission For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1503.title: Appropriation; Archives and History, Department of.
1503.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Department Of Archives And History, For The Fiscal Year 2012; And For Related Purposes.

1504.title: Appropriation; Arts Commission.
1504.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Arts Commission For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1505.title: Appropriation; Marine Resources, Department of.
1505.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Department Of Marine Resources For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1506.title: Appropriation; Grand Gulf Military Monument Commission.
1506.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Grand Gulf Military Monument Commission For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1507.title: Appropriation; Mississippi River Parkway Commission.
1507.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi River Parkway Commission For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Commission For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1508.title: Appropriation; Pat Harrison Waterway District.
1508.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Pat Harrison Waterway District For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1509.title: Appropriation; Yellow Creek State Inland Port Authority.
1509.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Yellow Creek State Inland Port Authority For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1510.title: Appropriation; Pearl River Basin Development District.
1510.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Pearl River Basin Development District For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1511.title: Appropriation; Pearl River Valley Water Supply District.
1511.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1512.title: Appropriation; Port Authority, State.
1512.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Port Authority At Gulfport For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1513.title: Appropriation; Insurance, Department of.
1513.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Insurance For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1514.title: Appropriation; Fire Academy.
1514.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Fire Academy For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1515.title: Appropriation; Human Services, Department of.
1515.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Human Services; And For Related Purposes, For The Fiscal Year 2012.

1516.title: Appropriation; Rehabilitation Services, Department of.
1516.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Rehabilitation Services For Fiscal Year 2012.

1517.title: Appropriation; reappropriation, DFA - Bureau of Building; FY12.
1517.description: An Act Making A Reappropriation To The Department Of Finance And Administration To Reauthorize The Expenditure Of Special Funds Previously Appropriated For Construction And/or Repair And Renovation Projects At Various State Agencies And Institutions, For Fiscal Year 2012.

1518.title: Bonds; increase amount authorized for the Supplementary Rural Fire Truck Fund and the Rural Fire Truck Fund.
1518.description: An Act To Amend Sections 136 Through 151, Chapter 1, Laws Of 2004 Third Extraordinary Session, As Last Amended By Section 48, Chapter 533, Laws Of 2010, To Increase The Amount Of Bonds That May Be Issued For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Supplementary Rural Fire Truck Fund And The Rural Fire Truck Fund; To Extend The Authority To Issue Such Bonds Until July 1, 2013; And For Related Purposes.

1519.title: Sales tax; exempt certain sales of personal property to certain organizations coordinating professional golf tournaments in this state.
1519.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Industrial Sales Tax Exemption For Sales Of Supplies, Equipment And Other Personal Property To An Organization That Is Exempt From Taxation Under Section 501(c)(3) Of The Internal Revenue Code And Is The Host Organization Coordinating A Professional Golf Tournament Played Or To Be Played In This State And The Property Will Be Used For Purposes Related To The Golf Tournament And Related Activities; And For Related Purposes.

1520.title: Suffrage; restore to Kimberly Thomas of Lamar County.
1520.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Kimberly Thomas Of Lamar County, Mississippi.

1521.title: Income tax and franchise tax; authorize credit for investments in digital interactive applications.
1521.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax And Franchise Tax Credit For Taxpayers That Are Digital Interaction Application Companies And Invest In Digital Interaction Applications; To Define Certain Terms For The Purposes Of This Act; To Provide For The Amount Of The Credit Authorized In This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1522.title: City of Ridgeland; authorize the city to levy an additional sales tax for certain purposes.
1522.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Ridgeland, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Sales Tax Of Not More Than 1% On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Businesses In The Municipality Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of 7% Or More Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide Certain Exemptions From The Special Sales Tax Authorized By This Act; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Not Be Levied Unless Authorized By At Least 3/5 Of The Votes Cast At An Election Called And Held For Such Purpose; To Provide The Purposes For Which The Revenue Collected From The Special Sales Tax May Be Used And Expended; And For Related Purposes.

1523.title: Lee County; authorize contribution to the Sanctuary Hospice House.
1523.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lee County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Sanctuary Hospice House; And For Related Purposes.

1524.title: City of Sardis; extend repealer on authority to impose tax on hotels, motels and restaurants.
1524.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 945, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Extend Until July 1, 2014, The Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Sardis, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants And Utilize The Revenue From The Tax To Enhance Tourism, For Industrial And Economic Development And For The Provision Of Parks And Recreation Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1526.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for construction of the Wellspring Center for Professional Futures.
1526.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Constructing, Furnishing And Equipping The Wellspring Center For Professional Futures In Union County, Mississippi; To Amend Sections 37-31-71, 37-31-73 And 37-31-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize School Districts, Community Or Junior College Districts And Local Governments To Enter Into Agreements To Establish Regional Education Centers; And For Related Purposes.

1527.title: Mississippi Small Business Investment Company Act; create.
1527.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Small Business Investment Company Act; To Provide For An Insurance Premium Tax Credit For Insurance Companies That Invest Designated Capital In Mississippi Small Business Investment Companies For Investment In Qualified Businesses; To Define Certain Terms For The Purposes Of This Act; To Provide That The Amount Of The Credit Shall Be Equal To A Portion Of Designated Capital Invested By A Participating Investor In A Mississippi Small Business Investment Company; To Provide That The Tax Credits Authorized Under This Act Shall Be Allocated By The Mississippi Development Authority And That The Aggregate Amount Of The Tax Credits That May Be Allocated To All Participating Investors Under This Act Cannot Exceed $50,000,000.00; To Provide For The Recapture Of All Or A Portion Of The Credit Under Certain Circumstances; To Amend Section 27-15-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Investments That May Reduce A Taxpayer's Insurance Premium Tax Liability Under Such Section Shall Not Include Any Investment For Which A Credit Is Allocated Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1528.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds to assist City of Jackson with purchase of fire fighting equipment.
1528.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, In Purchasing Fire Fighting Equipment And Apparatus Necessary To Enhance The City Fire Department's Fire Protection Service For High Rise Structures In The City; And For Related Purposes.

1529.title: City of Hattiesburg; extend repealer on Hattiesburg Tourism Commission and hotel/motel tax.
1529.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 878, Local And Private Laws Of 1990, As Last Amended By Chapter 925, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Extend Until July 1, 2014, The Date Upon Which The Hattiesburg Tourism Commission Is Repealed; And For Related Purposes.

1530.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to pay costs of state parks' construction & renovation & transfer certain responsibilities.
1530.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of Thirty Million Dollars, To Provide Funds To Pay The Costs Associated With The Construction Of New State Park Facilities And The Repair And Renovation Of Existing State Parks And State Park Facilities Within The State; To Amend Section 65-1-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning On July 1, 2011, The Mississippi Transportation Commission Shall Assume Jurisdiction And Control Over, And Require The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Be Responsible For, Constructing, Maintaining, Repairing And Improving All Driveways, Roadways, Rights-of-way, Streets And Roads On The Grounds Of The State Parks Of The State; To Provide That The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks Shall Not Be Required To Reimburse The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For Any Expenditures Incurred In Effectuating Such Responsibilities; To Amend Section 65-1-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Provide That Beginning On July 1, 2011, Any Corporation Formed As An Electric Power Association Shall Assume Jurisdiction And Control Over Electric Energy Services Within Any State Park Located In That Corporation's Service Area, Territory Or System; To Provide That The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks Shall Not Be Required To Pay Any Fees To The Applicable Corporation For Providing Such Electric Energy Services; To Amend Sections 77-5-215, 77-5-221, 77-5-225, 77-5-231, 77-5-235 And 77-5-237, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1532.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds to assist Rail Authority of East MS with construction of East MS Intermodal Railroad.
1532.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Rail Authority Of East Mississippi In Paying Costs Associated With The Development And Construction Of The East Mississippi Intermodal Railroad And Related Structures And Facilities In Wayne, Greene And George Counties; And For Related Purposes.

1533.title: Homestead exemption; increase and prorate for homeowner reaching age 65 after January 1 of year for which exemption is claimed.
1533.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-33-67 And 27-33-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Qualified Homeowners Who Reach Age Sixty-five After January 1 Of The Year For Which The Homestead Exemption Is Claimed Shall Be Exempt, On A Prorated Basis For That Year, From All Ad Valorem Taxes Not In Excess Of $7,500.00 Of The Assessed Value Of The Homestead Property Based On The Ratio That The Number Of Full Months Remaining In The Year After The Month In Which The Homeowner Reaches Age Sixty-five Bears To The Total Number Of Months In The Year; To Amend Section 27-33-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1534.title: Income tax; revise treatment of certain Gulf oil spill related compensation as gross income.
1534.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If A Taxpayer Received One Or More Qualified Gulf Oil Spill Payments During The 2010 Calendar Year, And The Aggregate Amount Of The Payments Was At Least Two Hundred Percent Of The Average Amount Of The Taxpayer's Annual Gross Income For The Previous Three Years, Then One-third Of The Amount Of The Payments Shall Be Included In The Taxpayer's Gross Income For The 2010 Taxable Year, One-third Of The Amount Of The Payments Shall Be Included In The Taxpayer's Gross Income For The 2011 Taxable Year And The Remainder Of The Amount Of The Payments Shall Be Included In The Taxpayer's Gross Income For The 2012 Taxable Year; To Define The Terms "qualified Gulf Oil Spill Payment" And "gulf Oil Spill" For Purposes Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1535.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for Local System Bridge Program and County Bridge and Road Safety Fund.
1535.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $20,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Program; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $20,000,000.00 To Provide Additional Funds For Use By The Office Of State Aid Road Construction For The Replacement And/or Rehabilitation Of Certain Deficient County Bridges And For Certain Safety Related Improvements To County Roads; And For Related Purposes.

1536.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for repair of bridges in Alcorn and Tishomingo Counties.
1536.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Incurred In Repairing A Bridge On County Road 346 In Alcorn County, Mississippi, And A Bridge On County Road 50 In Tishomingo County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1537.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for repair of Oakland School Road Bridge in Alcorn County.
1537.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Incurred In The Repair, Rehabilitation, Construction, Reconstruction, Upgrading And Improvement Of Oakland School Road Bridge In Alcorn County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1538.title: Ad valorem tax; revise definition of "home" or "homestead" under the homestead exemption law.
1538.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "home" Or "homestead" For Purposes Of The Homestead Exemption Law; And For Related Purposes.

1539.title: Madison County; authorize erection of certain electronic gates for the purpose of enclosing neighborhoods.
1539.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Madison County, Mississippi, To Allow The Erection Of Electronic Gates For The Purpose Of Enclosing Neighborhoods, Provided That The Gates Open Automatically Upon Approach By Any Motor Vehicle; And For Related Purposes.

1540.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for road and bridge improvements in small municipalities.
1540.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $10,000.000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi To Provide Funds For Use By The Office Of State Aid Road Construction For Grants To Municipalities For The Replacement And Rehabilitation Of Bridges That Are Determined By The Office Of State Aid Road Construction To Be Deficient And Which Are Not Part Of The National Bridge Inspection Inventory; And For Related Purposes.

1541.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for upgrades to Department of Revenue's information technology systems.
1541.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $18,675,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Making Additions, Upgrades And Improvements To The Department Of Revenue's Information Technology Systems; And For Related Purposes.

1542.title: Bonds; authorize issuance of for various railroad related projects.
1542.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-44-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $18,000,000.00 To $21,000,000.00 The Amount Of Bonds That May Be Issued To Fund Local Government Freight Rail Service Projects; To Amend Section 57-44-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $8,000,000.00 To $11,000,000.00 The Maximum Amount Of Grants That May Be Made To Counties From Monies In The Local Governments Freight Rail Service Project Revolving Loan Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $3,000,000.00 To Provide Additional Funds For The Railroad Revitalization Fund To Be Credited To The Mississippi Highway-railroad Grade Crossing Safety Account; To Amend Section 57-43-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Grant Funds To The Southwest Regional Railroad Authority To Pay A Portion Of The Costs Incurred By The Regional Railroad Authority For The Repair, Rehabilitation, Construction, Reconstruction, Upgrading And Improvement Of The Existing Railroad Line From The City Of Natchez, Mississippi, To Brookhaven, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $3,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For Such Grants; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $3,000,000.00 To Provide Funds To Assist The Rail Authority Of East Mississippi In Paying Costs Associated With The Development And Construction Of The East Mississippi Intermodal Railroad And Related Structures And Facilities In Wayne, Greene And George Counties; To Provide For The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $1,000,000.00 For The Purpose Of Paying Lowndes County's Cost Of Planning, Development, Repair, Rehabilitation, Construction, Reconstruction, Upgrading And Improvement Of Artesia Road In Lowndes County And Any Rail Infrastructure, Including, But Not Limited To, Rail Grade Crossings, Related To The Segment Of The Existing Railroad Line Running Parallel With And Adjacent To Artesia Road; To Amend Section 57-43-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1543.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for improvements to Mississippi Museum of Natural Science and certain projects in the City of Corinth.
1543.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $1,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Improvements To The Mississippi Museum Of Natural Science; To Authorize The Issuance Of $2,500,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Corinth, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Incurred For Repair, Renovation, Expansion Of And Improvements And Additions To The Curlee House And Related Facilities, And To Assist The Siege & Battle Of Corinth Commission In Paying Costs Incurred In Purchasing The Former West Corinth School Property And Campus In Corinth, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1544.title: DeSoto County; authorize contribution to the Memphis Child Advocacy Center.
1544.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County To Contribute Annually To The Memphis Child Advocacy Center; And For Related Purposes.

1545.title: Bonds; authorize for various projects and economic development programs.
1545.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For State Institutions Of Higher Learning, State Agencies And Community And Junior Colleges; To Amend Section 25, Chapter 533, Laws Of 2010, As Amended By Section 4, Chapter 30, Laws Of 2010 Second Extraordinary Session, As Amended By Section 1, House Bill No. 403, 2011 Regular Session, To Increase By $20,000,000.00 The Amount Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The Mississippi Industry Incentive Financing Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 57-61-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $323,100,000.00 To $328,900,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $32,500,000.00 To $37,500,000.00 The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Use Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act To Make Loans Or Grants To Counties And Municipalities Through An Equipment And Public Facilities Grant And Loan Fund To Aid In Infrastructure-related Improvements, The Purchase Of Equipment And In The Purchase, Construction Or Repair And Renovation Of Public Facilities; To Increase From $750,000.00 To $1,550,000.00 The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Use Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act For The Purpose Of Making Payments To Loan Loss Reserve Accounts Established At Financial Institutions That Participate In The Capital Access Program Established By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $2,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Rural Impact Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Existing Industry Productivity Loan Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Ace Fund; To Amend Sections 65-4-25, 65-4-29, 65-4-31 And 65-4-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $20,000,000.00 The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds Authorized To Be Issued Under The Economic Development Highway Act; To Extend The Reverter On Provisions That Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Bonds Issued Under The Economic Development Highway Act; To Authorize The Issuance Of $20,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of $200,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Improvements To The Jackson Zoo; To Authorize The Issuance Of $6,500,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying A Portion Of The Costs Associated With The Repair, Rehabilitation, Construction, Reconstruction, Upgrading And Improvement Of The Existing Railroad Line And Related Facilities Running From Southaven, Mississippi, To A Point Near Canton, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of $1,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Mississippi Community Heritage Preservation Grant Fund; To Amend Section 39-5-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Authorize The Issuance Of $300,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Meridian, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Making Repairs, Upgrades And Improvements To The City's Storm Drainage Infrastructure And Establishing Charles L. Young Sr. Freedom Park In The City; To Authorize The Issuance Of $200,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Natchez, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With The North Natchez Surface Water Project And The City's Street Overlay Projects; To Authorize The Issuance Of $200,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Hattiesburg, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Restoration, Repair, Renovation And Improvement Of The Old Eureka High School Building And Related Facilities; To Authorize The Issuance Of $200,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Hattiesburg Landmark Preservation In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Improvement Of The Old Hattiesburg High School Building And Related Facilities; To Authorize The Issuance Of $1,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Improvements To The Mississippi Museum Of Natural Science; To Authorize The Issuance Of $1,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Corinth, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Incurred For Repair, Renovation, Expansion Of And Improvements And Additions To The Curlee House And Related Facilities, And To Assist The Siege & Battle Of Corinth Commission In Paying Costs Incurred In Purchasing The Former West Corinth School Property And Campus In Corinth, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of $750,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Construction Of A New Cabin And The Repair And Renovation Of The Mississippi Future Farmers Of America Center In Raymond, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of $1,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying A Portion Of The Costs Associated With The Repair, Rehabilitation, Construction, Reconstruction, Upgrading And Improvement Of The Existing Railroad Line And Related Structures And Facilities Running From Bay Springs, Mississippi, To Newton, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of $500,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Preplanning The Construction Of A Football Stadium And Related Facilities For Jackson State University; To Authorize The Issuance Of $100,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Byhalia, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Restoration, Repair And Renovation Of The Old Byhalia High School Auditorium; To Authorize The Issuance Of $300,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Holly Springs, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Making Improvements To The City's Wastewater Treatment Infrastructure; To Amend Sections 25 Through 40, Laws Of 2003, Which Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Develop Moon Lake State Park In Coahoma County, Mississippi, To Provide That The Proceeds Of The Bonds May Be Used To Provide Funds To Assist Coahoma County, Mississippi, In The Development Of A Park On Property Transferred From The State Of Mississippi To Coahoma County; To Amend Section 1, Chapter 580, Laws Of 2007, As Last Amended By Section 56, Chapter 557, Laws Of 2009, To Revise The Purposes For Which The Proceeds Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The Mississippi Industries For The Blind May Be Used; To Amend Section 57-1-221, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By Section 3, House Bill No. 403, 2011 Regular Session, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "approved Business Enterprise" For Purposes Of The Mississippi Industry Incentive Financing Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 65-4-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "private Company" Under The Economic Development Highway Act To Include Tourism Enterprises; To Authorize The Issuance Of $9,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Completion Of Construction Of A Headquarters Building For The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges; To Amend Section 27-13-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For Purposes Of The Franchise Tax Law, Receipts For Sales To A Mississippi Distribution Facility Of Pharmaceutical Products By Certain Major Suppliers Are Not Included In The Mississippi Receipts In Computing The Apportionment Ratio; To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Income Tax Deduction For Certain Contributions Of Human Pharmaceutical Products By Certain Major Suppliers; And For Related Purposes.

1546.title: Economically Distressed Municipalities Development Act; create.
1546.description: An Act To Create The "economically Distressed Municipalities Development Act" To Assist Certain Municipalities In Encouraging Economic Development; To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Designate Certain Municipalities As Economically Distressed Municipalities; To Provide That Certain Municipalities May Apply To The Mississippi Development Authority For Designation As Economically Distressed Municipalities; To Provide Incentives In The Form Of Temporary Local Ad Valorem Tax Exemptions, State Income Tax, Franchise Tax And Sales Tax Exemptions And Loans For Approved Business Enterprises That Locate Or Expand In Economically Distressed Municipalities; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Loans Authorized Under This Act; To Amend Sections 27-7-21, 27-13-5, 27-13-7 And 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1547.title: Income tax; revise provisions regarding certain business deductions.
1547.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "captive Reit" For Purposes Of The State Income Tax Deduction Authorized For Dividend Distributions Made By A Real Estate Investment Trust And To Revise The Application Of The Deduction With Regard To A Captive Reit; To Revise The Definition Of The Terms "intangible Property" And "interest Expenses And Cost" And To Define The Terms "management And Administrative Fees" And "subchapter K Entity" For Purposes Of Restrictions On The Deduction Of Certain Expenses Incurred In Connection With Transactions With Related Members And To Revise Certain Provisions Regarding The Deduction; And For Related Purposes.

1548.title: Jackson County and the City of Pascagoula; may jointly create the LaPointe-Krebs Foundation, Inc.
1548.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Join With The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pascagoula, Mississippi, To Create The Lapointe-krebs Foundation, Inc., For The Preservation, Maintenance, Upkeep And Operation Of The Lapointe-krebs House; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors To Contribute To The Lapointe-krebs Foundation For Certain Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1549.title: Suffrage; restore to Gene King of Clay County.
1549.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Gene King Of Clay County, Mississippi.

1550.title: Suffrage; restore to Dale Eugene Ott of Monroe County.
1550.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Dale Eugene Ott Of Monroe County, Mississippi.

1551.title: City of Columbus and Lowndes County; establish Columbus-Lowndes Convention and Visitors Bureau.
1551.description: An Act To Create The Columbus-lowndes Convention And Visitors Bureau; To Provide The Composition And Powers Of The Bureau; To Authorize The Bureau To Contribute Funds To The Columbus-lowndes Development Link; And For Related Purposes.

1552.title: City of Indianola; extend repealer on Indianola Tourism Commission.
1552.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 931, Local And Private Laws Of 2003, As Amended By Chapter 959, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Law That Creates The Indianola Tourism Commission, Provides For The Composition Of The Commission, Prescribes The Powers And Duties Of The Commission And Authorizes The Governing Authorities To Levy A Tax To Fund The Commission; And For Related Purposes.

1553.title: Suffrage; restore to James Ronnie Daines of Tippah county.
1553.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To James Ronnie Daines Of Tippah County, Mississippi.

1554.title: Suffrage; restore to Clay Buford Ferguson of Attala County.
1554.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Clay Buford Ferguson Of Attala County, Mississippi.

1555.title: City of Waynesboro and Wayne County; extend repealer on recreational facilities tax.
1555.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 938, Local And Private Laws Of 2005, As Amended By Chapter 967, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, To Extend The Repealer From July 1, 2011, To July 1, 2014, On The Recreational Facilities Tax For The City Of Waynesboro And Wayne County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1556.title: City of Richland; authorize the city to acquire and convey real property in the Richland Industrial and Commercial Park.
1556.description: An Act To Authorize The City Of Richland, Mississippi, To Acquire By Gift, Purchase Or Otherwise, Certain Real Property Located In The North Richland Industrial And Commercial Park In The City Of Richland, Mississippi; To Authorize The City To Redeem Such Property From Tax Sales And To Pay Taxes And Assessments Presently Owing To The City, State And County On The Property; To Authorize The City To Use The Property For Economic Development Or Other Proper Municipal Purposes; To Provide An Alternate Means To Convey The Property To Private Or Public Parties For Economic Development Purposes Without The Necessity Of Appraisal Or Public Bidding; And For Related Purposes.

1557.title: Harrison County; authorize contribution to the Feed My Sheep program.
1557.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Harrison County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Feed My Sheep Program; And For Related Purposes.

1558.title: Hancock County; authorize board of supervisors to enter into certain contracts to promote tourism.
1558.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 1019, Local And Private Laws Of 1996, As Last Amended By Chapter 912, Local And Private Laws Of 2010, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Hancock County, Mississippi, To Enter Into Contracts With Not-for-profit Organizations For The Purpose Of Advertising, Marketing And Promoting Tourism And Conventions Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

1559.title: Town of Oakland; authorize contribution to Charles Johnson Scholarship Fund.
1559.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Oakland, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Charles Johnson Scholarship Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1560.title: Suffrage; restore to Dorothy Jones of Amite County.
1560.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Dorothy Jones Of Amite County, Mississippi.

1561.title: Tallahatchie County; authorize contribution to Mid-State Opportunity, Inc.
1561.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tallahatchie County, Mississippi, To Make A Contribution To Mid-state Opportunity, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1562.title: City of Oxford; authorize to establish the City of Oxford Municipal Reserve and Trust Fund.
1562.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Oxford, Mississippi, To Establish And Maintain The City Of Oxford Municipal Reserve And Trust Fund; To Authorize The City To Make Payments To The Fund To Be Used For The Benefit Of All Citizens Of The City; To Authorize The City To Delegate The Administration Of The Fund To Trustees; And For Related Purposes.

1563.title: Perry County; authorize contribution to Community Development, Inc.
1563.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Perry County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Community Development, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1564.title: City of Moss Point; authorize to expand water, sewer and gas services more than five miles outside of corporate limits.
1564.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Moss Point, Mississippi, To Expand Its Water, Sewer And Gas Services To Areas Within A Certain Distance Outside The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Moss Point; To Provide That Certain Consumers May Be Charged A Certain Rate For The Services; And For Related Purposes.

1565.title: City of Ellisville; revise the amount of tax that may be levied on hotels, motels and restaurants.
1565.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 920, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, As Amended By Chapter 918, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Revise The Amount Of The Tax That May Be Levied Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Certain Restaurants; To Extend The Date Of Repeal On This Act From July 1, 2018, To July 1, 2021; And For Related Purposes.

1566.title: City of McComb; authorize to impose a tourism tax to promote tourism, parks and recreation.
1566.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Mccomb, Mississippi, To Impose A Tourism Tax Within The City, And To Expend The Proceeds Of The Tax To Promote Tourism, Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

1568.title: City of Greenwood; extend repealer on Greenwood Tourism Commission.
1568.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 813, Local And Private Laws Of 1989, As Last Amended By Chapter 937, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Expand The Membership Of The Greenwood Tourism Commission; To Provide That The Commission Shall Appropriate Certain Funds To Certain Entities; To Expand The Date Of Repeal On The Commission From September 30, 2011, To September 30, 2014; And For Related Purposes.

1569.title: Jackson County; authorize pilot program for sheriff to use radar.
1569.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Establish A Pilot Program For The Use Of Radar Speed Detection Equipment By The Sheriff's Department Of The County For Two Twelve-month Periods; To Provide That If The Board Establishes Such Program, The Board May Purchase Or Acquire Radar Speed Detection Devices For Use By The Sheriff's Department Of The County In The Enforcement Of Speed Limits On The Roads, Streets And Highways Of The County Outside The Corporate Limits Of Any Incorporated Municipality; To Require The Sheriff To Collect And Report Certain Information To A Committee Appointed By The Board Of Supervisors And The Sheriff Demonstrating The Effect That The Use Of Such Radar Speed Detection Devices Has Had Over The Initial Twelve-month Period In Reducing Traffic Accidents And Casualties; To Provide That The Authority For The Sheriff's Department Of Jackson County To Use Radar Speed Detection Equipment After June 30, 2013, Shall Stand Repealed Unless Authorized By Subsequent Legislation Enacted By The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

1570.title: Jackson County; authorize sheriff to use radar on county roads.
1570.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County To Purchase Radar Speed Detection Equipment For Use By The Sheriff's Department Of The County In The Enforcement Of Speed Limits On The Roads, Streets And Highways Of The County Outside The Corporate Limits Of Any Incorporated Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

1571.title: Washington County; extend repealer on Washington County Convention and Visitors Committee and revise terms of committee members.
1571.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 816, Local And Private Laws Of 1991, As Last Amended By Chapter 964, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, To Revise The Terms Of Years That Committee Members Of The Washington County Convention And Visitors Committee May Serve; To Provide That Committee Members Shall Not Serve More Than Two Consecutive Terms; To Require The Committee To Allocate And Pay A Certain Amount To The County In Consideration For The Use Of County Facilities And Support Services; To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Committee; And For Related Purposes.

1572.title: Marshall County; authorize to establish the Cayce Community Sewer District.
1572.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Marshall County, Mississippi, To Provide For The Creation Of The Cayce Community Sewer District; To Provide That The District Created Pursuant To The Provisions Of This Act, Acting By And Through The Board Of Supervisors Of Marshall County, Mississippi, Its Governing Authority, Shall Have All Powers With Respect To Wastewater Facilities Granted To Districts By Section 19-5-151 Et Seq., Mississippi Code Of 1972; And For Related Purposes.

1573.title: Suffrage; restore to Jerry Eugene Arnold of Tippah County.
1573.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Jerry Eugene Arnold Of Tippah County, Mississippi.

1574.title: Suffrage; restore to Malcolm Myers of Pike County.
1574.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Malcolm Myers Of Pike County, Mississippi.

1575.title: Lafayette County; authorize contributions to Interfaith Compassion Ministries Homeless Shelter programs and facilities.
1575.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lafayette County, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually To The Interfaith Compassion Ministries Homeless Shelter Programs And Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1576.title: City of Jackson; authorize councilmen to maintain individual offices within City Hall.
1576.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To Allow Councilmen To Maintain Individual Offices Within The City Hall; And For Related Purposes.

1577.title: Prentiss, Alcorn, Benton, Marshall, Tippah, Tishomingo Counties; extend repealer on authority to contribute to NE MS Comm. Services.
1577.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 915, Local And Private Laws Of 2005, As Amended By Chapter 930, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Extend The Repealer Date On The Provision That Authorizes The Boards Of Supervisors Of Prentiss, Alcorn, Benton, Marshall, Tippah And Tishomingo Counties To Contribute To Northeast Mississippi Community Services, Inc., In An Amount Determined By Each Individual Board Not To Exceed $150,000.00 To Be Used As Matching Funds From The State Or Federal Government; And For Related Purposes.

1578.title: Marshall County; authorize to contribute to Northeast Mississippi Community Services, Incorporated.
1578.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Marshall County, Mississippi, To Contribute To Northeast Mississippi Community Services, Inc., A Community Action Agency; To Provide That The Contribution Is To Be Used By The Agency As Matching Funds To Receive Funds From The State Or Federal Government; And For Related Purposes.

1579.title: Benton County; authorize to contribute to Northeast Mississippi Community Services, Inc.
1579.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Benton County, Mississippi, To Contribute To Northeast Mississippi Community Services, Inc., A Community Action Agency; To Provide That The Contribution Is To Be Used By The Agency As Matching Funds To Receive Funds From The State Or Federal Government; And For Related Purposes.

1580.title: Benton County; authorize contribution to the United Community Action Agency, Inc.
1580.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Benton County, Mississippi, To Contribute To And/or Contract With United Community Action Agency, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1581.title: Hinds County; authorize to pay PERS employer contributions on net fee income of constables.
1581.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County, Mississippi, To Pay To The Pubic Employees' Retirement System The Required Employer Contribution On The Net Fee Income Of Each Constable Holding Office In The County; And For Related Purposes.

1582.title: Town of Isola; authorize to contract for the purchase of water from the Humphreys County Water Association.
1582.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Isola, Mississippi, To Enter Into A Certain Contract With The Humphreys County Water Association To Purchase Water From The Association; To Provide That Such Water Will Supply Certain Residents Of The County With Water Services; And For Related Purposes.

1583.title: Mayor-council form of government; authorize council members of certain to have offices in City Hall.
1583.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-8-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Municipal Population Threshold Below Which Councilmen And Councilwomen May Not Have An Office In City Hall In Those Cities Operating Under A Mayor-council Form Of Government; And For Related Purposes.

1584.title: Rankin County; authorize erection of certain electronic gates for the purpose of enclosing neighborhoods.
1584.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Rankin County, Mississippi, To Allow The Erection Of Electronic Gates For The Purpose Of Enclosing Neighborhoods, Provided That The Gates Open Automatically Upon Approach By Any Motor Vehicle; And For Related Purposes.

1585.title: Lauderdale County; revise membership of Emergency Communications Commission.
1585.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 936, Local And Private Laws Of 1984, As Last Amended By Chapter 915, Local And Private Laws Of 2006, To Revise The Membership Of The Lauderdale County Emergency Communications District By Replacing The Lauderdale County Civil Defense Director With The Director Of The Lauderdale County Emergency Management Agency And By Replacing The Director Of Homeland Security Of Lauderdale County With The Director From Meridian, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1586.title: City of Columbus; authorize to allow the Columbus Light and Water Department to offer certain assistance to certain consumers.
1586.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Columbus, Mississippi, To Allow The Columbus Light And Water Department To Take Measures To Assist Consumers In Reducing Their Electricity Bills; And For Related Purposes.

1587.title: Lauderdale County; authorize to fund chaplaincy program of the detention facility from revenue of inmate phone service.
1587.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lauderdale County, Mississippi, To Fund The Lauderdale County Detention Facility's Good News Jail And Prison Ministry Chaplain And Chaplaincy Program From Nontax Revenue Generated By The Inmate Telephone Service; And For Related Purposes.

1588.title: House Rules; member may serve as Speaker for only two terms.
1588.description: A Resolution To Amend House Rule 1, 2008-2012 Rules Of The House Of Representatives, To Provide That A House Member May Serve As Speaker For Only Two Terms.

1589.title: House Rules; amend to allow member to request that conference report be read in full before vote on adoption.
1589.description: A Resolution To Amend House Rule 54, 2008-2012 Rules Of The House Of Representatives, To Provide That A Conference Report Shall Be Read In Full Immediately Before The Vote On Its Adoption Upon The Request Of Any Member.

1590.title: Mrs. Ella Sellers Street; commend life, service and legacy upon her passing.
1590.description: A Resolution Commending The Life, Service And Legacy Of Mrs. Ella Sellers Street And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1591.title: Long Beach High School Bearcats Girls Volleyball Team; commend and congratulate upon winning MHSAA Class II State Championship.
1591.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Long Beach High School Bearcats Girls Volleyball Team For Winning The 2010 Mississippi High School Activities Association Class Ii State Championship.

1592.title: Claiborne C. Davis, Sr.; commend life and legacy upon his passing.
1592.description: A Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy, Service And Dedication Of Longtime Educator, Mr. Claiborne C. Davis, Sr., And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1593.title: House Rules; before conference report is considered, require that House be informed of any new provisions.
1593.description: A Resolution To Amend House Rule 54, 2008-2012 Rules Of The House Of Representatives, To Require That Before A Conference Report On A Measure May Be Considered, The House Shall Be Informed Of Any Provisions In The Report That Were Not Included In Any Version Of The Measure Previously Considered By The House.

1594.title: Reverend James Patterson; commend spiritual leadership and excellence of and for leading the House of Representatives in prayer.
1594.description: A Resolution Commending The Dedicated Service, Spiritual Leadership And Ecclesiastical Excellence Reverend James Patterson Provided As Pastor Of Foundation Of Life Church And Christian Learning Center In The Jeffries City Community Of Lamar, Mississippi, And Expressing Grateful Appreciation For Leading The House Of Representatives In Prayer On The First Day Of The 2011 Regular Session Of The Mississippi Legislature.

1595.title: HR; Mrs. Birdie Clara Spencer; commend life, legacy and service upon her passing.
1595.description: A Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Service Of Mrs. Birdie Clara Spencer And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1596.title: Crime and corrections; create House study committee to study and make recommendations.
1596.description: A Resolution To Create A House Study Committee On Crime And Corrections.

1597.title: Mr. Jimmy Carter Fairley; commend life, legacy and service of upon his passing.
1597.description: A Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Monumental Service Of Mr. Jimmy Carter Fairley, An Esteemed Hattiesburg Civil Rights Leader, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1598.title: Mississippi businesses; urge to implement ergonomic practices to protect the health of the state's workforce.
1598.description: A Resolution Urging Mississippi's Businesses And Industries To Help Protect The Health, Well-being And Investment Made In The State's Workforce By Implementing Ergonomic Practices And Programs Proven To Prevent And Relieve Musculoskeletal Disorders.

1599.title: Coach Eric Neel; commend upon being named Clarion-Ledger's 2010 Mississippi Softball Coach of the Year.
1599.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Coach Eric Neel Of The Wayne County High School Lady War Eagles Girls Softball Team For Being Named The 2010 Mississippi Softball Coach Of The Year By The Clarion-ledger Newspaper.

1600.title: Dr. William Edwin Moak; commend upon retirement after 60 years of medical practice in Richton, Mississippi.
1600.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Dr. William Edwin Moak Upon His Retirement From 60 Years Of Outstanding Medical Practice In Richton, Mississippi.

1601.title: Frances Fredericks; commend and congratulate upon being honored at "Black and White Affair" hosted by Harrison County Democratic Party.
1601.description: A Resolution Commending Frances Fredericks For Her Many Years Of Outstanding And Dedicated Service To The People Of The State Of Mississippi Upon Being Honored During The "black And White Affair" Hosted By The Harrison County Democratic Party On January 22, 2011.

1602.title: Cervical Cancer Awareness Month; acknowledge the month of January 2011 as in Mississippi.
1602.description: A Resolution Acknowledging The Month Of January 2011 As "cervical Cancer Awareness Month" In The State Of Mississippi, And Urging All Women To Understand The Risks Associated With Cervical Cancers And To Take Preventive Steps To Minimize Those Risks.

1603.title: Ethel Jefferson; commend upon the occasion of her 90th birthday.
1603.description: A Resolution Acknowledging And Commending The Life Of Mrs. Ethel Jefferson Of Jayess, Mississippi, And Congratulating Her Upon The Occasion Of Celebrating Her 90th Birthday.

1604.title: Hamilton High School Cheerleaders; commend on winning 2010 MHSAA Class 2A Overall State Championship.
1604.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Hamilton High School Cheerleading Team And Coach Kristan Truelove For Winning The 2010 Mhsaa Class 2a Overall State Championship And State Championship In The Pom Dance Category.

1605.title: Frances Washington; commend on receiving 2010 AARP Andrus Award for Community Service.
1605.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mrs. Frances Washington Upon Being Named Recipient Of The 2010 Aarp Andrus Award For Community Service.

1606.title: Betty Harris; commend upon retirement from MS Department of Rehabilitation Services-Office of Vocational Rehabilitation.
1606.description: A Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career Of Mrs. Betty Harris And Congratulating Her Upon The Occasion Of Her Retirement From The Mississippi Department Of Rehabilitation Services-office Of Vocational Rehabilitation After More Than 20 Years Of Meritorious Service To The Agency And More Than 40 Years Of Service To The Citizens Of The State Of Mississippi.

1607.title: Susan Alsbury; commend upon retirement from Town of Wesson's Library after 15 years of service.
1607.description: A Resolution Commending Susan Alsbury For Her Many Accomplishments And Congratulating Her Upon Her Retirement From The Town Of Wesson's Library.

1608.title: William "Larry" Lucas; commend career accomplishments on being honored by the Mississippi Legislative Black Caucus.
1608.description: A Resolution Commending The Impeccable Service And Career Accomplishments Of Mr. William "larry" Lucas, Former Vice President Of Government Affairs/diversity Programs For The Pharmaceutical Research And Manufacturers Of America (phrma) On The Occasion Of Being Honored By The Mississippi Legislative Black Caucus During Its 25th Annual Banquet.

1609.title: Legendary Bluesman Robert Johnson; acknowledge and designate 2011 as the 100th anniversary of birth.
1609.description: A Resolution Acknowledging And Designating The Year 2011 As The "100th Anniversary Of The Birth Of Legendary Bluesman Robert Johnson."

1610.title: Mississippi dentist and dental laboratories; commend volunteerism and support of Donated Dental Services.
1610.description: A Resolution Commending Mississippi Dentists And Dental Laboratories For Volunteering And Supporting Donated Dental Services, Which Has Provided Over Three Million Dollars In Donated Dental Treatment And Oral Health Care To Mississippi's Most Vulnerable And Needy Adult Citizens.

1611.title: Lisa Michele Hamel; commend work with the Carnival Association of Long Beach and spirit of volunteerism.
1611.description: A Resolution Acknowledging And Commending Mrs. Lisa Michele Hamel For Her Unprecedented Work With The Carnival Association Of Long Beach And For Her Unmatched Spirit Of Volunteerism.

1612.title: Mrs. A.M.E. Logan; commending the life and expressing sympathy upon the passing of the "Mother of the Jackson Civil Rights Movement".

1727.title: Citizens' environmental commission and environmental justice in the State of Mississippi; promote.
1727.description: A Resolution Promoting The Establishment Of A Citizens' Environmental Commission And Promoting Environmental Justice In The State Of Mississippi.

1728.title: Earnestine Perkins Purnell; commend upon her retirement from the Leflore County School District after 23 years of service.
1728.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mrs. Earnestine Perkins Purnell Upon Her Retirement From The Leflore County School District After 23 Years Of Dedicated Service.

1729.title: Dr. Gene Young; commend life and legacy upon his passing.
1729.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Civil Rights Icon, Dr. Gene Young, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1731.title: Bobby O'Quinn; commend life, legacy and brave feat of heroism upon his passing.
1731.description: A Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Brave Feat Of Heroism Of Bobby O'quinn And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1732.title: State agencies; commend on response to Deepwater Horizon oil spill.
1732.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Commitment, Dedication, Personal Sacrifice And "labor Of Love" Of Each State Agency Employee Who Responded To, And Continues To Respond To, The Impacts Of The British Petroleum Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill On The State Of Mississippi.

1733.title: Dr. Lovetta A. Brown; commend dedicated and laudable service to the State of Mississippi.
1733.description: A Resolution Commending The Meritorious Career Of Dr. Lovetta A. Brown And Acknowledging Her Many Years Of Dedicated And Laudable Public Service To The State Of Mississippi Through Her Employment With The Mississippi State Department Of Health.

1734.title: Chief Master Sergeant Harold B. Wilcher; commend service upon his retirement.
1734.description: A Resolution Commending The Esteemed Career And Public Service Of Chief Master Sergeant Harold B. Wilcher, And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1735.title: Larry Gregory; commend upon his retirement as Executive Director of the Mississippi Gaming Commission.
1735.description: A Resolution Commending The Service Of Larry Gregory, Executive Director Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission, For His Many Contributions, Tireless Devotion And Service To The State Of Mississippi And Congratulating Him Upon His Retirement From Public Service.

1736.title: Jack Alexander; commend distinguished and dedicated career upon his retirement.
1736.description: A Resolution Commending The Distinguished And Dedicated Career Of Mr. Jack Alexander And Acknowledging The Services He Has Provided To The Mississippi Farm Bureau Federation For More Than Three Decades Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1737.title: Constitution; amend to provide for a state university system state board of governors and local board of trustees.
1737.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 213a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Clarify That The Legislature Shall Make Adequate Provision By Law For The Establishment, Maintenance And Operation Of The Eight Public Universities In The State Of Mississippi; To Provide For A State University System Comprised Of The Eight Public Universities In The State Of Mississippi; To Establish A System Of Governance For The State University System Of Mississippi; To Provide For A Board Of Governors For The Management Of The State University System Comprised Of The Membership Of The Present Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Prescribe The General Responsibilities Of The Board Of Governors Of The State University System; To Provide For Local Boards Of Trustees For The Administration Of Each University In The State University System; To Prescribe The General Responsibilities Of The Local Boards Of Trustees; And For Related Purposes.

1738.title: Slavery; issue apology for state's role in upholding and perpetuating the institution of in Mississippi.
1738.description: A Concurrent Resolution Apologizing For The Wrongs Of Slavery, Expressing Profound Regret For Mississippi's Role In Slavery, The Discrimination Of Its Legacy And Urging Reconciliation.

1739.title: Constitution; amend to require Governor to give Legislature advance notice of extraordinary session.
1739.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 121, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require A Proclamation Which Calls The Legislature Into Extraordinary Session To Be Issued At Least Five Calendar Days Before The Convening Of The Legislature In Extraordinary Session; And For Related Purposes.

1740.title: Amend Constitution; exclude murder and capital murder from Governor's pardon power.
1740.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Amending Section 124 To Exclude Murder And Capital Murder From The Types Of Felony Convictions For Which The Governor May Grant A Pardon; And For Related Purposes.

1741.title: Amend Constitution; require public hearing before pardon for felony.
1741.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Amending Section 124 To Require A Public Hearing To Occur In The County In Which A Felony Is Committed Before A Pardon Is Granted For The Person Who Has Committed Such Felony; And For Related Purposes.

1742.title: Constitution; amend to change vote requirement from 3/5 to majority for passage of a bill that reduces a tax.
1742.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 70, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Vote Requirement For The Passage Of A Bill That Reduces A Tax Is Only A Majority Vote Of Each House Of The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

1743.title: Constitution; amend to provide that Supreme Court judges be appointed by the Governor.
1743.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, By Amending Section 145 To Provide That Judges Of The Supreme Court Shall Be Appointed; To Provide That Each Judge Shall Stand For An Election During The Last Year Of His Term Of Office To Determine If That Judge Shall Be Retained To Serve In That Office Or Removed From Office And A Successor Appointed; By Amending Sections 149 And 149-a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, In Conformity; By Repealing Sections 145-a And 145-b, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Which Provide For Six Judges In Addition To The Original Three Judges Of The Supreme Court; And For Related Purposes.

1744.title: Constitution; amend to limit members of Legislature to 20 years of service.
1744.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Add A New Section 35a To Provide That Any Person Who Is Elected To The Legislature In Or After The 2011 General Election Shall Not Be Eligible To Serve For More Than Twenty Years In The Legislature, Whether Those Years Are Consecutive Years Of Service Or Not; And For Related Purposes.

1745.title: Constitution; amend to provide that the Legislature shall meet in regular session once every two years.
1745.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 36, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Beginning In 2014, The Legislature Shall Meet In Regular Session Once Every Two Years Rather Than Annually; And For Related Purposes.

1746.title: 10th Amendment State Sovereignty; urge U.S. Congress to be mindful of.
1746.description: A Concurrent Resolution Reinforcing The Fundamental Principle And Authority Of State Sovereignty Under The Tenth Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Over Certain Powers And Discouraging The Federal Government From Imposing Certain Restrictive Mandates.

1747.title: U.S. Congress; memorialize to designate the "Honor and Remember Flag" as a national symbol of service and sacrifice.
1747.description: A Concurrent Resolution Memorializing The Congress Of The United States To Designate The Honor And Remember Flag As A National Emblem Of Service And Sacrifice By The Brave Men And Women Of The United States Armed Forces Who Have Given Their Lives In The Line Of Duty.

1748.title: Christy Knapp; commend and congratulate upon being elected President of the MS Economic Development Council.
1748.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Ms. Christy Knapp Upon Her Election As President Of The Mississippi Economic Development Council (medc) To Serve A One-year Term Of Office From October 2010 To September 2011.

1749.title: Constitution; amend to change day of November election for statewide officers from Tuesday to Saturday.
1749.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Section 102, Section 140 And Section 252, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Change The Day On Which The Election Of Statewide Officers Occurs From The First Tuesday After The First Monday In November To The First Saturday After The First Monday In November, Beginning In 2015.

1750.title: Constitutional amendment; bail not allowed for sex offenses.
1750.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 28, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Deny Bail To Those Accused Of A Sex Offense As Defined In Section 45-33-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972; And For Related Purposes.

1751.title: Constitution; amend to elect State Superintendent of Public Education.
1751.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 202, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide For The Election Of The State Superintendent Of Public Education Beginning At The General State Election In 2015.

1752.title: Diamondhead VFW; commend and congratulate on having second-largest percentage of veterans in the country.
1752.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging And Commending The Diamondhead, Mississippi, Veterans Of Foreign Wars (vfw) Post 2880 Upon Having The Second-largest Percentage Population Of Veterans In The Country.

1753.title: U.S. Congress; memorialize to amend the U.S. Constitution to require a balanced federal budget at the end of each fiscal year.
1753.description: A Concurrent Resolution Memorializing The United States Congress, By The End Of 2013, To Adopt An Amendment To The United States Constitution Requiring A Balanced Federal Budget At The Close Of Each Fiscal Year With Provisions For Certain Exceptions.

1754.title: State appointments, certain; urge to reflect more of the demographics and diversity of the state.
1754.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging That State Appointments For Agency Directors, Commissioners And Boards Be More Reflective Of The Demographics And Diversity Of The State Of Mississippi.

1755.title: State of Mississippi; urge to take critical and fundamental actions to improve the state's economic and social rankings.
1755.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Economic And Social Rankings And Encouraging Mississippi Agencies, And Public And Private Entities To Take Critical And Fundamental Actions To Improve Mississippi's Economic And Social Rankings.

1756.title: Joint Session; call to hear State of the State address of the Governor.
1756.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For A Joint Session Of The Mississippi Legislature To Hear The State Of The State Address Of Governor Haley Barbour.

1757.title: Honorable Judge Samac S. Richardson; commend and congratulate upon the occasion of his retirement.
1757.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Esteemed Legal And Judicial Career And Public Service Of The Honorable Judge Samac S. Richardson Rendered To The Citizens Of Central Mississippi And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement From Public Service.

1758.title: The Diabetes Center and KC Arnold; commend and congratulate upon being awarded the 2010 Nicholas E. Davies Ambulatory Award of Excellence.
1758.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Diabetes Center, Pllc, And Kc Arnold, Anp, Bc-adm, Upon Being Awarded The 2010 Nicholas E. Davies Ambulatory Award Of Excellence By The Healthcare Information And Management Systems Society.

1759.title: Constitution; amend to restrict use of eminent domain.
1759.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 17, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Private Property Shall Never Be Taken For Private Economic Development Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1760.title: Constitution; amend to elect Governor by majority of popular vote, with no electoral vote requirement.
1760.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Amending Sections 140 And 142 And Repealing Section 141 To Provide That The Person Receiving The Majority Of Votes For The Office Of Governor At The General Election Shall Be Declared Elected; To Provide That If No Person Receives A Majority Of The Votes, Then A Runoff Election Shall Be Held Between The Two Persons Receiving The Highest Number Of Votes; To Abolish The Requirement That The Governor Be Elected By Vote Of The House Of Representatives If No Person Receives Both A Majority Of The Popular Vote And A Majority Of The Electoral Votes; And For Related Purposes.

1761.title: Constitution; amend to set elections for statewide elective offices in even-numbered years.
1761.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Section 140 And Section 252, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Elections For Statewide Elective Offices Held After The Election In 2011 Shall Occur In 2014 And Every Four Years Thereafter.

1762.title: Constitution; amend to authorize metropolitan government.
1762.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require The Legislature To Enact General Laws And To Permit The Legislature To Enact Local And Private Laws Prescribing The Manner And Procedure By Which Counties And Cities May Merge And Consolidate To Form A Metropolitan Government; And For Related Purposes.

1763.title: Constitution; felony conviction results in loss of suffrage and legislature to impose conditions for restoration.
1763.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Section 241 And Section 253, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Delete The Enumeration Of Specific Felonies, Conviction Of Which Will Preclude A Person From Being Declared A Qualified Elector; To Provide That Conviction In A Court Of This State Or Of Any Other State Or In Any Federal Court Of Any Felony Will Preclude A Person From Being Declared A Qualified Elector; To Provide That A Person Disqualified As An Elector By Reason Of Conviction Of An Offense Under Section 241 Of This Constitution May Have His Right To Vote Restored Upon Completion Of His Sentence, Probation, Parole And Any Other Conditions As The Legislature, By General Law, May Prescribe; And For Related Purposes.

1764.title: Private William Brandon Dawson; commend life and legacy of upon his passing.
1764.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And The Gallant Service Of United States Army Private Second Class William Brandon Dawson Of Clarksdale And Tunica, Mississippi, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1765.title: Downtown Tupelo Main Street Association and MDEQ; commend efforts of successfully transforming a contaminated area of city.
1765.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Downtown Tupelo Main Street Association And The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality For Their Outstanding Efforts In Successfully Transforming A Contaminated Former Dry Cleaning Site Into The Popular Downtown Fairpark District In Tupelo, Mississippi, And Congratulating Them For Their Receipt Of A Phoenix Award In Recognition Of This Important Work.

1766.title: William K. and Barbara Dease; commend and congratulate on the occasion of their 50th wedding anniversary.
1766.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating William And Barbara Dease On The Celebration Of Their Fiftieth Wedding Anniversary.

1767.title: Patrick House; commend for making healthy lifestyle choices and winning the title of "The Biggest Loser" on NBC.
1767.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Personal Journey Of Mississippi Native, Patrick House, In His Quest To Improve His Health And Quality Of Life, Enduring The Rigors Of A High-intensity And Strictly Structured Exercise Regimen To Become The Season-10 Winner Of Nbc's Hit Reality, Self-help Series, "the Biggest Loser."

1768.title: Mrs. Winifred Hamrick Farrar; commend life, legacy and poetry of upon her passing.
1768.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Poetry Of Mrs. Winifred Hamrick Farrar And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1769.title: State of poverty in Mississippi; acknowledge need for improved economic viability and increased awareness.
1769.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging The State Of Poverty In The State Of Mississippi, Recognizing The State's 20 Poorest Counties And Their Impact On The Overall Status Of Our State, And Encouraging The Improvement Of Their Economic Viability Through Increased Awareness And Creation Of Opportunity By Emphasizing The Importance Of The Inter-relationship With All 82 Counties As It Relates To The Social And Economic Rankings In The State Of Mississippi.

1770.title: Constitution; amend to revise procedure to create and approve apportionment plan.
1770.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 254, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That An Agency Designated By The Legislature Shall Create A Plan To Apportion The State In Accordance With The Constitution Of The State And Of The United States Into Consecutively Numbered Senatorial And Representative Districts Of Contiguous Territory; To Revise The Procedure For Approval Of The Apportionment Plan; And For Related Purposes.

1771.title: Joint Rules; require 72-hour waiting period before voting on appropriation or revenue bill.
1771.description: A Concurrent Resolution Amending Rule 40, Which Is The Timetable For Processing Legislation, Of The Joint Rules Of The House Of Representatives And The Senate For The 2008-2012 Term Of The Mississippi Legislature To Require A 72-hour Waiting Period Before Certain Votes On Passage Of An Appropriation Or Revenue Bill May Be Taken.

1772.title: Constitution; amend Section 41 to provide that minimum age to serve in House of Representatives is 18 years.
1772.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 41, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Decrease The Minimum Age To Be A Member Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives From 21 Years To 18 Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1773.title: Constitution; amend Section 42 to provide that minimum age to serve in MS Senate is 18 years.
1773.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 42, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Decrease The Minimum Age To Be A Member Of The Mississippi State Senate From 25 To 18 Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1774.title: Constitution; bring forward 2011 Initiative Measure No. 27 regarding voter ID for possible consideration of legislative alternative.
1774.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Bring Forward The Proposed Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 Contained In Initiative Measure No. 27, Which Relates To The Subject Of Voter Identification, For The Purpose Of The Possible Consideration Of A Legislative Alternative To The Original Initiative Measure; And For Related Purposes.

1775.title: Constitution; bring forward 2011 Initiative Measure No. 31 regarding eminent domain for possible consideration of legislative alternative.
1775.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Bring Forward The Proposed Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 Contained In Initiative Measure No. 31, Which Relates To The Subject Of Eminent Domain, For The Purpose Of The Possible Consideration Of A Legislative Alternative To The Original Initiative Measure; To Bring Forward Sections 17, 110, 190 And 233, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Which Relate To The Subject Of Eminent Domain, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1776.title: Constitution; amend to set three-term limits for serving in state legislature.
1776.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Sections 34 And 35, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Person Who Has Served Three Consecutive Terms As A Member Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives Or The Mississippi Senate Is Not Eligible To Serve Again In That Office Until One Full Term Has Intervened During Which The Person Did Not Serve In That Office.

1777.title: Constitution; amend to prohibit laws compelling any person, employer or health care provider to participate in any health care plan.
1777.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Creating A New Section To Prohibit Laws Or Rules From Compelling Any Person, Employer Or Health Care Provider To Participate In Any Health Care System; To Permit A Person Or Employer To Pay Directly For Lawful Health Care Services And To Permit A Health Care Provider To Accept Direct Payment From A Person Or Employer For Lawful Health Care Services; To Provide That The Purchase Or Sale Of Health Insurance Shall Not Be Prohibited By Law Or Rule; And For Related Purposes.

1778.title: Constitution; automatically restore suffrage to persons convicted of certain offenses upon completing sentence and other conditions.
1778.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Sections 253 And 241, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Person Disqualified As An Elector By Reason Of Conviction Of Certain Felony Offenses Shall Have His Right To Vote Restored Automatically Upon Completion Of His Sentence, Probation, Parole And Any Other Conditions As The Legislature, May Prescribe By General Law; And For Related Purposes.

1779.title: Beth Israel Congregation in Jackson, MS; commend and congratulate on occasion of its 150th anniversary.
1779.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating Beth Israel Congregation In Jackson, Mississippi, On The Occasion Of Its Sesquicentennial Anniversary.

1780.title: Constitution; legislative alternative to Initiative No. 26 for necessary correction in section number designation.
1780.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Offered By The Mississippi Legislature As An Alternative To Initiative Measure No. 26, Which Relates To The Subject Of The Definition Of "person," For The Sole Purpose Of Making Necessary Nonsubstantive Clerical And Technical Corrections, Including Changing The Section Number Designation From Section 33 To Section 32a; And For Related Purposes.

1781.title: Hunting and fishing; recognize rights of citizens to engage in.
