1781.description: A Concurrent Resolution Expressing The Will Of The Legislature In Recognizing The Rights Of Mississippi Citizens To Hunt, Fish, Trap And Harvest Wildlife And Fish.

1782.title: First Lieutenant William Donnelly IV; commend life and service of upon his passing.
1782.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Mourning The Loss Of United States Marine First Lieutenant William J. Donnelly Iv Of Picayune, Mississippi, Who Was Lost In Action In The Helmand Province Of Afghanistan On November 25, 2010, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends.

1785.title: Lance Corporal Joshua Ose; commend life, legacy and service upon losing his life in action while in Afghanistan.
1785.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Mourning The Loss Of United States Marine Lance Corporal Joshua Ose Of Hernando, Mississippi, Who Was Lost In Action In Afghanistan On September 20, 2010, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1786.title: Suspend deadlines for intro.; S.O.S. may make correction to section number designation in proposed initiative to amend Constitution.
1786.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Provide That When An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 Is Proposed Under The State Voter Initiative Procedure, The Secretary Of State, With The Approval Of The Attorney General, May Make Certain Nonsubstantive Clerical Or Technical Corrections In The Section Number Designation Of The Proposed Constitutional Amendment; And For Related Purposes."

1787.title: Junior League of Jackson; commend on 70th anniversary.
1787.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Junior League Of Jackson On The Celebration Of Its 70th Anniversary.

1788.title: Mississippi Wing of the Civil Air Patrol; commend on Deepwater Horizon response.
1788.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Mississippi Wing Of The Civil Air Patrol For Its Response To The Deepwater Horizon Oil Well Explosion In The Gulf Of Mexico.

1789.title: Pontotoc Junior High School; commend and congratulate upon being designated a Star School.
1789.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Pontotoc Junior High School For Being Recognized As A "star School" By The State Department Of Education And The Mississippi School Board Association.

1790.title: Willie Louis Richardson; commend career and community service of.
1790.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Professional Career And Community And Civic Service Of Willie Louis Richardson And Acknowledging His Commitment To The State Of Mississippi.

1791.title: Phi Theta Kappa; commend the All-Mississippi Academic Team in observance of Mississippi Phi Theta Kappa Day.
1791.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Members Of Phi Theta Kappa's All-mississippi Academic Team On The Occasion Of "mississippi Phi Theta Kappa Day."

1792.title: Dr. Clay Hays; commend for selection as Grand Marshal of Jackson Christmas Parade and his contributions to promoting better health.
1792.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Dr. Clay Hays Of Jackson, Mississippi, For His Selection As The Grand Marshal Of The Annual Jackson Christmas Parade, And Recognizing Him For His Significant Professional And Civic Contributions To The City Of Jackson And The State Of Mississippi In Promoting Better Health For All Mississippians.

1793.title: Glenn F. Ryan, Sr.; commend upon retiring as announcer for Ocean Springs High School football.
1793.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging And Commending The Remarkable Service Of Glenn F. Ryan, Sr., As Announcer For The Ocean Springs High School Greyhounds Football Team Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1794.title: Walter J. Ryan; commend upon retiring as announcer for Ocean Springs High School football.
1794.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging And Commending The Remarkable Service Of Walter J. Ryan As Announcer For The Ocean Springs High School Greyhounds Football Team Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1795.title: Forest High School Bearcats Football Team; commend upon winning its fourth MHSAA Class-3A State Championship.
1795.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Forest High School Bearcats Football Team And Head Coach Judd Boswell For Their Outstanding 2010 Season And For Winning The Mhsaa Class 3a State Championship.

1796.title: Ocean Springs High School Boys Soccer Team; commend on winning the 2011 Class 6A State Championship.
1796.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Ocean Springs High School Greyhounds Boys Soccer Team For Their Outstanding 2010-2011 Season And For Winning The Class 6a State Championship.

1797.title: Ocean Springs High School Cheerleaders; commend on winning Class 6A State Cheerleading Championship.
1797.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Ocean Springs High School Cheerleaders For Winning The 2010 Class 6a State Championship.

1798.title: Ocean Springs High School Tennis Team; commend on winning the 2010 Class 6A State Championship.
1798.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Ocean Springs High School Greyhounds Tennis Team For Their Outstanding 2010 Season And For Winning The Class 6a State Tennis Championship.

1799.title: Albert Jackson; commend and congratulate upon attaining the rank of Eagle Scout.
1799.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Albert Jackson, Iii, On Achieving The Honor Of The Eagle Scout Award And Being Celebrated At The Distinguished Eagle Court Of Honor Ceremony.

1800.title: Bay High School Steppers; commend and congratulate on winning the overall Class 4A Grand State Championship.
1800.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Bay High School Steppers For Winning The Class 4a Grand State Championship.

1801.title: Javoral Quantez Harris; commend upon attaining the rank of Eagle Scout.
1801.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Javoral Quantez Harris Upon The Honor Of Earning The Eagle Scout Award And Being Honored At The Distinguished Eagle Court Of Honor Ceremony.

1802.title: Dr. Owen "Bev" Evans; commend upon retirement as Chairman of Pediatrics at UMMC and for record of service to children.
1802.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Dr. Owen "bev" Evans Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As The Chairman Of The Pediatrics Department At The University Of Mississippi Medical Center And For His Long Record Of Accomplishment In Providing Exceptional Care And Service To The Children Of Mississippi.

1803.title: Richton High School Rebels Baseball Team; commend on winning the Class 2A State Championship.
1803.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Richton High School Rebels Baseball Team For Their Outstanding 2010 Season And For Winning The Class 2a State Championship.

1804.title: Pearl Pirates Boy's Soccer Team; commend on winning Class 5A State Championship.
1804.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Pearl High School Boys Pirates Soccer Team For Their Outstanding 2010-2011 Season And For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 5a State Championship.

1805.title: Alpha Kappa Sorority, Inc.; commend and recognize new administration and program implementation on AKA Day at the Capitol.
1805.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Southeastern Region Of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated, For The New Administration And Implementation Of The New Program Initiatives Under The Theme "global Leadership Through Timeless Service."

1806.title: Crew of PCU Mississippi (SSN 782); commend service of in observance of Mississippi Navy Week on March 19-27, 2011.
1806.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Crew Of Virginia-class Attack Submarine Pre-commissioning Unit (pcu) Mississippi (ssn 782) In Acknowledgment Of Its Commitment To Naval And Maritime Service In Observance And Commemoration Of Mississippi Navy Week On March 19-27, 2011.

1807.title: "National Food Check-Out Week"; designate February 20-26, 2011, as.
1807.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing February 20-26, 2011, As "national Food Check-out Week" To Celebrate The Abundance And Safety Of Food In Our Country.

1808.title: Florence High School Eagles Boys Soccer Team; commend a on winning MHSAA Class 4A State Championship.
1808.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Florence High School Eagles Boys Soccer Team And Head Coach Gray Massey For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association (mhsaa) Class 4a State Championship.

1809.title: Senatobia, Mississippi; commend upon being named as one of Businessweek's "Best Places in America to Raise Kids."
1809.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Town Of Senatobia, Mississippi, As One Of Businessweek's "best Places In America To Raise Kids."

1810.title: Terrance M. Wray; commend the life, legacy and service upon his passing.
1810.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Accomplishments Of Mr. Terrance M. Wray, A Community Leader And Businessman, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1811.title: Joint Rules; amend to revise deadlines for filing & final adoption of conference reports on appropriation/revenue bills.
1811.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Amend Joint Rule No. 40 To Revise The Deadlines For Filing And Final Adoption Of Conference Reports On Appropriation And Revenue Bills.

1812.title: Travis Alford; commend life, legacy and unmatched public service upon his passing.
1812.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Unmatched Public Service Of Longstanding Walthall County Supervisor Travis Alford And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1813.title: Rev. Herman D. "Preacher" Dennis and late Margaret R. Dennis; commend service and pioneering spirit of.
1813.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Reverend Herman D. "preacher" Dennis And His Late Wife, Margaret Rogers Dennis, In Honor And Recognition Of The Observance Of Reverend Herman D. Dennis And Margaret's Grocery Awareness And Preservation Week During The Week Of March 20-26, 2011.

1814.title: Deloris Compston; commend on being selected Instructor of the Year at Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College Perkinston Campus.
1814.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Deloris Compston For Being Selected As Instructor Of The Year At The Perkinston Campus Of The Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College.

1815.title: Karen Fayard; commend on being selected as Instructor of the Year at Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College, Jefferson Davis Campus.
1815.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Karen Fayard For Being Selected As Instructor Of The Year At The Jefferson Davis Campus Of The Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College.

1816.title: Suzana Brown; commend on being selected Instructor of the Year at MGCCC Jackson County Campus.
1816.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Suzana Brown For Being Selected As Instructor Of The Year At The Jackson County Campus Of The Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College.

1817.title: Coach Doyle Wolverton; commend upon being the third winningest girls coach in the nation.
1817.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Coach Doyle Wolverton Of Leake Academy Upon Becoming The Third Winningest Girls Basketball Coach In The Nation.

1818.title: St. Joseph Catholic High School Bruins Boys Soccer Team; commend upon winning Class 1A/2A/3A State Championship.
1818.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The St. Joseph Catholic High School Bruins Boys Soccer Team For Their Outstanding 2010-2011 Season And For Winning The Class 1a/2a/3a Championship.

1819.title: Madison Central Lady Jaguars Soccer Team; commend on winning third consecutive Class 6A State Championship.
1819.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Madison Central High School Lady Jaguars Soccer Team For Their Outstanding 2010-2011 Season And For Winning The Class 6a Championship.

1820.title: Home Builders Association of Mississippi; commend on the occasion of its 50th anniversary.
1820.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Home Builders Association Of Mississippi On The Occasion Of Its 50th Anniversary.

1821.title: Dr. Authur Kinnard; commend the life and legacy upon his passing.
1821.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Accomplishments Of Dr. Arthur H. Kinnard, Jr., And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1822.title: Neshoba Central High School cheerleading team; commend for winning 2010 MHSAA Class 5A State Championship.
1822.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Neshoba Central High School Cheerleading Team And Coach Melonie Moore-washington For Winning The 2010 Mhsaa Class 5a Small Varsity State Championship.

1823.title: Mary B. Crossman; commend for 60 years of service to MS State Hospital and as longest tenured state employee.
1823.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Mrs. Mary B. Crossman For 60 Remarkable Years Of Exceptional Public Service To The Mississippi State Hospital And Congratulating Her As The Longest Tenured Mississippi State Employee.

1824.title: Charles Holder; acknowledge and commend service for commitment to enhancing workforce training and development.
1824.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging And Commending The Exceptional Service Of Charles Holder For His Commitment To Developing And Enhancing Workforce Training And For His Laudable Service To The State Of Mississippi.

1826.title: Gray Swoope; commend unmatched and meritorious service to the State of Mississippi upon his departure as Executive Director of MDA.
1826.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Unmatched And Meritorious Service And The Leadership Of Mississippi Development Authority Executive Director, Gray Swoope, And Expressing Grateful Appreciation Of The Mississippi Legislature For His Zeal And Unrelenting Efforts To Promote The Viability And Sustainability Of The State Of Mississippi As A Powerful Contender At The Forefront Of Attracting And Acquiring Economic Development Projects, Upon The Occasion Of His Departure From The Mississippi Development Authority On March 19, 2011.

1827.title: Jack Cristil; commend remarkable service upon the occasion of his retirement as the "Voice of the Bulldogs".
1827.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Remarkable Service Of Jack Cristil Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement From Mississippi State University As Radio Announcer For The Maroon And White After 58 Years Of Iconic Service.

1828.title: MS Nurses Association; commend and congratulate on 100th Anniversary.
1828.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Mississippi Nurses Association On The Celebration Of Its 100th Anniversary.

1829.title: Sumrall High School; commend and congratulate upon being named a Star School for two consecutive years.
1829.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Sumrall High School For Being Recognized As A "star School" By The State Department Of Education For The 2008-2009 And 2009-2010 School Years.

1830.title: "Vietnam Veterans of Mississippi Recognition Day"; designate April 30, 2011, as.
1830.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing April 30th As "vietnam Veterans Of Mississippi Recognition Day" To Recognize And Commend Mississippi's Veterans Of The Vietnam War.

1831.title: Ruby Jefferson Worsham; commend and congratulate on her 101st birthday.
1831.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging And Commending The Life Of Mrs. Ruby Jefferson Worsham And Congratulating Her Upon The Celebration Of Her 101st Birthday.

1832.title: Brookhaven Academy Lady Cougars Basketball Team; commend and congratulate on winning the MAIS overall championship.
1832.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Brookhaven Academy Lady Cougars Girls Basketball Team And Head Coach Barry Gray For Winning The Mais Overall Tournament Championship.

1833.title: Rick Cleveland; commend on being selected for the 2011 Richard Wright Literary Excellence Award.
1833.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Rick Cleveland Upon Being Selected For The 2011 Richard Wright Literary Excellence Award.

1834.title: Mr. Lawrence M. Sutton, Sr.; commend life, legacy and service upon his passing.
1834.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Service Of Mr. Lawrence Madison Sutton, Sr., And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1836.title: Suspend deadlines for further consideration of House Bill 1215; Protest at funerals; revise penalties.
1836.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of The Further Consideration And Passage Of House Bill 1215, Regular Session Of 2011, Entitled "an Act To Amend Section 97-35-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalties For Disturbance By Disruptive Protest Of A Funeral, Burial Service Or Memorial Service; And For Related Purposes."

1837.title: Secretary Raymond Edwin "Ray" Mabus, Jr.; commend dedication and leadership of the U.S. Navy in observance of Mississippi Navy Week.
1837.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Zealous Dedication Of Raymond Edwin "ray" Mabus, Jr., In Acknowledgment Of His Committed Leadership Of The United States Naval Forces And Maritime Service As Secretary Of The United States Navy In Observance And Commemoration Of Mississippi Navy Week On March 19-27, 2011.

1838.title: Mount Olive High School Pirates Football Team; commend on winning Class 1A State Championship.
1838.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Mount Olive High School Pirates Football Team And Head Coach Perry Murphy For Winning Their Second Consecutive Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 1a State Championship.

1839.title: Mrs. Georgia Moore; commend life, legacy and service of upon her passing.
1839.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Service Of Mrs. Georgia Moore, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1840.title: Chris White; commend and congratulate on being named recipient of the 2010 Cellular South Conerly Trophy.
1840.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Success And Athletic Accomplishments Of Mississippi State Bulldogs Linebacker Chris White Upon Being Named Recipient Of The Prestigious 2010 Cellular South Conerly Trophy.

1841.title: Dick Rice; commend service rendered to WTVA as Chief Meteorologist.
1841.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Dedication And Commitment Dick Rice Provided As Chief Meteorologist For Wtva News During More Than 31 Years Of Remarkable Service.

1842.title: Meridian Wildcats Boys Basketball Team; commend for winning the Class 6A championship.
1842.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Meridian Wildcats Boys Basketball Team For Their Outstanding 2010-2011 Season And For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a Championship.

1843.title: Madison-Ridgeland Academy Patriots Boys Basketball Team; commend for winning 5th consecutive Overall Championship.
1843.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Madison-ridgeland Academy Patriots Boys Basketball Team For Their Outstanding 2010-2011 Season And For Winning Their Fifth Consecutive Overall Championship.

1844.title: Northwest Rankin High School Lady Cougars Basketball Team; commend and congratulate on winning the Class 6A State Championship.
1844.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Northwest Rankin High School Lady Cougars Basketball Team For Their Outstanding 2010-2011 Season And For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a State Championship.

1845.title: Regional Rehabilitation Center of Tupelo; commend and congratulate on the occasion of its 50th anniversary.
1845.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Mission, Objectives And Outstanding Services Provided By The Regional Rehabilitation Center Of Tupelo, Mississippi, Upon The Auspicious Occasion Of Its 50th Year Anniversary.

1846.title: Booneville High School Blue Devils Boys Basketball Team; commend on winning Class 3A State Championship.
1846.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Booneville High School Blue Devils Boys Basketball Team For Their Outstanding 2010-2011 Season And For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 3a State Championship.

1847.title: Birdette M. Hughey; commend and congratulate upon being named Mississippi Teacher of the Year 2011.
1847.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Phenomenal Approach To Teaching And Student Engagement Of Ms. Birdette M. Hughey And Congratulating Her Upon Being Named Teacher Of The Year For The Second Congressional District And 2011 Mississippi Teacher Of The Year.

1848.title: Mr. Walter Lee Simpson; commend and recognize symbolic service as first African-American firefighter in Greenville, MS.
1848.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Recognizing The Symbolic Efforts And Service Of Mr. Walter Lee Simpson Upon Being The First African-american Firefighter In The City Of Greenville, Mississippi.

1849.title: Dr. Lester Spell; commend remarkable service provided as Commissioner of Agriculture upon his retirement.
1849.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Service Of Lester James Spell, Jr., D.v.m., For His Many Contributions, Tireless Devotion And Service To The State Of Mississippi And Congratulating Him Upon His Retirement From Public Service.

1850.title: Oxford High School; commend and congratulate for its academic accomplishments and the success of having nine 2011 National Merit Finalists.
1850.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Oxford High School For Its Academic Accomplishments And The Success Of Having Nine 2011 National Merit Finalists.

1851.title: Mrs. Carson Culver; commend on receiving 2011 MS Humanities Council Humanities Partner Award.
1851.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Ms. P. Carson Culver On Being Selected To Receive The Mississippi Humanities Council Humanities Partner Award For 2011.

1852.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; health insurance claims; revise reciprocal time limitations for audits of Medicaid claims.
1852.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Amend Section 83-41-219, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Reciprocal Time Limitations For Audits Of Claims Made By The Division Of Medicaid; And For Related Purposes."

1853.title: Suspend deadlines for further consideration of HB 1312; health insurance claims; revise reciprocal time limitations for audits.
1853.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of The Further Consideration And Passage Of House Bill 1312, Regular Session Of 2011, Entitled "an Act To Amend Section 83-41-219, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Reciprocal Time Limitations For Audits Of Claims Made By The Division Of Medicaid; And For Related Purposes."

1854.title: Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy (DPN) Awareness Day in Mississippi; recognize November 9, 2011, as.
1854.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing November 9, 2011, As "diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy (dpn) Awareness Day In Mississippi" To Bring Attention To Diabetes Management Programs.

1855.title: Fibromyalgia Awareness Day in Mississippi; recognize May 12, 2011 as.
1855.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing May 12, 2011, As "fibromyalgia Awareness Day In Mississippi."

1856.title: Smart Grid; urge all state agencies to define for purpose of creating more and better paying jobs and encouraging consumer savings.
1856.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging All State Agencies To Define The Smart Grid Energy Control For The Purposes Of Creating More And Better Paying Jobs And Encouraging Consumer Savings In The State Of Mississippi.

1857.title: Carrie Jones Golf Day; recognize March 26, 2011, as.
1857.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Carrie Jones For Her Many Historic Contributions To The Sport Of Golf And Recognizing March 26, 2011, As Carrie Jones Golf Day.

1858.title: Scott Gray, Jr.; commend and congratulate upon being named State Games AT&T Male Athlete of the Year.
1858.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Scott Gray, Jr., Upon Being Selected As The 2010 State Games Of Mississippi At&t Male Athlete Of The Year.

1859.title: Jaycee Tutor; commend and congratulate on being named the 2010 State Games AT&T Female Athlete of the Year.
1859.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Jaycee Tutor On Being Selected As The 2010 State Games Of Mississippi At&t Female Athlete Of The Year.

1860.title: Aviation; designate May as Aviation Month in Mississippi.
1860.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Commercial Airports And General Aviation Airports In The State Of Mississippi For Their Important Contributions To The State's Intermodal Transportation System And Economic Development And Designating The Month Of May As Aviation Month In The State Of Mississippi.

1861.title: Center Hill High School; commend for receiving Academic All-State Team awards for all 16 of its athletic teams.
1861.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Center Hill High School For Receiving Academic All-state Team Awards For All 16 Of Its Athletic Teams.

1862.title: Mrs. Jessie Lee Burks Henderson; commend the life of and express sympathy upon passing.
1862.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life Of And Philanthropic Efforts Of Mrs. Jessie Burks Henderson And Expressing Deepest Sympathy Upon Her Passing.

1863.title: Andrew Weddington; commend life and legacy of.
1863.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Andrew Weddington And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1864.title: Jack Winstead; commend for his work in support of the Mississippi Veterans Memorial Cemetery.
1864.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Jack Winstead For His Integral Work In Support Of The Mississippi Veterans Memorial Cemetery And Acknowledging His Lifelong Commitment To The State Of Mississippi.

1865.title: Ernest "Sonny" Cadden; commend former Band Director at Amory High School and congratulate upon his retirement.
1865.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Ernest "sonny" Cadden, Former Band Director At Amory High School In Amory, Mississippi, And Congratulating Him Upon His Retirement.

1866.title: Ocean Springs High School Dance Team; commend on winning the 2010 Class 6A Championship in both Pom and Jazz categories.
1866.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Ocean Springs High School Dance Team For Winning The 2010 Class 6a State Dance Championship In Both The Pom Category And Jazz Category.

1867.title: St. Stanislaus Rock-A-Chaws Boys Basketball Team; commend and congratulate on winning MHSAA Class 4A State Championship.
1867.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The St. Stanislaus (bay St. Louis) Rock-a-chaws Boys Basketball Team For Their Outstanding 2010-2011 Season And For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 4a State Championship.

1868.title: Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc.; commend and congratulate on its 100th anniversary.
1868.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc., For Its Dedication To Create Social Improvement Within The Community And Congratulating The Organization On The Occasion Of Its Centennial Anniversary.

1869.title: Harbors and water frontage; clarify intent of law that regulates and provides authority for.
1869.description: A Concurrent Resolution Clarifying The Intent Of Sections 59-15-1 Through 59-15-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, The Relation Of Those Sections To The Public Trust Tidelands Act, And Finding That The Municipal Harbors And Adjoining Parks, Structures And Areas Are Owned And Controlled By Certain Statutorily Described Cities, Not Under The Control Or Regulation Of The Secretary Of State And The Operation And Maintenance Of Such Are Consistent With The "higher Public Purposes" Intended By The Public Trust Tidelands Act.

1870.title: Bobby Moody; acknowledge dedicated state service and congratulate upon election to MS Farm Bureau Federation Board of Directors.
1870.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Bobby Moody, Deputy Director Of The Division Of Medicaid And Former State Representative, For His Outstanding And Dedicated Service To The People Of The State Of Mississippi And Congratulating Him Upon His Election To The Mississippi Farm Bureau Federation's Board Of Directors.

1871.title: Southaven High School Cheerleaders; commend for performance at national competition.
1871.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Southaven High School Chargers Junior Varsity Coed Cheerleading Team For Winning The National Title In Their Division.

1872.title: Joint Rules; suspend for further consideration of certain bills and amend to revise date of sine die.
1872.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Suspend The Joint Rules Of The House And Senate, Including The Deadlines And Other Provisions Imposed By Joint Rule No. 40, For The Purpose Of Permitting The Further Consideration, Filing And Adoption Of Conference Reports On Certain Appropriation And Other Bills; To Amend Joint Rule No. 40 To Revise The Date Of Sine Die During A 90-day Session From The 89th Day To The 90th Day; And For Related Purposes.

1875.title: Mrs. Lou Emma Allen; commend life and legacy upon her passing.
1875.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Civil Rights Leader, Lou Emma Allen, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1876.title: Suspend deadlines for further consideration of HB 1463; bonds; authorize for construction of Civil Rights and Mississippi History Museums.
1876.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of The Further Consideration And Passage Of House Bill 1463, Regular Session Of 2011, Entitled "an Act To Establish A Mississippi Civil Rights Museum Advisory Commission And Define Its Responsibilities; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi In The Amount Of $55,000,000.00 For The Purpose Of Providing Funding For Construction Of The Mississippi Civil Rights Museum, The New Museum Of Mississippi History And A Parking Garage; And For Related Purposes."

1877.title: Robert Forbes and Burnsville Public Library; commend on receiving excellence award from American Library Association.
1877.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Librarian Robert Forbes And The Burnsville Public Library For Receiving The Marshall Cavendish Excellence In Library Programming Award By The American Library Association.

1878.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; certain harbors; reaffirm state law providing that such harbors are controlled exclusively by local governing authorities.
1878.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Reaffirm And Clarify State Law Providing That Certain Harbors Maintained And Operated By Local Governing Authorities Are Controlled Exclusively By Those Local Governing Authorities And Are Not Under The Control Or Regulation Of The Secretary Of State; To Expressly Affirm That The Development By The Local Governing Authorities Of Certain Projects Associated With The Harbors Serves A Higher Public Purpose, For Purposes Of The Laws Regulating Public Trust Tidelands; To Provide That This Act Does Not Apply To Or Affect Leases Of Public Trust Tidelands Executed Between The Secretary Of State And A Gaming Licensee; To Expressly Affirm That Any Funds Made Available For A Specific Harbor Under Any Federal Or State Government Grant Or Loan Program Shall Be Duly Transmitted To The Local Governing Authorities That Control The Harbor, Without A Requirement That The Secretary Of State Approve The Use Or Transmittal Of Such Funds; To Clarify The Status Of Certain Leases Of Property Associated With Such Harbors That Have Been Executed Or That Are Pending Execution By Either The Local Governing Authorities Or The Secretary Of State, And To Prohibit The Secretary Of State From Taking Any Action Whatsoever That Would Cancel Or Invalidate Such Executed Or Pending Leases; To Amend Sections 59-15-1, 59-15-3, 29-15-3, 29-15-5, 29-15-13 And 29-15-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes."

1879.title: Commissioner Chris B. Epps; commend dedicated service to MDOC and recent election as 102nd President of ACA.
1879.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Commissioner Christopher B. Epps On His Dedicated And Outstanding Service To The Department Of Corrections And Upon Being The Longest Serving Commissioner In The History Of The Department And Upon His Recent Election As The 102nd President Of The American Correctional Association.

1881.title: Legislature; extend 2011 Regular Session, suspend deadlines for certain bills, set date of sine die adjournment.
1881.description: A Concurrent Resolution Extending The 2011 Regular Session Of The Legislature; Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Permitting The Further Consideration, Filing And Adoption Of Conference Reports On Certain Appropriation And Other Bills; And Setting The Date Of Sine Die Adjournment Of The 2011 Regular Session Of The Legislature.

1882.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; air pollutants; revise authority of commission to regulate on private residential property.
1882.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Amend Sections 49-17-17, 49-17-19 And 49-17-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Authority Of The Mississippi Air And Water Pollution Control Commission To Enter Upon Private Property To Inspect Air Contaminants."

1883.title: Jobie Martin; commend life, legacy and service of upon his passing.
1883.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Service Of Renown Local Tv Personality, Jobie Martin, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1884.title: Vaccinations; allow exemption from school attendance with certificate from physician.
1884.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-23-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Child Will Be Exempt From The Requirement For Having Any Specific Vaccination In Order To Attend A School, If The Child Or The Child's Parent Or Guardian Submits A Certificate From A Physician Stating That The Required Vaccination Would Be Injurious To The Health And Well-being Of The Child; To Amend Section 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize School Administrators, If There Is An Outbreak Of A Vaccine-preventable Disease At A School, To Exclude From Attendance Any Child Who Is Not Vaccinated Against That Disease Until The Disease Incubation Period Has Expired Or The Unvaccinated Child Presents Evidence Of Vaccination; And For Related Purposes.

1886.title: Public Employee Whistleblower Act; bring forward sections.
1886.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 25-9-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 25-9-172, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 25-9-173, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 25-9-175, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 25-9-177, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1887.title: Mississippi Code; provide a CD-ROM or hard copy to the school board of each public school district.
1887.description: An Act To Amend Section 1-1-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The School Board Of Each Public School District Shall Receive An Official Cd-rom Revision Of The Mississippi Code Of 1972 Unless The Official Makes A Request For A Bound Volume Of The Code; And For Related Purposes.

1888.title: Outside attorney fees; require review of certain state contracts for.
1888.description: An Act To Amend Section 7-5-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Notice Of Certain Litigation Shall Be Given To An Agency Head And That Agencies May Retain Separate Counsel In Certain Situations; To Amend Section 7-5-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Authority Of The Attorney General To Enter Into Contracts For Outside Legal Services; To Amend Section 7-5-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Case Docket Maintained By The Attorney General; To Authorize State Agencies And Other State Entities To Directly Employ Legal Counsel, Whether Salaried Or On A Case-by-case Basis, When Certain Conflicts Of Interest Exist; To Provide That Compensation Of Such Legal Counsel May Be Paid From Any Funds Appropriated Or Otherwise Available To The Appointing Or Employing Entity; To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Duties Of The Personal Service Contract Review Board To Review Certain Fee Contracts For Outside Legal Counsel When Entered Into By The Attorney General Or State Agencies; To Amend Section 7-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1889.title: Visitation; require for noncustodial parents concurrent with order of child support.
1889.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-9-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Statute Of Limitations On Paternity Actions; To Amend Section 93-9-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Mothers Be Informed Of The Existence Of The Statute Of Limitations; To Amend Sections 93-11-103 And 93-11-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Department Of Human Services To Seek An Order Of Visitation For The Noncustodial Parent Concurrently With The Child Support Proceedings; And For Related Purposes.

1890.title: Sales tax; authorize a sales tax holiday for retail sales of hunting supplies.
1890.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Retail Sales Of Firearms, Ammunition And Hunting Supplies During The Period Beginning At 12:01 A.m. On The Friday Prior To The First Monday In September And Ending At 12:00 Midnight The Following Sunday; And For Related Purposes.

1891.title: Tort reform; clarify legislative intent.
1891.description: An Act To Amend Sections 11-46-11 And 15-1-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Substantive Nature Of The Notice Requirements For A Person Making A Claim Under The Tort Claims Act Or For A Person Pursuing A Medical Malpractice Claim; And For Related Purposes.

1892.title: Court-appointed special advocates; clarify court's authority.
1892.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-21-121 And 9-5-89, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Authority Of The Youth And Chancery Courts To Appoint A Layperson Special Advocate And To Set Forth Minimum Qualifications For A Person To Serve In That Capacity; And For Related Purposes.

1893.title: Mississippi Principal and Income Act of 2012; enact.
1893.description: An Act To Enact The Mississippi Principal And Income Act Of 2012 Which Shall Be Codified In Title 91, Chapter 17, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Provide For The Duties Of Fiduciaries Of Estates And Trusts In Allocating Receipts And Disbursements To Or Between Principal And Income; To Provide The Manner In Which A Fiduciary Shall Exercise The Power To Adjust Authorized By This Act; To Authorize A Trustee To Adjust Between Principal And Income To The Extent The Trustee Considers Necessary Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide The Circumstances Under Which A Trustee May Not Make An Adjustment; To Provide That A Court May Not Order A Fiduciary To Change Certain Decisions Made By The Fiduciary Pursuant To This Act Unless It Determines That The Decision Was An Abuse Of The Fiduciary's Discretion; To Provide That If A Court Determines That A Fiduciary Has Abused Its Discretion, The Court May Place The Income And Remainder Beneficiaries In The Positions They Would Have Occupied If The Discretion Had Not Been Abused And To Provide Rules That A Court Follows In Such Cases; To Provide The Rules That Apply To Distribution Of The Assets Of An Estate Or Trust After A Decedent Dies, In The Case Of An Estate, Or After An Income Interest In A Trust Ends; To Provide When An Income Interest In An Estate Or Trust Begins And Ends; To Provide For The Allocation Of Receipts And Disbursements When A Decedent Dies, In The Case Of An Estate, Or An Income Interest Begins, In The Case Of A Trust; To Provide For The Allocation Of Undistributed Income When An Income Interest Ends; To Provide For The Allocation Of Receipts Between Principal And Income During The Administration Of A Trust; To Provide For The Allocation Of Disbursements From Income And Principal During The Administration Of A Trust; To Authorize The Transfers From Income To Principal Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide For The Allocation Of The Payment Of Income Taxes Between The Principal And Income Of A Trust; To Authorize Fiduciaries To Make Adjustments Between Principal And Income Because Of Taxes Under Certain Circumstances; To Repeal Sections 91-17-1 Through 91-17-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Comprise The Revised Uniform Principal And Income Law; And For Related Purposes.

1894.title: Public assistance benefits; require applicants to submit to random drug testing to qualify.
1894.description: An Act To Require Adult Applicants For Public Benefits In Mississippi To Submit To Random Drug Testing In Order To Be Eligible; To Provide That Any Such Person Whose Test Results Are Positive Regarding The Presence Of Any Unlawful Drug In The Person's System Shall Be Ineligible To Receive Public Assistance For A Period Of Time Based On The Number Of Positive Drug Tests; To Provide Procedures And Exceptions For Such Random Drug Testing; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Willful Violations Of Random Drug-testing Requirements; To Make It Unlawful For Any State Agency To Provide Any Public Benefit In Violation Of Random Drug-testing Requirements; To Amend Sections 43-13-115, 43-17-1, 71-5-511 And 43-33-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Require The Division Of Medicaid, The Department Of Human Services, The Office Of Employment Security And The Mississippi Housing Authorities To Require Applicants Of Public Assistance Programs To Submit To Random Drug Testing As Required Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1895.title: Elections; require persons or organizations that solicit voter registration applications to register with the Secretary of State.
1895.description: An Act To Require Every Person Or Organization That Solicits Or Collects Voter Registration Applications From Applicants For Voter Registration In This State, Unless Designated As A Voter Registrar By Law, To File An Annual Registration Statement With The Secretary Of State Prior To Engaging In Any Voter Registration Activities; To Require Certain Information Be Included In Such Statements; To Provide That There Shall Be No Registration Fee; To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Assess Fines For Failure To File Registration Statements Prior To Participating In Voter Registration Activities; To Require All Persons Or Organizations Registered Pursuant To This Act To File An Annual Report With The Secretary Of State Containing A List Of All Applications For Voter Registration Solicited Or Collected During The Preceding 12 Calendar Months And Certain Other Information; To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Fine A Registered Individual Or Organization For Failure To Submit Applications To The Appropriate Registrar; To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Fine A Registered Organization For Failure To Submit An Annual Report; To Provide That No Person Shall Receive Compensation Based On The Number Of Applications Solicited Or Collected Or On Any Other Volume Basis; To Provide That No Organization May Pay Compensation Based On The Number Of Applications Solicited Or Collected Or On Any Other Volume Basis; To Provide That All Voter Applications Solicited Or Collected Shall Be Delivered To The Appropriate Registrar Within A Certain Amount Of Time; To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Impose Fines For Failure To Timely Deliver Applications To The Appropriate Registrar; To Provide For Registration Of Persons Whose Applications Are Delivered To The Secretary Of State By A Registered Person Or Organization; To Amend Section 23-15-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1896.title: Criminal history record background check for new student applicants at any state university; authorize.
1896.description: An Act To Authorize The President Or Chancellor Of Any State Institution Of Higher Learning To Require Criminal History Record Checks And Fingerprinting For New Students Applying For Admission To The University; And For Related Purposes.

1897.title: Furlough Plan for State of Mississippi; require.
1897.description: An Act To Direct The Governor To Implement A Furlough Plan For The State Of Mississippi Applicable To All State Service And Nonstate Service Employees And State Contract Personnel; To Provide For State Agency Closures On Days When These Employees Are Furloughed; To Provide Exemptions For Employees And Agencies Providing Direct Patient Or Inmate Residential Care Or Providing Law Enforcement Services; To Amend Section 25-1-98, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1898.title: Elderly victims; enhance penalty for fraud and monetary crimes against.
1898.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-351, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Enhancement Of Penalties For Fraud And Nonviolent Monetary Crimes When Committed Against The Elderly; To Amend Section 97-23-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalties For Home Repair Fraud; And For Related Purposes.

1899.title: Court reporting; misdemeanor to practice without a license.
1899.description: An Act To Create New Section 9-13-125, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Misdemeanor Of Practicing Court Reporting Without A License Or Temporary Permit; To Amend Section 9-13-123, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1900.title: Student immunization requirements; provide exemption based on philosophical beliefs of parent or guardian.
1900.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-23-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Exemption From Immunization Requirements For Students Based Upon A Conflict With The Philosophical Beliefs Of The Parent Or Guardian, And To Provide Procedures To Exercise Such Exemption; And For Related Purposes.

1901.title: Tort immunity; include food donated to needy.
1901.description: An Act To Amend Section 95-9-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Include The Donation Of Food To Service Organizations For The Needy In The Tort Liability Exemption For Volunteer Charitable Activity; And For Related Purposes.

1902.title: Katie's Law; require DNA sample upon all felony arrests.
1902.description: An Act To Provide For Dna Collection From Persons Arrested For Certain Crimes; And For Related Purposes.

1903.title: Ignition interlock; create DUI-restricted driver's license.
1903.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Dui-restricted Driver's License To Authorize Operation Of Only A Vehicle That Is Equipped With An Ignition Interlock Device Upon A Second Or Subsequent Conviction And To Create An Opt-in Provision For A First Offense; To Amend Section 63-11-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Ignition Interlock; To Amend Section 63-1-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Ignition Interlock License; To Amend Section 63-1-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set The Fee For The Dui-restricted Driver's License And To Create The Driver's License Bureau Enhancement Fund; To Bring Forward Sections 63-1-45 And 63-1-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Amend Section 63-1-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Term And Renewal Of The Dui-restricted Driver's License; And For Related Purposes.

1904.title: Sunshine attorney act; require review of certain contracts for outside counsel.
1904.description: An Act To Amend Section 7-5-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Notice Of Certain Litigation Shall Be Given To An Agency Head And That Agencies May Retain Separate Counsel In Certain Situations; To Amend Section 7-5-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Authority Of The Attorney General To Enter Into Contracts For Outside Legal Services; To Amend Section 7-5-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Case Docket Maintained By The Attorney General; To Authorize State Agencies And Other State Entities To Directly Employ Legal Counsel, Whether Salaried Or On A Case-by-case Basis, When Certain Conflicts Of Interest Exist; To Provide That Compensation Of Such Legal Counsel May Be Paid From Any Funds Appropriated Or Otherwise Available To The Appointing Or Employing Entity; To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Duties Of The Personal Service Contract Review Board To Review Certain Fee Contracts For Outside Legal Counsel When Entered Into By The Attorney General Or State Agencies; And For Related Purposes.

1905.title: MS Telephone Solicitation Act; apply to cellular telephones.
1905.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-705, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "consumer" As Used In The Mississippi Telephone Solicitation Act In Order To Broaden The Application Of The Act To Include Cellular Telephones; And For Related Purposes.

1906.title: School board members elected in all districts; superintendents appointed after January 1, 2012.
1906.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Trustees Of Municipal Separate School Districts Shall Be Elected From Special Trustee Election Districts By The Qualified Electors Of Such District Beginning With The Municipal Elections In The Year 2013; To Provide That Such Election Shall Be Held Every Four Years In The Same Manner As Elections Are Held For Other Municipal Officers; To Provide That The Local School Board Shall Apportion The New Trustee Election Districts; To Amend Section 37-7-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Trustees Of Special Municipal Separate School Districts Shall Be Elected In The Same Manner As Trustees Of Municipal Separate School Districts; To Amend Sections 37-5-9, 37-7-211 And 37-7-711, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Uniform Number Of Signatures On Petitions Of Nomination To Run For The Office Of Elected School Board And To Require Petitions To Be Filed At Least 60 Days Prior To The Election; To Repeal Sections 37-7-209 Through 37-7-219, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Electing Trustees Of Municipal Separate School Districts From Added Territory; To Repeal Sections 37-7-705 Through 37-7-717, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Selecting Trustees Of Special Municipal Separate School Districts; To Amend Section 37-9-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Appointment Of All Superintendents Of Schools From And After January 1, 2012, Unless The Incumbent County Superintendent Of Education Chooses To Seek Reelection; To Amend Sections 37-5-61, 37-5-71 And 37-9-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Section 37-9-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Referendum On The Question Of Retaining The Elective Method Of Choosing The County Superintendent Of Education; To Repeal Sections 37-5-63 Through 37-5-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Election Of County Superintendents Of Education; And For Related Purposes.

1907.title: Reorganization of all public school districts in MS; require one school district per county.
1907.description: An Act To Provide For The Reorganization Of All Public School Districts In The State Of Mississippi Into A System With One Countywide School District Per Each County; To Abolish Other Types Of School Districts And Reconstitute Countywide School Districts As Is Necessary To Effect Said Reorganization; To Provide That The Territory Of Any School District Located In Two Or More Counties Shall Become Added Territory To The County School District In Which The School Buildings Are Located; To Provide That Counties With Less Than 3,000 Population Shall Form A Two-county School District With An Adjoining County, And Provide For A Special School Board In Such Situations; To Require All School Boards Affected By Said Reorganization To File A Transition Plan With The State Board Of Education On July 1, 2012; To Amend Sections 37-5-1, 37-5-7 And 37-5-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require New County Board Of Education Elections In All Counties In November 2012; To Repeal Section 37-5-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Residents Of Municipal Separate School Districts From Qualifying For The County Board Of Education, And Section 37-5-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Election Of School Board Members From Special Districts; To Repeal Sections 37-7-103 Through 37-7-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Abolition, Alteration Or Creation Of School Districts By Local School Governing Boards Or Petition Filed By The Electorate, And Sections 37-7-501 Through 37-7-511, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Disposition Of Property On Dissolution Of A School District; To Repeal Sections 37-7-201 Through 37-7-229, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Selection Of Boards Of Trustees Of Municipal Separate And Consolidated School Districts; To Repeal Sections 37-6-5 And 37-6-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Title Of Public School Districts And The Composition Of School Boards; To Amend Section 37-7-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Empower County Boards Of Education To Govern Reorganized School Districts, And To Amend Sections 37-6-3, 37-6-9, 37-6-11, 37-6-13, 37-6-15, 37-7-301, 37-7-303, 37-7-305, 37-7-307, 37-7-311, 37-7-315 Through 37-7-323, 37-7-327, 37-7-329, 37-7-333, 37-7-401, 37-7-405, 37-7-409, 37-7-411, 37-7-431, 37-7-433, 37-7-435, 37-7-451, 37-7-455, 37-7-471, 37-7-475, 37-7-477, 37-7-479 And 37-7-481, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 37-9-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Selection Of The County Superintendent Of Education By The County Board Of Education; To Amend Sections 37-9-3, 37-9-14, 37-9-15, 37-9-17, 37-9-21 Through 37-9-27, 37-9-33, 37-9-37 Through 37-9-43, 37-9-49, 37-9-55 Through 37-9-59, 37-9-70 And 37-9-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe The Duties Of The County Superintendent Of Education; To Repeal Sections 37-5-61 Through 37-5-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Elective Office Of County Superintendent Of Education, And Section 37-9-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribes The Powers And Responsibilities Of Administrative Superintendents; To Amend Sections 37-15-2, 37-15-3, 37-15-4, 37-15-8, 37-15-13, 37-15-15, 37-15-17, 37-15-21 And 37-15-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Permanent Pupil Records And Assignment Of Pupils To Schools By The Newly Reconstituted School Boards; To Amend Sections 37-57-1, 37-57-105, 37-57-107, 37-59-3, 37-59-11, 37-59-13, 37-59-17, 37-59-19, 37-59-23, 37-59-27 Through 37-59-31, 37-59-35, 37-59-37, 37-59-43, 37-59-101 Through 37-59-107, 37-59-109 And 37-59-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Sections 37-57-131 And 37-57-133, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Levy And Collection Of Ad Valorem Taxes By Municipal Governing Authorities In Annexed Territory; To Amend Section 29-3-1.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Sections 37-61-3, 37-61-9, 37-61-17, 37-61-19, 37-61-21, 37-61-23 And 37-61-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Section 37-151-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

1908.title: State General Fund budget requests; impose limitations on the growth of state agency budget requests.
1908.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-103-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That State General Fund Budget Requests By State Agency Heads Shall Not Exceed The Prior Year's Request By A Percentage In Excess Of Any Increase In Actual General Fund Revenue Collections In The Latest Fiscal Year With Certain Exceptions; And For Related Purposes.

1909.title: Traffic tickets; clarify time of filing in certain circumstances and revise authority to prescribe form of ticket.
1909.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-9-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Filing Of Traffic Tickets With The Clerk Of Court Under The Uniform Traffic Ticket Law And To Revise The Duties Of The State Auditor With Regard To The Uniform Traffic Ticket Law, Giving Additional Responsibility To The Commissioner Of Public Safety And Revising The Reporting Duties Of The Court Clerks; And For Related Purposes.

1910.title: Tony Gobar program; revise.
1910.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-803, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Programs That Are Funded By The Tony Gobar Individualized Assessment And Comprehensive Community Intervention Initiative (iaccii) Program Shall Emphasize Parental Accountability Or Parenting Classes; To Provide That The Legislature Shall Ensure That At Least 50% Of The General Funds That Are Saved From The Closure Or Downsizing Of Oakley Training School Shall Be Deposited Into The Fund Of The Iaccii Program; To Provide For Certain Uses Of The Deposited Funds; To Require Each County To Have Access To An Iaccii Program By The Year 2016; To Extend The Date Of Repeal On This Section From July 1, 2012, To July 1, 2016; And For Related Purposes.

1911.title: Compulsory school attendance requirements; child with 30 or more excused/unexcused absences not allowed to advance or graduate.
1911.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Compulsory-school-age Child That Has Accumulated 30 Or More Excused Or Unexcused Absences In A School Year Shall Not Be Allowed To Advance To The Next Grade Or Graduate; And For Related Purposes.

1912.title: Workers' Compensation; provide for admissibility of drug and alcohol testing.
1912.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Admissibility Of Drug And Alcohol Testing, Employer Administered Or Otherwise, Solely On The Issue Of Causation At The Time Of Injury For Workers' Compensation; And For Related Purposes.

1913.title: Drug and alcohol testing in the workplace; provide certain standards.
1913.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Certain Standards For Drug And Alcohol Testing In The Workplace; And For Related Purposes.

1914.title: Commercial driver's license; technical correction and clarification.
1914.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make A Technical Correction To Codal References And To Clarify That The Holder Of A Commercial Driver's License Is Ineligible For A Hardship-based Restoration Of The Driving Privilege; To Amend Section 63-1-222, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1915.title: Sex offender registration; revise to comply with federal mandates.
1915.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-33-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions; To Amend Section 45-33-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Registration Under The Act; To Amend Section 45-33-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Number Of Days Within Which Registration Is Required; To Create New Section 45-33-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Registration Of An Offender Housed At A Shelter During A Natural Disaster Or Other Emergency; To Amend Section 45-33-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Responsibility Of A Registrant To Update Registration Information; To Amend Section 45-33-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Notification Of Other Law Enforcement Agencies; To Amend Section 45-33-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalty For Violations; To Amend Section 45-33-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Responsibility Of A Registrant To Update Registration Information; To Amend Section 45-33-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Notification Given To Other Interested Parties; To Amend Section 45-33-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Registration Duties Of A Court Under The Act; To Amend Section 45-33-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Three-tier Classification Of Offenses To Correlate With The Length Of Time During Which Continuing Registration Is Required; To Amend Section 45-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Department's Responsibility To Maintain A Website And Provide Public Notice; To Amend Section 47-7-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1916.title: Cell phones; limit use and prohibit texting while driving.
1916.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Texting While Driving; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide Exemptions; To Prohibit Cell Phone Use By Certain Minors; To Provide Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

1917.title: Defensive driving school; authorize Internet courses.
1917.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-1-55 And 63-9-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Attendance At A Defensive Driving School Offered Through The Internet Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

1918.title: Elections; increase per diem of election commissioners on election days.
1918.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Commissioners Of Election To Be Paid Per Diem In The Amount Of $150.00 For The Performance Of Their Duties On The Day Of A General Or Special Election; And For Related Purposes.

1919.title: Abortions; physicians performing in clinics must be board certified in OB/GYN.
1919.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-75-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Physicians Who Perform Abortions In Abortion Facilities Must Be Board Certified In Obstetrics And Gynecology; And For Related Purposes.

1920.title: Certified athletic trainers; allow to receive salary supplement if have completed NATA certification process.
1920.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Licensed Athletic Trainer Who Has Met The Requirements And Acquired A National Certified Athletic Trainer (ncat) Certificate From The National Athletic Trainers Association Board Of Certification, Inc., And Who Is Employed By A Local School Board Or The State Board Of Education As An Athletic Trainer And Not As An Administrator Shall Receive An Annual Salary Supplement; And For Related Purposes.

1921.title: Law enforcement officers; require to be compensated for overtime work.
1921.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-92, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That State Law Enforcement Officers Shall Be Compensated For Overtime Worked Between 160 To 171 Hours In A 28-day Work Period; And For Related Purposes.

1923.title: Rape or sexual battery of a child; mandate life without parole.
1923.description: An Act To Amend Sections 97-3-65, 97-3-71, 97-3-95 And 97-3-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose The Penalty Of Life Imprisonment For Rape Or Sexual Battery Of A Child Younger Than 12 Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1924.title: Income tax; allow adjustment to gross income for certain unreimbursed travel expenses of National Guard/Reserves.
1924.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Unreimbursed Expenses Of Members Of The National Guard Or The Armed Forces Reserves For Overnight Travel Away From Home To Attend Meetings Of The National Guard Or Reserves Are Deductible As An Adjustment To Gross Income Under The State Income Tax Law In Accordance With Provisions Of The United States Internal Revenue Code; And For Related Purposes.

1925.title: Board of supervisors; authorize to pay for income loss protection for volunteer fire fighters.
1925.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-3-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Any County To Expend Funds To Defray The Costs Of Income Loss Protection Through Workers' Compensation Insurance For All Volunteer Fire Fighters In The County; And For Related Purposes.

1926.title: Child sexual conduct; revise computation of second or subsequent offense of depiction of.
1926.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-5-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Computation Of Second Or Subsequent Offense Of Depicting Child Sexual Conduct; And For Related Purposes.

1927.title: Right to work; private and public employers prohibited from permitting payroll deductions for union political activities.
1927.description: An Act Relating To The Right To Work; To Provide That The Right To Work Shall Not Be Infringed Or Restricted In Any Way Based On Membership In, Affiliation With, Or Financial Support Of A Labor Organization Or On The Refusal To Join, Affiliate With, Or Financially Or Otherwise Support A Labor Organization; To Authorize Employers To Deduct Union Fees From An Employee's Wages With The Employee's Signed Written Authorization, But To Prohibit Any Requirement For The Payment Of Dues Or Fees To A Labor Organization As A Condition Of Employment; To Prohibit Coercion And Intimidation Relating To Such Action; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Violation Of This Act; To Provide Civil Remedies For Violation Of This Act; To Provide That This Act Applies To Private And Public Employers; And For Related Purposes.

1928.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tags; prohibit receipt by Medicaid recipients.
1928.description: An Act To Provide That The Owner Of A Motor Vehicle Who Is A Recipient Of Medicaid Benefits Shall Not Be Allowed To Receive Any Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Which An Additional Fee Is Required; To Provide That The Department Of Medicaid, In Cooperation With The State Tax Commission, Shall Develop A Computer Program That Will Allow County Tax Collectors To Determine Whether An Applicant For A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag Is A Recipient Of Medicaid Benefits; And For Related Purposes.

1929.title: Medicaid recipients; redetermine eligibility every 6 months.
1929.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Division Of Medicaid To Redetermine Eligibility For All Categories Of Medicaid Recipients Not Less Than Once Every 6 Months; And For Related Purposes.

1930.title: Nursing home licensure; authorize State Department of Health to remove residents in imminently dangerous environment.
1930.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-11-13 And 43-11-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Remove Residents From Any Nursing Facility Which Has Created An Imminently Dangerous Environment; And For Related Purposes.

1931.title: Absentee ballots; require application of temporarily disabled to be accompanied by a statement from a doctor or nurse.
1931.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-629, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Application For An Absentee Ballot Of A Person Who Is Temporarily Physically Disabled To Be Accompanied By A Statement Signed By A Physician Or Nurse Practitioner Indicating That The Person Applying For The Absentee Ballot Is Temporarily Physically Disabled To Such A Degree That It Is Difficult For Him To Vote In Person Or His Attendance At The Voting Place Could Reasonably Cause Danger To Himself Or Others; And For Related Purposes.

1932.title: Social security numbers; provide for redaction in recorded documents.
1932.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-1-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State And Local Officials To Redact Individual Social Security Numbers When Any Record Is Published On The Internet Or On A Government Controlled Web Site; To Authorize Redaction Of Social Security Number By The Chancery Clerks When Possible; And For Related Purposes.

1933.title: Investigation costs; provide for reasonable recovery by Bureau of Narcotics.
1933.description: An Act To Provide For An Additional Assessment Against Convicted Criminal Defendants To Cover The Reasonable Costs Of Investigations; And For Related Purposes.

1934.title: School start date; require local school boards to fix the opening of the school term no earlier than the fourth Monday in August.
1934.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In The Local School Board's Exercise Of Authority To Fix The Opening And Closing Dates Of The School Term, The Board Shall Not Set The Opening Date Before The Fourth Monday In August; To Require The Board In Establishing The Opening And Closing Dates To Satisfy The Required Minimum Number Of Days For A Scholastic Year; To Provide That All Instructional Days Shall Be Conducted In A Manner Consistent With Fulfilling The Minimum Number Of Days For The Academic Year Beginning With The 2011-2012 School Term; To Prohibit Staff Development Training During A Regular School Day; To Provide That Such Training May Be Conducted After Regular School Hours Or During The Summer Interim; To Provide That Only Certain Holidays Shall Be Observed As School Holidays; To Create The "mississippi Successful School Performance Task Force"; To Provide For The Composition Of Its Membership And Its Duties; And For Related Purposes.

1935.title: Mississippi Civic Literacy Act; enact.
1935.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Civic Literacy Act; To Require The Teaching Of The Nation's Founding And Related Documents During The High School Years; To Require The State Department Of Education To Submit An Annual Report To The Governor And Legislature On The Effectiveness Of The Curriculum On Civic Literacy; And For Related Purposes.

1936.title: Auto liability insurance coverage; require before receiving tag.
1936.description: An Act To Create A New Code Section To Be Codified As Section 63-15-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Proof Of Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance Before Receiving Motor Vehicle License Tags; And For Related Purposes.

1937.title: Ballots; allow nicknames and require names to be listed alphabetically on the general election ballot.
1937.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-333, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Nicknames To Be Placed On The Primary Ballot And To Prohibit The Use Of Titles With Names On The Ballot And Nicknames That Promote A Political Ideal; To Amend Section 23-15-367, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Names On The General Election Ballot For Each Office Shall Be Arranged Alphabetically; To Allow Nicknames To Be Place On The Ballot And To Prohibit The Use Of Titles With Names On The Ballot That Promote A Political Ideal; And For Related Purposes.

1938.title: Voter assistance; require providers of assistance to complete declaration of voter assistance form.
1938.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-549, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If A Person Who Requires Assistance To Vote At Any Election Except A Federal Election By Reason Of Blindness, Disability Or Inability To Read Or Write Requests The Assistance Of An Election Official, He Must Be Assisted By Two Election Officials; The Voters Mother, Father, Sister, Brother, Child, Or Certain Other Persons Of The Voters Choice Who Are Registered Voters; To Require Persons Who Assist Such A Voter To Be Registered Voters; To Provide That No Person, Other Than An Election Official, May Assist More Than 10 Voters In Any Election; To Provide That No Candidate In The Election, Or A Family Member Of Such Candidate Or Poll Watcher Of Such Candidate, May Assist A Voter; To Require Persons Who Assist A Voter To Complete A Declaration To Provide Voter Assistance Form; To Amend Section 23-15-719, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Form Of The Certificate Of Person Providing Voter Assistance To Persons Voting By Absentee Ballot; And For Related Purposes.

1939.title: Mississippi Commission on Long-Term Care Residences for the Future; create.
1939.description: An Act To Create A Mississippi Commission On Long-term Care Residences For The Future To Study And Make A Report To The Legislature On Existing Long-term Care Programs And Innovative Practices Across The Country; To Provide For The Membership And Organization Of The Commission; And For Related Purposes.

1940.title: Funeral service/directing license; revise certain requirements for reinstatement after expiration.
1940.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-11-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That The Applicant For Reinstatement Of A License For The Practice Of Funeral Service Or Funeral Directing More Than Five Years After The License Expired Must Pass An Examination By The State Board Of Funeral Service; To Provide That The Maximum Total Amount Of All Fees Required To Be Paid For Reinstatement Of A License Shall Not Exceed Five Hundred Dollars, Regardless Of How Long The License Has Been Expired; And For Related Purposes.

1941.title: Curbside voting; make it clear that it is authorized only on the day of the election.
1941.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-541, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make It Clear That Curbside Voting For Physically Disabled Voters May Only Be Utilized On The Day Of The Election; And For Related Purposes.

1942.title: Mississippi Country and Western Music Commission; establish.
1942.description: An Act To Establish A Mississippi Country And Western Music Commission To Develop A Plan To Promote Authentic Mississippi "country And Western" Music And "country And Western Music Culture" For Purposes Of Economic Development; To Prescribe The Functions And Duties Of The Commission; To Empower The Commission To Accept And Expend Grant Funds; To Provide For Interdepartmental Cooperation; And For Related Purposes.

1943.title: Hill Fire folk life play; designate as official folk play of Mississippi.
1943.description: An Act To Designate Montgomery County Arts Council's Hill Fire As The Folk Life Play Of The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1944.title: "Bill of Rights" for patients and residents of health care facilities; provide.
1944.description: An Act To Provide A "bill Of Rights" For Patients And Residents Of Health Care Facilities; To Provide Definitions; To Require Disclosure Of Information About Rights And Treatment; To Require Courteous Treatment; To Require Appropriate Health Care And Freedom From Maltreatment; To Require The Disclosure Of The Physician's Identity; To Provide For Participation In Planning Treatment And Notification Of Family Members; To Provide The Right To Refuse Care; To Provide For Communication Privacy And Confidentiality Of Records Of Treatment; To Provide A Grievance Procedure; To Provide A Right To Associate; To Provide For Advisory Councils; To Provide For Protection And Advocacy Services; To Set Standards For Isolation And Restraints; And For Related Purposes.

1945.title: Nursing facilities; required to carry a minimum amount of liability insurance by licensing agency.
1945.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-11-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That The State Board Of Health Shall Require Nursing Facilities To Carry At Least $500,000.00 In Liability Insurance As A Condition Of Licensure; And For Related Purposes.

1947.title: Beer; increase the amount of alcohol that it may contain from 5% by weight to 8% by weight.
1947.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Permissible Alcoholic Content Of Beer From 5% Of Alcohol By Weight To 8% Of Alcohol By Weight; To Amend Section 67-3-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Every Person Shall Have The Right To Make Homemade Beer For Domestic Or Household Use Only; To Amend Sections 67-1-5, 67-3-1, 67-3-5, 67-3-7, 67-3-9, 67-3-13, 67-3-17, 67-3-28, 67-3-49, 67-3-53 And 27-71-509, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1948.title: Property/casualty insurance; prohibit premium increase for certain policies when no change in circumstances of insured.
1948.description: An Act To Provide That No Insurer Shall Be Entitled To Additional Premium For Any Property And Casualty Policy In Effect For A Certain Period Of Time When There Has Been No Material Change In The Circumstances Of The Insured From Those Stated In The Application For The Policy; To Require 30 Days' Notice For A Premium Increase When There Has Been A Material Change In The Circumstances Of The Insured From Those Stated In The Application For The Policy; To Prohibit An Insurer From Cancelling A Property And Casualty Policy After The Initial Policy Has Been In Effect For 60 Days Or More, Except In Certain Instances; And For Related Purposes.

1949.title: Constitutional rights; contractual waiver only effective if knowingly executed.
1949.description: An Act To Create New Section 11-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For And Restrict The Contractual Waiver Of Constitutional Rights; And For Related Purposes.

1950.title: Health insurance; require insurers to offer insurance under the federal Health Care Tax Credit Program.
1950.description: An Act To Require Any Insurer Delivering Or Issuing A Policy Of Accident And Sickness Insurance, As A Condition Of Doing Business In The State Of Mississippi, To Enter Into An Agreement With The Commissioner Of Insurance To Offer State-qualified Health Insurance Under The Federal Health Care Tax Credit Program; And For Related Purposes.

1951.title: Property insurance; policy with concurrent causation exclusion is unfair and deceptive act/adopt efficient proximate cause doctrine.
