1951.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-5-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Policies Containing Concurrent Causation Exclusions Are Defined As Unfair Methods Of Competition And Unfair And Deceptive Acts Or Practices In The Business Of Insurance; To Provide That, Whenever A Loss Under A Homeowners Or Commercial Property Insurance Policy Is Caused By A Combination Of A Covered Risk And An Excluded Risk, An Insurer Shall Be Liable If The Covered Risk Was The Efficient Proximate Cause Of The Loss; And For Related Purposes.

1952.title: Animal cruelty; revise.
1952.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Statement Of Legislative Intent As To The Purpose Of The Laws Concerning Animal Cruelty And Other Offenses Against Animals; To Amend Section 97-41-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Definitions; To Amend Section 97-41-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Misdemeanor Offense Of Cruelty To Animals; To Amend Section 97-41-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Offense Of Aggravated Cruelty To A Dog Or Cat, And To Provide That The Third Offense Shall Be A Felony; To Amend Section 97-41-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Exemptions From Criminal Liability Under The Act; To Amend Section 97-41-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Seizure Of Animals Believed To Be Subject To Neglect Or Abuse; To Amend Section 97-41-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 97-41-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Disposition Of Animals Seized; To Create New Section 97-41-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Exemptions From Criminal Liability In Cases Of Natural Or Man-made Disaster; To Create New Section 97-41-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Immunity From Liability For Those Who In Good Faith Report Suspected Violations Of The Act; To Create New Section 97-41-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Disposition Of Animals In The Possession Of A Person Who Is Arrested At The Time Of Arrest; To Create New Section 97-41-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Immunity Of Veterinarians Who Report Suspected Abuse; To Create New Section 97-41-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Proper Care Of Impounded Animals; To Repeal Section 97-41-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Seizure And Disposition Of Abused And Neglected Animals; To Repeal Section 97-41-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Malicious Injury To Dog And Cats; And For Related Purposes.

1953.title: Open Meeting and Public Records Acts; revised imposition of penalties for violation of.
1953.description: An Act To Be Known As The "meetings Accountability Act"; To Amend Section 25-41-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalty That May Be Imposed For Violations Of The Open Meetings Act; To Amend Section 25-61-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalty That May Be Imposed Under The Public Records Act; And For Related Purposes.

1954.title: Preparation of the Executive Budget and Legislative Budget; change procedures.
1954.description: An Act To Provide For The Preparation Of An Executive Budget; To Amend Section 27-103-137, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Joint Legislative Budget Committee And The Executive Budget Office Shall Conduct Joint Budget Hearings; To Amend Section 27-103-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Timetable For Preparation Of The Legislative Budget Beginning With The 2012 Regular Session; To Codify Sections 27-103-161 Through 27-103-187, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Office Of Budget And Fund Management Within The Department Of Finance And Administration Shall Be Known As The Executive Budget Office, To Provide For Budget Preparation, Recommendations And Studies As To State Agencies, To Provide For Executive Budget Parts, Separation Of Items, Limitation On Expenditures, Recommendations As To Additional Taxes Or Sources Of Revenue, To Provide That Budget Hearings Shall Be Conducted Jointly With The Joint Legislative Budget Committee, To Provide For Executive Budget Requests, Proceedings, Failure Or Refusal To File Budget Requests, Visitation Of State Agencies, Hearings On Executive Budget Requirements, To Provide For Reports To Be Furnished By Revenue-producing Agencies, To Provide For Submission Of The Executive Budget; To Amend Sections 27-103-101 And 27-103-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1955.title: Elections; holder of an elective office may not run for another office during his term of office.
1955.description: An Act To Prohibit A Person Who Holds Elective Office In This State From Being A Candidate For Any Other Elective Office During The Term For Which He Was Elected Unless The Date Of The Election For The Other Elective Office Is The Date Of The Election For The Office He Holds, Or He Resigns From The Elective Office That He Holds Prior To Qualifying As A Candidate For The Other Elective Office; To Amend Sections 23-15-299, 23-15-309 And 23-15-359, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1956.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for the purchase of new hybrid electric vehicles or electric vehicles.
1956.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers Who Purchase New Hybrid Electric Vehicles Or Electric Vehicles Without The Intent To Resell The Vehicle; To Limit The Amount Of The Tax Credit To The Lesser Of $1,500.00 Or 2% Of The Total Cost Of The Vehicle; To Provide That In No Event Shall The Amount Of The Credit Exceed The Amount Of Income Tax Imposed Upon The Taxpayer For The Taxable Year Reduced By The Sum Of All Other Credits Allowable To The Taxpayer Under The State Income Tax Laws; And For Related Purposes.

1958.title: Personal or medical leave; state law enforcement officers shall not be required to use after injury in the line of duty.
1958.description: An Act To Amend Sections 25-3-93 And 25-3-95, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That State Law Enforcement Officers Who Are Injured By Wound Or Accident In The Line Of Duty Shall Not Be Required To Use Earned Personal Or Major Medical Leave During The Period Of Recovery; And For Related Purposes.

1959.title: Community college districts; may waive out-of-state or out-of-district tuition for students living within 50 miles of campus.
1959.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-103-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of Any Community/junior College District To Waive Out-of-state Or Out-of-district Tuition For Any Student Living Within 50 Miles Of A Campus Or Branch Facility Of Such District; And For Related Purposes.

1960.title: Major medical leave; certain state law enforcement officers are not required to use for injuries in the line of duty.
1960.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-95, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Law Enforcement Officers Employed By State Agencies Who Are Injured By Wound Or Accident In The Line Of Duty Shall Not Be Required To Use Earned Major Medical Leave During The Period Of Recovery From Such Injury; And For Related Purposes.

1961.title: Insurance agents; exempt age 75 or older from continuing education requirements.
1961.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-17-251, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From The Requirements Of Continuing Education Insurance Agents Who Are 75 Years Of Age Or Older And Have Held An Agent's License For At Least Ten Years; And For Related Purposes.

1962.title: Sales tax exemption; Ducks Unlimited fund-raising purchases.
1962.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Taxation Purchases Of Tangible Personal Property Or Services By Ducks Unlimited Chapters, Which Tangible Personal Property Or Services Are Resold As Part Of The Chapters' Fund-raising Activities; And For Related Purposes.

1963.title: Hospital Infections Disclosure Act of 2011; enact.
1963.description: An Act Entitled The "hospital Infections Disclosure Act Of 2011"; To Provide Definitions; To Empower And Direct The State Department Of Health To Require Acute Care Hospitals And Ambulatory Surgical Facilities To Collect And Provide Statistical Quarterly Reports On Hospital-acquired Infection Rates For Specific Clinical Procedures; To Provide For The Appointment Of An Advisory Committee To Assist The Department In Developing A Methodology For Said Reports; To Provide For Confidentiality; To Provide Civil Penalties For Noncompliance With Said Reporting Requirements; To Amend Sections 41-9-15, 41-75-11 And 41-9-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1964.title: Children-at-risk; establish the Motivating Parents and Children (MPAC) pilot program for school districts.
1964.description: An Act To Establish A Motivating Parents And Children (mpac) Pilot Program Within The State Department Of Education For The Purpose Of Making Grants To School Districts That Provide Parental Involvement Services To Families Of Compulsory-school-age Children Residing In Such School District; To Set Forth The Purposes Of The Mpac Pilot Program; To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Develop And Implement The Mpac Pilot Program; To Prescribe The Basic Components Of Services To Be Offered By School Districts Under The Mpac Pilot Program; To Provide An Application And Selection Procedure For School Districts Participating In The Mpac Pilot Program; To Amend Section 37-11-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Parents To Attend Conferences And Other Functions Of School Districts Participating In The Mpac Pilot Program; To Amend Section 63-1-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Children Under 18 Residing In School Districts Participating In The Mpac Pilot Program Who Withdraw From School May Have Their Driver's License Suspended; To Amend Section 63-1-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Such Minors From License Reinstatement Fees; To Amend Section 63-1-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1965.title: School districts; pilot program requiring pupils to read a minimum of four books per school year.
1965.description: An Act To Establish A Pilot Program Authorizing Local School Boards In The State To Require All Pupils In Grades 1 Through 12 To Read A Minimum Of Four Books Per School Year And Make Reports Thereon; To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Develop And Issue Guidelines Under Which School Districts May Apply For Participation In This Pilot Program; And For Related Purposes.

1966.title: Manslaughter; increase maximum sentence.
1966.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Sentence For A Person Convicted Of Manslaughter; And For Related Purposes.

1967.title: Terrorism; add as an aggravating circumstance for capital offenses.
1967.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add As Aggravating Factor For Capital Cases Certain Acts Of Terrorism; And For Related Purposes.

1968.title: Ad valorem tax; increase the maximum number of mills that can be levied for parks and playgrounds.
1968.description: An Act To Amend Section 17-21-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Period Of Time That Notes Or Certificates Of Indebtedness Issued By Counties Or Municipalities Shall Mature To A Period Not To Exceed 10 Years From The Date Of The Issuance Of The Notes Or Certificates Of Indebtedness; And For Related Purposes.

1969.title: DUI; authorize constables to administer test.
1969.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Constables To Administer Dui Tests; And For Related Purposes.

1970.title: Radar; authorize sheriffs in counties with a certain population to use.
1970.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Sheriff In Counties Having A Certain Population To Use Radar Speed Detection Equipment Upon The Streets, Roads And Highways That Are Under The Jurisdiction Of The Board Of Supervisors And Located Outside The Corporate Limits Of A Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

1971.title: State emergency duty leave; certain state employees shall receive leave during state of emergency.
1971.description: An Act To Provide Emergency Duty Leave To State Employees Who Are Members Of Any Reserve Component Of The United States Armed Forces And Who Are Ordered To Active Duty During A State Declared Emergency; And For Related Purposes.

1972.title: Highways; add segments of certain roads within the corporate limits of the City of Jackson to the state highway system.
1972.description: An Act To Add Segments Of Certain Highways Within The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Jackson To The State Highway System; And For Related Purposes.

1973.title: Parole; provide for conditional release of an offender to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement in certain circumstances.
1973.description: An Act To Provide For The Conditional Release Of An Offender To The United States Immigration And Customs Enforcement Agency; And For Related Purposes.

1974.title: Legislature; reduce size of MS Senate beginning with 2015 statewide general election.
1974.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2015 Statewide General Election The Mississippi Senate Shall Consist Of 40 Members; And For Related Purposes.

1975.title: Driver's license; revise punishment for driving without.
1975.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Punishment For Driving Without A Suspended Driver's License To The Punishment For Driving With A Suspended Driver's License; And For Related Purposes.

1976.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize a tax-free tag for World War II Veterans.
1976.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-54, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Residents Of This State Who Are Veterans Of World War Ii; To Authorize The Surviving Spouse Of A Deceased Person Who Was Issued Such A License Tag To Apply For Or Retain Such License Tag For As Long As The Spouse Remains Unmarried; To Exempt Vehicles Owned By Veterans Of World War Ii From All Motor Vehicle Registration Fees And Privilege Taxes; To Amend Section 27-51-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Motor Vehicles Owned By Veterans Of World War Ii From Ad Valorem Taxation; And For Related Purposes.

1979.title: Ad valorem taxes; authorize cities to designate areas in which certain residences are exempt from city ad valorem taxes.
1979.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of Any Municipality To Designate Any Residential Area Within The Corporate Limits Of The Municipality As A Residential Enterprise Zone; To Provide That Residences That Qualify For Homestead Exemption That Are Located In A Residential Enterprise Zone Shall Be Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation, Except Ad Valorem Taxation For School District Purposes, For A Period Of Not More Than 5 Years From The Date The Area In Which It Is Located Was Designated A Residential Enterprise Zone; To Require Any Person Desiring To Obtain The Exemption Authorized In This Section To File A Written Application Therefor With The Governing Authorities Of The Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

1980.title: Ad valorem taxation; exempt a portion of the assessed value of egg houses, pullet houses and broiler houses.
1980.description: An Act To Exempt A Portion Of The Assessed Value Of Egg Houses, Pullet Houses And Broiler Houses From Ad Valorem Taxation For A Period Of Ten Years; And For Related Purposes.

1981.title: Professional association dues deduction by teachers; authorize.
1981.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Deduction Of Professional Association Dues By Local School District Personnel; And For Related Purposes.

1982.title: Constables; increase fee in criminal cases, revise reimbursement for travel expenses.
1982.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Uniform Total Fee Paid To Constables In All Criminal Cases And To Revise The Reimbursement Rate For Travel Expenses; And For Related Purposes.

1983.title: Eminent domain; restrict cities' authority to exercise.
1983.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-27-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Use Of The Power Of Eminent Domain By Municipalities For Certain Private, Nongovernmental Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1984.title: "Mississippi Student Religious Liberties Act of 2011"; enact.
1984.description: An Act To Enact The "mississippi Student Religious Liberties Act Of 2011"; To Provide For Voluntary Student Expression Of Religious Viewpoints In Public Schools; To Provide That Public School Districts Shall Provide A Limited Public Forum For Student Voluntary Expression Of A Religious Viewpoint; To Provide That Public School Districts Shall Provide A Limited Public Forum For Student Speakers At Nongraduation And Graduation Events; To Provide That Public School Districts Shall Allow Religious Expression In Class Assignments; To Provide That Public School Districts Shall Provide Students With The Freedom To Organize Religious Groups And Activities; And For Related Purposes.

1985.title: Animal cruelty; revise offense.
1985.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Crime Of Cruelty To Animals, To Incorporate Elements Of Offenses Found Elsewhere In Chapter 41, And To Distinguish Between Misdemeanor And Felony Degrees Of The Offense; To Amend Section 97-41-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Process By Which An Animal May Be Lawfully Destroyed, And To Grant Immunity To Those Acting Under The Section In Good Faith; To Enact Definitions; To Provide Exemptions From The Application Of The Chapter; To Repeal Section 97-41-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That Carrying Any Creature In A Cruel Or Inhuman Manner Is A Misdemeanor; To Repeal Section 97-41-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That Confining Any Living Creature Without Sufficient Food And Water Is A Misdemeanor; To Repeal Section 97-41-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That A Custodian Of Any Living Creature Who Fails To Provide Sufficient Food And Drink Is Guilty Of A Misdemeanor; To Repeal Section 97-41-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Penalties For Certain Acts Of Cruelty To Animals; And For Related Purposes.

1987.title: State lottery; create and provide for the distribution of revenue from.
1987.description: An Act To Create A State Lottery; To Provide That The State Lottery Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission Regarding The State Lottery; To Provide For The Disposition Of Proceeds Received From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; To Create A Special Fund Into Which A Portion Of The Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited And To Provide That Of The Proceeds Of The Lottery That Are Deposited Into The Special Fund The Legislature Shall Appropriate 25% To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Be Used For The Support Of Institutions Of Higher Learning, 25% To The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges To Be Used For The Support Of Public Community And Junior Colleges, 25% To The State Board Of Education For The Support Of The Mississippi Adequate Education Program, 10% To The Mississippi Department Of Public Safety, 10% To The Mississippi Department Of Revenue And 5% To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation; To Amend Sections 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; And For Related Purposes.

1988.title: Elective courses providing academic study of the Bible; authorize public school districts to offer.
1988.description: An Act To Authorize Public School Districts To Offer Students In Grade 9 Or Above Elective Courses Providing Academic Study Of The Bible; To Prescribe Certain Standards For Such Courses Of Study; To Provide For Bible Course Training To Assist Teachers Of Such Elective Bible Courses; To Amend Section 37-13-161, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

1989.title: Legislature; reduce size beginning with 2015 statewide general election.
1989.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-1-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2015 Statewide General Election The Mississippi House Of Representatives Shall Consist Of 90 Members; To Amend Section 5-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2015 Statewide General Election The Mississippi Senate Shall Consist Of 40 Members; And For Related Purposes.

1992.title: One minute of quiet reflection at the beginning of each school day; require local school boards to provide for.
1992.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Local School Boards To Provide For The Observance Of One Minute Of Quiet Reflection At The Beginning Of Each School Day; And For Related Purposes.

1994.title: Ad valorem school taxes; revise school board annual publication requirements.
1994.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-39-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Form And Content Of The Required Newspaper Publication For The School Board's Annual Ad Valorem Tax Assessment For The Support Of The School District; And For Related Purposes.

1995.title: Distinctive motor vehicle tags; Purple Heart Medal tags may be used upon motorcycles.
1995.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Distinctive Tag Issued To Recipients Of The Purple Heart Medal May Be Used Upon Motorcycles; And For Related Purposes.

1996.title: Notice of tax sale; increase fee allowed for sheriff upon serving.
1996.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-43-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fee Allowed For The Sheriff Upon Serving The Record Owner Of Property A Notice Of Tax Sale; And For Related Purposes.

1998.title: Income tax; provide a credit for certain energy-efficiency improvements to property.
1998.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Certain Costs And Expenses Incurred By A Taxpayer For Certain Energy Efficiency Improvements To Homes; To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Certain Expenses Incurred For The Installation Of A Wind Or Solar Energy System In The Home Of The Taxpayer Or At Business Or Commercial Property Owned By The Taxpayer; To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation The True Value Added To A Property As A Result Of The Installation Of A Wind Energy System Or A Solar Energy System That Is Eligible For The Tax Credit; And For Related Purposes.

1999.title: Civil actions; insurer has burden of proof for exclusions/exceptions in homeowners insurance policies.
1999.description: An Act To Provide That, In Any Action For Damages By The Policyholder Against An Insurer Under A Homeowner's Policy, The Insurer Has The Burden Of Proof As To The Application Of Any Exclusion In The Policy And Any Exception To Or Other Avoidance Of Coverage By The Insurer; And For Related Purposes.

2000.title: Homemade beer; authorize making of homemade beer for domestic or household uses.
2000.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-3-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Every Person Who Is 21 Years Of Age Or Older Shall Have The Right To Make Homemade Beer For Domestic Or Household Uses; To Provide That Homemade Beer Made For Domestic Or Household Use Is Not Subject To Taxation; To Limit The Amount Of Homemade Beer That May Be Produced In Any One Calendar Year; To Authorize The Removal Of Homemade Beer From The Location Where It Is Made For Family Or Domestic Uses And To Authorize Homemade Beer To Be Taken To Organized Events, Exhibitions Or Competitions; To Make It Clear That Homemade Wine Or Beer May Not Be Offered For Sale; And For Related Purposes.

2001.title: Gubernatorial pardon; require public hearing.
2001.description: An Act To Provide That The District Attorney And Sheriff Of A County In Which A Felony Crime Is Committed Shall Be Contacted By The Governor, Or His Designee, When The Governor Exercises His Power To Grant A Pardon For A Person Convicted Of Such Felony Crime; To Require A Public Hearing And Advertisement Thereof At The Expense Of The Applicant; And For Related Purposes.

2002.title: Personal Service Contract Review Board; approve state agency advertising procurements.
2002.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Personal Services Contract Review Board To Establish Standards And Preapprove All State Agency Advertising Procurements; And For Related Purposes.

2003.title: Ethics in lobbying reform; omnibus bill.
2003.description: An Act To Amend Sections 5-8-3 And 5-8-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definitions Of "lobbying" And "lobbyist" And Related Concepts And Exceptions Thereto; To Create Section 5-8-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Terms And To Limit State Agencies' Ability To Expend General Funds To Pay Contract Lobbyists; To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Create A Task Force To Study, Develop And Make Recommendations Relating To Legislation Necessary To Assist In The Development And Implementation Of Practices That Will Improve The Document Retention Policies Of The State Of Mississippi And Any Office, Department, Agency, Division, Bureau, Commission, Board, Institution, Hospital, College, University, Airport Authority Or Other Instrumentality Thereof; To Provide For The Composition Of Such Task Force; To Provide That The Task Force Shall Make And Submit A Report To The Legislature And Governor No Later Than December 1, 2011; And For Related Purposes.

2004.title: School employment procedures law; reduce probationary period for certified employees.
2004.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Probationary Period For Certified School District Employees Under The School Employment Procedures Law To One Year And To Eliminate The Probationary Period For Certified Employees Transferring From Another School District; And For Related Purposes.

2005.title: Students with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD); State Dept. of Education to implement program in the public schools.
2005.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The Mississippi Department Of Education To Develop Standards And Implement Autism Spectrum Disorder (asd) Classrooms In The School Districts Statewide To More Fully Meet The Needs Of Students With Autism In The Public School Setting; And For Related Purposes.

2006.title: Cooperatives; provide for the incorporation of.
2006.description: An Act To Provide For The Incorporation Of Cooperative Associations; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of Cooperatives; To Provide The Requisites For The Articles Of Association Of Cooperatives; To Provide For The Adoptions Of Bylaws By Cooperatives; To Specify The Membership Of Cooperatives And The Requisites For Voting By Members; To Provide For The Organization Of Meetings And The Notification Of Members Of Meetings; To Provide For The Authorization Of, Control And Use Of Stock By Cooperatives; To Provide For The Number, Election And Removal Of Directors; To Provide For The Meetings Of Directors; To Authorize Executive Committees; To Provide For The Officers Of Cooperatives; To Provide For The Compensation And Benefits To Directors, Officers And Employees Of A Cooperative; To Provide For The Liability Of Directors, Members, Stockholders And Patrons Of Cooperatives; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Dispose Of Assets; To Provide Rules That Govern Contracts By Cooperatives; To Authorize Contracts To Be Filed With The Chancery Clerk And Provide The Effect Of Such Filing; To Provide That The Directors Shall Determine And Distribute Net Assets At Least Once Annually; To Provide For Annual Reports; To Provide The Manner In Which Articles Of Association May Be Amended; To Provide The Manner In Which Cooperatives May Merge And Consolidate; To Provide The Manner In Which A Corporation May Convert Itself Into A Cooperative; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Voluntarily Dissolve Itself; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Be Involuntarily Dissolved; To Provide For The Liquidation Of The Assets And Business Of A Cooperative Under Court Supervision; To Provide For Derivative Actions By Members And Stockholders; To Limit The Use Of The Term "cooperative" To Associations Organized Under This Act And To Provide Penalties For Improper Use Of Such Term; And For Related Purposes.

2007.title: Bonds; increase for loans to develop the Farish Street Historic District.
2007.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 465, Laws Of 1999, As Amended By Chapter 533, Laws Of 2010, To Increase From $6,500,000.00 To $12,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued To Provide Funds To The Mississippi Development Authority For The Purpose Of Making Loans Or Grants Available To The Appropriate Planning And Development District To Develop Certain Property In The Farish Street Historic District; And For Related Purposes.

2008.title: "I am Mississippi"; designate as official state poem.
2008.description: An Act To Create A New Code Section To Be Codified As Section 3-3-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate "i Am Mississippi" As The Official State Poem; And For Related Purposes.

2009.title: Nitrous oxide; technical correction to prohibition of use on public streets and highways.
2009.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Use Of Nitrous Oxide In Any Motor Vehicle Or Motorcycle Driven On The Streets Or Highways And To Prescribe Penalties For The Use Of Nitrous Oxide In Motor Vehicles Or Motorcycles Driven On The Streets Or Highways; And For Related Purposes.

2011.title: Health care facilities; repeal CON law.
2011.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 41-7-171 Through 41-7-209, Mississippi Code Of 1972, And Sections 8 And 9, Chapter 482, Laws Of 1982, As Amended, Which Are The Mississippi Health Care Facility Certificate Of Need Law Of 1979; And For Related Purposes.

2012.title: State Board of Chiropractic Examiners; extend repealer on.
2012.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 73-6-1 Through 73-6-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create And Empower The State Board Of Chiropractic Examiners; To Amend Section 73-6-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Definition Of The Practice Of Chiropractic And Authorized Chiropractic Adjustment Or Manipulation; To Amend Section 73-6-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Appointment Of Members Of The State Board Of Chiropractic Examiners; To Amend Section 73-6-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Meetings Of The Board And To Clarify The Authorized Services That May Be Provided By Chiropractic Assistants And To Prescribe Training Courses For Such Assistants; To Amend Section 73-6-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Authority For Applicants For Licensure By Persons Who Are Not Citizens Of The United States And To Delete The Authority For Reciprocity Licensure Of Such Individuals And To Clarify The Qualifications For Reciprocity Licensure; To Codify Section 73-6-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Board Of Chiropractic Examiners To Establish A Preceptorship And Extern Program, To Authorize The Board To Establish A Temporary License Program For Nonresident Chiropractors Traveling With Entities From Other States And To Authorize The Board To Issue Emergency Licenses For A Limited Time Period; To Amend Section 73-6-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Continuing Education Requirements For Chiropractors; To Amend Section 73-6-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Grounds For Disciplinary Action Against Licensees; To Amend Section 73-6-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete Certain Restrictions On Telephone Directory Listing Of Licensees; To Amend Section 73-6-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On Those Statutes Which Create And Empower The State Board Of Chiropractic Examiners; To Amend Section 73-6-34, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Qualifications For Chiropractors Performing Insurance Claims Reviews; And For Related Purposes.

2013.title: Fuel taxes; allocate a portion to the City of Jackson to defray costs incurred as a result of being the seat of state government.
2013.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That From The Proceeds Of Gasoline, Diesel Fuel Or Kerosene Taxes, An Amount Equal To 2% Of The Revenue From Gasoline And Diesel Fuel Taxes On Gasoline, Diesel Fuel And Kerosene Sold Within The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, Shall Be Allocated For Distribution To The City Of Jackson And Paid To The City; To Amend Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2014.title: MS Training and Education Marketing Board and Special Task Force for Economic Development Planning; create.
2014.description: An Act To Establish The Mississippi Training And Education Marketing Board And Provide For Its Membership; To Empower This Board To Conduct Programs To Advertise And Increase Participation In Workforce Training And Education Programs; To Authorize The Board To Adopt Regulations And Employ Personnel; To Amend Section 57-63-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make The Vice President For Agriculture, Forestry And Veterinary Medicine At Mississippi State University And The Chairman Of The Department Of Agriculture At Alcorn State University Members Of The Special Task Force For Economic Development Planning; To Require The Heads Of The State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Assist The Special Task Force For Economic Development Planning In An Advisory Capacity And To Meet With The Task Force At Least Once Annually; And For Related Purposes.

2015.title: CON for nursing facility in any underserved minority zip code area in the state; authorize.
2015.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Issuance Of A Health Care Certificate Of Need For The Construction Of A 60-bed Nursing Facility In Any Underserved Minority Zip Code Area In The State; And For Related Purposes.

2016.title: MS Affordable Housing Trust Fund; create to assist in the development, rehabilitation and preservation of affordable housing.
2016.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund; To Provide That Money In The Trust Fund Shall Be Made Available For Assisting The Development, Rehabilitation And Preservation Of Affordable Housing; To Provide That The Trust Fund Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Create The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund Oversight Board To Approve Rules And Regulations Proposed By The Mississippi Development Authority, To Oversee The Management Of Monies In The Trust Fund And To Approve Awards Of Trust Fund Monies To Applicants; To Provide For The Membership Of The Oversight Board; To Amend Section 75-76-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of All Taxes, Fees, Interest, Penalties, Damages, Fines Or Other Monies Collected By The Department Of Revenue Under The Gaming Control Act Shall Be Deposited To The Credit Of The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2017.title: Federal Workforce Investment Act; Hinds County is separate workforce investment area.
2017.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-153-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Hinds County Shall Be A Separate Workforce Investment Area Under The Federal Workforce Investment Act; And For Related Purposes.

2018.title: Sex education pilot program; SBE and SBH shall establish.
2018.description: An Act To Require The State Board Of Education, Acting Jointly With The State Board Of Health, To Establish A Sex Education Pilot Program; To Require The State Department Of Education And The State Department Of Health To Determine The Grade Or Grades In Which The Pilot Program Will Be Implemented; To Require The State Department Of Education To Select School Districts For Participation In The Program; To Require The State Department Of Education, With The Input Of The State Department Of Health, To Submit A Report On The Pilot Program To The Chairmen Of Certain Legislative Committees Before January 1, 2014; To Amend Section 41-79-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish The School Nurse Intervention Program Within The State Department Of Health And Provide For The Creation Of A Prevention Of Teen Pregnancy Pilot Program And An Abstinence Education Pilot Program; To Bring Forward Section 37-14-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Designates The State Department Of Education As The State Agency Responsible For The Administration Of The Public School Nurse Program And Prescribes The Responsibilities Of The Nurses; And For Related Purposes.

2019.title: Gaming; authorize aboard cruise vessels on the Pearl River within a city with a population of 150,000 or more.
2019.description: An Act To Amend Sections 67-1-71, 87-1-5, 97-33-1, 97-33-7, 97-33-17, 97-33-25 And 97-33-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Gaming To Be Conducted On Vessels As Defined In Section 27-109-1 Whenever Such Vessel Is On The Pearl River Within The Corporate Limits Of A Municipality With A Population Of 150,000 Or More According To The Most Recent Federal Decennial Census; And For Related Purposes.

2020.title: Robert E. Lee Building; authorize DFA to sell or lease.
2020.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Upon Consultation With The Chairmen Of The Public Property Committees Of The Senate And House Of Representatives, To Sell And Convey Or Lease The Property Located At 239 North Lamar Street In The City Of Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi, Known As The "robert E. Lee Building"; And For Related Purposes.

2021.title: Department of Finance and Administration; shall place a moratorium on the acquisition of real property within the City of Jackson.
2021.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Place A Moratorium On The Acquisition Of Any Real Property Within The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, And To Prohibit The Relocation Of Any State Agency Located Within The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To Any Locality Outside The City Of Jackson, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2022.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for taxpayers who are first-time homebuyers of a principal residence in this state.
2022.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers Who Are First-time Homebuyers Of A Principal Residence In This State; To Provide The Amount Of The Credit; To Provide That First-time Homebuyers Must Apply For Such Credit With The Department Of Revenue; To Provide That The Department Shall Award Such Credits On A First-come, First-served Basis; To Limit The Aggregate Amount Of Such Credits That May Be Awarded In Any Calendar Year; And For Related Purposes.

2023.title: General Fund estimate; limit to 7-year average and deposit any excess into Working Cash-Stabilization Fund.
2023.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-103-211 And 27-103-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The General Fund Revenue Estimate Shall Not Exceed The Average Annual General Fund Revenue Received Over The Immediately Preceding Seven Years And To Provide That Any Amount Received In Excess Of The General Fund Revenue Estimate Shall Be Deposited Into The Working Cash-stabilization Reserve Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2025.title: Taxation; authorize an income tax credit for installation of energy-efficient products in homes.
2025.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Certain Taxpayers For The Cost And Expenses Incurred For Purchasing And Installing Insulation, Energy-efficient Replacement Windows And High-efficiency Heating And Cooling Equipment On Property Upon Which Homestead Exemption Is Granted; To Limit The Amount Of The Credit; And For Related Purposes.

2026.title: Public buildings; require art by Mississippi artists in certain state buildings.
2026.description: An Act To Create The Allocation For Art For Public Facilities Act; To Declare Legislative Intent And Purpose; To Require State Agencies To Expend, Out Of Monies Allocated For Original Construction, Remodeling Or Renovation Of Any State Facility, A Certain Percentage For The Purpose Of Including Works Of Art By Mississippi Artists In Such Facility; To Establish In The State Treasury The "art For Public Facilities Fund"; To Authorize The Mississippi Arts Commission To Administer This Act; To Provide That The State Of Mississippi Shall Receive The Right To Sole Ownership And Public Display Of All Art Acquired Under The Act, Subject To Certain Rights Retained By The Artist; And For Related Purposes.

2027.title: Municipal governing bodies; require those elected to serve to receive basic and continuing education.
2027.description: An Act To Create New Code Section 21-15-2.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require All Elected Municipal Officials, Whether Legislative Or Executive, To Complete A Certified City Management Course And To Complete Annual Continuing Education Hours; And For Related Purposes.

2028.title: Mississippi Youth Build Program for court-ordered delinquent juveniles; DHS to establish.
2028.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-605, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The Department Of Human Services Division Of Youth Services To Establish And Operate The Mississippi Youth Build Program In Jackson, Mississippi, For Court-ordered Delinquent Youth To Provide Certain Rehabilitation Services; And For Related Purposes.

2029.title: Health insurance policies; require coverage for autism spectrum disorders.
2029.description: An Act To Require All Health Insurance Policies To Provide Coverage For The Diagnosis And Treatment Of Autism Spectrum Disorders In Individuals Less Than 21 Years Of Age; To Provide That Coverage Shall Be Subject To A Certain Maximum Benefit Per Year; To Require The Department Of Mental Health To Establish Standards To Be Utilized By Managed Care Plans For The Credentialing Of Autism Service Providers; And For Related Purposes.

2030.title: Adequate education program appropriation and local school district budgets to identify program funding categories; require.
2030.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Mississippi Adequate Education Program Appropriation Bill To Identify Program Funding Categories; To Amend Section 37-61-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Local School District Budgets To Contain A Detailed Statement Of The Estimated Amounts To Be Expended By Program Budget Categories And The Amount Of Such Categories To Be Paid From Adequate Education Program Funds And From Local Revenue And Other Sources; To Amend Section 37-61-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require School District Expenditures To Be Limited To The Specific Budget Categories And To Provide Personal Liability Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

2031.title: Mississippi patient safety program for hospitals; establish.
2031.description: An Act To Enact The "mississippi Patient Safety Act"; To Require The Development Of A Patient Safety Program For Hospitals, Ambulatory Surgical Centers And Mental Hospitals; To Require Hospitals, Ambulatory Surgical Centers And Mental Hospitals To Annually Report To The State Health Officer A Listing Of Certain Errors Or Occurrences; To Provide Whistle-blower Protection To Certain Employees; To Require Hospitals To Maintain A Program Capable Of Identifying And Tracking Hospital-acquired Infections; To Prescribe Penalties For Violations Of The Act; To Amend Sections 41-9-15, 41-75-11 And 41-9-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2032.title: Uniform laws; create Uniform Real Property Electronic Recording Act.
2032.description: An Act To Create The Uniform Real Property Electronic Recording Act; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide For The Validity Of Electronic Documents; To Provide For The Recording Of Electronic Documents; To Provide For Administration And Standards; To Provide For Uniformity; To Clarify The Relation Of This Act To The Electronic Signatures In Global And National Commerce Act; To Amend Sections 89-3-1, 89-5-1 And 89-5-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2033.title: Uniform Emergency Volunteer Healthcare Practitioners Act; enact.
2033.description: An Act Entitled The Uniform Emergency Volunteer Healthcare Practitioners Act; To Provide Definitions; To Provide Conditions Applicable To Providing Health Care Or Veterinary Services While An Emergency Declaration Is In Effect; To Provide A Volunteer Health Care Practitioner Registration System Under The State Department Of Health; To Provide For Interstate Licensure Recognition For Volunteer Health Care Practitioners; To Provide Administrative Sanctions For Failure To Adhere To Scope Of Practice Requirements; To Authorize The State Board Of Health To Promulgate Rules To Implement The Provisions Of This Act; To Provide Liability Limitations; To Amend Sections 73-9-1, 73-10-7, 73-15-3, 73-19-3, 73-21-83, 73-22-3, 73-23-35, 73-25-1, 73-25-35, 73-26-3, 73-30-25, 73-31-27, 73-39-59, 41-9-7, 41-59-9, 41-59-33, 41-75-5 And 43-11-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Health Care Practitioner Licensure Statutes With The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2036.title: Cemeteries; authorize reasonable ingress and egress under certain circumstances when located on private property.
2036.description: An Act To Grant Certain Persons The Authority Of Reasonable Ingress And Egress To Cemeteries Located On Private Property Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2037.title: Retirement; earned compensation of member of the Supreme Court and Court of Appeals includes all remuneration except mileage.
2037.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For Purposes Of The Public Employees' Retirement System, The Term "earned Compensation" For Justices Of The Supreme Court And Judges Of The Court Of Appeals Shall Include All Remuneration Amounts Paid, Except Mileage; To Amend Section 25-3-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Authorize Justices Of The Supreme Court And Judges Of The Court Of Appeals To Claim As Earned Compensation The Expense Allowances Paid To Them From And After December 31, 2003, That Were Not Reported As A Part Of Their Earned Compensation To The Public Employees' Retirement System Under Certain Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

2038.title: Certificate of need; authorize transfer of 20 nursing beds from Adams County to CCRC in Lincoln County.
2038.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Transfer A Certificate Of Need For 20 Nursing Beds In Adams County To A New Continuing Care Retirement Community In Lincoln County; And For Related Purposes.

2039.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; reauthorize issuance of for supporters of the Boys and Girls Clubs.
2039.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.133, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag To Supporters Of The Boys And Girls Clubs Rather Than Supporters Of The Mississippi Alliance For Boys And Girls Clubs And To Reauthorize The Issuance Of The Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag Authorized By This Section; And For Related Purposes.

2040.title: Justice Court; increase clerks' fee on general traffic violations.
2040.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Additional Fee To Be Collected Upon Traffic Violation Convictions By The Justice Court Clerks; And For Related Purposes.

2042.title: Mississippi Department of Insurance Transparency Act; create.
2042.description: An Act To Create The Department Of Insurance Transparency Act; To Require Insurance Companies Transacting Business In This State To Submit Homeowners And Commercial Property Policy And Premium Information To The Department; To Require The Department To Provide On Its Web Site Aggregate Data Of The Number Of Homeowners And Commercial Property Insurance Policies, The Total Dollar Amount Of Premiums Collected, And Claims Incurred Or Paid; To Require The Department To Post On Its Web Site A Comprehensive Description Of The Actuarial Model Used By The Department For Homeowners And Commercial Property Risk; To Provide Penalties For Noncompliance; And For Related Purposes.

2043.title: Retirement; authorize members of the optional retirement plan to participate in IHL retirement incentive program.
2043.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-101-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Employees Of Institutions Of Higher Learning Who Are Participants In The Optional Retirement Plan To Participate In Retirement Incentive Programs Offered By Institutions Of Higher Learning; And For Related Purposes.

2044.title: Appropriations; Department of Public Safety Highway Patrol trooper training class.
2044.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of State General Funds To The Department Of Public Safety, Division Of Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol, For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of A Sixty-member Highway Patrol Trooper Training Class, For Fiscal Year 2012.

2045.title: Legislative compensation for extraordinary session duties; no extra payment if Legislature is convened in regular session.
2045.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-1-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Legislators Shall Not Be Entitled To Additional Compensation For Any Extraordinary Session Which Is Held While The Legislature Is Convened In Regular Session; And For Related Purposes.

2046.title: Synthetic cannabinoids; technical correction.
2046.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-29-113 And 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Punishment For The Illegal Possession, Manufacture And Sale Of Synthetic Cannabinoids To Conform To The Punishment For The Illegal Possession, Manufacture And Sale Of Marihuana; And For Related Purposes.

2047.title: City manager; authorize certain outside employment.
2047.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-9-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A City Manager To Accept Part-time Employment Outside The City Limits That Does Not Create A Conflict Of Duty; And For Related Purposes.

2048.title: Texting while driving; prohibit.
2048.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Any Driver From Sending Or Receiving Written Messages While Driving; To Provide Exemptions And Penalties For Violations Of The Prohibition; And For Related Purposes.

2049.title: Sales taxation; exempt sales to dentist of dental prosthetic appliances made by dental laboratories.
2049.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales To Dentists Of Dental Prosthetic Appliances Made By Dental Laboratories; And For Related Purposes.

2050.title: Distinctive license tags; reauthorize for supporters of Rotary International.
2050.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.108, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Rotary International; And For Related Purposes.

2051.title: TiPAC; create the Transparency in Private Attorney Contracts Act.
2051.description: An Act To Create The Transparency In Private Attorney Contracts Act; To Enact Definitions; To Enact Conditions Required Of The Attorney General Before Entering Into A Contingency Fee Contract For Legal Services; To Require Public Notice Of Contracts Entered Into And Contingency Fees Paid; To Place Incremental Restrictions Upon The Amount Of Contingency Fees That Can Be Paid Out Of A Specific Recovery Amount; To Amend Sections 7-5-1, 7-5-5 And 7-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2052.title: State Truth Commission; establish.
2052.description: An Act To Create The State Truth Commission; To Prescribe Powers And Duties Of The Commission; To Provide For The Establishment Of Procedures To Investigate Grievances Registered With The Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2053.title: Drug overdoses; health care providers to give notice of certain.
2053.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Health Care Providers To Notify The Bureau Of Narcotics Within 24 Hours Of Any Drug Overdose In A Patient Over The Age Of 12; And For Related Purposes.

2054.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for dyslexia awareness.
2054.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Dyslexia Awareness Motor Vehicle License Tag; To Prescribe The Fee For Such Tag And To Provide For The Distribution Of Such Fee; And For Related Purposes.

2055.title: Ad valorem taxes; remove the provision that prescribes the manner in which affordable rental housing must be appraised.
2055.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-35-50, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provision That Prescribes The Manner In Which The Appraisal Of Affordable Rental Housing Shall Be Made For The Purpose Of Arriving At The True Value Of The Property; And For Related Purposes.

2056.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag for school districts; exempt from time limit to purchase required number.
2056.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-44, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make It Clear That Distinctive License Tags Issued For School Districts Under Section 27-19-56.154 Are Exempt From The Time Limit For Submitting Proof That At Least 300 Of Such License Tags Or Plates Will Be Purchased And Deposit With The Department An Amount Necessary To Purchase 300 Of Such License Tags Or Plates; To Amend Section 27-19-56.154, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2057.title: Income taxes; exclude transportation fringe benefits from gross income as allowed under the Internal Revenue Code.
2057.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude From Gross Income For State Income Tax Purposes Qualified Transportation Fringe Benefits Provided By An Employer Of The Taxpayer To The Taxpayer In The Amount Allowed To Be Excluded From The Taxpayer's Federal Gross Income Under Section 132 Of The Internal Revenue Code; And For Related Purposes.

2059.title: Public school construction projects; require major projects to meet USGBC's LEED silver standard.
2059.description: An Act To Require All Major Facility Projects Of Public School Districts Receiving Any Funding In A State Or Local Capital Budget To Be Designed, Constructed And Certified To At Least The United States Green Building Council's Leed Silver Standard; To Provide That A Public School District May Determine That The Leed Silver Standard Is Not Practicable For A Project; To Provide That, If Leed Standards Are Not Followed For The Project, The Public School District Shall Report These Reasons To The Department Of Education; To Authorize The Department Of Education To Adopt Rules And Regulations To Implement This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2060.title: State parks; allow the use of electric golf carts within a state park.
2060.description: An Act To Amend Section 55-3-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Use Of Electric Golf Carts Within State Parks; And For Related Purposes.

2061.title: Mississippi S.A.F.E. Mortgage Act; exempt any natural person making a mortgage loan with his own funds.
2061.description: An Act To Amend Section 81-18-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Under The Mississippi S.a.f.e. Mortgage Act Any Natural Person Making A Mortgage Loan With His Own Funds For His Own Investment; And For Related Purposes.

2064.title: Ballots; clarify placement of special election candidate; require special election for certain period of time after vacancy.
2064.description: An Act To Amend Sections 23-15-367, 23-15-511 And 23-15-833, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Provisions Regarding The Placement Of Titles Of Offices On The Ballot Shall Apply In Special Elections To Fill Vacancies In Office That Occur On The Same Day As The General Election; To Provide That In Such Cases The General Election Candidates And Special Election Candidates Shall Be Clearly Distinguished From Special Election Candidates Under The Title Of The Office For Which They Are Candidates; To Amend Section 23-15-853, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Vacancies In The Office Of United States Senator Shall Be Filled In The Same Manner As Vacancies In The Office Of Representative In Congress; To Repeal Section 23-15-855, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides The Manner In Which Vacancies In The Office Of United States Senator Are Filled; And For Related Purposes.

2065.title: Motor vehicle safety inspection law; repeal.
2065.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 63-13-1 Through 63-13-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Constitute The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Law; And For Related Purposes.

2066.title: Bonds; issue general obligation bonds to improve Duncan Park Golf Course in Natchez.
2066.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi In The Amount Of $3,500,000.00 For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For Repair, Renovation And Improvements To The Duncan Park Golf Course In The City Of Natchez; And For Related Purposes.

2067.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize issuance of tag with the word "DON'T TREAD ON ME" imprinted thereon.
2067.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag With The Word "don't Tread On Me" Imprinted Thereon; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For Such Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

2068.title: Mississippi Auto Liability Insurance No Pay, No Play Act; create.
2068.description: An Act To Create The "mississippi Auto Liability Insurance No Pay, No Play Act"; To Provide That There Shall Be No Recovery For The First $10,000.00 Of Bodily Injury And No Recovery For The First $10,000.00 Of Property Damage Based On Any Cause Or Right Of Action Arising Out Of A Motor Vehicle Accident If The Owner Or Operator Of The Motor Vehicle Fails To Have Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance; To Provide For A Decreased Rate For Certain Uninsured/underinsured Motorist Coverage; And For Related Purposes.

2069.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for supporters of Jackson Academy.
2069.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of Jackson Academy; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For Such Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

2070.title: Sales taxation; exempt sales of tangible personal property at certain events conducted by churches.
2070.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Tangible Personal Property At An Event Conducted By A Church For The Sole Purpose Of Raising Funds For The Church Or An Organization Sponsored By The Church; And For Related Purposes.

2071.title: Qualifications for local school board; require at least 2 years of postsecondary education.
2071.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-5-1 And 37-7-201 Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Members Of Local School Boards To Have At Least Two Years Of Postsecondary Education As A Qualification For Office; And For Related Purposes.

2072.title: Accreditation of nonpublic schools; direct MS. Commission on School Accreditation to recognize Assn. of Christian Schools (ACSI).
2072.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Mississippi School On School Accreditation To Recognize The Association Of Christian Schools International (acsi) As A Regional Accrediting Agency; And For Related Purposes.

2073.title: Prekindergarten programs; require under-performing school districts in the Delta to implement.
2073.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish A Pilot Program For A Mandatory Prekindergarten Program In Under-performing School Districts Located In The Mississippi Delta; And For Related Purposes.

2074.title: Controlled substances; restrict prescription of and provide criminal liability for practitioners for overdose deaths.
2074.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-137, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Prescription Of Addictive Drugs To Known Drug Addicts; To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Practitioner Who Prescribes A Fatal Overdose To A Drug Addict Will Be Guilty Of Manslaughter; And For Related Purposes.

2075.title: Transportation; require safety lights on a load of timber products projecting a certain distance beyond the end of the trailer.
2075.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That A Motor Vehicle Transporting Timber Products At Night Must Be Equipped With A Light On The End Of The Load If The Timber Products Extend More That A Certain Distance Beyond The Rear Of The Trailer; And For Related Purposes.

2076.title: Open Meetings Act; revise fine and impose personal liability therefor on public officials.
2076.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-41-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Fine For Violations Of The Open Meetings Act And To Make The Violating Public Official Personally Liable For That Fine; And For Related Purposes.

2077.title: Statement of economic interest; revise penalty and procedure upon failure to file.
2077.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-4-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fine Assessed For A Public Official's Failure To File A Required Statement Of Economic Interest; And For Related Purposes.

2078.title: Bureau of Narcotics; authorize issuance of administrative subpoenas.
2078.description: An Act To Authorize Issuance Of Administrative Subpoenas By The Director Of The Bureau Of Narcotics Or His Designee; And For Related Purposes.

2079.title: All-terrain vehicles; require competency training and helmets under a certain age.
2079.description: An Act To Provide That Operators Of All-terrain Vehicles On Public Property Must Possess A Driver's License Or Have Taken Training And Be Certified; To Require The Cooperative Extension Service To Devise An Atv Safety Course; To Allow Any Organization Approved By The Department Of Public Safety To Devise An Atv Safety Course; To Provide A Penalty For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2080.title: All-terrain vehicles; prohibit the use on public highways, roads and streets.
2080.description: An Act To Prohibit The Operation Of All-terrain Vehicles On Public Highways, Roads And Streets; And For Related Purposes.

2081.title: Concealed weapons; exempt county and municipal prosecutors from carrying permit.
2081.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt County And Municipal Prosecutors From The Carry Permit Law On The Same Basis As Other Prosecutors; And For Related Purposes.

2082.title: Public waterways; landowner not liable for illegal use of ATVs in public waters.
2082.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-1-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Persons Using All-terrain Vehicles In Public Waterways Without Permission Of Landowner Are Not Entitled To Recover Damages Against Such Landowner For Injuries; And For Related Purposes.

2083.title: City of Jackson; require payments in lieu of taxes on state-owned property located in the city.
2083.description: An Act To Require The State Of Mississippi To Provide Funds To The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, As Payment In Lieu Of Ad Valorem Taxes For The Purpose Of Assisting The City To Defray The Ad Valorem Tax Loss The City Sustains As A Result Of State Ownership Of Property In The City And To Defray Certain Costs The City Incurs As A Result Of Being The Seat Of Government; To Provide That The Amount Of The Annual Payment Shall Be Equal To 50% Of The Ad Valorem Tax Revenue That Would Be Due Each Calendar Year On All State-owned Property Within The City Limits Of Jackson If The Property Were Not Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation; To Provide The Purposes For Which The Funds May Be Used; And For Related Purposes.

2084.title: Net-energy metering; require electric utilities to allow.
2084.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Renewable Energy Development Act; To Declare Legislative Findings; To Require Electric Utilities To Allow Net-metering Facilities To Be Interconnected; To Require The Public Service Commission To Establish Appropriate Rates, Terms And Conditions For Net-metering Contracts; To Provide That The Public Service Commission May Authorize A Greater Fee Or Charge On The Net-metering Customer, If The Utility's Direct Costs Outweigh The Distribution System, Environmental And Public Policy Benefits Of Allocating The Costs Among The Utility's Entire Customer Base; And For Related Purposes.

2085.title: Mississippi Consumer Insurance Policyholder Bill of Rights; create.
2085.description: An Act To Set Forth The Mississippi Consumer Insurance Policyholder Bill Of Rights; To Provide That, In Any Action For Damages By The Policyholder Against An Insurer Under A Homeowner's Policy, The Insurer Has The Burden Of Proof As To The Application Of Any Exclusion In The Policy And Any Exception To Or Other Avoidance Of Coverage By The Insurer; To Amend Section 83-5-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Policies Containing Concurrent Causation Exclusions Are Defined As Unfair Methods Of Competition And Unfair And Deceptive Acts Or Practices In The Business Of Insurance; To Amend Section 83-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Commissioner Of Insurance From Receiving Gifts Or Campaign Contributions From Any Insurance Company Doing Business And Regulated Within The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2086.title: Commissioner of Insurance; require insurers to give reasons for declination, cancellation or nonrenewal if requested.
2086.description: An Act To Provide That The Commissioner Of Insurance, Upon Request By An Applicant For Insurance Or A Policyholder, Shall Require An Insurer To Provide A Written Statement Of Reasons For The Declination, Cancellation Or Nonrenewal Of An Insurance Policy; And For Related Purposes.

2087.title: Income tax; authorize a deduction for certain college savings plans maintained by other states.
2087.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Contributions To Qualified Tuition Programs, As Defined In Section 529 Of The Internal Revenue Code That Are Established And Maintained By Another State Or An Agency Or Instrumentality Thereof For The Purpose Of Meeting The Qualified Higher Education Expenses Of Designated Beneficiaries, Are Deductable From Taxable Income; To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2088.title: Homeowners insurance; adopt efficient proximate cause doctrine to require coverage for certain losses.
2088.description: An Act To Provide That, Whenever A Loss Under A Homeowners Insurance Policy Is Caused By A Combination Of A Covered Risk And An Excluded Risk, An Insurer Shall Be Liable If The Covered Risk Was The Efficient Proximate Cause Of The Loss; And For Related Purposes.

2089.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds for improvements to the Natchez Institute school building.
2089.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For Improvements To, And Repair And Renovation Of, The Natchez Institute School Building; And For Related Purposes.

2090.title: Ad valorem taxation; revise the definition of "home" or "homestead" under the homestead exemption law.
2090.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "home" Or "homestead" For Purposes Of The Homestead Exemption Law; And For Related Purposes.

2091.title: Commissioners of election; may run for other offices if they resign before they qualify.
2091.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-217, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Commissioner Of Election Of A County May Seek Another Office During His Four-year Term As Election Commissioner If He Resigns From The Office Of Election Commissioner Prior To Qualifying For The Office He Desires To Seek; And For Related Purposes.

2093.title: Ad valorem tax; increase mills that municipalities may levy for recreational purposes.
2093.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-37-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase To Four Mills The Amount That The Governing Authorities Of A Municipality May Levy Annually For The Purpose Of Constructing, Supporting And Maintaining Parks And Playgrounds, And For Recreational Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2094.title: All-terrain vehicles; require certificate of number.
2094.description: An Act To Require All-terrain Vehicles To Obtain A Certificate Of Number; To Authorize The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Issue Such Certificates; To Provide That Such Certificate Of Number Shall Be Placed On All-terrain Vehicles; To Provide A Penalty For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2095.title: Failure to stop or yield right-of-way; prescribe penalties whenever injury or death results.
2095.description: An Act To Create A New Section To Be Codified As Section 63-3-1006, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Criminal Penalties For Any Vehicle Operator Who Fails To Stop Or Yield The Right-of-way For Another Vehicle Or Pedestrian, When And As Required By Law, Whenever Such Failure Results In The Bodily Injury Or Death Of Another; To Amend Sections 63-1-51 And 63-1-216, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity With The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2096.title: Deputy sheriff for narcotics; fund from drug fines.
2096.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-25-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Salary Of Additional Deputy Sheriffs Who Are Specifically Designated For Narcotics Enforcement Shall Be Funded From The Proceeds Of Fines Collected By The County From Convictions Under The Uniform Controlled Substances Law; And For Related Purposes.

2097.title: Residential property insurance; require rate filings to include discounts when certain construction techniques are used.
2097.description: An Act To Require Rate Filings For Residential Property Insurance To Include Discounts, Credits Or Other Rate Differentials For Properties On Which Construction Techniques That Have Been Demonstrated To Reduce The Amount Of Loss In A Windstorm Have Been Installed Or Implemented; And For Related Purposes.

2098.title: Medicaid and S.C.H.I.P.; redetermination of eligibility for shall be available by mail.
2098.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-13-115 And 41-86-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Regular Redetermination Of Medicaid And Childrens Health Insurance Program (s.c.h.i.p.) Eligibility Shall Be Available By Mail In Hardship Cases; To Provide That The Division Of Medicaid Shall Have Eligibility Workers Available At Various Sites To Accept Applications For Medicaid And S.c.h.i.p. And To Assist Applicants With The Application Process; And For Related Purposes.

2099.title: School-sponsored athletic programs; any student maintaining passing grades may participate.
2099.description: An Act To Provide That Any Student Maintaining Minimum Proficiency Standards For Promotion Established By The Local School Board May Participate In School-sponsored Athletics; And For Related Purposes.

2100.title: Seat belts; revise exemptions to cover mechanics.
2100.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Exemptions From The Application Of The Requirement To Wear A Seat Belt In A Moving Vehicle; And For Related Purposes.

2101.title: Public schools; require testing of portable classrooms and participation indoor air quality program developed by EPA.
2101.description: An Act To Require Portable Classrooms To Be Tested For Volatile Organic Compounds; To Require School Districts To Participate In The Indoor Air Quality Tools For Schools Program Developed By The U.s. Environmental Protection Agency; And For Related Purposes.

2102.title: Unfair Claims Settlement Practices Act; create under authority of Insurance Commissioner.
2102.description: An Act To Create The "unfair Claims Settlement Practices Act"; To Set Forth Standards For The Investigation And Disposition Of Claims Arising Under Policies Or Certificates Of Insurance; To Provide Definitions Of Unfair Claims Practices; To Provide Hearing Procedures; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2103.title: School influenza vaccination program; State Department of Health apply for federal grants.
2103.description: An Act To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Apply For Federal Grants And To Provide An Influenza Vaccination School Program In Mississippi For School-aged Children 5 Through 18 Years Of Age And To Provide Certain Standards For The Program; And For Related Purposes.

2104.title: Retired teachers; may draw retirement benefits and be reemployed as teachers if they have 25 years of creditable service.
2104.description: An Act To Create New Section 25-11-126, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Persons Receiving A Retirement Allowance From The Public Employees' Retirement System Who Are Employed As Teachers In The Public School System After Their Retirement, And Certain Persons Employed As Teachers In The Public School System Who Are Eligible To Receive A Retirement Allowance From The Public Employees' Retirement System, May Receive A Retirement Allowance During Their Employment As Teachers In Addition To Receiving A Teacher's Salary; To Provide That Those Persons Shall Not Be Contributing Members Of The Retirement System Nor Receive Any Creditable Service For The Period During Which They Receive A Retirement Allowance During Their Employment As Teachers; To Amend Sections 25-11-103, 25-11-105 And 25-11-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity With The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Certain Limitations On The Salaries Of Persons Who Are Employed As Teachers After Retirement And Choose To Continue Receiving A Retirement Allowance; And For Related Purposes.

2106.title: Used motor vehicle licenses; seminars required for may be conducted by any association recognized by the Department of Revenue.
2106.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-17-76, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Seminars Required To Be Attended By Applicants For A Used Motor Vehicle Dealer's License To Be Conducted By Any Recognized Association Approved By The Department Of Revenue; And For Related Purposes.

2107.title: "Mississippi Legislature United States Constitution Study Committee"; create to identify unconstitutional state laws.
2107.description: An Act To Codify Section 5-3-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A "mississippi Legislature United States Constitution Study Committee" And Prescribe Its Membership And Authority; To Direct The Committee To Identify And Report On State Laws Which Have Been Passed By The Mississippi Legislature In Violation Of The United States Constitution; To Repeal Sections 5-3-27, 5-3-29 And 5-3-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Define And Provide For The Study Of Un-american Activities In The State By The General Legislative Investigative Committee; And For Related Purposes.

2108.title: Window tint law; exempt government fire department vehicles.
2108.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Government-owned Fire Department Vehicles From The Window Tint Law; And For Related Purposes.

2109.title: Schedule I; expand definition of cathinone derivatives and synthetic cannabinoids.
2109.description: An Act To Be Known As The Dewayne Crenshaw Act; To Amend Section 41-29-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Cathinone Derivatives In Schedule I, To Expand The Definition Of Synthetic Cannabinoids And To Clarify The Punishment For Offenses Involving Synthetic Cannabinoids; To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Punishment For Offenses Involving Synthetic Cannabinoids; And For Related Purposes.

2110.title: Oil storage tanks; require safety measures at location of.
2110.description: An Act To Be Known As "the Devon And Wade Bill"; To Require Specific Safety Measures For Certain Oil And Gas Well Sites Under Certain Circumstances; To Create A Violation For Breach Of The Safety Standards; To Enact Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2111.title: Unauthorized aliens; prohibited from receiving financial aid from state universities or colleges.
2111.description: An Act To Prohibit College Or University Students Who Are Unlawfully Present In The United States From Receiving Financial Aid Awarded By Any State Institution Of Higher Learning Or Public Community College; And For Related Purposes.

2112.title: Trade Secrets; revise Uniform Act.
2112.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-26-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions And The Mississippi Uniform Trade Secrets Act; To Amend Section 75-26-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify When Injunctive Relief Is Appropriate; To Amend Section 75-26-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow A Court Award Of Reasonable Expenses To The Prevailing Party In Addition To Attorney's Fees; To Amend Section 75-26-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Necessity Of Preservation Of Secrecy During Litigation; And For Related Purposes.

2113.title: Mississippi Securities Act of 2010; clarify nonpublic nature of certain personal information obtained during investigations.
2113.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-71-607, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Certain Personal Information Concerning Persons Being Investigated That Is Obtained By The Secretary Of State In The Course Of Investigation Conducted Under The Mississippi Securities Act Of 2010 Is Not A Public Record Subject To Disclosure; And For Related Purposes.

2114.title: Accident response service fee; prohibit.
2114.description: An Act To Prohibit Imposition Of An Accident Response Service Fee By Any Law Enforcement Agency; And For Related Purposes.

2115.title: State Board for Community/Junior Colleges; change name to "Mississippi Community College Board".
