2253.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-76-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Declare As Public Policy That Children Are Adversely Affected When A Parent Who Has An Outstanding Child Support Arrearage Diverts Child Support To Gaming; To Codify Section 75-76-58, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Procedures For The Mississippi Gaming Commission, The Department Of Human Services And Licensees Under Chapter 76 Of Title 75 Of The Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Carry Out The Intercept And Seizure Of Game Winnings Of Parents With A Child Support Arrearage; And For Related Purposes.

2254.title: State Longitudinal Data System (SLDS); provide for development and interagency participation to link education with employment.
2254.description: An Act To Provide For The Development Of A State Longitudinal Data System (slds) To Establish A Multiagency Database To Track Education And Student Outcomes In The Workforce; To Provide For Interagency Cooperation With The Slds; To Provide For A Slds Governing Board; And For Related Purposes.

2255.title: School buses; may be used to transport general public to air show held on military base located in the school district.
2255.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-41-27 Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Local School Boards To Approve The Use Of School Buses For The Transportation Of Citizens Attending An Air Show Held On A Military Base Located In The School District; And For Related Purposes.

2256.title: Health Care Practitioner Transparency Act; enact.
2256.description: An Act To Be Known As The "health Care Practitioner Transparency Act" To Provide Clarity And Transparency For Patients When They Search For And Visit Health Care Practitioners; To Provide That Advertisements For Health Care Services That Name A Health Care Practitioner Must Identify The Type Of License Held By The Practitioner And Must Be Free From Any And All Deceptive Or Misleading Information; To Require Health Care Practitioners Providing Health Care Services In This State To Conspicuously Post And Affirmatively Communicate The Practitioner's Specific Licensure By Wearing A Photo Identification Name Tag During All Patient Encounters That Includes The Type Of License Held By The Practitioner; To Require Health Care Practitioners To Display In Their Office A Writing That Clearly Identifies The Type Of License Held By The Practitioner; To Provide That Failure To Comply With Any Provision Of This Act Constitutes A Violation Of This Act; To Provide That Any Health Care Practitioner Who Violates Any Provision Of This Act Is Guilty Of Unprofessional Conduct And Subject To Disciplinary Action Under The Appropriate Licensure Provisions Governing The Respective Health Care Practitioner; To Amend Sections 73-6-19, 73-9-61, 73-10-21, 73-15-29, 73-19-23, 73-21-97, 73-23-59, 73-24-24, 73-25-29, 73-27-13, 73-30-21, 73-31-21, 73-38-27, 73-53-17, 73-54-29, 73-55-19, 73-57-31, 73-65-13, 73-67-27 And 73-71-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

2257.title: Uniform Real Property Electronic Recording Act, create.
2257.description: An Act To Create The Uniform Real Property Electronic Recording Act; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide For The Validity Of Electronic Documents; To Provide For The Recording Of Electronic Documents; To Create The Mississippi Electronic Recording Commission; To Provide For Administration And Standards; To Provide For Uniformity; To Clarify The Relation Of This Act To Electronic Signatures In Global And National Commerce Act; To Amend Sections 89-3-1, 89-5-1 And 89-5-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2260.title: State and local governments; shall strip law enforcement vehicles before selling or disposing of the vehicles.
2260.description: An Act To Require Any State Agency, Department, Institution Or Political Subdivision Thereof, To Completely Strip Any Law Enforcement Vehicle Of Any Law Enforcement Markings, Decals, Supplies And Other Accessories Before Selling Or Disposing Of The Vehicle; And For Related Purposes.

2261.title: Students with disabilities; parents have option of tape recording IEP meetings.
2261.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-23-137, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Parents Of Students With Disabilities Have The Option Of Tape Recording Their Child's Iep Meeting; And For Related Purposes.

2263.title: Land records; revise instrument recordation minimum standards.
2263.description: An Act To Amend Section 89-5-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Minimum Font For Certain Legal Typed Instruments To Be Presented For Recording Be Increased From Eight Point To Twelve Point Font Size; To Amend Section 27-3-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Certain Identifying Information Be Included On The First Page Of Real Property Instruments Filed With The Chancery Clerk; And For Related Purposes.

2264.title: SREB contract program at Southern College of Optometry; students not required to practice in Mississippi.
2264.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-135-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Mississippi Students Participating In The Southern Regional Education Board (sreb) Contract Program At The Southern College Of Optometry Shall Not Be Required To Return To The State Of Mississippi To Practice After Graduation; And For Related Purposes.

2265.title: MS Debt Management Services Act; exempt certain services provided by attorneys in the regular course of the practice of law.
2265.description: An Act To Amend Section 81-22-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From The Mississippi Debt Management Services Act Certain Services Provided By Attorneys In The Regular Course Of The Practice Of Law; And For Related Purposes.

2266.title: Students participating in General Educational Development (GED) option programs; clarify funding.
2266.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That A Student Participating In A General Educational Development (ged) Option Program Under A School District Agreement With A Community College Or Other Local Entity Shall Not Be Deemed A Dropout For Funding Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2267.title: Mississippi Money Transmitters Act; revise the license and examination fees.
2267.description: An Act To Amend Sections 75-15-15 And 75-15-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The License And Examination Fees For Persons Engaging In The Business Of Money Transmission; And For Related Purposes.

2268.title: Students with disabilities; parents provided alternate assessment scores at no cost.
2268.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-23-137, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Parents Of Students With Disabilities Shall Be Provided A Copy Of Their Child's Alternate Assessment Scores At No Cost; And For Related Purposes.

2269.title: Students with disabilities; parents shall receive copy of outside evaluation and observation report.
2269.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-23-137, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Parents Of Students With Disabilities Shall Be Provided A Copy Of An Outside Entity's Assessment/evaluation And Observation Report; And For Related Purposes.

2270.title: Students with a disability; parents provided copy of child's assessment.
2270.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-23-137, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Parents Of A Child With A Disability Will Be Provided With A Copy Of Their Child's Initial Or Reevaluation Assessment Report Before An Iep Meeting; And For Related Purposes.

2271.title: Financial reimbursements to sponsoring school districts for students placed in youth detention centers; SDE issue policy.
2271.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-321, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Issue Policies Regarding Financial Reimbursements To Sponsoring School Districts For Services To Students Placed In Youth Detention Centers; And For Related Purposes.

2272.title: Homeschooled students; to be tested for grade assignment prior to transfer into public school district.
2272.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-15-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Homeschooled Students To Be Tested Prior To Transfer Into A Public School District For Grade Assignment Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2273.title: School textbooks; clarify procedure for executing publishing contracts.
2273.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-43-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Procedure For Executing And Distributing School Textbook Publishing Contracts; And For Related Purposes.

2274.title: Concurrent jurisdiction; establish with United States for crimes committed on federal military installations.
2274.description: An Act To Establish Concurrent Criminal Jurisdiction With The United States For Trying And Punishing All Persons For Offenses Committed On Federal Military Installations In This State; And For Related Purposes.

2275.title: School teacher and administrator licensure; provide penalties for sexual involvement of school employees with a student.
2275.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Specific Grounds For Revocation Or Suspension Of A Teacher Or Administrator's License For Sexual Misconduct; To Clarify The Requirements For Issuing A Standard License Based Upon Reciprocity; To Amend Sections 97-5-24 And 37-11-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Legal Duty For School Superintendents To Report Incidences Of Sexual Involvement Of School Employees With A Student And To Provide Criminal Penalties For Failure To Report; And For Related Purposes.

2276.title: Drug courts; authorize drug court judge to assess direct cost of confinement for person in jail.
2276.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-23-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972 To Provide That A Drug Court Judge May Assess A Defendant For The County's Cost Of Confinement; And For Related Purposes.

2277.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for repair of bridges in Alcorn and Tishomingo Counties.
2277.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Incurred In Repairing A Bridge On County Road 346 In Alcorn County And A Bridge On County Road 50 In Tishomingo County; And For Related Purposes.

2279.title: MS Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Law; repeal and provide additional tag fee.
2279.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 63-13-1 Through 63-13-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Law; To Amend Section 63-7-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 27-19-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For An Additional Tag Fee; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Fee; And For Related Purposes.

2280.title: Income taxation; exclude wages of certain full-time students from gross income.
2280.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude From The Term "gross Income" Under The Income Tax Laws, Wages That Are Earned By A Taxpayer During Any Period Of Time That The Taxpayer Is A Full-time Student At Any University, College, Or Community/junior College; And For Related Purposes.

2281.title: Early voting; authorize a pilot program in Alcorn County.
2281.description: An Act To Create An Early Voting Pilot Program In Alcorn County; To Provide The Procedures For Early Voting In Such County; And For Related Purposes.

2283.title: MS Community Heritage Preservation Grant Fund; revise use of certain funds.
2283.description: An Act To Amend Section 39-5-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Funds In The Mississippi Community Heritage Preservation Grant Fund May Be Utilized To Pay The Costs Of Capital Improvements, Repairing, Renovating, Restoring, Rehabilitating, Preserving, Furnishing And/or Equipping Buildings And Facilities Near The Courthouse In Jacinto, Mississippi, Restoring The Historic Northside School In West Point, And Restoring The Columbus City Hall; And For Related Purposes.

2284.title: Elected judiciary and district attorneys; bring forward law relating to the annual salaries of.
2284.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 25-3-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Relating To The Annual Salaries Of The Elected Judiciary, District Attorneys And Legal Assistants, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2285.title: Bonds; issue state general obligation bonds for purchase of rights-of-way for Hwy. 15 from U.S. 78 to Tennessee state line.
2285.description: An Act To Provide For The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Paying The Cost Of Acquiring Rights-of-way Necessary To Four Lane Mississippi Highway 15 From U.s. Highway 78 To The Tennessee State Line; And For Related Purposes.

2286.title: Headlights; require use during precipitation.
2286.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Headlights Of Vehicles Shall Be Operated Whenever Precipitation Or Other Conditions Result In Poor Visibility; To Prohibit The Use Of Only The Parking Lights Of Vehicles During Times When The Use Of Headlights Is Required; And For Related Purposes.

2287.title: Highways; Transportation Department construct Highway 72 bypass for City of Corinth.
2287.description: An Act To Provide That The Mississippi Department Of Transportation Shall Construct A Four-lane Bypass For The City Of Corinth On U.s. Highway 72; And For Related Purposes.

2288.title: Early Voting Act; authorize voting prior to election day.
2288.description: An Act To Authorize A Qualified Elector To Vote Early Not More Than 21 Days Nor Less Than 5 Days Before The Date Of An Election; To Provide That Early Voting May Be Conducted In The Registrar's Office Or At A Location Designated By The Registrar; To Require A Person Who Desires To Vote Early To Appear At The Registrar's Office And To Provide That After Signing The Receipt Book Such Person Shall Be Entitled To Vote At The Registrar's Office Or At The Location Designated By The Registrar During The Early Voting Period In The Same Manner As He Would At His Voting Precinct On The Day Of The Election; To Provide That The Election Laws That Govern Procedures For A Person Who Appears To Vote On The Day Of Election Shall Apply When A Person Appears To Vote During The Early Voting Period; To Provide That All Votes Cast During The Early Voting Period Shall Be Final; To Provide That The Votes Cast During Early Voting Shall Be Announced Simultaneously With The Vote Cast On Election Day; To Provide That Each Candidate Shall Have The Right To Be Present At The Registrar's Office And To Challenge The Qualifications Of Any Person Offering To Vote Early In The Same Manner As Provided By Law At The Polling Place On The Day Of The Election; To Require The Secretary Of State To Promulgate Rules And Regulations Necessary To Effectuate Early Voting; To Amend Sections 23-15-195, 23-15-653 And 23-15-353, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Sections 23-15-627, 23-15-637, 23-15-641, 23-15-713 And 23-15-715, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Voters May Not Cast Absentee Ballots At The Office Of The Registrar During The Early Voting Period; And For Related Purposes.

2289.title: Corrections; authorize MDOC to contract with Tishomingo County for regional prison.
2289.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-931, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Corrections To Contract With Tishomingo County For A Regional Prison; And For Related Purposes.

2290.title: Employment Security Law; exclude services performed by individuals in the delivery of newspapers regardless of age.
2290.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-5-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude From The Term "employment" Under The Mississippi Employment Security Law, Certain Services Performed By An Individual In The Delivery Or Distribution Of Newspapers Or Shopping News Regardless Of The Individual's Age; And For Related Purposes.

2291.title: Corporate charters; provide for automatic statutory extension.
2291.description: An Act To Amend Section 79-1-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Statutory Automatic Extension Of Corporate Charter For Certain Corporations Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2292.title: Banks; shall post owner information of ATM if machine is owned by another bank or entity.
2292.description: An Act To Require Any Bank That Has An Automated Teller Machine Located On Its Premises That Is Owned By Another Financial Institution Or Other Entity To Affix On The Front Of The Machine The Name, Address And Contact Information Of The Owner; And For Related Purposes.

2293.title: Counties; maintain private roads used as Head Start turnarounds.
2293.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-3-42, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Boards Of Supervisors To Maintain Private Roads Or Driveways Used As Turnarounds By Head Start Buses; And For Related Purposes.

2294.title: Human Relations Commission; establish.
2294.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Human Relations Act Of 2011"; To Establish And Empower A Mississippi Commission On Human Relations; To Require The Cooperation Of State Agencies; And For Related Purposes.

2295.title: Unemployment compensation law; provide a direct seller exemption from.
2295.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-5-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Direct Seller Exemption From The Applicability Of The Unemployment Compensation Law; And For Related Purposes.

2296.title: Blue Alert System; create.
2296.description: An Act To Create The "blue Alert" Program To Help In The Investigation And Apprehension Of Perpetrators Of Crimes Involving The Death Or Serious Injury Of A Law Enforcement Officer; And For Related Purposes.

2297.title: Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP); create.
2297.description: An Act To Authorize Members Of The Public Employees' Retirement System Who Have Reached Their Normal Retirement Date To Participate In A Deferred Retirement Option Program (drop) Under Which The Employee May Retire And Continue Working For A Specified Period And Receive His Or Her Regular Salary, While Having The Retirement Benefit He Or She Would Have Otherwise Received Paid Into An Account For The Member's Benefit; To Provide That Money In Such Account Will Be Paid To The Member Upon Completion Of The Drop Period; To Provide That The Member Must Elect To Participate In The Program Within 12 Months Immediately Following The Date Upon Which The Member Reached His Or Her Normal Retirement Date; To Provide That The Drop Period May Be For Any Time Not Exceeding Five Years; To Provide That The Decision To Participate In The Drop Program Is Irrevocable Once It Is Made; To Provide That The Drop Account For The Benefit Of The Member Shall Be Held In Reserve Until The End Of The Drop Period; To Provide That Regular Interest Shall Be Paid On Monies In The Drop Account During The Time That The Member Participates In The Drop Program And Until The Monies Are Paid To The Member; To Provide That The Member Shall Receive The Accumulated Monies In The Drop Account In Addition To The Regular Retirement Allowance At The End Of The Drop Period; To Provide That Any Member Participating In The Drop Program Shall Not Be An Active Member Of The Retirement System And Shall Not Receive Any Creditable Service For The Period Of Participation In The Program; To Amend Sections 25-11-105, 25-11-109, 25-11-117 And 25-11-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2298.title: Motor carriers; change incorrect reference to Interstate Commerce Commission.
2298.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change Reference To The Interstate Commerce Commission To Conform To Federal Organizational Nomenclature; And For Related Purposes.

2299.title: Vehicle service contracts; provider not required to be named insured under reimbursement policy upon certain conditions.
2299.description: An Act To Create New Section 83-65-125, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Provider Of Vehicle Service Contracts Shall Not Be Required To Be A Named Insured Under A Reimbursement Insurance Policy If The Provider Complies With Certain Requirements; And For Related Purposes.

2300.title: Franchise tax; base the levy on retained earnings employed in this state.
2300.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-13-5 And 27-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Franchise Tax Levy To Provide That The Levy Shall Be Equal To $2.50 For Each $1,000.00, Or Fraction Thereof, Of The Retained Earnings Of The Entity Taxed That Are Employed In This State; To Amend Sections 27-13-9, 27-13-11 And 27-13-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2301.title: "Mississippi Free Health Clinic Volunteers in Medicine Act"; enact.
2301.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Free Health Clinic Volunteers In Medicine Act"; To Provide Definitions Of Health Care Providers And Free Clinics Subject To The Provisions Of This Act; To Provide For Contracts Between Health Care Providers And Free Clinics; To Provide For The Annual Registration Of Free Clinics With The Mississippi State Department Of Health; To Provide That Health Care Providers And Volunteers Providing Services To Free Clinics Under Such Contract Shall Be Deemed Governmental Employees With Liability Immunity Protection Under The Mississippi Tort Claims Act; To Require Notification Of Such Limitation Of Liability To Patients And Recipients Of Services At Free Clinics; To Provide That Free Clinics And Health Care Providers Shall Be Assessed For The Cost Of Such Immunity Under The Tort Claims Act; To Require Certain Reports; To Amend Sections 11-46-1 And 73-25-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Sections 73-15-5 And 73-25-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Nurses And Nurse Practitioners To Dispense Medication To Patients In A Free Clinic Setting; To Amend Section 73-21-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Drug Manufacturers To Donate Drugs To Free Clinics Up To One Year Following The Labeled Expiration Date; And For Related Purposes.

2302.title: Licensing of insurance adjusters; revise definition to exclude multi-peril crop insurance adjusters.
2302.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-17-401, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude Any Person Who Is A Multi-peril Crop Insurance (mpci) Adjuster From The Definition Of The Term "adjuster" As Used In The Article Which Provides For The Licensing Of Adjusters; And For Related Purposes.

2303.title: "Eyebrow threading"; define for regulatory purposes and require registration.
2303.description: An Act To Define The Term "eyebrow Threading"; To Provide That Persons Practicing Eyebrow Threading For Compensation Are Required To Register With The State Department Of Health And Pay A Fee; To Provide That The Department Is Not Authorized To License Or Regulate The Practice Of Eyebrow Threading; To Direct The Department To Develop Brochures Containing Information About This Practice; To Authorize The Department To Conduct Inspections Of Premises To Determine Whether Self-testing For Infection Control Is Available On Eyebrow Threading Sites; To Clarify That This Provision Is Not Applicable To Licensed Cosmetologists Or Barbers; And For Related Purposes.

2304.title: Workers' compensation; provide that appeals from commission go directly to Court of Appeals.
2304.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Decisions Made By The Workers' Compensation Commission May Be Appealed Directly To The Court Of Appeals; To Amend Section 9-4-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2305.title: Ad valorem taxation; exempt military housing constructed pursuant to the Military Housing Privatization Initiative.
2305.description: An Act To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Military Housing Units And Ancillary Supporting Facilities For The Units That Are Acquired Or Constructed Pursuant To The Military Housing Privatization Initiative; And For Related Purposes.

2307.title: State Board of Barber Examiners; extend automatic repealer on.
2307.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-5-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On Those Statutes Which Create And Empower The State Board Of Barber Examiners; To Reenact Sections 73-5-1 Through 73-5-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Regulation Of Barbers; And For Related Purposes.

2309.title: Obstruction of emergency assistance; create offense.
2309.description: An Act To Create The Offense Of Obstruction Of Emergency Assistance; To Provide Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2311.title: Funding mechanism for community colleges and universities based on productivity; direct Education Achievement Council to develop.
2311.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-163-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Mississippi Education Achievement Council To Research And Develop A New Funding Mechanism For Community Colleges And Institutions Of Higher Learning Based Upon Productivity And Make A Report To The 2012 Regular Session; And For Related Purposes.

2312.title: Revenue from leasing of channels awarded by the FCC; are public funds expendable by the state agency leasing the channels.
2312.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-63-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Revenue Generated By The Leasing Of Channels Awarded By The Federal Communications Commission To A State Agency Are Public Funds And May Be Expended By The Leasing Agency Pursuant To Law; And For Related Purposes.

2313.title: Nurse practitioner supervision by physician or dentist; revise.
2313.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-15-5 And 73-15-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Requirement That Advanced Practice Registered Nurses Must Practice Within A Collaborative Or Consultative Relationship With A Physician Or Dentist; And For Related Purposes.

2314.title: Law enforcement officers; provide minimum due process rights for municipal.
2314.description: An Act Entitled The "law Enforcement Employment Procedures Act"; To Require Municipalities To Provide A Predisciplinary Hearing Prior To The Suspension Or Termination Of Any Law Enforcement Officer; To Establish A Minimum Level Of Written Due Process Procedures; To Specify What Notice Shall Be Provided To The Officer; To Provide That The Officer May Attend The Hearing, May Be Represented By Counsel, May Present Evidence On His Own Behalf And Question Witnesses; To Provide That The Evidentiary Phase Of The Hearing May Be Held In Executive Session; To Provide That Final Adjudication Shall Be Held In Open Meeting; To Exempt Municipalities That Have A Civil Service Commission Or Due Process Policy; And For Related Purposes.

2315.title: Absentee ballots; revise the manner in which absentee ballots are counted.
2315.description: An Act To Amend Sections 23-15-637 And 23-15-639, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Registrar Shall Keep All Absentee Ballots He Receives By 5:00 P.m. On The Date Preceding The Election And Deliver Them To The Commissioners Of Election, In The Case Of General Elections, And Designated Members Of The County Executive Committee, In The Case Of Primary Elections, By Not Later Than 9:00 P.m. On The Day Of The Election; To Require The Registrar To Prepare A List Of The Persons Who Are Registered To Vote In The Precinct And Who Lawfully Cast An Absentee Ballot And Deliver The List To Each Precinct Before The Polls Open On Election Day; To Require The Election Managers At Each Precinct To Note All Persons On The List Who Appeared In Person And Voted At The Election; To Require The Election Managers To Deliver The List With Notations Of Those Who Voted In Person To The Appropriate Election Officials As Soon As Possible After The Polls Have Closed; To Provide That The Commissioners Of Election Or The Designated County Executive Committee Members Shall Examine The Absentee Ballot Envelopes And Ballots At A Meeting Held For That Purpose Not Later Than 9:00 P.m. On The Day Of The Election; To Require The Rejection Of The Absentee Ballots Of Those Who Voted In Person And For Other Reasons For Which Absentee Ballots May Be Rejected; To Provide That Such Election Officials Shall Count The Absentee Ballots And Add The Votes To The Appropriate Precinct Totals Before The Vote Is Certified; To Amend Sections 23-15-641, 23-15-643 And 23-15-719, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2316.title: Children with identified disabilities; revise distribution of certain documents to parents.
2316.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-23-137, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The School District Requirements For The Distribution Of The Procedural Safeguards Document Related To Children With An Identified Disability; And For Related Purposes.

2317.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tags; authorize for supporters of Le Bonheur Children's Hospital.
2317.description: An Act To Provide For The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of Le Bonheur Children's Hospital; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

2318.title: State Medical Examiner; transfer to Mississippi Department of Health.
2318.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-61-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Medical Examiner Shall Be Appointed By The Commissioner Of Public Safety Subject To The Approval Of A Panel; To Provide For The Members Of The State Medical Examiner Advisory Council; To Amend Section 41-61-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Section; To Amend Section 41-61-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Entity Established To Adopt Regulations For The Administration Of The Medical Examiner Act; To Amend Section 41-61-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The County Medical Examiner Who Is Notified Of A Death Affecting The Public Interest To Notify The State Medical Examiner; To Amend Section 41-61-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The County Medical Examiner In Investigations Of Deaths Affecting The Public Interest Where An Autopsy Will Not Be Performed To Make Decisions In Consultation With Law Enforcement Officials And/or The State Medical Examiner; To Amend Section 41-61-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In Investigations Where An Autopsy Will Be Performed, The State Medical Examiner May Choose A Competent Pathologist To Perform The Autopsy; To Amend Section 41-61-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Medical Examiner May Be An Affiliate Or Regular Faculty Member Of The Department Of Pathology At The University Of Mississippi Medical Center; And For Related Purposes.

2319.title: Public schools; require certain appropriate conduct by students.
2319.description: An Act To Require Certain Appropriate Conduct By All Students In Public Schools In Certain Circumstances; To Require City And County School Boards To Provide For Incorporation Of Such Requirements Into Any Existing Discipline Policy Or Policies Or Any Code Of Conduct Of The School System; And For Related Purposes.

2324.title: Fees charged by the State Department of Health; revise.
2324.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-9-9, 41-71-5, 41-75-7, 41-75-9, 41-77-9, 41-85-7, 43-11-7, 43-11-8, 43-11-13 And 45-14-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Certain Fees Charged By The State Department Of Health; And For Related Purposes.

2325.title: Manslaughter; distinguish between voluntary and involuntary.
2325.description: An Act To Amend Sections 97-3-25, 97-3-35 And 97-3-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Distinguish Between Voluntary An Involuntary Manslaughter And To Revise The Penalties Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

2326.title: DUI; increase penalties for 4th and 5th offenses.
2326.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create An Increased Penalty For A Fourth Or Fifth Conviction Of Driving Under The Influence; And For Related Purposes.

2327.title: Mississippi Nonprofit Corporation Act; revise.
2327.description: An Act To Amend Section 79-11-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Provisions Dealing With The Issuance Of Certificates Of Existence To Conform To The Model Nonprofit Corporation Act; To Amend Section 79-11-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions; To Amend Section 79-11-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Form And Delivery Of Notice Under The Act; To Amend Section 79-11-137, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Nonprofits Formed After The Effective Date To State A Principal Purpose In Their Articles Of Incorporation And To Revise Director Liability; To Amend Section 79-11-165, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Change Of A Registered Agent For Service; To Amend Section 79-11-197, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Electronic Meetings Of Members; To Amend Section 79-11-199, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Electronic Special Meetings; To Amend Section 79-11-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Approval Of Actions Without Meeting; To Amend Section 79-11-211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Written Ballot Requirements; To Amend Section 79-11-221, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Proxy Authorization; To Amend Section 79-11-235, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Minimum Number Of Directors For Nonprofits That Solicit In The State; To Amend Section 79-11-267, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify A Director's Liability To The Nonprofit; To Amend Section 79-11-283, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Electronic Record Keeping; To Amend Section 79-11-287, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Electronic Copies; To Amend Section 79-11-347, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Grounds For Administrative Dissolution; To Amend Section 79-11-349, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Procedure For Administrative Dissolution; To Amend Section 79-11-377, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Procedure For The Change Of A Registered Agent For Service; To Amend Section 79-11-399, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Relationship Of The Act To The Federal Electronic Signatures In Global And National Commerce Act; To Create New Code Section 79-11-405, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Certain Provisions Regarding A Nonprofit's Exemption From Tax; And For Related Purposes.

2328.title: "Mississippi Pharmacy Practice Act"; extend repealer on and make technical amendments.
2328.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Sections Which Create The State Board Of Pharmacy And Prescribe Its Duties And Powers; To Reenact Sections 73-21-71 Through 73-21-123, And Amend Section 73-21-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is The "mississippi Pharmacy Practice Act"; To Amend Section 73-21-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define "pharmacy Benefit Manager" For The Purposes Of The Pharmacy Practice Act; To Amend Section 73-21-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Appointment Of Members Of The State Board Of Pharmacy; To Amend Section 73-21-97, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board To Impose Disciplinary Actions Against Persons Who Fail To Obtain The License, Registration Or Permit Required By The Pharmacy Practice Act; To Amend Section 73-21-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board To Impose Monetary Penalties Upon Any Person Or Business That Practices Or Does Business Without The License, Registration Or Permit Required By The Pharmacy Practice Act; To Amend Sections 73-21-83 And 73-21-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Fees For Pharmacy Benefit Managers; To Amend Section 73-21-109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Unlawful Use Of Certain Business Names; To Amend Sections 73-21-157 And 73-21-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Pharmacy Benefit Managers To Obtain A License From The Board Before Beginning To Do Business; To Clarify The Regulatory Authority Of The State Board Of Pharmacy Relating To Pharmacy Benefit Managers; To Amend Section 73-21-106, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Permitting Requirements For Nonresident Pharmacies That Deliver Prescription Drugs Into This State And To Require The Pharmacist-in-charge Of A Nonresident Pharmacy To Hold A Mississippi Pharmacist License; To Amend Section 41-29-125, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Registration Of Out-of-state Facilities That Distribute Or Dispense Controlled Substances Within The State; To Amend Section 73-21-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The State Board Of Pharmacy Authority To Track Controlled Substances Under The Mississippi Prescription Monitoring Program; And For Related Purposes.

2329.title: Mississippi Board of Psychology; reenact and make technical amendments.
2329.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-31-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definitions Of Several Terms Used In The Psychologist Licensure Law; To Amend Section 73-31-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Composition Of The Mississippi Board Of Psychology Shall Include Practicing Psychologists And University Faculty; To Amend Section 73-31-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board To Issue Nondisciplinary Educational Letters To Licensees; To Amend Section 73-31-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Amounts Of License Application Fees And Renewal Fees And To Authorize The Board To Charge A Late Fee For Late Renewals; To Amend Section 73-31-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Applicants For Licensure Must Undergo A Criminal Background Check; To Place A Repealer On The Education, Supervised Professional Experience And Examination Requirements For Licensure; To Amend Section 73-31-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board To Issue Temporary Licenses And Temporary Practice Certificates; To Amend Section 73-31-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Provisions For Licensure By Reciprocity; To Create New Section 73-31-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create And Prescribe The Qualifications For Psychologist Emeritus Status; To Amend Section 73-31-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board To Direct A Psychologist To Obtain An Assessment Of Ability To Practice Safely Because Of Possible Impairment Due To Substance Abuse Or Mental Incapacity; To Amend Section 73-31-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Repealer On The Section And Move The Repealer To A New Code Section; To Amend Section 73-31-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Certain Exemptions From The Application Of The Psychologist Licensure Law To The Use Of Official Titles By Persons In The Employ Of Certain Agencies Or Organizations; To Clarify The Circumstances Under Which Lecturers Employed By Universities May Use Academic Or Research Titles; To Delete The Repealers On Sections 73-31-3, 73-31-5, 73-31-7, 73-31-9, 73-31-13, 73-31-21 And 73-31-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, And Move The Repealers To A New Code Section; To Amend Sections 73-31-1, 73-31-11, 73-31-19, 73-31-25 And 73-31-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; To Create New Section 73-31-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For A Repealer On The Psychologist Licensure Law; And For Related Purposes.

2330.title: Medicaid program; direct DOM to establish a medical home program to support primary care providers.
2330.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Division Of Medicaid To Establish A Medical Home Program To Support Primary Care Providers; And For Related Purposes.

2331.title: Certificate of need review; provide for direct appeal and expedited review for certain health care expenditures.
2331.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Direct Appeal To The Mississippi Supreme Court On A Final Order By The State Department Of Health Pertaining To A Certificate Of Need For Any Health Care Facility; To Amend Section 41-7-205, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Expedited Review Of A Request For A Certificate Of Need For Certain Health Care Expenditures; And For Related Purposes.

2332.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for supporters of the Mississippi Veterinary Association.
2332.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of The Mississippi Veterinary Association; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Dyslexia Awareness Motor Vehicle License Tag; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag With The Word "don't Tread On Me" Imprinted Thereon; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of Jackson Academy; To Provide For The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of Le Bonheur Children's Hospital; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Abbie Rogers Civitan Camp; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of The Animal Rescue League Of Laurel; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of The Farm Families Of Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of Brookhaven Academy; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag Honoring Ronald Reagan, Fortieth President Of The United States, And His Many Outstanding Accomplishments; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of Jackson Preparatory School; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag With The Words "we Love Life" Imprinted Thereon; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of Such Fees; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Special License Tag For Trailers Primarily Designed For The Transport Of Horses To Supporters Of The Mississippi State Equine Association; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; To Amend Section 27-19-44, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make It Clear That Distinctive License Tags Issued For School Districts Under Section 27-19-56.154 Are Exempt From The Time Limit For Submitting Proof That At Least 300 Of Such License Tags Or Plates Will Be Purchased And Deposit With The Department An Amount Necessary To Purchase 300 Of Such License Tags Or Plates; To Amend Section 27-19-56.154, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 27-19-56.108, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Rotary International; To Amend Section 27-19-56.133, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag To Supporters Of The Boys And Girls Clubs Rather Than Supporters Of The Mississippi Alliance For Boys And Girls Clubs And To Reauthorize The Issuance Of The Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag Authorized By This Section; To Amend Section 27-19-56.216, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Distinctive Tag Authorized Under This Section Shall Be Issued To Supporters Of The Laurel School District; To Revise The Words Required To Be Displayed On The Tag; To Provide That The Additional Fee Collected On The Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag Issued Under This Section Shall Be Distributed To The Laurel School District; To Amend Section 27-19-48, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Issuance Of Personalized License Tags For Noncommercial Trailers; And For Related Purposes.

2333.title: Agriculture; conform state organic certification program to USDA National Organic Program.
2333.description: An Act To Conform The Mississippi Organic Certification Program To The United States Department Of Agriculture National Organic Program; To Amend Section 69-47-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Certain Definitions; To Amend Section 69-47-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete Requirement That A Seller Of Organic Food Must Be Certified By The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce; To Amend Section 69-47-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 69-47-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Accredited Certifier May Certify Organic Crops; To Amend Section 69-47-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Certifier Shall Assume Certain Duties Of The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce; To Delete The Requirement That The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce Must Conduct Inspections; To Amend Section 69-47-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Applications Must Be Submitted To A Certifier; To Amend Section 69-47-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That A Seller Of Organic Products Must Be Certified By A Certifier Instead Of The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce; To Amend Section 69-47-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete Reference To The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce; To Amend Section 69-47-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certifiers Shall Perform Inspections; To Amend Section 69-47-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Requirement That A Person Must Receive Prior Approval From The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce Before Using The Mississippi Certified Organic Mark; To Repeal Section 69-47-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Created An Advisory Committee To The Organic Certification Program; To Repeal Section 69-47-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorized The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Develop An Organic Certification Program For Organic Meat, Organic Fish, Organic Poultry And Organic Seafood; To Provide For The Repeal Of This Act On July 1, 2013; And For Related Purposes.

2334.title: IHL; may waive out-of-state tuition for students on a reciprocity basis.
2334.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-103-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Waive Out-of-state Tuition On A Reciprocity Basis; To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of Any Community/junior College To Waive Out-of-state Tuition On A Reciprocity Basis; And For Related Purposes.

2335.title: Medicaid coverage for breast prosthesis and bra; provide reimbursement for.
2335.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Medicaid Coverage For A Breast Prosthesis And Bra For Medicaid-eligible Women Who Have Undergone A Mastectomy Or Related Breast Reconstruction Procedures For The Treatment Of Breast Cancer; And For Related Purposes.

2336.title: Kidnapping; expand definition.
2336.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Definition Of Kidnapping To Include Vulnerable Persons; And For Related Purposes.

2338.title: Service of process; Model Registered Agents Act (ULC).
2338.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Registered Agents Act; To Create New Section 79-35-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Short Title; To Create New Section 79-35-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Definitions; To Create New Section 79-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Fees And Allow The Secretary Of State To Reduce Fees For Electronic Filings Under The Act; To Create New Section 79-35-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Standards For Street And Mailing Addresses Used In Registering Under The Act; To Create New Section 79-35-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Appointment Of A Registered Agent; To Create New Section 79-35-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Listing Of A Commercial Registered Agent; To Create New Section 79-35-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Termination Of Listing Of A Commercial Registered Agent; To Create New Section 79-35-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For A Change In Registered Agent; To Create New Section 79-35-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For A Change Of Name Or Address By A Noncommercial Registered Agent; To Create New Section 79-35-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For A Change Of Name, Address Or Business Type By A Commercial Registered Agent; To Create New Section 79-35-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Resignation Of A Registered Agent; To Create New Section 79-35-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Appointment Of An Agent By A Nonfiling Or Nonqualified Foreign Entity; To Create New Section 79-35-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Service Of Process On Entities And To Specify Procedures When Service Cannot Be Had; To Create New Section 79-35-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Duties Of A Registered Agent; To Create New Section 79-35-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Appointment Of An Agent Does Not Confer Jurisdiction Or Determine Venue; To Create New Section 79-35-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct Uniformity With Other States In The Construction Of The Act; To Create New Section 79-35-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Relationship Between This Act And The Electronic Signatures Act; To Create New Section 79-35-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Savings Clause; To Create New Section 79-35-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Penalties For Violation Of The Act; To Amend Sections 79-4-1.20, 79-4-1.22, 79-4-1.25, 79-4-1.26, 79-4-1.41, 79-4-2.02, 79-4-7.03, 79-4-7.04, 79-4-7.20, 79-4-7.48, 79-4-8.09, 79-4-10.05, 79-4-11.07, 79-4-13.30, 79-4-14.07, 79-4-14.08, 79-4-14.20, 79-4-14.21, 79-4-14.22, 79-4-14.23, 79-4-14.31, 79-4-15.03, 79-4-15.04, 79-4-15.10, 79-4-15.20, 79-4-15.30, 79-4-15.31, 79-4-15.32, 79-4-15.33, 79-4-16.04, 79-4-16.05, 79-4-16.22, 79-11-109, 79-11-115, 79-11-117, 79-11-131, 79-11-137, 79-11-201, 79-11-213, 79-11-289, 79-11-299, 79-11-327, 79-11-345, 79-11-347, 79-11-349, 79-11-351, 79-11-353, 79-11-355, 79-11-357, 79-11-367, 79-11-369, 79-11-381, 79-11-383, 79-11-385, 79-11-389, 79-11-391 And 79-13-1001, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Revise The Limited Liability Partnership Act To Allow Administrative Dissolution On Grounds Of Appointment Of A Nonconsenting Agent; To Create New Section 79-13-1003, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Administrative Dissolution Of A Limited Liability Partnership; To Create New Section 79-13-1004, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow For A Limited Liability Partnership To Correct Deficiencies In Order To Avoid Administrative Dissolution; To Create New Section 79-13-1005, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Reinstatement Of A Limited Liability Partnership Following Administrative Dissolution; To Create New Section 79-13-1006, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Denial Of Reinstatement; To Amend Section 79-13-1102, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Revise The Foreign Limited Liability Partnership Act To Allow Administrative Dissolution On Grounds Of Appointment Of A Nonconsenting Agent; To Create New Section 79-13-1106, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Notice Of Pending Revocation Of Qualification Of A Foreign Limited Liability Partnership; To Create New Section 79-13-1107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Revocation Of Foreign Qualification; To Create New Section 79-13-1108, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Reinstatement Of Qualification Of A Foreign Limited Liability Partnership; To Create New Section 79-13-1109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Denial Of Reinstatement Of A Foreign Limited Liability Partnership; To Amend Sections 79-14-104, 79-14-201, 79-14-202 And 79-14-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Create New Section 79-14-809, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Administrative Dissolution Of A Limited Partnership; To Create New Section 79-14-810, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Notice Of Pending Administrative Dissolution Of A Limited Partnership; To Create New Section 79-14-811, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Reinstatement Following Administration Dissolution Of A Limited Partnership; To Revise The Limited Partnership Act To Allow Administrative Dissolution On Grounds Of Appointment Of A Nonconsenting Agent; To Create New Section 79-14-812, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Notice Following Denial Of Reinstatement; To Amend Section 79-14-902, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Revise The Foreign Limited Partnership Act To Allow Administrative Dissolution On Grounds Of Appointment Of A Nonconsenting Agent; To Create New Section 79-14-910, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Revocation Of Registration Of A Foreign Limited Partnership; To Create New Section 79-14-911, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Procedure For Revocation Of Registration Of A Foreign Limited Partnership; To Create New Section 79-14-912, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Reinstatement Following Revocation Of Registration Of A Foreign Limited Partnership; To Create New Section 79-14-913, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Procedure For Denial Of Reinstatement; To Amend Sections 79-14-1104, 79-15-109, 79-15-129, 79-15-131, 79-15-135, 79-16-11, 79-16-27, 79-16-29, 79-16-33, 79-29-201, 79-29-209, 79-29-211, 79-29-231, 79-29-803, 79-29-819, 79-29-823, 79-29-825, 79-29-827, 79-29-913, 79-29-923, 79-29-1003, 79-29-1023, 79-29-1025 And 79-29-1203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Repeal Sections 79-4-5.01, 79-4-5.02, 79-4-5.03 And 79-4-5.04, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For A Registered Agent Maintaining A Registered Office, For The Change Of The Registered Office Of A Registered Agent, For The Resignation Of A Registered Agent, For Service Of Process On A Corporation, And Which Collectively Constitute Article 5, Office And Agent, Of The Mississippi Business Corporation Act; To Repeal Section 79-4-15.07, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Registered Office Of A Registered Agent Of A Foreign Corporation; To Repeal Section 79-4-15.08, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Change Of An Officer Or Registered Agent Of A Foreign Corporation; To Repeal Section 79-4-15.09, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Resignation Of A Registered Agent Of A Foreign Corporation; To Repeal Section 79-11-163, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires That A Nonprofit Corporation Maintain A Registered Office And Registered Agent Within The State; To Repeal Section 79-11-165, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Change Of Registered Office Or Registered Agent By A Nonprofit Corporation; To Repeal Section 79-11-167, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Resignation Of A Nonprofit Corporation's Registered Agent; To Repeal Section 79-11-169, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Service Of Process Upon A Nonprofit Corporation; To Repeal Section 79-11-375, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires That A Foreign Nonprofit Corporation Maintain A Registered Office And Registered Agent Within The State; To Repeal Section 79-11-377, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Change Of Registered Office Or Registered Agent By A Foreign Nonprofit Corporation; To Repeal Section 79-11-379, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Or The Resignation Of A Foreign Nonprofit Corporation's Registered Agent; To Repeal Section 79-15-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires That A Foreign Investment Trust Maintain A Registered Office And Registered Agent Within The State; To Repeal Section 79-15-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Change Or Resignation Of Registered Office Or Registered Agent By A Foreign Investment Trust; To Repeal Section 79-15-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Service Of Process Upon A Foreign Investment Trust; To Repeal Section 79-16-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires That A Foreign Business Trust Maintain A Registered Office And Registered Agent Within The State; To Repeal Section 79-16-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Change Or Resignation Of Registered Office Or Registered Agent By A Foreign Business Trust; To Repeal Section 79-16-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Service Of Process Upon A Foreign Business Trust; To Repeal Section 79-29-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires That A Limited Liability Company Maintain A Registered Office And Registered Agent Within The State; To Repeal Section 79-29-125, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Service Of Process Upon A Limited Liability Company; And For Related Purposes.

2339.title: Counties; authorize to acquire cell phones for Wildlife, Fisheries and Parks' officers.
2339.description: An Act To Authorize County Boards Of Supervisors To Acquire Cellular Phones Which May Be Used By The Enforcement Officers Of The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks, And To Pay The Monthly Bill For The Cellular Phones Out Of The County General Fund Or Any Other Appropriate Funds; And For Related Purposes.

2340.title: Malicious prosecution; define as an intentional common-law tort.
2340.description: An Act To Create New Section 95-1-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Common-law-intentional Tort Of Malicious Prosecution; And For Related Purposes.

2341.title: Retired teachers; may draw retirement benefits and be reemployed as teachers if they have 30 years of creditable service.
2341.description: An Act To Create New Section 25-11-126, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Persons Receiving A Retirement Allowance From The Public Employees' Retirement System Who Are Employed As Teachers In The Public School System After Their Retirement, And Certain Persons Employed As Teachers In The Public School System Who Are Eligible To Receive A Retirement Allowance From The Public Employees' Retirement System, May Receive A Retirement Allowance During Their Employment As Teachers In Addition To Receiving A Teacher's Salary; To Provide That Those Persons Shall Not Be Contributing Members Of The Retirement System Nor Receive Any Creditable Service For The Period During Which They Receive A Retirement Allowance During Their Employment As Teachers; To Amend Sections 25-11-103, 25-11-105 And 25-11-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity With The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2342.title: Local system roads; allow portion of state aid allocated to counties to be used to retire debt for.
2342.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-18-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Amount Of State Aid Road Allocation Of A County For Use In The Construction, Reconstruction Or Paving Of Local System Roads To Be Utilized For The Retirement Of Any Debt Incurred By The County For Use On Local System Roads; To Amend Sections 65-18-11 And 65-9-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2343.title: Chancery clerks; authorize, upon request, the redaction of social security numbers on recorded documents.
2343.description: An Act To Authorize Chancery Clerks, Upon Request, To Redact The Social Security Number From Any Recorded Document, If The Records Are Stored In A Manner That Permits Redaction And If The Request Specifically Identifies The Record Sought To Be Redacted; And For Related Purposes.

2344.title: Unemployment compensation; increase the minimum weekly benefit.
2344.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-5-503, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Minimum Amount Of The Weekly Benefit Paid To Individuals As Unemployment Compensation Under The Mississippi Employment Security Law; To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Unemployment Compensation Benefit Provision; And For Related Purposes.

2345.title: Board on Law Enforcement Standards and Training; revise qualification for certain officers.
2345.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-6-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Qualifications To Be Designated As A Law Enforcement Officer For Part-time Officers Having A Certain Level Of Experience; And For Related Purposes.

2346.title: Sixteenth section school land; limit rent increases on farm-residential land.
2346.description: An Act To Amend Sections 29-3-63 And 29-3-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Annual Rental For Sixteenth Section School Land Classified As Farm-residential Land Shall Not Be Increased To An Amount Exceeding 5% Of The Current Market Value Of Agricultural Land In The County In Which The Lease Is Located; And For Related Purposes.

2347.title: Appropriations; tobacco litigation funds, supplemental health insurance for law enforcement; FY2012.
2347.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From The Health Care Expendable Fund To The Department Of Finance And Administration For The Purpose Of Paying For Supplemental Health Insurance For Law Enforcement Officers Employed By The State Of Mississippi Who Desire To Participate In An Optional Supplemental Health Insurance Program, For Fiscal Year 2012.

2348.title: Regional Alternative School Pilot Program (R.A.S.P.); authorize under Division of Youth Services.
2348.description: An Act To Create A "regional Alternative School Pilot Program (r.a.s.p.)" In Noxubee County Which Shall Be An Interdiction Residential Program For Children Grades 9 Through 12 Who Are Not Appropriate For Referral To Local Alternative School Programs; To Provide For The Administration Of Said Program By The Division Of Youth Services Of The Department Of Human Services; And For Related Purposes.

2349.title: School bus drivers; school districts may pay health insurance premium of retirees employed as school bus drivers.
2349.description: An Act To Authorize Public School Districts To Pay With Local Funds The Full Cost Of The Health Insurance Premiums For Retired Members Of The Public Employees' Retirement System Who Are Employed As School Bus Drivers By The School Districts; To Amend Section 25-11-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Any Retiree, Regardless Of Age, To Be Employed By A Public School District As A School Bus Driver And Draw A Retirement Allowance From The Public Employees' Retirement System If The Annual Compensation For Such Employment Does Not Exceed $10,000.00 Per Year; And For Related Purposes.

2350.title: Tuition-free attendance at any state IHL or community college; authorize for Mississippi residents age 65 or over.
2350.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Mississippi Resident Age 65 Or Over Shall Be Eligible For A Scholarship Equal To The Full Cost Of Tuition At Any State Institution Of Higher Learning Or Public Community College; To Provide That Such Waiver Shall Be Administered Under The Mississippi Resident Tuition Assistance Grant Program (mtag); And For Related Purposes.

2351.title: Gaming; create statewide lottery to fund Hope College Scholarship Program.
2351.description: An Act To Create A State Lottery; To Provide That The State Lottery Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission Regarding The State Lottery; To Provide For The Disposition Of Proceeds Received From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; To Create The Trust Fund Into Which A Portion Of The Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited; To Amend Sections 37-106-5, 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; And For Related Purposes.

2352.title: Concealed weapons; remove prohibition against carrying in certain places.
2352.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete Any Prohibition Against Carrying A Concealed Weapon Into Certain Places Or In Certain Situations By A Person Holding A Concealed Weapon Permit; To Amend Sections 45-9-53 And 97-37-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2353.title: State budget; exclude state veterans home patient rates from budget cuts.
2353.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-104-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Rates For Patient Care Established By The Mississippi Veterans Affairs Board Shall Not Be Considered Special Funds And Shall Be Exempt From State Budgetary Reductions; And For Related Purposes.

2354.title: Sidearm; allow district attorneys and certain staff to retain upon retirement (MPA).
2354.description: An Act To Permit Retention Of One Service-issued Sidearm Upon Retirement By District Attorneys, Assistant District Attorneys And Criminal Investigators Of District Attorneys; And For Related Purposes.

2355.title: Nathan's law; increase penalty for unlawful passing of school bus.
2355.description: An Act To Create "nathan's Law"; To Amend Section 63-3-615, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Offense Of Passing A School Bus When Stopped To Load Or Unload Students And To Revise The Penalty Therefor; To Require The State Department Of Education To Develop Curriculum Guidelines For School Bus Safety; To Amend Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Use Of Wireless Communication Devices By Bus Drivers; To Amend Section 97-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Section 63-1-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Driver's License Examination Requirements To Ensure Coverage Thereon Of School Bus Safety Issues; To Authorize Cameras On School Bus Stop Arms; To Authorize The Departments Of Transportation And Education To Conduct A Public Education Campaign On School Bus Safety; And For Related Purposes.

2357.title: Judicial procedure; clarify setting of bail in municipal court.
2357.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-23-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Judicial Procedures By Which Bail Is Set In Municipal Court And That Bail Set In Municipal Court Is Payable To The Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

2358.title: Child abuse and neglect; revise persons with a duty to inform (AG).
2358.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-353, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The List Of People With A Duty To Inform Of Suspected Child Abuse Or Neglect; And For Related Purposes.

2359.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act; revise forfeiture under.
2359.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-176, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Forfeiture Of Property Other Than Controlled Substances Under The Uniform Controlled Substances Act; To Amend Section 41-29-181, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Inform The Code Publisher Of Certain Nonsubstantive Language That Should Be Revised; To Bring Forward Section 41-29-185, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2361.title: Unemployment compensation benefits; eliminate one-week waiting period for eligibility.
2361.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-5-511, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Until July 1, 2013, The One-week Waiting Period Required For Eligibility For Unemployment Compensation Benefits Shall Be Eliminated; And For Related Purposes.

2362.title: Traffic safety violator course; may be an Internet course.
2362.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-9-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Internet Courses May Be Approved By Courts For Traffic Safety Violator Courses To Qualify For Nonadjudication Of Certain Traffic Offenses; And For Related Purposes.

2363.title: Expunction of felony offenses; clarify filing fee for petition.
2363.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-72, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Fee To Be Charged For The Expunction Of Certain Felony Convictions; And For Related Purposes.

2364.title: Sheriffs; bring forward law relating to annual salaries of.
2364.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 25-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Relating To The Annual Salaries Of Sheriffs, For Purpose Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2365.title: Pearl River Valley Water Supply District; add two board members from the City of Jackson.
2365.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-9-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Governor Shall Appoint Two Members From The City Of Jackson To Serve On The Board Of Directors Of The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District From A List Of Six Names Submitted By The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson; And For Related Purposes.

2367.title: Drug violations; enhance penalties when children under 18 are present.
2367.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Potential Punishment For Certain Drug Violations In Cases Where A Child Under The Age Of 18 Is Present During The Violation; And For Related Purposes.

2368.title: Coroners; allow to carry a concealed weapon without a permit.
2368.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Coroners To Carry A Concealed Weapon Without A Permit; And For Related Purposes.

2369.title: Sidearm; allow district attorneys and certain staff to retain upon retirement.
2369.description: An Act To Permit Retention Of One Service-issued Sidearm Upon Retirement By District Attorneys, Assistant District Attorneys, And Criminal Investigators Of District Attorneys; And For Related Purposes.

2370.title: Circuit Court Community Corrections Act of 2010; clarify discretionary nature of.
2370.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-7-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Pilot Community Corrections Programs Are Discretionary With The Senior Circuit Judge; And For Related Purposes.

2371.title: Local law enforcement officers; authorize supplemental pay for certain.
2371.description: An Act To Authorize Extra Compensation For Commissioned Full-time Law Enforcement Officers Employed In Actually Performing Direct Law Enforcement Duties; To Specify The Amount Of The Extra Compensation; To Set Parameters For Eligibility For The Extra Compensation; To Authorize State Reimbursement Of Costs Associated With The Application For Certification By Law Enforcement Agencies; And For Related Purposes.

2372.title: County board of education is levying authority for all school districts in county school system; provide.
2372.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-57-1, 37-57-104, 37-57-105 And 37-61-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The County Board Of Education Shall Be The Ad Valorem Tax Levying Authority For Any School District Which Is In The County School System; And For Related Purposes.

2373.title: Judicial elections; provide procedure to be followed when the only candidate for a judicial office dies, resigns or is disqualified.
2373.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-977, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Procedures To Be Followed In The Event Only One Person Has Qualified As A Candidate For A Judicial Office And That Person Dies, Resigns Or Is Otherwise Disqualified From Holding That Office Prior To The General Election; To Amend Section 23-15-365, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2374.title: Convicted felons; clarify prohibition against possession of knife.
2374.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Restriction Against The Possession Of Certain Knives By A Convicted Felon; And For Related Purposes.

2375.title: Controlled substances; acquiring by theft, fraud and the like.
2375.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-144, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Prohibited Acts In Obtaining Possession Of A Controlled Substance Or Legend Drug By Theft, Fraud And The Like; And For Related Purposes.

2376.title: Marriage and Family Therapy and Social Worker Licensure Act; delete repealer and make technical amendments.
2376.description: An Act Relating To The Licensure Of Social Workers And Marriage And Family Therapists; To Amend Sections 73-53-1, 73-53-3 And 73-53-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions Applicable To The Licensure Of Social Workers; To Amend Section 73-53-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Requirement For Licensure As A Prerequisite To The Performance Of Social Work Services; To Amend Sections 73-53-8, 73-53-10 And 73-53-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe The Duties And Responsibilities Of The Board Of Examiners For Social Workers And Marriage And Family Therapists; To Amend Section 73-53-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Qualifications For Licensure As A Social Worker; To Amend Section 73-53-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Term Of A Social Worker License And To Authorize Fees For Licensure And Renewal; To Amend Sections 73-53-17, 73-53-19, 73-53-21, 73-53-23, 73-53-25 And 73-53-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Grounds For Disciplinary Action By The Board, Prescribe Complaint Procedures, Prescribe Investigative Procedures, Prescribe Procedures For Disciplinary Hearings, Provide Sanctions Available To The Board In Disciplinary Matters, And Clarify The Authority Of The Court To Order Production Of Evidence Before The Board In Disciplinary Hearings; To Reenact Sections 73-53-29 And 73-53-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Reenact Sections 73-54-1 Through 73-54-13, 73-54-17 Through 73-54-23 And 73-54-27 Through 73-54-39, And Sections 73-53-3, 73-53-8, 73-53-10, 73-53-11 And 73-53-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Amend Sections 73-54-5, 73-54-7, 73-54-11, 73-54-13, 73-54-17, 73-54-27, 73-54-29, 73-54-37 And 73-54-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Licensed Marriage And Family Therapy Associates; To Amend Section 73-54-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Exempt Conduct; To Amend Sections 73-54-19 And 73-54-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Administration Of The National Examination Of Marital And Family Therapy; To Repeal Sections 73-54-15 And 73-54-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Qualifications For License Applicants Prior To 2000; To Repeal Section 73-54-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is The Automatic Repealer On The Marriage And Family Therapy Licensure Act And Which Create And Empower The Board Of Examiners For Social Workers And Marriage And Family Therapists; And For Related Purposes.

2377.title: Retirement; revise amount that disability retiree may earn from gainful employment.
2377.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Amount That A Disability Retiree Who Is Engaged In A Gainful Occupation May Be Paid Without A Reduction In His Disability Benefit; And For Related Purposes.

2378.title: Distinctive license tag for Afghanistan service; exempt from pre-purchase requirements.
2378.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-44, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Special Motor Vehicle License Tag Authorized To Be Issued To Mississippians Who Receive Certain Medals For Service In Or In Support Of Operations In Afghanistan Shall Be Exempt From The Requirement That Proof Must Be Submitted To The Department Of Revenue That A Certain Number Of Such Tags Will Be Purchased And That The Amount Necessary To Purchase Such Tags Must Be Deposited With The Department Within Three Years After The Effective Date Of The Law Authorizing The Tag; And For Related Purposes.

2379.title: Elections; prescribe minimum number of OMR ballots that must be printed & voting machines & DRE units that must be utilized at elections.
2379.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-423, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For Each Primary Or General Election, The Officials In Charge Of The Election Shall Utilize At Least 75% Of All The Voting Machines Available To The County Or Municipality, As The Case May Be; To Amend Section 23-15-513, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In Primary Or General Elections Conducted Using Optical Mark Reading Equipment, The Number Of Official Ballots That Shall Be Printed Shall Be A Number That Is Equal To Not Less Than 75% Of The Registered Voters Eligible To Vote In The Election; To Amend Sections 23-15-531.4 And 23-15-531.6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In Primary Or General Elections Conducted Using Direct Recording Electronic Voting Equipment (dre), The Officials In Charge Of The Election Shall Utilize At Least 75% Of All The Dre Units That Are Available To The County Or Municipality, As The Case May Be; And For Related Purposes.

2380.title: Circuit clerks; authorize fee for the docketing and filing of a Notice of Renewal of Judgment.
2380.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Circuit Clerks To Charge A Fee For The Docketing And Filing Of A Notice Of Renewal Of Judgment; And For Related Purposes.

2381.title: Child Protection Act; enact.
2381.description: An Act To Provide For The Mandatory Reporting Of Sexual Crimes Against Minors; To Create A Civil Action For Failure To Make A Mandatory Report Of Abuse; To Provide For The Retaining Of The Dna Of A Fetus For The Purpose Of Documenting The Perpetrator Of A Sex Crime Against A Minor; To Create A Civil Action For Causing, Aiding Or Assisting A Minor To Obtain An Abortion; And For Related Purposes.

2382.title: Trauma Care Systems Fund; exempt certain golf carts from fee imposed for.
2382.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-17-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Golf Carts With A Maximum Speed Of Less Than 20 Miles Per Hour From The Point-of-sale Fee That Is Levied On All-terrain Vehicles And Motorcycles For Deposit Into The Mississippi Trauma Care Systems Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2383.title: Motor vehicles; authorize the operation of low-speed electric vehicles on certain public roads.
2383.description: An Act To Authorize The Operation Of Certain Low-speed Four-wheeled Electric Vehicles On Public Roads And Streets On Which The Posted Speed Limit Is 35 Miles Per Hour Or Less; To Provide That Such Vehicles May Be Operated On Such Public Roads And Streets Only By The Holder Of A Valid Driver's License; To Authorize Counties, Municipalities And The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Prohibit The Operation Of Such Vehicles Upon Streets Under Their Jurisdiction If Such Prohibition Is In The Interest Of Safety; To Amend Section 27-19-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make It Clear That Such Vehicles Are Included Within The Definition Of The Term "motor Vehicle" Under The Laws Governing The Privilege Taxation And Licensing Of Motor Vehicles; And For Related Purposes.

2384.title: Memorial highway; designate a certain segment of I-59 as "Mississippi Gold Star Memorial Highway."
2384.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Interstate 59 As The "mississippi Gold Star Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

2385.title: "Mississippi" by Danny Wayne Purcell; designate as official Country Music Song of Mississippi.
2385.description: An Act To Designate The Song "mississippi" By Danny Wayne Purcell As The Official State Country Music Song Of Mississippi.

2386.title: Public Service Commission; shall have jurisdiction over rates for electricity provided by TVA directly to industrial customers.
