2386.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Public Service Commission Shall Not Have Jurisdiction To Regulate The Rates For Wholesale Electric Services By The Tennessee Valley Authority To Cooperative Electric Power Associations, Except For Services Provided By The Tennessee Valley Authority Directly To Industrial Customers In This State; And For Related Purposes.

2387.title: School district trustees in special municipal school district embracing entire county; change qualifying date requirement.
2387.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-711, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Qualifying Date Requirement For School Board Trustees In Certain Special Municipal Separate School Districts Embracing An Entire County; And For Related Purposes.

2388.title: Domestic abuse; Protective Order Registry to be checked before granting bail on another charge.
2388.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-5-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Judges To Check The Attorney General's Protective Order Registry Before Granting Bail On Certain Other Charges; To Bring Forward Section 99-5-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2389.title: Concealed weapon; authorize carrying in church with permit.
2389.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Carrying Of A Concealed Weapon In A Church By Permit Holders; And For Related Purposes.

2391.title: Highway patrol officer; revise minimum qualifications.
2391.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-3-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Minimum Qualifications For Members Of The Highway Safety Patrol; To Amend Section 45-3-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2392.title: Uniform traffic ticket; revise responsibility for devising form and accounting for copies.
2392.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-9-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Duties Of The State Auditor With Regard To The Uniform Traffic Ticket Law; To Give Additional Responsibility To The Commissioner Of Public Safety, Including The Decision As To The Number And Distribution Of The Ticket Forms, Where Filed, And What Information Is To Be Reported By Court Clerks; And For Related Purposes.

2394.title: Hunting rights on sixteenth section school land; local school board may hold an auction on leases for.
2394.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-3-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Local School Board Is Authorized To Reject Bids For Hunting And Fishing Rights On Sixteenth Section School Land And Hold An Auction Among Those Who Submitted Bids; And For Related Purposes.

2395.title: Criminal convictions; judge to explain to convict whether he remains a qualified elector.
2395.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Judge To Explain To Every Person Convicted Of A Felony Whether He Remains A Qualified Elector Upon Sentencing; And For Related Purposes.

2396.title: Licensed school employees; allow use of personal leave near holiday if summoned by court.
2396.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow A Licensed School Employee To Use Personal Leave On The First/last Day Of A School Term And The Day Before/after A Holiday, If The Employee Is Summoned To Appear For Jury Duty Or As A Witness In Court On Such Days; And For Related Purposes.

2397.title: Smoking in all public places; prohibit.
2397.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Uniform Smoke-free Public Place Act Of 2011"; To Prohibit Smoking In Public Places; To Provide For Definitions; To Prohibit Smoking In Certain Public Places And Areas; To Prohibit Smoking In Any Indoor Or Outdoor Public Facility In Mississippi During Any Time That Persons Under 18 Years Of Age Are Engaged In An Organized Athletic Event In The Facility; To Provide For Exceptions; To Provide For Posting Of Signs And Removal Of Ashtrays; To Provide For An Informational Program; To Provide For Enforcement By The State Department Of Health; To Provide That Violations Of Smoking Prohibition Are Punishable By Civil Penalty; To Provide That This Prohibition Supercedes Local Ordinances; To Amend Sections 29-5-160, 29-5-161 And 29-5-163, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Enforcement And Penalty Provisions Of This Act Shall Be Applicable To The Statutes Prohibiting Smoking In Government Buildings, To Provide That Prohibitions On Smoking In Government Buildings Are Applicable To Government-owned Vehicles And To Provide That Prohibitions On Smoking In University Or College Buildings Are Applicable To Private Universities And Colleges; To Amend Section 97-32-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Smoking In All Private School Buildings And Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2398.title: Income tax; increase credit for ad valorem tax paid on inventory.
2398.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-22.5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Income Tax Credit For Ad Valorem Taxes Paid By Taxpayers On Certain Inventory; To Include Raw Materials Or Works-in-process In The Type Of Inventory Covered By The Credit; To Provide That Beginning With The 2013 Taxable Year A Taxpayer May Claim A Percentage Of The Ad Valorem Taxes That He Pays On Inventory For The Credit; To Increase The Percentage Amount Of Ad Valorem Taxes Paid By The Taxpayer That May Be Claimed For Such Credit Each Taxable Year For Five Taxable Years Until Such Time As The Entire Amount Of Ad Valorem Tax Paid On Inventory By The Taxpayer May Be Utilized For Such Credit; To Provide That The Taxpayer Shall Be Eligible For A Payment From The State In The Amount That The Ad Valorem Tax Credit Exceeds The Amount Of Income Tax Due The State In The Calendar Year In Which The Credit Is Claimed; And For Related Purposes.

2399.title: Alcoholic beverages, light wine and beer permits; suspend or revoke for the discharge of a firearm on the premises.
2399.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That On-premises Retailer's Permits Issued Under The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law May Be Revoked Or Suspended For The Discharge Of A Firearm On The Premises That Is Reported To Law Enforcement Authorities; To Amend Section 67-3-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Revenue To Revoke Or Suspend The Light Wine And Beer Permit Of Any Permit Holder Who Sells Light Wine Or Beer For Consumption On The Licensed Premises If The Discharge Of A Firearm On The Premises Is Reported To Law Enforcement Authorities; And For Related Purposes.

2400.title: Noise abatement; revise offense of noise disturbance.
2400.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-35-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of Noise Disturbance; And For Related Purposes.

2402.title: Motor carriers/shipper indemnity contracts; create study committee.
2402.description: An Act To Create The Motor Carriers And Shippers Contractual Indemnity Study Committee To Conduct A Study Of Indemnity Provisions In Transportation Services Contracts Between Motor Carriers And Shippers And To Make Recommendations Of Proposed Legislation; To Provide For The Membership Of The Study Committee And Its Powers And Duties; And For Related Purposes.

2403.title: Wildlife; prohibits nonresidents from hunting in second season of hunting deer with guns and dogs in the Homochitto Nat'l. Forest.
2403.description: An Act To Prohibit Nonresidents From Hunting Deer With Guns And With Dogs During The Second Season Of Hunting Deer With Guns And With Dogs On The Homochitto National Forest Lands; And For Related Purposes.

2404.title: Hunting; require a gun to be enclosed in a case when transported on a public road.
2404.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-15-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Gun To Be Enclosed In A Case When Being Transported On A Public Road; And For Related Purposes.

2405.title: Elections; allow mileage to receiving and returning managers.
2405.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-227, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If A Manager Or Other Person Utilizes A Privately Owned Motor Vehicle To Transport Certain Necessities Required For The Election To Or From The Place Of Voting, He Shall Be Reimbursed For Mileage Traveled In Excess Of Ten Miles In Carrying Out This Duty; And For Related Purposes.

2406.title: Managers of election; require to attend training courses annually.
2406.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-239, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Managers Of Election To Attend Annual Training Courses; To Provide That Such Training Courses May Last Up To Eight Hours; And For Related Purposes.

2407.title: Election commissioners; provide that the office shall be nonpartisan.
2407.description: An Act To Provide That The Office Of Election Commissioner Is A Nonpartisan Office; To Provide That The Names Of Candidates For The Office Of Election Commissioner Shall Be Listed As Nonpartisan; To Amend Sections 23-15-213 And 23-15-367, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2408.title: Secretary of State; authorize to convey certain buildings in Jackson County to United States Coast Guard.
2408.description: An Act Authorizing The Secretary Of State To Convey And Transfer Certain State-owned Property In Jackson County, Mississippi, To The United States Of America For The Use And Occupancy Of The United States Coast Guard; And For Related Purposes.

2409.title: State Advisory Panel on Special Education; revise membership and duties.
2409.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-23-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The Mississippi State Advisory Panel On Special Education And Prescribe Its Duties; And For Related Purposes.

2410.title: Students with disabilities; revise complaint procedures to supply parents with response information.
2410.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-23-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Complaint Procedures To Require That Parents Of Students With Disabilities Shall Receive Certain Response Information; And For Related Purposes.

2411.title: Wildlife; allow mentally handicapped persons to hunt during special youth season and exempt from license requirements.
2411.description: An Act To Allow Mentally Handicapped Persons To Hunt During Any Special Youth Season Established By The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks; To Exempt Those Persons From Obtaining A License; And For Related Purposes.

2412.title: Schools at-risk of failing; revise procedures and sanctions under school district conservatorship law.
2412.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Department Of Education May Take Certain Corrective Action In School Districts Where An Emergency Has Been Declared Due To The Majority Of Schools In The District Under At-risk Status For Any One Year; To Amend Sections 37-18-3 And 37-18-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Responsibilities Of The State Department Of Education Relative To Evaluating School At-risk Data And To Delete The Specific Membership Requirements For A Local Parent/citizen Advisory Council As Part Of The At-risk School Evaluation Process; To Amend Section 37-18-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Sanctions To Be Imposed By The Conservator In Schools Under At-risk Status; To Delete The Requirement That Professional Development Plans Be Developed For Certain Teachers, Principals, School District Administrative Office Personnel, And Superintendents In Need Of Improvement Based Upon The Length Of Time The School Has Been Under At-risk Status; To Delete The Authority Of The State Board Of Education To Request The Removal Or A Referendum To Remove The Members Of The School Board Of A School District Which Has Been Under At-risk Status For Three Years; To Delete The Requirement That The State Department Of Education Make A Semiannual Report To The State Board Of Education On Schools At-risk; To Delete The Requirement That The State Board Of Education Provide Staff Development Training; To Delete The Requirement That The State Board Of Education Provide A Legislative Report On Schools At-risk; And For Related Purposes.

2413.title: Wildlife; regulate deer-breeding farms.
2413.description: An Act To Regulate Deer-breeding Farms; To Require Deer-breeding Farms To Be Licensed; To Authorize The State Veterinarian To Regulate Deer-breeding Farms And To Establish License Fees; To Establish Requirements For The Operation Of Deer-breeding Farms; To Allow The Importation Of Farm-raised White-tailed Deer, Semen, Ova And Embryos From States And Herds That Are Certified Free Of Chronic Wasting Disease; To Require Electronic Tagging System For Farm-raised White-tailed Deer; To Provide Penalties For Violations; To Amend Section 49-7-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 49-7-58.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Penalty For Regulation Violations; To Provide That Chapter 7 Of Title 49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Does Not Apply To Farm-raised White-tailed Deer Or To Deer-breeding Farms; And For Related Purposes.

2415.title: Central business functions; payroll and purchases for all state agencies; establish DFA Office of Shared Services.
2415.description: An Act To Establish An Office Of Shared Services (oss) In The Department Of Finance And Administration; To Provide That Beginning On July 1, 2011, The Office Of Shared Services Shall Establish A Central Business Office For All State Agencies In The State To Provide Shared Business Services; To Require The Office Of Shared Services To Develop A Transition Plan To Phase-in These Services Prior To July 1, 2015; To Require State Agencies To Comply With The Plan; To Authorize Fees For Services; To Amend Section 27-104-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 25-9-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Employees And Service Functions Of The Office Of Shared Services Shall Be Exempt From State Service Until July 1, 2015; And For Related Purposes.

2416.title: School district conservator/financial advisor; remove from requirements of Personal Service Contract Review Board.
2416.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Contracts For A School District Conservator Or Financial Advisor From The Rules And Regulations Of The Personal Service Contract Review Board; And For Related Purposes.

2417.title: Mississippi Pawnshop Act; make various amendments.
2417.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-67-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "pawnbroker" As Used In The Mississippi Pawnshop Act; To Amend Section 75-67-305, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Information Required To Be Recorded On Pawn Tickets At The Time Of Making A Pawn Or Purchase Transaction For Firearms; To Amend Section 75-67-321, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fee For A Pawnbroker License; To Amend Section 75-67-323, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Applicant Shall Not Have Been Convicted Of A Felony To Be Eligible For A Pawnbroker License; To Amend Section 75-67-327, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Application Process For The Transfer Of Existing Licenses; To Amend Section 75-67-333, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Notice And Hearing Requirement Before Imposing A Civil Penalty Against Licensees And To Deposit Civil Penalties Into The Consumer Finance Fund Of The Department Of Banking And Consumer Finance; To Amend Section 75-67-341, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Banking To Charge An Examination Fee; To Create A New Section To Provide Liability Protections For Licensees For Acts Done Or Ommitted In Conformity With Rules Or Regulations Of The Commissioner Of Banking Or Any Other State Or Federal Agency; To Repeal Section 75-67-339, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides A Time Limit For Existing Pawnbrokers In Business On July 1, 1993, To Apply For And Receive A License; And For Related Purposes.

2419.title: Parental choice for assignment of twins to class; delete repealer.
2419.description: An Act To Reenact Section 37-11-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, And To Amend Section 2 Of Chapter 484, Laws Of 2009, To Delete The Automatic Repealer On The Provision Allowing Parental Choice For The Placement Of Twins In The Same Or In Separate Classrooms; To Amend Section 37-43-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Local School Boards To Offer Surplus Inventory Textbooks To Parents Or Guardians Of Students Residing In The School District; And For Related Purposes.

2422.title: Commissioner of Banking; authorize to disclose certain regulatory information to other government agencies.
2422.description: An Act To Amend Section 81-1-89, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance To Disclose Certain Regulatory Information To Additional Government Agencies; To Amend Section 81-18-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Correct An Incorrect Reference In The Exemptions To The Mississippi Mortgage Consumer Protection Law; And For Related Purposes.

2423.title: Commissioner of Banking; may require consumer industry licensees to participate in a multistate licensing system.
2423.description: An Act To Authorize The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance To Require Consumer Industry Licensees Regulated By His Agency To Participate In A Multistate Licensing System; And For Related Purposes.

2425.title: Immigration Reform Act of 2011; enact.
2425.description: An Act To Create The Immigration Reform Act Of 2011; To Amend Sections 63-1-60 And 45-35-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enhance The Penalty For Creation Or Use Of False Identification If The Offender Is An Illegal Alien; To Create A New Crime Of Transporting An Illegal Alien; To Provide For Cooperative Law Enforcement By State And Local Law Enforcement Agencies On Immigration Matters; To Require Verification Of Citizenship Or Immigration Status Of Persons Who Are Arrested; To Prohibit Official Resistance Or Noncooperation Of Sharing Information Regarding Immigration Status; And For Related Purposes.

2426.title: Authorize Tunica County; authorize contribution to Institute of Community Services, Inc.
2426.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Institute Of Community Services, Inc., To Assist The Institute In Establishing And Operating Head Start Classes For Children In Tunica County, To Acquire, Operate And Maintain New And Existing Vehicles To Be Used To Transport The Children To And From The Head Start Facility And To Provide Day Care Vouchers For Parents; And For Related Purposes.

2427.title: Controlled substances; enhance penalty for illegal sale in proximity to drug rehab facility.
2427.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-142, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Enhancement Of Penalties For The Sale Of Drugs Within 1500 Feet Of A Drug Or Alcohol Treatment Or Rehabilitation Facility; And For Related Purposes.

2428.title: Indecent assault; create crime of unlawful sexual touching.
2428.description: An Act To Create New Section 97-3-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Crime Of Indecent Assault Against A Person Of Any Age If Done Without Consent; And For Related Purposes.

2429.title: DNA testing; revise in context of post-conviction relief.
2429.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-49-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Post-conviction Dna Testing Of Prisoners, Create A Short Title And Statement Of Purpose Therefor, And To Revise Definitions; To Create New Section 99-49-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Filing Of A Motion For Post-conviction Dna Testing; To Create New Sections 99-49-103 And 99-49-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose Certain Requirements On The Filing Of Such A Motion; To Create New Section 99-49-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Circumstances Under Which Such A Motion May Be Filed; To Create New Section 99-49-109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Filing Of Such A Motion In Certain Cases; To Create New Section 99-49-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Procedure For Consideration Of A Motion Under The Act; To Create New Section 99-49-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Filing Of A Motion Under The Act Constitutes Consent For Obtaining A Dna Sample Which May Be Entered Into Databases; Constitutes Waiver Of Any Statute Of Limitations On Any Additional Crimes In Which The Movant May Be Implicated By The Analysis Of His Dna; And To Specify In What Was Test Results Shall Be Disseminated; To Create New Section 99-49-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Consent To Dna Testing And For Maintaining A Dna Database; To Create New Section 99-49-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Allocation Of Costs; To Amend Sections 99-39-5, 99-39-7, 99-39-9, 99-39-11 And 99-39-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2430.title: Ad valorem school taxes; exempt publication requirement if no increase in ad valorem tax effort in dollars is proposed.
2430.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-39-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Required Newspaper Publication For The School Board's Annual Ad Valorem Tax Assessment For The Support Of The School District Shall Not Be Required If No Increase In Ad Valorem Tax Effort In Dollars Is Proposed; And For Related Purposes.

2431.title: Long-arm statute; revise completion of service of process.
2431.description: An Act To Amend Section 13-3-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Service Of Process That Is Mailed Under The Automobile Collision Long-arm Statute Shall Be Complete Upon Filing Of Evidence That The Mail Was Not Able To Be Delivered Due To Actions Taken Or Not Taken By The Defendant; And For Related Purposes.

2432.title: Voter registration; authorize person to apply online.
2432.description: An Act To Authorize Persons Eligible To Vote In This State Who Possess A Current And Valid Mississippi Driver's License Or Identification Card To Submit Voter Registration Applications Through A Secure Internet Web Site Established By The Secretary Of State; To Allow Persons Who Are Registered To Vote To Update Their Voter Registration Information Using Such Web Site; To Provide That Such Applications Shall Be Forwarded Electronically To The Department Of Public Safety And The Department Shall Compare The Information Submitted By The Applicant With The Information Maintained In The Department's Database Listing Individuals Who Possess A Current And Valid Mississippi Driver's License Or Identification Card And, If The Department Of Public Safety Determines That The Applicant Is Eligible To Submit An Online Application, The Department Shall Electronically Forward The Application And Certain Other Information To The Secretary Of State; To Provide That The Secretary Of State Shall Forward The Application And Additional Information Received From The Department Of Public Safety To The Registrar Of The County In Which The Applicant Currently Resides; To Provide Procedures By Which The County Registrar Shall Process Such Applications; To Amend Section 23-15-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2433.title: Motorcycle Operator Safety Program; establish.
2433.description: An Act To Enact A Motorcycle Safety Education Program; To Require The Department Of Public Safety To Establish And Operate A Motorcycle Safety And Operator Training Program For The Purpose Of Motorcycle Operator Training And To Promote Motorcycle Safety And Motorcycle Awareness; To Establish Course Requirements; To Authorize The Commissioner Of Public Safety To Appoint A Statewide Motorcycle Safety Director To Administer The Program; To Prescribe The Qualifications Of The Director And The Program Instructors; To Establish A Motorcycle Safety And Operator Training Fund; To Amend Sections 27-19-5, 63-1-21 And 63-1-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase Certain Taxes And Fees To Fund The Program; And For Related Purposes.

2434.title: State employee wellness councils; state agencies shall allow employees to participate.
2434.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-97-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That State Agencies Shall Allow Employees To Participate In Wellness Council Activities; And For Related Purposes.

2435.title: Child support; authorize chancery judge to assess cost of confinement for person in jail for delinquent child support.
2435.description: An Act To Provide That A Chancery Judge May Assess A Delinquent Child Support Parent Serving Time For Contempt For The County's Cost Of Confinement; And For Related Purposes.

2436.title: Local school district budgets; require at least 75% to be expended for instructional purposes.
2436.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2011-2012 School Year The State Board Of Education Shall Require Each School District To Comply With The Financial Accountability And Reporting System Requirement That Not Less Than 75% Of School District Funds Shall Be Expended For Instructional Purposes; To Amend Sections 37-61-9 And 37-61-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Local School District Budgets To Contain A Detailed Statement Of The Estimated Amounts To Be Expended For Instruction And Other Program Budget Categories, And To Require School District Expenditures To Be Limited By The Said 75% Requirement And To Provide Personal Liability Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

2437.title: "Mississippi Accountability and Transparency Act"; define data to be maintained on searchable website.
2437.description: An Act To Revise And Clarify The "mississippi Accountability And Transparency Act Of 2008"; To Create New Section 27-104-152, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Declare Legislative Findings And Intent Regarding Public Access To The Details On State Expenditures Of Tax Dollars And Other State Funds And The Performance Results That Are Achieved For The Expenditures; To Amend Section 27-104-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Additional Terms Used Under The Act; To Amend Section 27-104-155, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Data That Is Required To Be Maintained On The Searchable Website Of The Department Of Finance And Administration That Includes Information On Expenditures Of State Funds And To Prescribe Additional Requirements For The Website; To Provide That The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning Shall Create The Ihl Accountability And Transparency Website No Later Than July 1, 2012; To Provide That The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges Shall Create The Community And Junior College Accountability And Transparency Website No Later Than July 1, 2012; To Amend Section 27-104-157, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Agencies To Provide The Department With Access To All Required Data Within 14 Days After The Data Becomes Available To The Agency; To Create New Section 27-104-158, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Auditor To Examine Agencies' Compliance With The Requirements Of The Act; To Amend Section 27-104-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Expenditures Of The Legislative Branch Shall Be Subject To The Provisions Of The Act; To Amend Section 25-61-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provision; And For Related Purposes.

2438.title: Homeschool students; authorize dual enrollment in public schools.
2438.description: An Act To Authorize Local School Districts To Dually Enroll Homeschool Students Under Certain Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

2439.title: Recall election procedures for local officials by referendum; specifically include local school board members.
2439.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-5-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add Local School Board Members To The Statutory Provisions For Calling A Recall Election By Referendum; And For Related Purposes.

2440.title: Career track program for students not pursuing baccalaureate degree; provide certain conditions.
2440.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-16-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Certain Conditions For High School Career Option Programs And Career Track Curricula For Students Not Wishing To Pursue A Baccalaureate Degree; And For Related Purposes.

2441.title: Children's Product Safety; create (AG).
2441.description: An Act To Create The Children's Product Safety Act; To Provide When A Children's Product Is Deemed Unsafe; To Require The Attorney General To Create, Maintain And Update A Comprehensive List Of Unsafe Children's Products; To Prohibit A Seller From Reselling Unsafe Children's Products; To Provide Penalties For Violation Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2442.title: Automatic school district transfer for children of military parents stationed in Mississippi; provide for.
2442.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-15-29 And 37-15-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Automatic Transfer Of School-age Children Whose Parents Are Members Of The United States Armed Forces Stationed In The State Of Mississippi To Another School District Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

2444.title: Toys; prohibit sale of those containing lead at toxic levels.
2444.description: An Act To Prohibit Sale Of Toys Containing Lead At Toxic Levels; And For Related Purposes.

2445.title: School buses; require new buses to be equipped with seatbelts.
2445.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Every School Bus That Is Purchased New After July 1, 2011, And Is Used To Transport Public School Students In Grades Prekindergarten Through Grade 12 Must Be Equipped With Seat Belts Meeting Applicable Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standards; To Amend Section 37-41-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Board Of Education To Adopt Rules And Regulations To Ensure That School Districts Require All Passengers To Wear These Belts Whenever The Bus Is In Motion; And For Related Purposes.

2446.title: Office of Capital Defense Counsel/Office of Indigent Appeals; merge into Office of State Public Defender.
2446.description: An Act To Consolidate The Office Of Capital Defense Counsel, The Office Of Indigent Appeals, And The Division Of Public Defender Training Into The Office Of State Public Defender; To Provide Administrative, Budgeting And Financial Services Support To The Office Of Capital Defense Counsel, The Office Of Indigent Appeals, And The Division Of Public Defender Training; To Amend Section 99-18-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Accomplish The Consolidation, To Coordinate The Collection And Dissemination Of Statistical Data Related To The Indigent Defense System, And To Develop Plans And Proposals For A Statewide Public Defender System In Coordination With The Mississippi Public Defender Task Force; To Amend Sections 99-18-3, 99-18-5, 99-18-7, 99-18-9, 99-18-11, 99-18-13, 99-18-15, 99-18-17 And 99-40-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Section 99-39-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Organization Of The Mississippi Office Of Capital Post-conviction Counsel; To Repeal Section 99-18-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That, Upon Determination Of Indigence, The Circuit Court May Appoint Local Counsel For The Purpose Of Defending Death-eligible Indigent Defendants At The Expense Of The Capital Defense Counsel Special Fund, And That Upon Determination Of Lack Of Competent Local Counsel, A State Defender May Be Appointed; And For Related Purposes.

2447.title: Mississippi Adequate Education Program; increase funding for at-risk pupils.
2447.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Allotment Of Mississippi Adequate Education Program Funding For At-risk Students; And For Related Purposes.

2448.title: School Employment Procedures Law; include assistant teachers under.
2448.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-9-103 And 37-9-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Assistant Teachers Shall Be Subject To The Same Procedures For Notification Of Nonreemployment Or Nonrenewal Of Contract As Other Licensed Teachers Under The School Employment Procedures Law; And For Related Purposes.

2449.title: Certified emergency telecommunicators; require continuing education for.
2449.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-355, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Continuing Education For Certified Emergency Telecommunicators; And For Related Purposes.

2451.title: Real estate transactions; require disclosure if meth production occurred on the property.
2451.description: An Act To Require A Seller Or Transferor Of Real Property To Disclose In Writing If, To His Knowledge, Methamphetamine Production Has Occurred On Habitable Property; To Declare Legislative Findings And Purpose Of The Act; To Define Certain Terms; To Establish A Decontamination Standard For Methamphetamine Inside Habitable Property Unless A Different Standard Is Adopted By The Department Of Environmental Quality; To Authorize The Department Of Environmental Quality To Establish By Rule The Minimum Standards For Training And Certification Of Contractors Who Perform Remediation Of The Property; To Require State And Local Law Enforcement Agencies To Report To The Department Of Environmental Quality Whenever Habitable Property Has Been Contaminated By Its Use As A Clandestine Methamphetamine Drug Lab; To Require The Department Of Environmental Quality To Maintain A List Of Habitable Properties That Have Been Reported As Contaminated; To Amend Section 89-1-527, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2452.title: Health care certificates of need; issue for construction of PRTF and child acute care beds in certain counties.
2452.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Issue A Certificate Of Need For The Construction Or Expansion Of 30 Psychiatric Residential Treatment (prtf) Beds In Rankin County, A Certificate Of Need For The Construction Or Expansion Of 30 Psychiatric Residential Treatment (prtf) Beds In Winston County, A Certificate Of Need For The Construction Or Expansion Of 30 Psychiatric Residential Treatment (prtf) Beds In Lauderdale County, A Certificate Of Need For The Construction Or Expansion Of 20 Child/adolescent Acute Care Beds In Lauderdale County, To Provide That Five Child/adolescent Acute Care Beds Authorized In Winston County Are Eligible For Participation In The Medicaid Program, And To Authorize 15 Child/adolescent Acute Care Beds In Rankin County; And For Related Purposes.

2453.title: State agency personnel; remove from certain State Personnel Board procedures.
2453.description: An Act To Amend Sections 25-9-127 And 25-9-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For A Period Of Two Years The Personnel Actions Of All State Agencies Subject To The Regulations Of The State Personnel Board Shall Be Exempt From State Personnel Board Procedures, And All Employees Of Such Agencies Shall Be Classified As Nonstate Service During That Period; And For Related Purposes.

2454.title: Arrest warrant; require probable cause hearing before issuance.
2454.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-3-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Probable Cause Hearing Upon A Criminal Affidavit Prior To Issuance Of Any Arrest Warrant; And For Related Purposes.

2455.title: Official state song; adopt "My Home Mississippi."
2455.description: An Act Adopting "my Home Mississippi" By Delma Furniss As The Official State Song; And For Related Purposes.

2456.title: Landlord tenant relations; require locks to be changed between residential tenancies.
2456.description: An Act To Amend Section 89-8-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Residential Landlords To Change The Locks Of Dwelling Units Between Tenants; And For Related Purposes.

2457.title: Motor vehicle license tags; require proof of citizenship or legal alien status to obtain.
2457.description: An Act To Require Proof That The Owner Of A Motor Vehicle Is A United States Citizen Or Alien Who Is Legally In This Country Before He May Receive Motor Vehicle License Tags; And For Related Purposes.

2458.title: Alcoholic beverages; qualified resort areas may be established in dry counties only after a countywide vote.
2458.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That From And After July 1, 2011, A Resort Area May Not Be Established In A County That Has Not Voted In Favor Of Coming Out From Under The Dry Law Unless An Election Is Held In The County On The Question Of Whether Qualified Resort Areas Shall Be Allowed In The County; And For Related Purposes.

2459.title: Institutions of higher learning; implement vehicle management system.
2459.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-101-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Implement A Vehicle Management System For The Individual Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Set Out The Board's Powers With Respect To The Implementation Of Such System; And For Related Purposes.

2460.title: Wildlife; prevent waste of migratory game birds when hunting from a boat in certain small streams.
2460.description: An Act To Prohibit The Waste Of Migratory Game Birds When Hunting From A Boat In Certain Streams; And For Related Purposes.

2461.title: Income tax credit; authorize for taxpayers who maintain, support and care for a dependent with a diagnosis of developmental disability.
2461.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit To Any Taxpayer In This State Who Is Maintaining, Supporting And Caring For A Dependent With A Diagnosis Of Developmental Disability In His Home; And For Related Purposes.

2463.title: Legal gaming; limit conduct to counties in which it is already being conducted.
2463.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-3-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Legal Gaming In Counties Other Than Those In Which Legal Gaming Is Being Conducted On The Effective Date Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2464.title: Charitable organizations; violations of the Charitable Bingo Law are also a violation of law requiring registration.
2464.description: An Act To Amend Section 79-11-505, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Charitable Organizations That Conduct Bingo Under The Charitable Bingo Law Shall Not Be Exempt From The Requirement That Charitable Organizations Must Register With The Secretary Of State; To Amend Section 79-11-509, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Deny, Suspend Or Revoke The Registration Of A Charitable Organization For Violations Of The Charitable Bingo Law; To Amend Section 79-11-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That It Shall Be A Violation Of The Law That Requires Charitable Organizations To Register With The Secretary Of State For A Registered Charitable Organization To Violate The Provisions Of The Charitable Bingo Law; And For Related Purposes.

2466.title: Radar; repeal requirements and restrictions.
2466.description: An Act To Repeal Section 63-3-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Specifies Certain Requirements For And Restrictions Upon The Purchase And Use Of Radar Speed Detection Equipment Upon Any Public Street, Road Or Highway Of This State; And For Related Purposes.

2467.title: Radar; authorize speed detection by all officers.
2467.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Any Law Enforcement Officer Authorized To Enforce Title 63 To Operate Radar Speed Detection Equipment; And For Related Purposes.

2468.title: Radar; revise entities authorized to operate.
2468.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Operation Of Radar By Various Law Enforcement Entities In Limited Situations; And For Related Purposes.

2469.title: Disabled veterans; increase for totally disabled veterans and extend to unremarried surviving spouses of such veterans.
2469.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-33-75 And 27-33-67, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Person Having A Service-connected, Total Disability As An American Veteran And Who Has Been Honorably Discharged From Military Service Shall Be Exempt From All Ad Valorem Taxes On The Assessed Value Of Homestead Property And To Extend Such Exemption To Unremarried Surviving Spouses Of Such American Veterans; And For Related Purposes.

2470.title: Corrections; prohibit trusty convicted of murder or any other crime of violence from working at Governor's Mansion.
2470.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-138.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Inmate In Trusty Status Who Was Convicted Of Murder Or Any Other Crime Of Violence Shall Not Be Allowed To Participate In Any Program At The Governor's Mansion; And For Related Purposed.

2471.title: Property insurance; prohibit hurricane deductible unless damages arose from a named storm.
2471.description: An Act To Prohibit The Application Of A Hurricane Deductible For Property Damage In Insurance Policies Unless The Damage Arose From A Named Hurricane Or Tropical Storm; To Provide Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2472.title: Major medical leave; MBN officers injured in the line of duty shall not be required to use.
2472.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-95, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Officer Of The Mississippi Bureau Of Narcotics Who Is Injured By Wound Or Accident In The Line Of Duty Shall Not Be Required To Use Earned Major Medical Leave During The Period Of Recovery From Such Injury; And For Related Purposes.

2473.title: Ad valorem taxes; revise advertising requirements when county proposes no millage increase.
2473.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-39-205, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Form And Content Of The Required Newspaper Advertisement When A County's Proposed Ad Valorem Tax Assessment For The Support Of The County Does Not Require Any Increase In Its Current Millage Rate; And For Related Purposes.

2474.title: Rating Bureau; shall use Fire Suppression Rating Schedule (FSRS) published by ISO when rating municipalities or districts.
2474.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-3-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Mississippi State Rating Bureau To Utilize The Fire Suppression Rating Schedule (fsrs), Or Its Successor, Published By Insurance Services Office, Inc., When Rating A Municipality Or Fire District; And For Related Purposes.

2475.title: Sex offense; revise definition (MPA).
2475.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-33-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of "sex Offense" For Purposes Of The Sex Offender Registration Act; And For Related Purposes.

2476.title: School term; revise first day and reduce length in all school districts.
2476.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Public School Terms Shall Open On The Tuesday Following Labor Day; To Amend Sections 37-13-63 And 37-151-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Minimum Length Of The School Term In All School Districts; And For Related Purposes.

2477.title: High school students suspended from extracurricular/athletic activity for failure to maintain certain grades; repeal.
2477.description: An Act To Repeal Section 37-11-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires Students In Grades 7 Through 12 To Be Suspended From Participation In Extracurricular Or Athletic Activity For Failure To Maintain A Certain Cumulative Grade Point Average; And For Related Purposes.

2478.title: Psychiatric residential treatment facility; allow all beds in facility in DeSoto County to participate in Medicaid.
2478.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That 40 Of The Beds In A Psychiatric Residential Treatment Facility Authorized Under A Certificate Of Need Issued To A Hospital In Desoto County May Participate In Medicaid; To Provide That Up To 52 Acute Child/adolescent Psychiatric Beds In A Hospital In Desoto County May Be Certified To Participate In Medicaid; And For Related Purposes.

2481.title: Sheriff of Tunica County; authorize additional salary supplement by board of supervisors.
2481.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of The Salary Supplement Which May Be Paid Annually By The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County To The Sheriff Of That County; And For Related Purposes.

2482.title: CON; authorize transfer of beds from Hancock County and new CON in Lamar County.
2482.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Health To Transfer And Relocate Nursing Facility Beds Formerly Licensed In Hancock County To Three Locations In Stone, Lamar And Hancock Counties; To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Health To Issue A Certificate Of Need For Nursing Facility Beds In Lamar County; And For Related Purposes.

2484.title: Tunica County; authorize contract with and/or contribute to Mid-State Opportunity, Inc.
2484.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Contract With And Donate Funds To Mid-state Opportunity, Incorporated; And For Related Purposes.

2485.title: Tunica County; authorize contribution to Aaron E. Henry Community Health Clinic, P.A.
2485.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Aaron E. Henry Community Health Clinic, Incorporated, And The G.a. Stover Health Clinic, P.a., For The Purpose Of Improving The Medical Care For The Residents Of Tunica County; And For Related Purposes.

2486.title: Memorial highways; designate segments of U.S. Highways as memorial highways.
2486.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Highway 49e As The "willye B. White Memorial Highway"; To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Highway 82 In Montgomery County As The "mr. & Mrs. E.h. Sumner Memorial Highway"; To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Highway 98 In George County As The "a.c. Hillman Highway"; To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Highway 72 In Alcorn County As The "william S. "seth" Ricketts Memorial Highway"; To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Highway 11 In Jones County As The "coach Sim Cooley Memorial Highway"; To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Highway 11 In Jones County As The "walter W. Jack, Jr., Memorial Highway"; To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Highway 82 In The City Of Starkville As The "jack Cristil Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

2487.title: Salaries of judges; increase/establish funding.
2487.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of The Justices Of The Supreme Court, Judges Of The Court Of Appeals, And Judges Of The Chancery And Circuit Courts; To Amend Section 25-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The General Docket Fee For Filing An Appeal In A Civil Or Criminal Case; To Amend Sections 25-7-9 And 25-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish An Additional Fee For Every Civil Case Filed With The Chancery And Circuit Clerk To Be Deposited Into The State General Fund For The Purpose Of Providing Additional Funds For Judicial Salaries; To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose A State Assessment Upon Persons Convicted Of Certain Criminal Violations For The Purpose Of Providing Additional Funds For Judicial Salaries; And For Related Purposes.

2488.title: Memorial highway; designate MS Highway 6 in Pontotoc County as "Military Order of the Purple Heart Highway."
2488.description: An Act To Designate That Segment Of Mississippi Highway 6 Within Pontotoc County, Mississippi, As The "military Order Of The Purple Heart Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

2490.title: MS Telephone Solicitation Act; apply to commercial telephone lines.
2490.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-705, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "consumer" As Used In The Mississippi Telephone Solicitation Act To Include Commercial Telephone Lines; And For Related Purposes.

2491.title: Physician licensees from other states; provide for Mississippi license without examination under certain conditions.
2491.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-25-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Board Of Medical Licensure Shall Issue A License To Practice Medicine Without A Special Purpose Examination (spex) To Licensees From Other States Who Can Verify A License In Good Standing And Verify Hospital Privileges For At Least 5 Years Immediately Preceding Application; And For Related Purposes.

2492.title: Mississippi Interagency Council on Homelessness; establish.
2492.description: An Act To Establish A Mississippi Interagency Council On Homelessness Within The Mississippi Department Of Human Services; To Prescribe The Membership Of The Council; To Prescribe The Duties Of The Council; And For Related Purposes.

2493.title: Mississippi Individual On-Site Wastewater Disposal System Law; extend repealer.
2493.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 41-67-1 Through 41-67-29 And 41-67-33 Through 41-67-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Mississippi Individual On-site Wastewater Disposal System Law; To Amend Section 41-67-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Mississippi Individual On-site Wastewater Disposal System Law; To Amend Section 41-67-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A System Chosen From Systems Listed As Suitable For Installation On A Lot By The Department Of Health Does Not Require Additional Approval Of The Department; And For Related Purposes.

2494.title: Municipally owned waterworks; prohibit from charging higher rates to certain customers in another municipality.
2494.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-27-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Certain Municipalities From Charging Greater Rates For Water Supplied To Consumers Residing Outside Of And Within One Mile Of The Corporate Limits Of The Municipality Than For Water Supplied To Consumers Residing Within The Municipality; To Amend Section 77-3-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Previous Section; And For Related Purposes.

2495.title: Community hospital services in certain counties; authorize direct negotiation with hospital in adjoining county to provide.
2495.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-13-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Certain Counties With Authorized Casino Gaming To Negotiate Directly With A New Hospital In An Adjoining County To Provide Medical Services In Publicly Operated Clinics; And For Related Purposes.

2496.title: Contempt of the PEER Committee; provide criminal penalties.
2496.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-3-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Criminal Penalty For Contempt Of The Peer Committee And To Establish Proper Venue In Cases Arising Under This Provision; To Create New Code Section 5-3-70, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish An Alternate Civil Penalty For Contempt Of The Committee; To Amend Section 25-61-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Peer Committee From The Scope Of Any Protective Orders Authorized By The Section; And For Related Purposes.

2497.title: Elections; increase fee paid by legislative candidates upon entering the race for party nominations.
2497.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-297, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fee Paid By Candidates For State Senator Or State Representative Upon Entering The Race For Party Nomination For Such Offices; To Amend Section 23-15-299, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2498.title: Feticide; revise killing or injury of an unborn child.
2498.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Elements Of The Offenses Of Killing Of Or Injury To An Unborn Child; To Revise The Punishment For The Offense; And For Related Purposes.

2499.title: Wireless Communication Commission; revise membership.
2499.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The Wireless Communication Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2500.title: Abortions; all physicians performing in abortion clinics must have admitting privileges at a local hospital.
2500.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-75-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That All Physicians Who Perform Abortions In Abortion Facilities Must Have Admitting Privileges At A Local Hospital And Must Be Board Certified In Obstetrics And Gynecology; And For Related Purposes.

2501.title: Sunshine Attorney Act; create.
2501.description: An Act To Amend Section 7-5-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Notice Of Certain Litigation Shall Be Given To An Agency Head And That Agencies May Retain Separate Counsel In Certain Situations; To Amend Section 7-5-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Authority Of The Attorney General To Enter Into Contracts For Outside Legal Services; To Amend Section 7-5-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Case Docket Maintained By The Attorney General; To Authorize State Agencies And Other State Entities To Directly Employ Legal Counsel, Whether Salaried Or On A Case-by-case Basis, When Certain Conflicts Of Interest Exist; To Provide That Compensation Of Such Legal Counsel May Be Paid From Any Funds Appropriated Or Otherwise Available To The Appointing Or Employing Entity; To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Duties Of The Personal Service Contract Review Board To Review Certain Fee Contracts For Outside Legal Counsel When Entered Into By The Attorney General Or State Agencies; To Amend Section 7-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2502.title: MS Gulf Coast Region Utility Board; extend repealer.
2502.description: An Act To Amend Sections 49-17-707 Through 49-17-713, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealers On The Provisions That Create And Govern The Mississippi Gulf Coast Region Utility Board; And For Related Purposes.

2503.title: Dept. of Fin. & Administration; may grant an easement on certain property located in the Howard Miller Wildlife Management Area.
2503.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Grant A Perpetual Easement To A.j. Warren On Certain State-owned Property Located In Issaquena County, Mississippi, And Being A Part Of The Howard Miller Wildlife Management Area; And For Related Purposes.

2504.title: State Employees Health Insurance Management Board; shall use certain procedures to procure CHIP insurance.
2504.description: An Act To Require The State And School Employees Health Insurance Management Board To Competitively Procure The Insurance Coverage For The Chip Program By Using A Request For Proposals And Specific Criteria For Evaluating An Insurer; And For Related Purposes.

2505.title: DFA; authorize to sell certain real property at Delta State University.
2505.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, To Sell And Convey Certain Real Property And Any Improvements Thereon At Delta State University, Located In The City Of Cleveland, Bolivar County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2506.title: Hospitals to require authentication of verbal physician orders; direct.
2506.description: An Act To Direct Hospitals To Require Authentication Of Verbal Physician Orders; And For Related Purposes.

2507.title: Unlawful absences from school; no promotion or graduation if student has accumulated 21 or more absences in preceding school year.
2507.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-16-7 And 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No School District Shall Promote A Compulsory-school-age Student To The Next Grade Level Or Allow Such Student To Graduate If That Student Has Accumulated 21 Or More Unlawful Absences In The Immediately Preceding School Year; And For Related Purposes.

2508.title: Physicians who self-refer diagnostic imaging tests; limit billing options.
2508.description: An Act To Limit The Ability Of Physicians Who Self-refer Diagnostic Imaging Tests To Bill Directly For The Technical Component Of Such Imaging Services; And For Related Purposes.

2509.title: Taxation; limit prosecution's authority to plea-bargain.
2509.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-3-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Limit The Discretion Of The Prosecutor In Any Prosecution For Tax Evasion; And For Related Purposes.

2510.title: Alcoholic beverage; certain advertisements for may originate in dry areas.
2510.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provision That Prohibits Advertisements For Alcoholic Beverages From Originating In A Municipality, County Or Judicial District That Has Not Voted To Legalize The Sale Of Alcoholic Beverages; And For Related Purposes.

2512.title: Health care insurance; no person, employer or health care provider shall be required to participate in any health care plan.
2512.description: An Act To Provide That No Person, Employer Or Health Care Provider Shall Be Required To Participate In Any Health Care Services Payment System; To Permit A Person Or Employer To Pay Directly For Lawful Health Care Services And To Permit A Health Care Provider To Accept Direct Payment From A Person Or Employer For Lawful Health Care Services; To Provide That The Purchase Or Sale Of Health Insurance Shall Not Be Prohibited By Law Or Rule; And For Related Purposes.

2513.title: Prescription Monitoring Program; practitioners to check database before prescribing Schedule II drugs to new patients.
2513.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-137, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Practitioners Who Are Licensed To Prescribe Controlled Substances To Check The Prescription Monitoring Program Database On New Patients Who Are Not Hospitalized Before Prescribing Schedule Ii Substances To The New Patient; And For Related Purposes.

2514.title: Task Force to Study Teacher Salaries; establish.
2514.description: An Act To Create A Task Force To Study The Teacher Salary Scale In Order To Solve The Current Teacher Shortage In Mississippi To Make Recommendations To The 2012 Regular Session Of The Legislature; To Provide For The Membership Of The Task Force; To Set Forth The Duties Of The Task Force; And For Related Purposes.

2515.title: Credit cards; place restrictions on marketing to college students.
2515.description: An Act To Provide That A Credit Card Issuer Shall Not Offer To A Student At A Public Or Private University, College Or Community Or Junior College Any Tangible Item To Induce The Student To Apply For A Credit Card; To Provide That A Credit Card Issuer Shall Not Engage In Any Marketing Of A Credit Card That Involves The Physical Presence Of An Individual Representing The Credit Card Issuer On The Campus Of A Public Or Private University, College Or Community Or Junior College; To Provide That A Public Or Private University, College Or Community Or Junior College Shall Not Receive Any Direct Or Indirect Payment Or Compensation For Credit Card Marketing Activity On A Campus Of The Institution That Is Directed At The Students Of The Institution; To Provide That The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges And Public Or Private University, College Or Community Or Junior College Shall Not Sell Or Otherwise Provide To A Credit Card Issuer The Names, Postal Addresses Or Electronic Mail Addresses Of Students Or Engage In Any Marketing On Behalf Of A Credit Card Issuer That Is Directed At Students; And For Related Purposes.

2516.title: Mississippi Civil Rights Museum; establish commission to select site and employ director.
2516.description: An Act To Provide For The Creation Of The Mississippi Civil Rights Museum; To Establish A Mississippi Civil Rights Museum Commission And Define Its Responsibilities; To Direct The Commission To Select A Site For The Museum And To Employ A Director And Curator; To Provide For The Appointment Of A Permanent Governing Board For The Museum Which Shall Be A Nonprofit Corporation; To Create The Mississippi Civil Rights Museum Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2517.title: Mississippi Civil Rights Museum; establish and issue bonds to construct.
2517.description: An Act To Provide For The Creation Of The Mississippi Civil Rights Museum; To Establish A Mississippi Civil Rights Museum Commission And Define Its Responsibilities; To Direct The Commission To Select A Site For The Museum And To Employ A Director And Curator; To Provide For The Appointment Of A Permanent Governing Board For The Museum Which Shall Be A Nonprofit Corporation; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi In The Amount Of $25,000,000.00 For The Purpose Of Providing Funding For Construction Of The Mississippi Civil Rights Museum; And For Related Purposes.

2518.title: Corrections; delete repealer on the authority of the department to assign inmates to certain facilities.
2518.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-110, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Repealer On The Provision That Provides That Any Commitments To Any Institution Or Facility Within The Jurisdiction Of The Department Of Corrections Shall Be To The Department, Which May Also Establish Certain Programs; And For Related Purposes.

2519.title: Income tax; authorize transfer, sale or assignment of credit received for rehabilitation of certain historic structures.
2519.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-22.31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Transfer, Sale Or Assignment Of Income Tax Credits Received For The Rehabilitation Of Certain Historic Structures; And For Related Purposes.

2520.title: Corrections; authorize regional facility for Quitman County.
2520.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-931, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Corrections To Contract With Quitman County For A Regional Prison; And For Related Purposes.

2521.title: Mississippi Anti-Discrimination in Employment Act; enact.
2521.description: An Act To Prohibit Discrimination In The Workplace On The Basis Of Race, Color, Religion, Sex, National Origin, Age Or Disability; To Prohibit Retaliation; To Establish A Statute Of Limitation; And For Related Purposes.

2522.title: Suffrage; authorize restoration by circuit court.
2522.description: An Act To Authorize A Circuit Judge To Restore To A Defendant The Right Of Suffrage; And For Related Purposes.

2523.title: Appropriation FY12; SDH operate two STD/HIV clinics in underserved areas of the state.
2523.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The State Department Of Health For The Purpose Of Establishing And Operating Two Std/hiv Specialty Clinics In Underserved Areas Of The State, For The Fiscal Year Ending June 30, 2012.

2524.title: Adult day care assisted living services; authorize Division of Medicaid to establish program.
2524.description: An Act To Provide That The Division Of Medicaid Shall Design And Implement A Temporary Program To Provide Adult Day Care Assisted Living Services For Certain Individuals; To Provide That The Division Shall Reimburse Those Entities And Individuals In Accordance With A Mutually Agreed Upon Reimbursement Schedule; To Provide That The Program Is Not Part Of Or Connected To The Medicaid Program; And For Related Purposes.

2525.title: Emmitt Louis Till Victims' Compensation Fund; create.
2525.description: An Act To Be Known As The Emmitt Louis Till Victims' Compensation Act; To Codify Section 99-42-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Codify Section 99-42-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe The Basis Of Claims Under The Act; To Codify Section 99-42-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Legislative Intent; To Codify Section 99-42-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Conditions And Exceptions For Awards; To Codify Section 99-42-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe The Penalty For False Claims; To Codify Section 99-42-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Special Fund To Be Known As The Emmitt Louis Till Victims' Compensation Fund; To Amend Sections 99-41-7, 99-41-9 And 99-41-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2526.title: Public utilities; shall make personal contact before terminating heat-related service.
2526.description: An Act To Require Any Utility Supplying Heat-related Service To Attempt To Contact Personally An Adult Resident Of The Premises Before A Scheduled Suspension, Disconnection Or Termination; To Require A Personal Conference, If Personal Contact Is Made With The Customer, To Resolve The Suspension, Disconnection Or Termination; And For Related Purposes.

2527.title: Law enforcement training expenses; revise time for reimbursement of formerly employing entity.
2527.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-6-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Time During Which A Governmental Entity Must Reimburse The Formerly Employing Entity For The Costs Incurred By That Entity In Connection With The Officer's Training By The Minimum Standards Training Academy; And For Related Purposes.

2528.title: Workers' compensation disability payments; extend time period for receiving.
2528.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Period Of Time Allowed For The Receipt Of Workers' Compensation Disability Payments; And For Related Purposes.

2529.title: Death penalty; eliminate for persons who are mentally retarded.
2529.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Eliminate The Death Penalty For Individuals Who Are Mentally Retarded; And For Related Purposes.

2530.title: Individual development accounts; authorize for certain low-income individuals.
2530.description: An Act To Create The Family Savings Initiative Act; To Authorize The Creation Of Individual Development Accounts For Low-income Individuals That May Be Utilized By The Account Holder For Certain Purposes; To Authorize The Department Of Human Services To Contract With Fiduciary Organizations To Serve As Intermediaries Between Individual Development Account Holders And Financial Institutions Holding Account Funds; To Provide That The Gross Household Income Of Individual Retirement Account Holders May Not Exceed 200% Of The Poverty Level And The Account Holder's Net Worth May Not Exceed $10,000.00; To Require Individuals Opening An Individual Development Account To Enter Into An Agreement With A Fiduciary Organization; To Provide That The Fiduciary Organization Shall Provide Matching Funds For Amount Contributed To The Individual Development Account By The Individual Development Account Holder; To Limit The Amount Of Matching Funds That May Be Provided For An Individual Development Account; To Provide The Purposes For Which Individual Development Accounts May Be Utilized; To Provide Civil Penalties For The Withdrawal Of Individual Development Account Funds For Purposes Other That Those Authorized Under This Act; To Require Fiduciary Organizations To Make Quarterly Reports To The Department Of Human Services Containing Certain Information; To Provide That Funds Deposited In An Individual Development Account, Shall Not Be Counted As Income, Assets Or Resources Of The Individual In Determining Financial Eligibility For Assistance Or Services Pursuant To Any Federal, Federally Assisted, State Or Municipal Program Based On Need; To Authorize A Credit Against State Income Tax Liability For Taxpayers Who Contribute Matching Funds To A Fiduciary Organization; To Limit The Amount Of Such Credit; To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude From Gross Income Interest Or Dividend Earned On An Individual Development Account; And For Related Purposes.

2532.title: Employment procedures; prohibit employer from using an arrest record as a basis to deny an applicant.
2532.description: An Act To Prohibit A Private Or Public Employer From Using An Arrest Record As A Basis To Deny An Applicant An Employment Position; And For Related Purposes.

2533.title: Suffrage; provide for immediate restoration upon completion of sentence and other conditions.
2533.description: An Act To Create The Restoration Of Voting Rights Act; To Provide That A Person Who Was Disqualified As An Elector For Commission Of Certain Crimes Shall Have The Right To Vote Restored Automatically Upon Completion Of The Sentence And Following A Two-year Waiting Period; To Provide That Notice Shall Be Given Before A Plea Of Guilty Or Nolo Contendere Is Accepted In A Court Of Law; To Require The Secretary Of State To Implement Certain Education Programs For State Agencies And Judges; To Amend Section 23-15-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2534.title: Expunction; authorize for certain first offense felonies.
2534.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Expunction Of Certain Nonviolent Felonies For First Offenders; And For Related Purposes.

2535.title: Divorce; create bona fide separation as the 13th ground.
2535.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-5-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create As A Thirteenth Ground For Divorce The Bona Fide, Complete Separation Of The Parties For A Certain Period Of Time; To Enact Certain Restrictions; And For Related Purposes.

2536.title: Statutory rape; must be knowing and willful.
2536.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Knowledge And Willfulness In Order To Convict For Statutory Rape; And For Related Purposes.

2538.title: Commission on School Payroll, Business and Procurement Efficiency; establish.
2538.description: An Act To Establish A Commission On School Payroll, Business And Procurement Efficiency To Develop A Report And Implementation Plan To The 2012 Regular Session Relating To School District Payroll, Business And Procurement Coordination; And For Related Purposes.

2540.title: Privatization of school bus transportation; State Board of Education to issue regulations for contracts.
2540.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-41-1 And 37-41-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education To Promulgate Regulations Providing Standards For School Districts To Privatize The School Bus Transportation System; And For Related Purposes.

2542.title: Veterans Day; clarify public observance of.
2542.description: An Act To Amend Section 3-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Counties Or Municipalities From Designating A Local Holiday In Lieu Of Veterans Day And To Direct Public Schools To Conduct Exercises In Honor Of Armistice (veterans) Day; And For Related Purposes.

2543.title: Computer and electronic waste; require management plan for recycling and disposal.
2543.description: An Act To Provide A Program For The Recycling And Disposal Of Computer And Electronic Solid Waste; To Require Each State Agency To Implement Such Program; To Provide For The Sale Or Donation Of Such Equipment; To Create A Computer And Electronic Recycling Fund; To Provide For The Disbursement Of Fund Proceeds; And For Related Purposes.

2544.title: Environmental Quality; require the department to identify all coal ash dam sites.
2544.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Environmental Quality To Identify And Publish The Locations Of All Coal Ash Dam Sites In The State And To Develop Regulations To Monitor Such Sites; And For Related Purposes.

2545.title: Environmental fees; authorize Commission on Environmental Quality to set to cover costs of permitting programs.
2545.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Commission On Environmental Quality To Establish Fees Necessary To Defray The Costs Of Operation Of The Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality; To Create The Department Of Environmental Quality Program Fund; To Amend Sections 51-3-31, 51-5-1, 53-7-21, 53-7-25, 53-7-69 And 49-31-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Commission To Set Program Fees And To Direct Fees To The Department Of Environmental Quality Program Fund; To Bring Forward Section 53-7-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Applications For The Modification, Transfer Or Reissuance Of Any Surface Mining Permit, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2548.title: Residential property foreclosures; prohibit unless 90-day written notice is given.
2548.description: An Act To Prohibit Foreclosure On Residential Property Unless The Mortgagee Or Holder Of The Mortgage Gives The Mortgagor 90 Days' Written Notice; To Prescribe The Contents Of The Notice To Foreclose; To Require The Mortgagee To Notify The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance Of The Date Of The Foreclosure Sale, The Purchase Price Obtained At The Sale, And A Copy Of The Notice To Foreclose; To Require The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance To Maintain A Database Of Certain Foreclosure Activity Information; And For Related Purposes.

2549.title: Payday lending; prohibit activities of/declare public nuisance.
2549.description: An Act To Declare Legislative Intent To Prohibit Activities Commonly Referred To As Payday Lending, Deferred Presentment Services, Advance Cash Services And Other Similar Activities; To Provide That It Shall Be Unlawful To Engage In The Business Of Making Certain Small Loans; To Provide Criminal Penalties Therefor; To Provide For Collection Of Civil Penalties In Actions By The State Or By Private Parties On Behalf Of The State; To Declare The Site Or Location Of A Place Of Business Where Payday Lending Takes Place In The State Of Mississippi As A Public Nuisance; To Repeal Sections 75-67-401 Through 75-67-449, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Title Pledge Act; To Repeal Sections 75-67-501 Through 75-67-539, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Check Cashers Act; And For Related Purposes.

2550.title: Governor; reduce the annual salary of.
2550.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Annual Salary Of The Governor; And For Related Purposes.

2551.title: Appeal bond; set the maximum amount for appeals from decisions of local governments as to taxes.
2551.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-51-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Amount Of The Appeal Bond Required For An Appeal From A Decision By A Board Of Supervisors Or Municipal Authorities As To The Assessment Of Taxes Shall Be Not Less Than $100.00 Nor More Than $10,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

2552.title: Health insurance policies; require coverage for hearing aids.
2552.description: An Act To Require Certain Insurers And Nonprofit Health Service Plans To Provide Coverage Of Hearing Aids; And For Related Purposes.

2553.title: Wind Pool Reinsurance Assistance Fund; divert amount of insurance premium tax to the fund.
2553.description: An Act To Provide For The Deposit Of A Certain Amount Of Insurance Premium Tax Revenues Into The Mississippi Windstorm Underwriting Association Reinsurance Assistance Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2554.title: State land mammal; designate black bear as.
2554.description: An Act To Amend Section 3-3-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate The American Black Bear As One Of The State Land Mammals; And For Related Purposes.

2555.title: Marihuana; allow medical use by seriously ill patients under doctor's supervision.
2555.description: An Act To Authorize The Medical Use Of Marihuana By Seriously Ill Patients Under A Physician's Supervision; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide An Exemption From Criminal And Civil Penalties For The Medical Use Of Marihuana; To Provide Limitations On The Medical Use Of Marihuana; To Provide A Legal Defense For Patients And Primary Caregivers; To Amend Sections 41-29-113 And 41-29-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer Marihuana From Schedule I To Schedule Ii Under The Controlled Substances Law; To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Medical Use Of Marihuana From Criminal Penalties Under The Controlled Substances Law; And For Related Purposes.

2556.title: Beer; increase the amount of alcohol that it may contain from 5% by weight to 17% by weight.
2556.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Permissible Alcoholic Content Of Beer From 5% Of Alcohol By Weight To 17% Of Alcohol By Weight; To Amend Section 67-3-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Every Person Shall Have The Right To Make Homemade Beer For Domestic Or Household Use Only; To Amend Sections 67-1-5, 67-3-1, 67-3-5, 67-3-7, 67-3-9, 67-3-13, 67-3-17, 67-3-28, 67-3-49, 67-3-53 And 27-71-509, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2557.title: Insurance; prohibit use of credit information in underwriting and rating.
2557.description: An Act To Prohibit Insurers From Using Information Regarding A Consumer's Creditworthiness, Credit Standing Or Credit Capacity For The Purpose Of Determining Rates For Insurance Or Eligibility For Coverage; And For Related Purposes.

2558.title: Natural resources; require an assessment of the value of Mississippi's natural resources.
2558.description: An Act To Require The Assessment Of The Economic Value Of The Natural Resources Of The State; And For Related Purposes.

2559.title: Environmental justice; require meaningful involvement of all people in siting process.
2559.description: An Act To Require The Fair Treatment And Meaningful Involvement Of All People Regardless Of Race, Color, National Origin Or Income With Regard To The Development And Enforcement Of Environmental Laws And The Siting Of Certain Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2560.title: Environmental Quality; require commission to adopt rules on radon control.
2560.description: An Act Requiring The Commission On Environmental Quality To Adopt Rules For Radon Control; And For Related Purposes.

2561.title: The Sweetened Beverages and Syrups Tax Law; enact.
2561.description: An Act To Create The Sweetened Beverages And Syrups Tax Law; To Provide That Distributors Who Receive, Store, Manufacture, Bottle Or Distribute Certain Sweetened Beverage Products For Sale To Retailers In This State Must Obtain From The Department Of Revenue A Permit To Engage In Such Business; To Impose An Excise Tax On Every Distributor For The Privilege Of Selling Certain Sweetened Beverage Products; To Create The Children's Health Promotion Fund; To Provide That 20% Of The Revenue From The Excise Tax Imposed By This Act Shall Be Deposited To The Credit Of The Children's Health Promotion Fund And That The Remainder Of Such Revenue Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund; To Provide For The Allocation Of The Money In Such Fund; To Provide Certain Exemptions From The Tax Levied By This Act; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2562.title: Appropriation; district attorneys/assistant district attorneys; special judges, chancellors & circuit judges; additional for FY2011.
