2562.description: An Act Making An Additional Appropriation Of General Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The District Attorneys And Assistant District Attorneys; And To Pay Expenses Of Special Judges, Chancellors And Circuit Judges For Fiscal Year 2011; And For Related Purposes.

2563.title: State budget; exclude special funds derived from additional fees paid for distinctive license tags from budget cuts.
2563.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-104-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Special Funds Derived From Additional Fees Paid For The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Or Plates, And Special Funds Of The Mississippi Veterans Affairs Board That Are Paid To The Board By The Veteran Residents Of State Veterans Homes To Fund Their Monthly Expenses, Shall Be Removed From The Definition Of The Term "state-source Special Funds" In Order To Exclude Those Special Funds From Budget Cuts; And For Related Purposes.

2564.title: Mississippi Resident Tuition Assistance/Eminent Scholars Grant Programs; student renewal application is automatic.
2564.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-106-29 And 37-106-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Eligibility For Renewal Of A Mississippi Resident Tuition Assistance Grant Or A Mississippi Eminent Scholars Grant Shall Be Determined Automatically By The University Or College Without The Necessity Of A Reapplication By The Student; And For Related Purposes.

2565.title: Dept. of Agriculture; authorize use of advertising funds & other source funds for improvements to property & marketing programs.
2565.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Accept, Budget, Receive And Expend Funds From Any Source For Improvements To Facilities And For Marketing And Promotion Programs Of The Department; To Create A Special Fund For Those Funds; To Authorize The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Allow Advertising On Department Property And In Its Publications; To Authorize The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Sell Certain Items In The Possession Of The Mississippi Agriculture And Forestry Museum; And For Related Purposes.

2566.title: Mississippi Check Cashers Act; revise maximum fee and length of check deferral.
2566.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-67-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Maximum Fee And Length Of Deferral On Loans Made By Check Casher Licensees; To Amend Sections 75-67-505 And 75-67-515, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The License Renewal Fees And Examination Fees Paid To The Commissioner Of Banking By Check Casher Licensees; And For Related Purposes.

2568.title: Healthy Food Retail Act; create to encourage consumption of affordable healthy foods in underserved communities.
2568.description: An Act To Create The Healthy Food Retail Act; To Provide That, To The Extent Funds Are Available, The Department Of Human Services, In Cooperation With Public And Private Sector Partners, Shall Establish A Pilot Program That Provides Grants And Loans To Healthy Food Retailers That Increase Access To Fresh Fruits And Vegetables And Other Affordable Healthy Food In Underserved Communities; To Provide That The Department May Contract With One Or More Qualified Nonprofit Organizations Or Community Development Financial Institutions To Administer The Program Described In This Act Through A Public-private Partnership, To Raise Matching Funds, Market The Program Statewide, Evaluate Applicants, Make Award Decisions, Underwrite Loans, And Monitor Compliance And Impact; To Provide That The Program Shall Provide Funding On A Competitive, One-time Basis As Appropriate For The Eligible Project; To Provide The Types Of Programs And Projects For Which Funding May Be Provided; To Provide The Criteria That Must Be Met For Funding Under The Program; To Provide That The Department Shall Establish Program Benchmarks And Reporting Processes To Make Certain That The Program Benefits Both Rural And Urban Communities In Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2569.title: Dylan's law; require and set regulations for gasoline safety cans.
2569.description: An Act To Create Dylan's Law; To Enact Requirements For The Safe Transportation And Storage Of Gasoline By Consumers; To Enact Safety Standards; And For Related Purposes.

2570.title: Arrest; revise right of certain individuals to probable cause hearing.
2570.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-3-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Right Of Certain Individuals To A Probable Cause Hearing Before Arrest; And For Related Purposes.

2571.title: Drug drop-off and disposal; create program.
2571.description: An Act To Create A Drug Drop-off And Disposal Program To Be Operated By The Bureau Of Narcotics; And For Related Purposes.

2572.title: Sexual motivation; require special allegation in certain felony prosecutions.
2572.description: An Act To Require Prosecution For An Enhancement Of Penalty By Special Allegation Of Sexual Motivation For Offenses That Are Not Sex Offenses Per Se, But That Are Sexually Motivated; And For Related Purposes.

2573.title: State Grand Jury Act; delete repealer on.
2573.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 13-7-1, 13-7-3, 13-7-5, 13-7-7, 13-7-9, 13-7-11, 13-7-13, 13-7-15, 13-7-17, 13-7-19, 13-7-21, 13-7-23, 13-7-25, 13-7-27, 13-7-29, 13-7-31, 13-7-33, 13-7-35, 13-7-37, 13-7-39, 13-7-41, 13-7-43, 13-7-45, 13-7-47 And 13-7-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The State Grand Jury Act And Provide For The Operation Of A State Grand Jury; To Amend Section 99-11-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Repeal Date On Venue For Indictments By The State Grand Jury; To Amend Section 27, Chapter 553, Laws Of 1993, As Amended By Chapter 382, Laws Of 1998, As Amended By Chapter 480, Laws Of 1999, As Amended By Chapter 471, Laws Of 2002, As Amended By Chapter 506, Laws Of 2005, To Delete The Repeal Date On The State Grand Jury Act; And For Related Purposes.

2574.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds for construction of a Highway Patrol substation in Leflore County.
2574.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Constructing A New Highway Patrol Substation In Leflore County In Highway Safety Patrol District 2; And For Related Purposes.

2576.title: Blue Alert system; create.
2576.description: An Act To Create The "blue Alert" Program To Help In The Investigation And Apprehension Of Perpetrators Of Crimes Involving The Death Or Serious Injury Of A Law Enforcement Officer; And For Related Purposes.

2577.title: Justice court judges; exempt certain sitting judges from certain examination requirements.
2577.description: An Act To Amend Sections 9-11-3 And 9-11-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Certain Justice Court Judges From The Competency Examination Enacted In The Justice Court Reform Act Of 2008; And For Related Purposes.

2578.title: Agritourism; provide limited liability for persons engaged in agritourism.
2578.description: An Act To Provide Limited Liability To Persons Engaged In Agritourism Activities; To Define Certain Terms; To Require Warning Signs At Agritourism Farms; And For Related Purposes.

2579.title: Alcoholic beverages and prescription medications; prohibit adults from allowing party for minors to obtain.
2579.description: An Act To Prohibit Adults From Allowing A Party To Take Place At A Private Residence Or Private Premises If A Minor At The Party Obtains Any Prescription Medication Or Any Alcoholic Beverage Or Beer And The Adult Knows Or Reasonably Should Know That The Minor Has Obtained Prescription Medications, Alcoholic Beverages Or Beer; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Amend Section 67-3-70, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2581.title: Local System Bridge Replacement and Rehabilitation Fund; authorize issuance of general obligation bonds to provide funds for.
2581.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $20,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Program; To Amend Section 65-37-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2582.title: Model Business Corporation Act; amend to conform Mississippi Act to Uniform Act.
2582.description: An Act To Amend Section 79-4-1.22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Fees Charged And Collected By The Secretary Of State Under The Business Corporation Act; To Amend Section 79-4-1.25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Time In Which The Secretary Of State Must Deliver Notice Of A Refusal To File A Document; To Amend Section 79-4-1.29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fine For Knowingly Signing A False Document; To Amend Section 79-4-1.40, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions; To Amend Section 79-4-1.41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Forms Of Notice Considered Sufficient Under The Act; To Amend Section 79-4-4.01, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Requirements Pertaining To Corporation Names; To Amend Section 79-4-4.02, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Reservation Of A Corporate Name; To Amend Section 79-4-5.01, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Requirement Of A Registered Agent For Service Of Process; To Amend Section 79-4-5.02, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Changing Of A Registered Agent; To Amend Section 79-4-6.20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make A Technical Revision To The Provision Dealing With Subscription Of Shares; To Amend Section 79-4-7.04, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Electronic Transmission Of Consent To An Action; To Amend Section 79-4-7.05, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Remote Participation; To Create Section 79-4-7.09, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Electronic Shareholder Meetings; To Amend Section 79-4-7.22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Electronic Appointment Of A Proxy; To Amend Section 79-4-7.42, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Date Of Delivery Of A Written Demand; To Amend Section 79-4-8.01, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Exercise Of Power By The Board Of Directors; To Amend Section 79-4-8.05, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Expiration Of Terms Of The Board Of Directors; To Amend Section 79-4-8.06, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Staggering Of Terms Of The Board Of Directors; To Amend Section 79-4-8.07, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Resignation Of Directors; To Amend Section 79-4-8.10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Filling Of Vacancies On The Board Of Directors; To Amend Section 79-4-8.24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Presumption Of Assent To Corporate Actions; To Amend Section 79-4-8.26, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Submission Of A Matter To The Shareholders For A Vote When The Action Is Not Recommended By The Board; To Amend Section 79-4-8.31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Potential Liability Of A Director; To Amend Section 79-4-8.50, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions; To Amend Section 79-4-8.53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Payment Of Expenses Of Litigation; To Amend Section 79-4-8.60, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions; To Amend Section 79-4-11.01, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions; To Amend Section 79-4-11.06, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Filing Of Articles Of Incorporation; To Amend Section 79-4-11.08, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Abandonment Of A Plan Of Merger Or Share Exchange; To Amend Section 79-4-13.20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Certain Notices To Shareholders; To Amend Section 79-4-13.21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Assent To An Action To Assert Appraisal Rights; To Amend Section 79-4-13.22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Form Of Notice Of An Action Requiring Appraisal Rights; To Amend Section 79-4-14.21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Notice Of Dissolution; To Amend Section 79-4-14.22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Reinstatement; To Amend Section 79-4-15.01, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Activities Requiring Certificate; To Amend Section 79-4-15.02, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Transaction Of Business Without Authority; To Amend Section 79-4-15.06, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Requirements That Apply To A Corporate Name; To Amend Section 79-4-15.07, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Requirement Of A Registered Agent For Service; To Amend Section 79-4-15.08, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Change Of A Registered Agent; To Amend Section 79-4-15.31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Revocation Of A Foreign Corporation's Certificate Of Authority; To Amend Section 79-4-16.01, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Required Record Keeping; To Amend Section 79-4-16.02, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify A Shareholder's Right Of Inspection; To Amend Section 79-4-16.06, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Notice To Shareholders; To Amend Section 79-4-16.20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Annual Financial Statement Requirement; To Repeal Section 79-4-16.21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Dealing With The Reporting Of The Indemnification Of Or Expense Advances To A Director And Certain Share Issues By The Corporation; To Create Section 79-4-17.05, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Relation Of The Act To The Federal Electronic Signatures Act; And For Related Purposes.

2583.title: Child support; exclude SSI from income to calculate.
2583.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-19-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude Certain Benefit Payments From The Category Of Gross Income For The Purposes Of Calculating Child Support Obligations; And For Related Purposes.

2584.title: Assistant teachers; require school districts to provide notice of nonreemployment at least 5 days before the school year ends.
2584.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require School Districts To Give Assistant Teachers Notification Of Nonreemployment No Later Than Five Days Before The End Of The Academic School Year; And For Related Purposes.

2585.title: MS Rice Promotion Fund; delete the repealer on assessment on rice grown in the state and records and reporting requirements.
2585.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-10-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Repealer On The Law Providing For The Assessment On Rice Grown In The State Of Mississippi And The Records And Reporting Requirements Of The Mississippi Department Of Agriculture And Commerce For The Mississippi Rice Promotion Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2586.title: Nonemergency transportation services provided under the Medicaid program; delete authority for reimbursement.
2586.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Authority For The Division Of Medicaid To Reimburse Nonemergency Transportation Services For Medicaid Recipients; To Repeal Section 43-13-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is The Authority For A Temporary State-funded Program For Nonemergency Transportation Services For Dialysis Services For Certain Medicaid Recipients; And For Related Purposes.

2587.title: Citizenship in the State of Mississippi; define.
2587.description: An Act To Define Criteria For Citizenship In The State Of Mississippi; To Clarify That The Status Of Citizenship In Mississippi Shall Not Confer Any Right, Privilege, Immunity Or Benefit Under Law; And For Related Purposes.

2588.title: Trespass; revise punishment for.
2588.description: An Act To Amend Sections 97-17-85 And 97-17-89, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalties For Trespass On The Lands Of Another And The Destruction Of Crops Of Another; And For Related Purposes.

2589.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for supporters of Abbie Rogers Civitan Camp.
2589.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Abbie Rogers Civitan Camp; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

2590.title: Court reporting; provide for discipline of persons who engage in unauthorized.
2590.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-13-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Certified Court Reporters To Discipline Persons Who Engage In The Unauthorized Practice Of Court Reporting; And For Related Purposes.

2593.title: Council for Education Technology; repeal.
2593.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 37-151-15, 37-151-17, 37-151-19, 37-151-21 And 37-151-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establish A Council For Education Technology, Prescribe Its Membership, Define Its Responsibilities And Create A State Public School Education Technology Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2594.title: Mississippi Rating Bureau; shall publish guidelines for the grading of fire trucks.
2594.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-3-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Rating Bureau To Formalize Standards For Awarding Credits To Fire Departments For Certain Fire Equipment For Use In Determining Fire Ratings; And For Related Purposes.

2595.title: Memorial highway; designate U.S. Highway 51 in Coldwater as "Martin Luther King, Jr. Highway."
2595.description: An Act To Designate That Segment Of U.s. Highway 51 Within The Corporate Limits Of Coldwater, Mississippi, As The "martin Luther King, Jr. Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

2597.title: Memorial highway; designate U.S. Highway 84 in Adams County as "Sgt. Todd Partridge Memorial Highway."
2597.description: An Act To Designate That Segment Of U.s. Highway 84 Within Adams County, Mississippi, As The "sgt. Todd Partridge Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

2598.title: Homeowner's Insurance Cost Disclosure Act; create.
2598.description: An Act To Create The Homeowner's Insurance Cost Disclosure Act; To Require Each Insurance Carrier Of A Homeowners Policy To Include With Each Annual Renewal Package A Clear Written Disclosure Of The Costs Of Each Type Of Individual Coverage Contained In The Policy; And For Related Purposes.

2599.title: Corrections; increase penalty for providing cell phones to inmates.
2599.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-195, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Penalty For Providing Cell Phones To Inmates; And For Related Purposes.

2600.title: Personalized license plates for noncommercial trailers; authorize.
2600.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-48, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Issuance Of Personalized License Tags For Noncommercial Trailers; And For Related Purposes.

2601.title: Statewide wireless communications system; require all costs to be satisfied by certain revenue sources.
2601.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require All Operational And Maintenance Costs For All Statewide Wireless Communications Systems Implemented Or Operated By The Wireless Communication Commission To Be Satisfied Through Certain Revenue Sources; And For Related Purposes.

2602.title: Highways; add certain segment of MS 4 to immediate needs priority for upgrade.
2602.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-3-97, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Consider A Certain Segment Of Mississippi 4 In Immediate Needs Category For Establishing Priority For Upgrades And Improvements; And For Related Purposes.

2603.title: State agency rent; exempt public spaces in the Old Capitol and William Winter Building.
2603.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-5-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Square Footage Designated As Public Space In The Old Capitol Building And The William Winter Building Shall Not Be Included In The Square Footage Charged For Rent By The Department Of Finance And Administration; And For Related Purposes.

2604.title: International Baccalaureate Diploma Program; require IHL to grant minimum credit to graduates of.
2604.description: An Act To Require The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Adopt And Implement A Policy For The Granting Of A Minimum Number Of College Or University Credits To First-time Freshmen Students Who Have Successfully Completed An International Baccalaureate Diploma Program; To Require The Board To Make The Policy Available To The Public; To Require Each State Institution Of Higher Learning To Establish The Number Of Credits The Institution May Grant To A Student Who Has Successfully Completed An International Baccalaureate Diploma Program; To Require Students Scoring Three Or Higher On International Baccalaureate End-of-course Exams To Be Granted A Minimum Number Of Twenty-four College Or University Credits; To Amend Section 37-15-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2605.title: Corrections; require all offenders on conditional medical release to be responsible for medical costs.
2605.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That All Offenders On Conditional Medical Release Are Responsible For Medical Costs; To Delete The Reference To The Medical Director Of The Department Of Corrections; And For Related Purposes.

2606.title: Mississippi Geologic Sequestration of Carbon Dioxide Act; enact.
2606.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Geologic Sequestration Of Carbon Dioxide Act; To Articulate Legislative Intent; To Enact Definitions; To Specify Duties And Powers Of The Oil And Gas Board In Respect To Geologic Sequestration Of Carbon Dioxide; To Require Board Approval For Use Of A Reservoir For Carbon Dioxide Storage; And For Related Purposes.

2607.title: Alcohol-free motor fuels; ensure the availability of.
2607.description: An Act To Require Retail Dealers And Distributors Of Gasoline To Offer For Sale Or Use Nonethanol-blended Unleaded Premium Grade Gasoline; And For Related Purposes.

2608.title: Public Service Commission; sale of propane gas shall be under the authority of.
2608.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Sale Of Propane Gas Shall Be Subject To The Authority Of The Mississippi Public Service Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2609.title: Smoking in government and university buildings and vehicles; prohibit.
2609.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-5-161 And 29-5-163, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Smoking In All State And Local Government And University Buildings And Government Vehicles; And For Related Purposes.

2610.title: State personnel system; create Strategic Planning Council.
2610.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Strategic Planning Council For The Statewide Personnel System; To Establish The Duties Of The Council And Its Reporting Responsibilities; And For Related Purposes.

2611.title: Children's Health Insurance Program; prescribe process for taking bids.
2611.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-86-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That The Administering Agency Of The Children's Health Insurance Program Follow A Specified Process In Soliciting Bids For Insurance Coverage; And For Related Purposes.

2612.title: Corrections; clarify prohibition against possessing unauthorized items within jails and prisons.
2612.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-193, Mississippi Code Of 197, To Clarify The Prohibition Against Possessing Unauthorized Items On Grounds Of Correctional Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2613.title: Mississippi S.A.F.E. Mortgage Act; applies to activities of owner financing only as determined by HUD.
2613.description: An Act To Amend Section 81-18-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Mississippi S.a.f.e. Mortgage Act Shall Apply To The Activities Of Owner Financing Only To The Extent As Determined By The United States Department Of Housing And Urban Development; And For Related Purposes.

2614.title: Agents of State Board of Pharmacy; clarify law enforcement authority.
2614.description: An Act To Amend Sections 45-6-3 And 41-29-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Agents Of The State Board Of Pharmacy May Only Carry Out Functions Of Law Enforcement Officers If They Are Certified By The Board Of Law Enforcement Training And Standards; And For Related Purposes.

2616.title: Files and records of the Legislature; clarify privileged status of.
2616.description: An Act To Make Certain Files And Records Of The Legislature Privileged And Not Subject To Judicial Or Administrative Subpoena Or Discovery; And For Related Purposes.

2617.title: Trauma care services fee program; extend repealer on.
2617.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 41-9-51, 41-59-3, 41-59-5, 41-59-7, 41-59-75, 27-19-43 And 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Amend Section 9 Of Chapter 549, Laws Of 2008, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Emergency Medical Services And Trauma Care Services Fee Program; To Amend Reenacted Section 41-59-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Use Of Fees For The Exclusive Benefit Of The Statewide Trauma System; To Amend Reenacted Section 41-59-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add The Trade Association For Ambulance Service Providers To The Emergency Medical Services Advisory Council Within The Department Of Health; To Amend Section 43-11-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On Certain Hospice And Nursing Home Regulations; To Reenact And Amend Section 63-17-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Levies A Point-of-sale Fee On Retail Sales Of All-terrain Vehicles And Motorcycles For Deposit Into The Mississippi Trauma Care Systems Fund; To Levy A Fee On Any Resident Of This State Who Purchases A New And Not Previously Registered Motorcycle In Another State And Brings The Motorcycle Into This State; To Provide That The Person Shall Pay The Fee To The Tax Collector At The Time Of Registering The Motorcycle And Applying For A License Tag; To Provide That The Proceeds Of The Fee Shall Be Deposited Into The Mississippi Trauma Care Systems Fund; To Levy A Fee On Any Resident Of This State Who Purchases A New All-terrain Vehicle In Another State And Brings The Vehicle Into This State; To Provide That The Proceeds Of The Fee Shall Be Deposited Into The Mississippi Trauma Care Systems Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2618.title: Historic tax credit; allow refund of excess amount of credit.
2618.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-22.31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If The Amount Of The Income Tax Credit Allowed For Costs And Expenses Incurred In The Rehabilitation Of Certified Historic Structures Exceeds The Taxpayer's Tax Liability For The Year, The Taxpayer May Claim A Refund In The Amount Of 90% Of The Excess To Be Paid From Current Tax Collections; To Extend The Repeal Date On This Section Until December 31, 2014; And For Related Purposes.

2619.title: Refinery construction sales tax; remove July 1, 2011, repeal date on.
2619.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The July 1, 2011, Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Levies A Tax On The Sale Of Manufacturing Or Processing Machinery To Be Installed And/or Used At A Refinery In This State And On The Performance Of Construction Activities At Or In Regard To A Refinery In This State And Provides That If The Owner Of The Refinery Holds A Direct Pay Permit Issued By The Department Of Revenue, He Must Furnish The Permit To The Seller Or Person Performing The Construction Activity And The Seller Or Person Performing The Construction Activity Is Relieved Of The Duty To Collect The Tax And The Owner Of The Refinery Must Pay The Tax; To Amend Section 27-65-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The July 1, 2011, Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Exempts Construction Activities Performed At Certain Refineries From The Tax Imposed By This Section; And For Related Purposes.

2620.title: Step therapy or fail-first protocols by a prescribing practitioner under certain circumstances; provide for.
2620.description: An Act To Provide For The Step Therapy Or Fail-first Protocols By A Prescribing Practitioner Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2621.title: Minimum length of school term; specify in classroom hours.
2621.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Minimum Length Of School Term In Classroom Hours; And For Related Purposes.

2622.title: Mississippi Check Cashers Act; extend repealer on.
2622.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 75-67-501 Through 75-67-537, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Check Cashers Act And Provide For The Licensing Of Check Cashers; To Amend Section 75-67-539, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On Those Reenacted Sections; And For Related Purposes.

2623.title: Certified burn centers designated by SDH; may participate in Mississippi trauma system and burn care fund.
2623.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-59-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Certain Burn Centers Certified By The State Department Of Health To Participate In The Mississippi Trauma Care System Fund Program And The Mississippi Burn Care Fund Program; To Amend Sections 7-9-70, 27-19-44.3, 21-19-58, 27-39-331, 27-39-332, And 37-115-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Medical Center To Establish A Separate Burn Unit; And For Related Purposes.

2624.title: Mandatory comprehensive eye examination for students entering kindergarten or first grade; require.
2624.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-3-87, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Comprehensive Eye Examination For All Students Entering Kindergarten, The First Grade Or Enrolling For The First Time In A Public, Private Or Parochial School; To Provide Standards For Required Eye Examinations; To Direct The State Board Of Health To Develop And Issue Regulations Establishing Standards For The Student Eye Examination Program; To Provide For An Advisory Committee On The Mandatory Student Eye Examination Requirement And The Student Vision Screening Program; And For Related Purposes.

2626.title: Abortions; prohibit in State of Mississippi.
2626.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-41-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Declare Legislative Intent Relative To The Termination Of The Life Of An Unborn Child And The Protection Of The Health And Rights Of Women; To Prohibit Abortions In The State Of Mississippi Except In Certain Cases; To Amend Section 41-41-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Criminal Penalties For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2627.title: Drug Enforcement Coordinating Committee; establish.
2627.description: An Act To Create A New Code Section 41-29-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Requiring The Creation Of A Drug Enforcement Coordinating Committee; To Establish The Committee's Membership And Define Its Duties; To Amend Section 41-29-168, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Committee To Develop Reporting Forms Used By Law Enforcement In Reporting Information To The Bureau Of Narcotics; To Require The Department Of Public Safety To Continue To Operate The Mississippi Analysis And Information Center; And For Related Purposes.

2628.title: Marine Resources fees; authorize Commission on Marine Resources to set to cover costs of permitting programs.
2628.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Commission On Marine Resources To Establish Fees Necessary To Defray The Costs Of Operation Of The Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Marine Resources; To Create The Department Of Marine Resources Program Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2629.title: First Circuit Court District; provide additional legal assistant and criminal investigator.
2629.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-31-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Additional Legal Assistant To The District Attorney In The First Circuit Court District; To Amend Section 25-31-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Additional Criminal Investigator To The District Attorney In The First Circuit Court District; And For Related Purposes.

2630.title: Minimum length of school term; school districts may use up to 5 snow days.
2630.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-13-63 And 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Local School Districts To Suspend Operation For Up To 5 Days During The 2010-2011 School Year Due To Snow Or Ice Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

2631.title: Mississippi Transportation Commission; shall donate certain real property to the Town of Walnut Grove.
2631.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Donate To The Town Of Walnut Grove All Of Its Right, Title And Interest In Certain Real Property Located In The Town Of Walnut Grove, Leake County, Mississippi; To Require The State Board Of Mental Health To Convey Without Compensation To The Mississippi Transportation Commission All Of Its Right, Title And Interest In Certain Real Property Located In Rankin County, Mississippi; To Require The Ellisville State School To Convey Without Compensation To The Mississippi Transportation Commission All Of Its Right, Title And Interest In Certain Real Property Located In Jones County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2632.title: Robert E. Lee Building; authorize sale of.
2632.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Upon Consultation With The Chairmen Of The Public Property Committees Of The Senate And House Of Representatives, To Sell And Convey, Exchange Or Lease The Property Located At 239 North Lamar Street In The City Of Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi, Known As The "robert E. Lee Building"; And For Related Purposes.

2633.title: Driver's education; require for drivers under age 17.
2633.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Drivers Under The Age Of 17 To Have Completed A Driver's Education Course In Order To Hold An Intermediate License; And For Related Purposes.

2634.title: Legislative mail carrier; delete statutory authority for.
2634.description: An Act To Repeal Section 5-1-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Selection Of The Legislative Mail Carrier; And For Related Purposes.

2635.title: Elections; enact Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote.
2635.description: An Act To Enact Into Law The Agreement Among The States To Elect The President By National Popular Vote And Provide That The State Of Mississippi Enters The Compact With Other States That Join In The Compact; To Provide That Under The Compact, The President Of The United States Be Elected Using The Vote Total From The National Popular Vote; To Amend Sections 23-15-781 23-15-783 23-15-785 And 23-15-787, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2636.title: Privilege license tax; local governments may reduce or waive.
2636.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-17-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Counties And Municipalities To Reduce Or Waive The Amount Imposed As A Tax To Secure A Privilege License; And For Related Purposes.

2638.title: Emergency 911 address; authorize counties to charge registration fee for.
2638.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-313, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors To Charge A Registration Fee For The Registration Of A New 911 Address Or A Change Of Ownership Or Occupancy Of An Existing 911 Address; And For Related Purposes.

2639.title: Volunteer Emergency Responder Job Protection Act; create.
2639.description: An Act To Create The "volunteer Emergency Responder Job Protection Act"; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide That An Employee Shall Not Be Terminated, Demoted Or In Any Other Manner Discriminated Against Because The Employee, When Serving As A Volunteer Emergency Responder, Is Absent From The Employee's Place Of Employment; To Provide That The Employment Protection Does Not Apply If The Volunteer Employee Is Absent For A Period Of More Than 10 Regular Business Days In A Calendar Year; To Provide That An Employer May Charge Against An Employee's Regular Pay Time That The Employee Is Absent From Employment While Serving As A Volunteer Emergency Responder; To Provide A Civil Cause Of Action For Violations Of The Act; And For Related Purposes.

2640.title: Health insurance; require health insurance policies and State Health plan to cover autism spectrum disorders.
2640.description: An Act To Require Health Insurance Coverage, Including Coverage Under The State And School Employees Health Insurance Plan, For Autism Spectrum Disorders; To Define "autism Spectrum Disorder" As An Autistic Disorder, Asperger's Syndrome, Or Pervasive Developmental Disorder Not Otherwise Specified; And For Related Purposes.

2642.title: Public assistance benefits; require applicants to verify United States citizenship and take drug tests to qualify.
2642.description: An Act To Require Adult Applicants For Public Benefits In Mississippi To Verify United States Citizenship Or Lawful Residence In Order To Be Eligible; To Provide Procedures And Exceptions For Such Verification; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Willful Violations Of Lawful Presence Requirements; To Make It Unlawful For Any State Agency To Provide Any Public Benefit In Violation Of Lawful Presence Requirements; To Require Random Drug Testing For Any Person Receiving Public Benefits; To Provide That Any Such Person Whose Test Results Are Positive Regarding The Presence Of Any Unlawful Drug In The Person's System Shall Be Ineligible To Receive Public Benefits For One Year; To Amend Sections 43-13-115, 43-17-1, 43-17-5, 71-5-511 And 43-33-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Require The Division Of Medicaid, The Department Of Human Services, The Office Of Employment Security And The Mississippi Housing Authorities To Require Applicants Of Public Assistance Programs To Verify Lawful Presence As Required Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2643.title: Public utilities; charitable or civic contributions shall not be allowed as costs or expenses for rate-making purposes.
2643.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Charitable Or Civic Contributions Made By Public Utilities Shall Not Be Allowed In Any Amount As Costs Or Expenses For Rate-making Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2644.title: Birth certificate; major errors may be corrected by order of tribal court.
2644.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-57-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow A Tribal Court Of Competent Jurisdiction To Hear And Decide A Proceeding To Correct Any Major Deficiency In A Mississippi Birth Certificate; To Retain The Provision That The State Board Of Health Be Named As A Respondent In The Matter; And For Related Purposes.

2645.title: Forestry; revise standard of negligence for liability for prescribed burns of timber.
2645.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-19-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Standard Of Negligence For Liability For Prescribed Burns Of Timber; And For Related Purposes.

2646.title: Emerging Crops Fund; loan program for agribusinesses engaged in poultry production is separate from other loan programs in the fund.
2646.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-2-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Loan Program In The Emerging Crops Fund For Certain Agribusinesses Engaged In Poultry Production Operations To Enable The Such Agribusinesses To Make Certain Upgrades, Renovations, Repairs And Other Improvements To Equipment, Facilities And Operations Shall Be Separate From Other Loan Programs In The Emerging Crops Fund And To Make Loans Under Such Program Available To Other Agribusiness Enterprises; To Increase The Maximum Amount Of The Loans That May Be Made Under Such Program; And For Related Purposes.

2647.title: Stationary assembly points and mobile labor camps provided by railroads; State Board of Health provide standards for.
2647.description: An Act To Establish Standards For Stationary Assembly Points And Mobile Labor Camps Provided By A Railroad Company For Maintenance Of Way Employees; To Require A Railroad Company To Provide Drinking Water At Assembly Points Where Maintenance Of Way Employees Meet; To Direct The State Board Of Health To Adopt Rules And Regulations Concerning Mobile Camps; And For Related Purposes.

2648.title: Motor vehicle; revise regulation of relationship between manufacturers and dealers of.
2648.description: An Act To Create New Section 63-17-114, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Funds Received By A Motor Vehicle Dealer In A Transaction Involving The Purchase Or Trade-in Of A Vehicle Are Trust Funds Held In Trust By The Motor Vehicle Dealer For Certain Entities; To Provide That Certain Funds Held By A Manufacturer That Are Necessary To Perform The Obligation Of The Manufacturer To Motor Vehicle Dealers Or Customers Are Trust Funds Held In Trust By The Manufacturer For The Motor Vehicle Dealer Or Customers; To Provide That The Holder Of The Trust Funds May Not Grant Any Security Or Other Interest In Such Funds; To Create New Section 63-17-118, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Compensation Of Motor Vehicle Dealers Upon Termination, Cancellation, Refusal To Continue Or Refusal To Renew A Franchise Or Upon Discontinuation Of Any Line Make; To Amend Section 63-17-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Terms; To Amend Section 63-17-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Certain Actions By A Motor Vehicle Manufacturer, Distributor, Wholesaler, Distributor Branch Or Division, A Factory Branch Or Division, Or A Wholesaler Branch Or Division; To Amend Section 63-17-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Audit For Warranty Parts Or Service Compensation Shall Be Performed Within The Six-month Period Immediately Following The Date Of The Payment Of The Disputed Claim By The Manufacturer Or Distributor, And That Any Audit For Sales Incentives, Service Incentives, Rebates Or Other Forms Of Incentive Compensation Shall Be Performed Within The Nine-month Period Immediately Following The Date Of The Payment Of The Disputed Claim By The Manufacturer Or Distributor; To Repeal Section 63-17-141, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Duties Of Dealers And Manufacturers Or Distributors Upon Termination Or Nonrenewal Of Motor Vehicle Franchise Agreements; And For Related Purposes.

2649.title: Practice of cosmetology and barbering; create new State Board of Cosmetology and Barbering.
2649.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 73-7-1 Through 73-7-37 And Sections 73-7-51 Through 73-7-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The State Board Of Cosmetology And Prescribe Its Duties And Powers; To Amend Section 73-7-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Board Of Cosmetology To Contract With A Recognized Testing Service; To Amend Section 73-7-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Schools Of Cosmetology To Only Admit Students Who Have Passed The General Aptitude Test Battery (gatb) Or The Test Of Adult Basic Education (tabe); To Amend Section 73-7-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Fees; To Amend Section 73-7-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On Those Sections; And For Related Purposes.

2650.title: Child support; chancellor may order itemized monthly statement.
2650.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-11-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Chancellor To Require An Itemized Monthly Statement From A Custodial Parent As To The Expenditure Of Child Support Payments; And For Related Purposes.

2651.title: Recreational vehicle franchise law; create.
2651.description: An Act To Create The Recreational Vehicle Franchise Law; To Enact Definitions; To Provide For Contracting As To Designated Dealer Territories; To Provide For Termination, Cancellation, Nonrenewal And Alteration Of A Dealership By A Manufacturer Or Distributor With And Without Cause; To Provide For Termination, Cancellation, Nonrenewal And Alteration Of A Dealership By A Dealer With And Without Cause; To Provide For Repurchase Of Inventory Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide For Transfer Of Dealership Under Certain Circumstances; To Specify Warranty Obligations; To Provide For Indemnification Of The Parties To The Agreement Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide For Inspection And Rejection By A Dealer; To Prohibit Coercion Of A Dealer; To Provide For Mediation Of Disputes; To Amend Sections 63-17-73, 63-17-111 And 63-17-131, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2653.title: Self-Employment Assistance Program (SEAP); establish under Mississippi Department of Employment Security.
2653.description: An Act To Codify Section 71-5-545, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish A Self-employment Assistance Program (seap) Under The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security (mdes); To Provide Eligibility And Standards For The Program And To Provide For The Amount Of Self-employment Assistance Allowance; To Provide For A Seap Steering Committee; To Authorize The Mdes To Issue Regulations To Administer The Program; And For Related Purposes.

2654.title: Proprietary School and College Registration law; provide for fees and agent permits.
2654.description: An Act To Amend Sections 75-60-4 And 75-60-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges To Levy Certain Fees As May Be Required For The Performance Of The Proprietary School And College Registration Law; To Amend Section 75-60-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Surety Bond To Be Posted By Applicants For Certificates Of Registration; To Amend Sections 75-60-19, 75-60-23, 75-60-25, 75-60-27, 75-60-29, 75-60-31, 75-60-33, 75-60-35 And 75-60-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Proprietary School Agent Permits, Fees And Agent Bonds; And For Related Purposes.

2655.title: Mississippi Mineral Rights Reform Act of 2011; create.
2655.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Mineral Rights Reform Act Of 2011; To Require Registration Of Severed Mineral Interests In The Office Of The Chancery Clerk Of The County In Which The Mineral Interest Is Located; To Provide For Forfeiture To The State Of Any Severed Mineral Interest Not So Registered; And For Related Purposes.

2657.title: Charter schools; authorize open-enrollment and conversion public charter schools in the state.
2657.description: An Act To Codify Sections 37-28-1, 37-28-3, 37-28-5, 37-28-7, 37-28-9, 37-28-11, 37-28-13, 37-28-15, 37-28-17, 37-28-19 And 37-28-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Authorization For Conversion Charter Schools Under Which Existing Public Schools Meeting Certain Criteria May Convert To Charter School Status, To Provide Authorization For New Open-enrollment Public Charter Schools In The State Of Mississippi, To Provide That Such Open-enrollment Public Charter Schools Shall Be Organized As Nonprofit Tax-exempt Organizations, To Provide Criteria For Academic Achievements At The Public Charter Schools, To Provide That Certain State Funds Shall Go Directly To The Newly Established Public Charter Schools On A Per-pupil Expenditure Basis, To Provide That Such Public Charter Schools May Use A Weighted Lottery System To Fill Enrollment Seats, To Provide For The Governance Of Such Public Charter Schools And To Provide That Teachers Shall Be Employees Of The Public Charter Schools, To Provide That The State Board Of Education Shall Issue Regulations, And To Provide For Reporting, To Provide For Transportation Of Students Attending Public Charter Schools, And To Provide For Probation And Revocation Of Public Charter Schools By The State Superintendent Of Education; To Repeal Sections 37-28-1 Through 37-28-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Effective July 1, 2020; To Repeal Sections 37-165-1 Through 37-165-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is The "conversion Charter School Act Of 2010"; And For Related Purposes.

2658.title: Dangerous dogs; revise manslaughter when running at large.
2658.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Crime Of Manslaughter As Charged Against The Owner Of An Animal That Kills A Human Being When Allowed To Run At Large; To Create An Additional Crime For The Owner Of A Dog Who Seriously Injures A Person Under Certain Circumstances; To Define Terms; To Create Exceptions; And For Related Purposes.

2660.title: Department of Information Technology Services; require inventory of technology hardware for all agencies and institutions.
2660.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services To Inventory On-premise Information Technology Hardware For All Agencies, Community And Junior Colleges, And Institutions Of Higher Learning, And To Prioritize A List Of Candidate Agencies For A Virtualization Analysis; And For Related Purposes.

2661.title: Animal cruelty; misdemeanor offense.
2661.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Crime Of Cruelty To Animals, To Incorporate Elements Of Offenses Found Elsewhere In Title 97, Chapter 41, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Amend Section 97-41-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Authority To Seize Maltreated, Neglected, Or Abandoned Animals; To Amend Section 97-41-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Process By Which An Animal May Be Lawfully Destroyed; To Provide Exemptions From The Application Of The Chapter; To Repeal Section 97-41-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That Carrying Any Creature In A Cruel And Inhumane Manner Is A Misdemeanor; To Repeal Section 97-41-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That Confining Any Living Creature Without Sufficient Food And Water Is A Misdemeanor; To Repeal Section 97-41-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That A Custodian Of Any Living Creature Who Fails To Provide Sufficient Food And Drink Is Guilty Of A Misdemeanor; To Repeal Section 97-41-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Penalties For Certain Acts Of Cruelty To Animals; And For Related Purposes.

2663.title: Aggravated animal cruelty; first offense a felony.
2663.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Crime Of Cruelty To Animals, To Distinguish Between Misdemeanor And Felony Offenses Of The Crime, To Incorporate Elements Of Offenses Found Elsewhere In Title 97, Chapter 41, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Amend Section 97-41-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Authority To Seize Maltreated, Neglected, Or Abandoned Animals; To Amend Section 97-41-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Process By Which An Animal May Be Lawfully Destroyed; To Provide Exemptions From The Application Of The Chapter; To Repeal Section 97-41-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That Carrying Any Creature In A Cruel And Inhumane Manner Is A Misdemeanor; To Repeal Section 97-41-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That Confining Any Living Creature Without Sufficient Food And Water Is A Misdemeanor; To Repeal Section 97-41-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That A Custodian Of Any Living Creature Who Fails To Provide Sufficient Food And Drink Is Guilty Of A Misdemeanor; To Repeal Section 97-41-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Penalties For Certain Acts Of Cruelty To Animals; And For Related Purposes.

2665.title: Memorial highway; designate a certain segment of Highway 11 in Jones County as "Jefferson 'Carl' Monk, Jr. Memorial Highway."
2665.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 11 Within Jones County, Mississippi, As The "jefferson 'carl' Monk, Jr. Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

2666.title: Regional airport authority; revise commission membership selection.
2666.description: An Act To Amend Section 61-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Municipalities To Share A Commissioner On A Regional Airport Authority; And For Related Purposes.

2667.title: Traffic citations; camera citations from another state not placed on driver's record in this state.
2667.description: An Act To Prohibit Traffic Citations Issued From Another State As The Result Of The Use Of A Camera Or Electronic Speed Sensors Any Enforcement Method Not Authorized In Or By The State Of Mississippi From Being Placed On Driver's Record In This State Or Reported To Insurance Companies; To Provide An Exception; And For Related Purposes.

2669.title: M.T.A.G. and Eminent Scholars Grant programs; increase tuition assistance under.
2669.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-106-29 And 37-106-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Tuition Amounts Available Under The Mississippi Resident Tuition Assistance Grant (m.t.a.g.) Program And The Mississippi Eminent Scholars Grant Program; To Provide That Qualified Students Who Have Graduated From A Mississippi Community/junior College Shall Be Eligible For A Grant Equal To 100% Of The Cost Of Tuition And Fees For The Student's Junior Year At A Mississippi University Or Private College; To Clarify That Students Completing Accredited Homeschool Programs Shall Be Eligible To Apply For A Mississippi Resident Tuition Assistance Grant Or A Mississippi Eminent Scholars Grant; And For Related Purposes.

2670.title: State agencies; require to accept payment by personal check upon certain conditions.
2670.description: An Act To Require All State Agencies, Departments, Boards Or Commissions To Accept Personal Checks For Payment Of Any License, Permit, Fee Or Any Obligation Owing To The Agency Or Trust Deposit; And For Related Purposes.

2671.title: Nuclear Energy Research and Demonstration Center; IHL establish at ASU.
2671.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Establish The Nuclear Energy Research And Demonstration Center At Alcorn State University In Cooperation With Local And County Governments In The Surrounding Counties; To Set Forth The Purpose Of The Program; And For Related Purposes.

2672.title: Child support obligation; grant priority as an unsecured interest.
2672.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create Court-ordered Child Support Obligations As Unsecured Interest Of The Highest Priority Under The Drug Forfeiture Law; To Amend Sections 41-29-177 And 93-11-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2673.title: Real estate broker's price opinion; provide regulation of.
2673.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-34-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Real Estate Appraiser Licensing And Certification Act Shall Not Apply To Real Estate Licensees Who Are On Active Status And Who Perform A Broker Price Opinion; To Amend Section 73-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Terms "automated Valuation Model" And "broker Price Opinion" As Used In The Real Estate Brokers License Law; To Create A New Section To Be Codified Within Chapter 35, Title 73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Requirements And Regulations Of A Broker's Price Opinion; And For Related Purposes.

2674.title: State agency information technology services; authorize Mississippi Department of Information Technology Services to consolidate.
2674.description: An Act Relating To The Planning And Implementation Of The State's Information Technology Resources By The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services (mdits); To Amend Section 25-53-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Department Of Information Technology Services To Manage One Or More State Data Centers; To Direct The Authority To Identify Opportunities For Consolidation Of Computer Hardware And Software And Use Virtualization Technology To Optimize The Number Of Machines And Environmentally Controlled Facilities; To Direct Mdits To Optimize The Shared Technology Components Of The State; To Direct Mdits To Increase Federal Participation In The State Data Center And Its Shared Technology Infrastructure; To Direct Mdits To Expand Online Services To Citizens, Businesses And Other Governmental Entities; To Direct State Agencies And Institutions To Give Their Full Cooperation And Assistance In The Successful Achievement Of These Efforts; To Direct Mdits To Report Progress In Its Annual Report To The Legislature; To Codify Section 25-53-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Applicability Of The State Data Center Operated By Mdits; To Authorize And Direct Mdits To Develop A Strategic Plan For The Consolidation Of Information Resources For All State Agencies At The State Data Center; To Require Certain State Agencies To Comply With The Plan For Consolidating Identified Operations To Be Performed Through The State Data Center; To Authorize The State Data Center To Issue A Timetable For Selected State Agencies To Enter Into Interagency Agreements For The Provision Of Information Services By The State Data Center; To Provide For The Transfer Of Ownership Of Information Resources Pursuant To The Interagency Agreement; To Authorize The State Data Center To Set And Charge Fees For Information Technology Services; To Authorize Mdits To Issue Rules And Regulations To Implement This Act; To Amend Section 25-53-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Each Member Of The Information Technology Services Board Shall Continue To Serve After The Expiration Of His Term Until His Successor Is Duly Appointed; To Amend Sections 25-53-1, 25-53-3, 25-53-25 And 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Bring Forward Section 25-53-109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Relating To Telecommunications Services To State Agencies; And For Related Purposes.

2675.title: Transportation; require MDOT to develop a complete streets program.
2675.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Complete Streets Legislation; And For Related Purposes.

2676.title: Driving; prohibit texting and revise punishment for no license.
2676.description: An Act To Create Section 63-3-217, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Texting While Driving; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide Exemptions; To Amend Section 63-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Punishment For Driving Without A License; To Repeal Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Texting While Driving By The Holders Of Temporary And Intermediate Licenses; And For Related Purposes.

2677.title: Construction projects; certain bid requirements shall not apply when funded by federal grants.
2677.description: An Act To Amend Sections 31-3-15 And 31-3-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Bid Requirements Shall Not Apply To Construction Projects Funded In Whole Or In Part By Federal Grants; To Amend Section 61-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Federal Requirements Shall Be Controlling With Federal Grants To Airport Authorities When There Is A Conflict Between Federal And State Requirements For Bids And Awards; And For Related Purposes.

2678.title: Airport authorities; allow to use the Internet to sell surplus personal property.
2678.description: An Act To Amend Section 61-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Airport Authorities To Use The Internet Web Service To Sell Surplus Personal Property; And For Related Purposes.

2680.title: Marine Resources; allow bait camp application to be submitted at anytime.
2680.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-64.4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Applications For Live Bait Camps To Be Submitted At Anytime; And For Related Purposes.

2681.title: Mandated reports by schools and the State Department of Education; revise requirements.
2681.description: An Act To Direct The State Board Of Education To Develop And Promulgate Regulations For Improving Reporting Mandates For School Districts And The Department Of Education; To Amend Sections 27-101-1, 37-3-11, 37-3-53, 37-17-6 And 37-151-97, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Annual Report Information To Be Included In Reports Of The State Department Of Education; To Amend Sections 37-1-11, 37-3-7, 37-3-8, 37-3-83, 37-13-10, 37-13-80, 37-13-85, 37-14-3, 37-18-7, 37-19-7, 37-23-16, 37-159-3 And 37-161-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete Certain Annual Reporting Requirements By Schools; To Repeal Section 37-3-97, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Joint Report On State Teacher Education Programs, And Sections 37-25-9, 37-25-25 And 37-159-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Require Certain Annual Reports From School Districts To The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

2682.title: Highway 315; conduct an environmental impact study on certain segment.
2682.description: An Act To Direct The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Conduct An Environmental Impact Study For A Certain Segment Of Highway 315 In Panola County; And For Related Purposes.

2683.title: Forfeiture; seizure of conveyances used to transport counterfeit.
2683.description: An Act To Provide For The Seizure And Forfeiture Of Property Used In Trademark And Recordings Violations; To Provide For Seizure And Forfeiture Proceedings; To Provide For Notice To Lienholders And Parties With Security Interests; To Provide For The Disposition Of Property And Proceeds; To Amend Sections 97-21-53, 97-21-55, 97-21-57 And 97-23-89, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2685.title: Light wine and beer laws; remove repeal date on authority of Alcoholic Beverage Control officers to enforce.
2685.description: An Act To Amend Sections 67-1-37, 67-3-31, 67-3-37 And 67-3-74, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The July 1, 2011 Repeal Date On The Provisions That Authorize The Enforcement Agents Of The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division Of The Department Of Revenue Do Enforce Certain Provision Of The Light Wine And Beer Laws; And For Related Purposes.

2686.title: Light wine and beer; Commissioner of Revenue may establish dates for expiration of permit and may issue temporary permits.
2686.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Revenue To Establish Dates For The Expiration Of Permits Issued Under The Laws Governing The Manufacture And Sale Of Light Wine And Beer; To Authorize The Commissioner Of Revenue To Issue Temporary Permits Under The Laws Governing The Sale Of Light Wine Or Beer; To Provide That Such Permits Shall Contain Certain Information; And For Related Purposes.

2688.title: Counties; revise cleaning of private property and lien therefor.
2688.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Method Of Giving Notice By A County To The Owner Of Unsafe Or Dilapidated Property That The County Intends To Clean The Property And Assess The Cost Thereof To The Property Owner; And For Related Purposes.

2689.title: Bail; revise setting bond in city court, bond forfeiture and arrest of principal.
2689.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-5-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Bond Forfeiture; To Amend Section 99-5-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Sureties May Arrest And Surrender The Principal; To Amend Section 21-23-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Judicial Procedures By Which Bail Is Set In Municipal Court And That Bail Set In Municipal Court Is Payable To The Municipality; To Amend Section 83-39-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The License Requirements Of Bail Agents, And To Exempt From Certain Education Requirements Certain Licensed Professional Bail Agents When Renewing Another Type Of Bail Agent License; To Amend Section 83-39-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Each Licensed Professional Bail Agent To Maintain An Office Physically Located Within The State Of Mississippi In Any County Where Records Are Kept For Business Activities Of The Agent; To Amend Section 83-39-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Allowable Fees For Monitoring Shall Not Be Considered Part Of The Premium Or Fee Charged Under This Section; To Amend Section 83-39-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Paying Of A Fee Or Rebate To Any Person, Other Than A Soliciting Bail Agent, For The Purpose Of Procuring A Bail Bond; And For Related Purposes.

2690.title: Bail; revise approval of sureties.
2690.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-5-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Approval Of Sureties For Bail; And For Related Purposes.

2691.title: Driver's license; revise punishment for driving with suspended.
2691.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Punishment For The Offense Of Driving With A Suspended License; And For Related Purposes.

2692.title: Commitment; revise eligibility for treatment with charges pending.
2692.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-21-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Criteria For Commitment Of Persons Who Have Unresolved Felony Charges Pending; And For Related Purposes.

2693.title: Controlled Substances Law; conform to federal schedules and add certain other prescription drugs.
2693.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Tapentadol And Anpp In Schedule Ii Of The Controlled Substances Act; To Amend Section 41-29-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Certain Anabolic Steroids And Butalbital In Schedule Iii Of The Controlled Substances Act; To Amend Section 41-29-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Fospropofol, Carisoprodol And Tramadol In Schedule Iv Of The Controlled Substances Act; To Amend Section 41-29-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Lacosamide In Schedule V; To Make Certain Technical Amendments To More Closely Conform To The Federal Controlled Substance Schedules; To Amend Section 41-29-137, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2694.title: Prescription monitoring program; clarify access to.
2694.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Access To The Prescription Monitoring Program Of The State Board Of Pharmacy And Make Certain Technical Corrections; And For Related Purposes.

2695.title: Ultram, Soma and Fioricet; schedule as controlled substances.
2695.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Butalbital On Controlled Substance Schedule Ii; To Amend Section 41-29-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Carisoprodol And Tramadol On Controlled Substance Schedule Iv; And For Related Purposes.

2696.title: Department of Transportation; allow law enforcement employees to retain weapon upon retirement.
2696.description: An Act To Allow Law Enforcement Officers With The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Retain A Sidearm Upon Retirement; And For Related Purposes.

2697.title: Law Enforcement Officers Death Benefits Trust Fund; expand coverage to include emergency management personnel.
2697.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund To Include Death Benefits For Emergency Management Agency Personnel; And For Related Purposes.

2698.title: Tuition; waive at universities and colleges for children and spouses of deceased and disabled veterans.
2698.description: An Act To Provide For The Waiver Of Tuition And Required Fees At The State Institutions Of Higher Learning And Community And Junior Colleges For The Children Or Spouse Of Deceased Veterans Of The United States Armed Forces Or The Mississippi National Guard Who Were Killed In The Line Of Duty And The Children Or Spouse Of Certain Disabled Veterans Of The United States Armed Forces Or The Mississippi National Guard; To Require Applications For A Waiver To Include Documentation Concerning The Deceased Veteran's Death Or The Veteran's Disability; To Provide That Tuition May Be Waived For Both Full-time And Part-time Students; To Provide That The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning Shall Be The Administering Agency Of The Tuition Waiver Program; And For Related Purposes.

2700.title: Airports; allow airport authority to enter into contracts without limitation of vendor's liability if commercially reasonable.
2700.description: An Act To Amend Section 61-3-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Airport Authority To Enter Into Certain Contracts Without A Provision For Limitation Of Vendor's Liability If It Is Commercially Reasonable And Provides Protection To The Authority; And For Related Purposes.

2701.title: Highways; revise requirements for trucks carrying loose material.
2701.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-83 And Section 63-7-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Requirements For Trucks Carrying Loose Material; And For Related Purposes.

2702.title: Airports; exempt parking revenue from sales tax.
2702.description: An Act To Amend Section 61-3-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Airport Authority Revenue From Certain Sales Taxes; And For Related Purposes.

2704.title: Crimes against animals; enact "Mississippi Dog and Cat Pet Protection Law of 2011."
2704.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact The "mississippi Dog And Cat Pet Protection Law Of 2011"; To Clarify And Revise The Crime Of Cruelty To A Dog Or Cat; To Specifically Describe Activities That Do Not Constitute The Crime Of Cruelty To A Dog Or Cat; To Amend Sections 97-41-1, 97-41-3, 97-41-5, 97-41-7, 97-41-9, 97-41-17, 97-41-21 And 97-41-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2705.title: Crimes against animals; enact "Mississippi Dog and Cat Pet Protection Law of 2011" first offense felony.
2705.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact The "mississippi Dog And Cat Pet Protection Law Of 2011"; To Clarify And Revise The Crime Of Cruelty To A Dog Or Cat; To Amend Sections 97-41-1, 97-41-3, 97-41-5, 97-41-7, 97-41-9, 97-41-17, 97-41-21 And 97-41-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2706.title: Reentry courts; provide for creation of.
2706.description: An Act To Provide For The Creation Of Reentry Courts; And For Related Purposes.

2707.title: Mississippi Small Business Regulatory Flexibility Act; create.
2707.description: An Act To Create The "mississippi Small Business Regulatory Flexibility Act"; To Make Legislative Findings; To Define Certain Terms As Used In The Act; To Establish A Small Business Regulatory Review Committee; To Improve State Rulemaking By Creating Procedures To Analyze The Economic Impact On And Availability Of More Flexible Approaches For Small Business; And For Related Purposes.

2708.title: Municipalities; city attorneys required to carry errors and omission coverage.
2708.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-15-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Errors And Omission Coverage For City Attorneys; To Amend Sections 21-15-25 And 21-15-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2710.title: Voter fraud; constitute a disqualifying conviction.
2710.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create Voter Fraud As Disqualifying Conviction For Purposes Of Voter Registration Pursuant To Section 244a Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890; And For Related Purposes.

2711.title: Conspiracy; subject to same enhancement as any underlying offense.
2711.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-1-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Conspiracy To Commit An Offense That Is Subject To Enhancement May Be Punished In The Same Manner As The Enhanced Offense Would Be; And For Related Purposes.

2712.title: Depart. of Finance & Administration; authorize to accept certain real property from TVA in Tishomingo County.
2712.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The State Of Mississippi, To Accept And Receive From The Tennessee Valley Authority All Right, Title And Interest In Certain Real Property And Any Improvements Thereon Located In Tishomingo County, Mississippi, To Be Titled In The Name Of The State Of Mississippi For The Benefit And Use Of The Mississippi Development Authority, Subject To Certain Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

2713.title: Ambulance service providers; impose certain requirements for transporting patients across county lines.
2713.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-55-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Certain Requirements And Limitations On Charges By Ambulance Providers Who Transport Patients Across County Lines; And For Related Purposes.

2714.title: Home-based educational technology school readiness skills program for preschool children (Mississippi Upstart); authorize.
2714.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education To Contract With A Sole Source Vendor For A Home-based Educational Technology Program To Provide School Readiness Skills For Preschool Children To Be Named The "mississippi Upstart" Program; To Provide Definitions; To Provide Minimum Standards For The Program; To Provide For Local School District Participation In The Mississippi Upstart Program Under Certain Conditions; To Provide Eligibility Requirements For Family Participation In The Mississippi Upstart Program; To Provide For The Purchase Of Equipment For The Program Through Cooperative Purchasing Contracts; To Provide For Audit Of The Program And Reports; To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education To Develop And Implement Financial Literacy Education Programs In The Public School Districts Under Certain Standards And Recognition And Incentive Programs For Students Who Complete The Program; And For Related Purposes.

2715.title: Additional assessment for vulnerable adults investigation and prosecution; provide for.
2715.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For An Additional Misdemeanor And Felony Assessment For The Vulnerable Adults Investigation And Prosecution Program; And For Related Purposes.

2716.title: Tourism; revise definition of tourism project for purpose of tourism project sales tax incentive program.
2716.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-26-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Term "tourism Project" For Purposes Of The Tourism Project Sales Tax Incentive Program To Provide That The Term May Include Historical Resort Developments; To Define The Term "historical Resort Development"; And For Related Purposes.

2718.title: Economic development loans; delete interest rate requirement.
2718.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-10-513, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Requirement That Certain Economic Development Loans Made Through Planning And Development Districts Bear An Interest Rate Of At Least 5% Per Annum; And For Related Purposes.

2719.title: "Rose Isabel Williams Mental Health Reform Act of 2011"; enact.
2719.description: An Act Entitled The "rose Isabel Williams Mental Health Reform Act Of 2011"; To Amend Section 41-4-1 And Create New Section 41-4-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Board Of Mental Health To Adopt Regulations To Ensure That Core Adult Mental Health Services, Child Mental Health Services, Intellectual/developmental Disabilities Services And Crisis Services Are Provided In Every County Of The State; To Amend Section 41-4-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Board To Appoint A Medical Director For The Department Of Mental Health; To Empower The Board To Establish Minimum Standards And Certify The Required Services For The Regional Mental Health Commissions And Centers And Other Community Service Providers In Order To Receive State Funds For Such Services, And To Identify Appropriate Community Service Providers To Provide Such Core Services; To Direct The Board To Establish A Strategic Planning And Best Practices Committee For Mental Health Services; To Amend Section 41-19-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Regional Mental Health/intellectual/developmental Disability Commissions And Centers To Administer Mental Health/intellectual Disability Programs Required By The Board In Order To Be Eligible For State Funding, To Annually Submit An Itemized Service Plan To The Department For Certification; To Amend Section 41-21-87, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Notice For The Discharge Of A Civilly Committed Patient, And To Direct The Department Of Mental Health To Provide The Directors Of Community Mental Health Centers The Names Of Individuals Discharged To Their Catchment Area With A Referral For Community-based Services; And For Related Purposes.

2720.title: State Medical Examiner and Crime Laboratory; transfer to Mississippi Department of Health.
2720.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-61-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer And Merge The Administration And Programs Of The Central Office For The State Medical Examiner And The Mississippi Crime Laboratory From The Department Of Public Safety To The Mississippi Department Of Health On July 1, 2011; And For Related Purposes.

2721.title: County supervisors; authorize to bury dead poultry in emergency situations.
2721.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Any County To Use Road Equipment And Employees To Bury Poultry That Has Died As The Result Of A Natural Or Man-made Disaster Or Emergency Situation; To Place Certain Requirements And Restrictions On The Board's Authority; And For Related Purposes.

2722.title: Municipal special sales tax; provide that revenue must be used for road repairs and water, sewer and drainage projects.
2722.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-241, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Law That Authorizes The Levy Of A Municipal Special Sales Tax In Certain Municipalities To Provide That The Revenue Collected Pursuant To The Tax Levy Shall Be Used To Pay The Cost Of Road And Street Repair, Reconstruction And Resurfacing Projects Based On Traffic Patterns, Need And Usage, And To Pay The Costs Of Water, Sewer And Drainage Projects; To Provide That A Municipality May Not Hold An Election Required By This Section More Than Twice; To Reduce The Amount Of The Special Tax Revenue That The Department Of Revenue May Retain To Defray The Costs Incurred By The Department In The Collection Of The Special Tax; To Provide That The Commission Required To Be Established Pursuant To This Section Shall, With Input From The Municipality, Establish A Master Plan For Road And Street Repair, Reconstruction And Resurfacing Projects Based On Traffic Patterns, Need And Usage, And For Water, Sewer And Drainage Projects; To Provide That Expenditures Of The Revenue From The Tax Authorized To Be Imposed Pursuant To This Section Shall Be Made At The Discretion Of The Governing Authorities Of The Municipality If The Expenditures Comply With The Master Plan; To Provide That The Committee Shall Monitor The Compliance Of The Municipality With The Master Plan; To Extend The Date Of Repeal On This Section Until July 1, 2032, Unless The Tax Fails To Be Adopted At An Election Held For Such Purpose Prior To July 1, 2014, In Which Case This Section Is Repealed From And After July 1, 2014; And For Related Purposes.
