2723.title: Pain-Capable Unborn Child Protection Act; enact.
2723.description: An Act To Create The Pain-capable Unborn Child Protection Act; To Define Terms; To Prohibit Abortions Under Certain Conditions; To Enact Penalties; To Amend Section 73-25-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Grounds For Unprofessional Conduct By A Physician To Include Violations Of The Pain-capable Unborn Child Protection Act; And For Related Purposes.

2724.title: Forest severance tax; revise to fund bonds issued by county for road repair.
2724.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-25-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Distribution Of Timber Severance Tax To Counties For Retiring Bonds Issued For Road Repair; And For Related Purposes.

2725.title: Board of supervisors; may assess homeowners based on pro-rata platted lot area after taking ownership of a private street.
2725.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors, Upon Taking Ownership Of A Private Street Or Roadway, To Assess Each Homeowner Fronting That Street Based On The Homeowner's Pro-rata Platted Lot Area; And For Related Purposes.

2726.title: Employment Protection Act; revise and clarify.
2726.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-11-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Retention Of E-verify Confirmations For At Least 3 Years, Revise And Clarify Enforcement And Penalties Under The Mississippi Employment Protection Act, Revise Definitions, And Provide For Expediting Trial Of Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2727.title: Asset forfeiture; constables can participate in drug cases.
2727.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-181, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That A Constable Can Participate In The Forfeiture Of Property Under The Section With The Share Allocated To The Constable's Participation To Be Credited To The County Budget; And For Related Purposes.

2728.title: "Mississippi Honoring Patients' Assignment of Health Care Benefits Act"; enact.
2728.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Honoring Patients' Assignment Of Health Care Benefits Act"; To Provide Definitions; To Provide That Health Care Coverage Shall Be Paid Directly To Any Similarly Licensed Nonparticipating Provider With A Written Assignment Of Benefits Under Certain Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

2729.title: University depository; extend period of contract.
2729.description: An Act To Amend Section 7-9-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Term Of Public University Depository Contracts; And For Related Purposes.

2730.title: Institutions of Higher Learning; authorize Board of Trustees to pay reasonable travel expense for candidates.
2730.description: An Act To Codify Section 37-101-26, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Pay Reasonable Travel Expenses For Candidates Considered For Open Positions At State Universities Or In The Board Executive Office; And For Related Purposes.

2731.title: Director of Mississippi University Research Authority; revise qualifications.
2731.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-147-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Qualifications Of The Executive Director Of The Mississippi University Research Authority; And For Related Purposes.

2732.title: Student financial assistance programs; revise curriculum eligibility requirements.
2732.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-157-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Curriculum Eligibility Requirements For University Students In The Help Financial Assistance Program; And For Related Purposes.

2733.title: Proprietary school registration; authorize national accreditation for certain schools.
2733.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-7-16, 73-67-35 And 75-60-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Private Business And Vocational Schools Are Authorized To Submit Evidence Of Current National Accreditation From An Accrediting Agency Designated By The United States Department Of Education In Lieu Of Other Application Requests; And For Related Purposes.

2734.title: Levee damage commissioners; provide for appointment for part of Warren County within the Mississippi Levee District.
2734.description: An Act To Amend Section 17, Chapter 1, Laws Of 1865, As Last Amended By Chapter 359, Laws Of 1997, To Provide For The Appointment Of Commissioners To Assess Levee Damages For That Part Of Warren County Lying Within The Mississippi Levee District; And For Related Purposes.

2735.title: Mississippi Freedom of Choice in Health Care Act; create.
2735.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Freedom Of Choice In Health Care Act; To Provide That The Legislature May Not Require Any Person To Participate In Any Health Care System Or Plan, Nor May It Impose A Penalty Or Fine For Choosing To Obtain Or Decline Health Care Coverage Or For Participation In Any Particular Health Care System Or Plan; And For Related Purposes.

2737.title: Insurance company catastrophe models; require Attorney General to study accuracy and reliability of.
2737.description: An Act To Require The Attorney General To Study The Accuracy And Reliability Of Catastrophe Models Used By Insurance Companies Writing Property Insurance In The State Of Mississippi; To Require The Attorney General To Report Its Findings To The Legislature And Commissioner Of Insurance; To Require Any Insurance Company Writing Property Insurance In The State Of Mississippi To Grant The Attorney General Access To The Models' Underlying Data, Formulas And Calculations; And For Related Purposes.

2738.title: Marine Resources; authorize DMR to create a pilot marine reserve using Deepwater Horizon oil spill funds.
2738.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Marine Resources To Create A Pilot Marine Reserve Project; To Authorize The Use Of Funds From The Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill For The Marine Reserve; And For Related Purposes.

2739.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for the Animal Rescue League of Laurel.
2739.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of The Animal Rescue League Of Laurel; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For Such Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

2740.title: Licensed hospitals; SDH adopt regulations to allow off-campus emergency departments.
2740.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-9-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Health As Licensing Agency To Adopt Regulations Allowing Hospitals To Operate Off-campus Emergency Departments Under Certain Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

2741.title: IHL Board; shall implement a vehicle management system for each institution of higher learning.
2741.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-101-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Require The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Implement A Vehicle Management System For The Individual Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Set Out The Board's Powers With Respect To The Implementation Of Such System; And For Related Purposes.

2742.title: Schedule II controlled substance; delivery by mail requires adult signature.
2742.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-125, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Delivery By Mail Or Other Shipping Method Is To Be Made Only To An Adult Who Must Sign For Receipt; To Amend Section 41-29-129 And 73-21-106, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2744.title: Outboard motors; require registration.
2744.description: An Act To Amend Section 59-21-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Each Person Registering A Boat Under The Mississippi Boating Law Of 1960 To Register With The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks The Serial Numbers Of All Outboard Motors Owned By Him; To Amend Section 59-21-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That, If Applicable, The Use Tax On Such Motors Must Be Paid Before The Outboard Motor May Be Registered; And For Related Purposes.

2745.title: Insurance companies; prohibit payment of loss ratio bonus to agents.
2745.description: An Act To Prohibit Any Insurance Company To Pay, Directly Or Indirectly, To An Agent Any Bonus Or Extra Compensation Contingent On The Number Of Claims That Are Filed And/or Paid On An Insurance Policy, Or On The Actual Amount Of The Claims Paid On An Insurance Policy; And For Related Purposes.

2746.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for supporters of the Laurel School District.
2746.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.216, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Distinctive Ag Authorized Under This Section Shall Be Issued To Supporters Of The Laurel School District; To Revise The Words Required To Be Displayed On The Tag; To Provide That The Additional Fee Collected On The Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag Issued Under This Section Shall Be Distributed To The Laurel School District; And For Related Purposes.

2747.title: Franchise agreements; regulate between outdoor sport equipment dealers, manufacturers and distributors.
2747.description: An Act To Regulate Franchise Agreements Between Outdoor Sport Equipment Dealers, Manufacturers And Distributors; To Define Certain Terms Used In The Act; To Require A Dealership Agreement And Compliance; To Prescribe The Contents Of A Dealership Agreement; To Prohibit Certain Conduct With Regard To The Sale, Transfer, Exchange Of Dealership; To Regulate The Cancellation And Alteration Of Dealerships; To Require The Repurchase Of Inventory If Dealer Agreement Is Terminated Without Good Cause; To Regulate Warranty Claims Submitted By A Dealer To An Outdoor Sport Equipment Manufacturer; To Provide Remedies For Violations Of The Act; And For Related Purposes.

2748.title: Uniform Foreign Money-Judgments Recognition Act/Uniform Foreign-Country Money Judgments Act; enact.
2748.description: An Act To Enact The "uniform Foreign Money-judgments Recognition Act"; To Enact The "uniform Foreign-country Money Judgments Recognition Act"; And For Related Purposes.

2749.title: Sewer services; require person to pay delinquent fees before receiving car tag.
2749.description: An Act To Provide That A Person Must Pay Delinquent Sewer Service Fees Prior To Obtaining A Car Tag; To Bring Forward Section 17-25-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972; And For Related Purposes.

2750.title: Burn Center Lodge for families of victims treated at Rankin County burn unit; authorize county millage for.
2750.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-39-332, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Counties To Levy Millage For The Construction And Operation Of The Burn Center Lodge For Families Of Victims Being Treated At The Burn Unit At Crossgates River Oaks Hospital; And For Related Purposes.

2751.title: Highway Patrol; establish escort procedures and policy.
2751.description: An Act To Establish An Escort Policy For The Mississippi Highway Patrol; To Establish Certain Requirements For Escorts; To Provide For Leave And Pay Of The Officers Participating In An Escort; And For Related Purposes.

2752.title: Dual enrolled students and dual credit students; clarify prerequisites.
2752.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-15-38 And 37-15-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise And Clarify The Provisions Relating To Dual Enrolled Students And Dual Credit Students; And For Related Purposes.

2753.title: Auto liability insurance; authorize Dept. of Public Safety to implement an uninsured motorist database/increase fines.
2753.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-15-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Public Safety To Implement A Motorist Identification Database Program For The Purpose Of Identifying Uninsured Motorists In This State, To Increase The Amount Of Fines Imposed For Failing To Have Proof Of Liability Insurance, And To Provide That A Portion Of Such Fines Shall Be Deposited Into The State Trauma System Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2754.title: Agricultural aviation; require safety markings on certain towers.
2754.description: An Act To Require The Marking Of Certain Anemometer Towers; To Require Other Measures For Safety Of Aerial Applicators; To Provide For The Repeal Of This Act On July 1, 2013; And For Related Purposes.

2755.title: Memorial highway; designate a certain segment of highway adjacent to Camp Shelby as "Chaplin Clark Polling Memorial Highway."
2755.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Highway Adjacent To Camp Shelby As The "chaplin Clark Polling Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

2756.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of tangible personal property made to raise funds for schools.
2756.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Tangible Personal Property Made For The Sole Purpose Of Raising Funds For School Or An Organization Affiliated With A School; And For Related Purposes.

2757.title: Corrections; authorize sheriffs and police chiefs to operate a jamming system within correctional facility.
2757.description: An Act To Authorize The Sheriff Of A County And The Police Chief Of A Municipality To Institute A Jamming System Within Any Correctional Facility To Jam Unauthorized Wireless Communication Within The Facility By Offenders; And For Related Purposes.

2758.title: Beer breweries; allow to provide certain samples.
2758.description: An Act To Provide That A Holder Of A Permit To Manufacture Beer Who Operates A Brewery May Provide Limited Amounts Of Beer On The Premises Of The Brewery For Tasting Or Sampling; To Provide That Beer Provided For Tasting Or Sampling Must Be Manufactured In This State By The Holder Of The Permit; To Provide That Beer Samples May Be Provided Only To Persons On The Premises Of A Brewery At No Cost And For Consumption On The Premises Of The Brewery; To Provide The Times During Which Beer Samples May Be Provided And That The Samples Must Be Provided In Conjunction With A Tour Of The Brewery; To Limit The Amount Of Beer Samples That May Be Provided To An Individual Within A Twenty-four-hour Period; To Bring Forward Sections 67-3-45, 67-3-46, 67-3-51 And 67-3-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are Sections Of The Laws Regulating The Manufacturing, Sale And Distribution Of Light Wine And Beer, For The Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-71-301, Which Provides Definitions For Purposes Of The Laws Taxing Light Wine And Beer, For The Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2759.title: District attorneys; clarify authority.
2759.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-31-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Authority Of The District Attorney To Collect Certain Debts Owed To Counties And Municipalities; To Bring Forward Section 19-3-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Amend Section 21-17-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Authority Of A Municipality To Donate Surplus Lands To An Institution Of Higher Learning; And For Related Purposes.

2760.title: Corrections; revise conditions for medical release of inmates.
2760.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That An Inmate Must Be Terminally Ill To Qualify For Conditional Medical Release; And For Related Purposes.

2761.title: Federal estate tax exemption; provide rule of construction for certain will and testaments.
2761.description: An Act To Provide That Certain Provisions In The Wills And Testaments Of Decedents Who Passed Away In 2010 Shall Be Construed In The Context Of Federal Estate Taxation Law; And For Related Purposes.

2762.title: Propane; prohibit price-gouging.
2762.description: An Act To Prohibit Price-gouging In The Sale And Distribution Of Liquefied Petroleum Gas Or Propane; To Create A Procedure For Filing Of Consumer Complaints; To Delegate Authority For The Enforcement Of The Act To The Attorney General And Department Of Agriculture; And For Related Purposes.

2763.title: Prosecutorial discretion; revise under certain circumstances.
2763.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revive Prosecutorial Discretion Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2765.title: Memorial highway; designate MS Highway 552 in Claiborne and Jefferson Counties as "Dr. Walter Washington Parkway."
2765.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 552 Within Claiborne And Jefferson Counties, Mississippi, As The "dr. Walter Washington Parkway"; And For Related Purposes.

2766.title: Railroad grade crossings; prohibit obstruction of vehicular traffic for more than 20 consecutive minutes at grade crossings.
2766.description: An Act To Prohibit Any Train, Railroad Car Or Equipment, Or Engine From Obstructing Vehicular Traffic At A Railroad Grade Crossing Upon A Public Street, Road Or Highway For A Period In Excess Of 20 Consecutive Minutes; To Provide Exceptions To Such Prohibition; To Provide Fines For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2767.title: Highways; require removal of trees along right-of-way that shade the highway preventing the melting of ice or snow.
2767.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Remove Trees Along The Right-of-way Of A Highway During Inclement Weather; And For Related Purposes.

2768.title: Trusties who are authorized to accumulate additional earned time; revise.
2768.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-138.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Offender Who Has Been Convicted Of Certain Drug Crimes And Is In Trusty Status May Be Awarded Additional Trusty Earned Time; And For Related Purposes.

2769.title: Independent contractors; limit amount that agencies may pay if the contractor is receiving a retirement allowance from PERS.
2769.description: An Act To Limit The Amount Of Compensation That May Be Paid By An Agency To An Independent Contractor Who Is Receiving A Retirement Allowance From The Public Employees' Retirement System; And For Related Purposes.

2770.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for supporters of Farm Families of Mississippi.
2770.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of The Farm Families Of Mississippi; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of Such Fees; And For Related Purposes.

2771.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for supporters of Brookhaven Academy.
2771.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of Brookhaven Academy; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of Such Fees; And For Related Purposes.

2772.title: Life insurance companies; prohibit payout to beneficiary by depositing proceeds into checking account.
2772.description: An Act To Prohibit Any Life Insurance Company From Paying A Beneficiary Of A Life Insurance Policy By Depositing The Proceeds Into A Checking Account Controlled By The Insurer, Even If The Account Is In The Beneficiary's Name; And For Related Purposes.

2773.title: PERS; provide for payment of contributions on income of chancery or circuit clerks-county may elect to pay all employee contributions.
2773.description: An Act To Create A New Code Section To Be Codified As Section 25-11-106.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The County Is Responsible For Employer Contributions To The Public Employees' Retirement System (pers) On Net Income Attributable To Direct Treasury Or County Payroll Income To The Chancery Or Circuit Clerk From The County And May Elect To Be Responsible For The Employer Contributions On The Clerk's Net Income Attributable To Fees; To Provide That The Chancery Or Circuit Clerk Is Responsible For The Employee Contributions To Pers On Net Income Attributable To Direct Treasury Or County Payroll Income And, If The County Does Not Elect To Be Responsible For The Employee Contributions On Net Income Attributable To Fees, Both The Employee And Employer Share Of Contributions On The Proportionate Share Of Net Income Attributable To Fees; To Provide That If The Chancery Or Circuit Clerk Fails To Make Full Payment Of Contributions As Required In Calendar Year 2010 Or Any Calendar Year Thereafter, Pers Shall Certify The Delinquency To The County And The County Shall Withhold Any And All Payments And Fees Due To The Chancery Or Circuit Clerk Until Such Time As The Amount Of His Or Her Delinquent Contributions Are Withheld And Pay The Amount So Withheld To Pers; To Provide That Any Current Or Former Chancery Or Circuit Clerk For Whom Appropriate Employee And Employer Contributions And Interest On All Fees And County Income From Covered Service Before January 1, 2010, Have Not Been Made, Shall Pay To Pers The Required Contributions And Interest By Not Later Than December 31, 2011, Or Irrevocably Forfeit Service Credit For Any Period For Which Contributions Are Delinquent, Or Elect, Before December 31, 2011, Not To Pay Delinquent Employee And Employer Contributions And Applicable Interest For Service As A Chancery Or Circuit Clerk Before January 1, 2010, And Irrevocably Forfeit Service Credit For Any Period For Which Contributions Are Delinquent; And For Related Purposes.

2774.title: Crimes; revise penalties for certain unlawful alcohol sales.
2774.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Punishment For Buying Alcohol With Forged Identification; To Amend Section 67-1-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Punishment For Selling Alcohol To A Person Visibly Intoxicated, A Commission Interdict, Or After Hours; And For Related Purposes.

2775.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize to honor Ronald Reagan.
2775.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag Honoring Ronald Reagan, Fortieth President Of The United States, And His Many Outstanding Accomplishments; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For Such Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

2777.title: Special funds; expand uses of money in certain special funds.
2777.description: An Act To Amend Sections 57-10-511, 57-61-21, 57-61-41, 57-93-1, 69-2-13 And 69-34-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Purposes For Which Money In The Mississippi Small Business Assistance Program, The Mississippi Business Investment Fund, The Port Revitalization Revolving Loan Fund, The Mississippi Existing Industry Productivity Loan Fund, The Emerging Crops Fund And The Milk Producers Transportation Cost Assistance Loan Fund May Be Utilized; And For Related Purposes.

2778.title: Retirement; increase amount that a constable may be paid and continue receiving a retirement allowance.
2778.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Compensation That A Retiree Who Is Serving As A Constable May Receive For That Office And Continue To Receive A Retirement Allowance; And For Related Purposes.

2779.title: Memorial highway; designate certain segment of U.S. Highway 78 as "William R. 'Bill' Minor Memorial Highway."
2779.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Highway 78 Within Mississippi As The "william R. 'bill' Minor Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

2780.title: Eminent domain; property owner to recover costs under certain circumstances.
2780.description: An Act To Amend Sections 11-27-19, 11-27-37, 11-27-85 And 11-27-89, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Party Exercising The Right Of Eminent Domain Or Of Eminent Domain With Immediate Possession To Pay Certain Costs Of The Party Whose Property Is Being Taken Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2781.title: Public contracts related to a federally declared disaster; grant preference to resident contractors.
2781.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Preference Shall Be Given To Resident Contractors/vendors Over Nonresident Contractors/vendors In The Letting Of Public Contracts Related To A Federally Declared Disaster; And For Related Purposes.

2782.title: Public purchases; revise bid preference law.
2782.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Law Requiring State Agencies To Give Preference To Goods And Services That Have Been Manufactured Or Produced In This State; And For Related Purposes.

2783.title: State agencies; prohibit from using public funds for procedures that result in destruction or injury of human embryos.
2783.description: An Act To Prohibit State And Local Institutions, Agencies, Officials And Employees From Using Any Public Funds For Medical Procedures, Scientific Or Laboratory Research, Or Other Kinds Of Investigation Derived From Or Resulting In The Destruction Or Injury Of Human Embryos; And For Related Purposes.

2784.title: Attorney's fees; owed in suits for certain failures to pay amount when due.
2784.description: An Act To Provide For Payment Of Reasonable Attorney's Fees To The Prevailing Party In A Lawsuit Based On A Contract, Promissory Note Or Other Writing That Does Not Provide For The Payment Of Attorney's Fees In The Event Of Default Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2785.title: Bail agents; revise license requirements and prohibit certain acts.
2785.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-39-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The License Requirements Of Bail Agents, And To Exempt From Continuing Education Requirements Certain Licensed Professional Bail Agents When Renewing Another Type Of Bail Agent License; To Amend Section 83-39-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Each Licensed Professional Bail Agent To Maintain An Office Physically Located Within The State Of Mississippi In Any County Where Records Are Kept For Business Activities Of The Agent; To Amend Section 83-39-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Fees For Monitoring Shall Not Be Considered Part Of The Premium Or Fee Charged Under This Section; To Amend Section 83-39-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Paying Of A Fee Or Rebate To Any Person, Other Than A Soliciting Bail Agent, For The Purpose Of Procuring A Bail Bond; And For Related Purposes.

2786.title: State Health Insurance Management Board; authorize to impose premium surcharge on certain retirees.
2786.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-15-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State And School Employees' Health Insurance Management Board To Impose A Premium Surcharge On Retired Employees Who Are Under The Age For Medicare Eligibility And Who Were Initially Employed Before July 1, 2006, And Increase The Rate Of The Premium Surcharge Annually Not To Exceed 15% Until The Premium Surcharge Amount Is Equal To The Amount That The Board Determines Actuarially To Cover The Full Cost Of The Insurance; And For Related Purposes.

2787.title: Surplus lines insurance; revise law to comply with the federal Nonadmitted and Reinsurance Reform Act.
2787.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-21-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Eligibility Requirements For Nonadmitted Insurers To Write Business In The State Of Mississippi; To Create New Section 83-21-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Insurance To Enter Into An Agreement With Other States To Establish Procedures For Allocating Premium Taxes; To Amend Section 83-21-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Licensing Provisions For Resident And Nonresident Surplus Lines Insurance Producers; To Amend Section 83-21-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Stamping Procedures May Apply To The Reporting, Payment, Collection And Allocation Of Premium Taxes For Nonadmitted Insurance Consistent With Any Agreement, Compact Or Procedures Entered Into By The Commissioner Of Insurance; To Amend Section 83-21-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That, When Placing Nonadmitted Insurance For An Exempt Commercial Purchaser, A Surplus Lines Insurance Producer Is Not Required To Make A Due Diligence Search To Determine Whether The Full Amount Or Type Of Insurance Can Be Obtained From Admitted Insurers; To Amend Sections 83-21-25, 83-21-27 And 83-21-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Certain Technical And Nonsubstantive Changes; To Amend Section 83-34-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Each Insured In This State Who Directly Procures Or Renews Insurance With A Nonadmitted Insurer On Properties, Risks Or Exposures Located In This State, Other Than Insurance Procured Through A Surplus Lines Licensee, Shall Be Subject To The Nonadmitted Policy Fee Which Shall Be Paid Pursuant To The Procedures Provided For Premium Taxes; And For Related Purposes.

2788.title: U.S. Highway 82; authorize MDOT to construct an interchange in Washington County.
2788.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Construct An Interchange On U.s. Highway 82 In Washington County; And For Related Purposes.

2789.title: Beer; authorize manufacture of beer of more than 5% by weight for sale in another state.
2789.description: An Act To Amend Sections 67-3-1, 67-3-5, 67-3-7, 67-3-13, 67-3-17 And 67-3-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Transportation, Storage, Sale, Distribution, Possession, Receiving, And/or Manufacturing Of Beer Of An Alcoholic Content Of More Than 5% By Weight, If The Beer Is Manufactured To Be Sold Legally In Another State And Is Transported Outside Of This State For Retail Sale; To Amend Section 67-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2790.title: Attorneys at law; separate billing requirements imposed on.
2790.description: An Act To Require Attorneys To Make Timely Disclosure Of Legal Fees As The Fees Are Incurred Under Certain Circumstances; To Require Contracts Authorizing A Lien To Secure Payment Of Fees To Be In A Separately Signed Contract; To Prohibit Waiver Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2791.title: Board of Animal Health; clarify authority to approve veterinarians providing certain services to livestock auctions.
2791.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Authority Of The Board Of Animal Health To Approve Veterinarians Providing Certain Services At Livestock Auctions; And For Related Purposes.

2792.title: CON for ICFMR beds at Columbia Training School property; authorize.
2792.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Issue A Certificate Of Need To Millcreek Of Columbia, Inc., For The Purpose Of Establishing An Intermediate Care Facility For The Mentally Retarded (icfmr) At The Columbia Training School Property, Not To Exceed 200 Beds; And For Related Purposes.

2793.title: Review of child support orders of TANF recipients; DHS to conform to federal requirements.
2793.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-19-34, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Human Services To Review Child Support Orders For Tanf Recipients In Conformity With Federal Requirements; To Delete The Automatic Repealer On The Statute Providing For Stipulated Agreement For Modification Of Support Orders; And For Related Purposes.

2794.title: Paternity; provide circumstances for disestablishment and clarify genetic testing requirements.
2794.description: An Act To Codify Section 93-9-10 And Amend Section 93-11-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Circumstances Under Which A Legal Father May Disestablish Paternity And Terminate A Child Support Obligation; To Amend Section 93-9-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Genetic Testing Only When Paternity Has Not Been Previously Established; To Amend Section 93-9-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Amount Of Time A Person Has To Rescind Acknowledgement Of Paternity After Having Acknowledged Paternity And Said Acknowledgement Is Added To The Child's Birth Certificate; And For Related Purposes.

2795.title: Enforcement of child support orders by DHS; delete repealers and reverters.
2795.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-19-34, 43-19-46, 93-11-71, 93-11-101 And 93-11-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, And To Reenact 43-19-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Automatic Repealers And Reverters On Certain Statutes Relating To The Enforcement Of Child Support Orders By The Mississippi Department Of Human Services; And For Related Purposes.

2796.title: State budget; transfer certain funds into the Budget Contingency Fund during FY2012.
2796.description: An Act To Direct The State Fiscal Officer To Transfer Certain Amounts To The Budget Contingency Fund From The State General Fund And Certain Special Funds During Fiscal Year 2011 And Fiscal Year 2012; To Amend Section 43-13-407, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In Fiscal Year 2012 Certain Additional Sums Shall Be Transferred From The Health Care Trust Fund To The Health Care Expendable Fund, And To Extend The Repealer On The Health Care Expendable Fund; To Amend Section 43-13-405, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Health Care Trust Fund; To Bring Forward Section 43-13-409, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Amend Sections 57-10-511, 57-61-21, 57-61-41, 57-93-1 And 69-34-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Purposes For Which Money In The Mississippi Small Business Assistance Program, The Mississippi Business Investment Fund, The Port Revitalization Revolving Loan Fund, The Mississippi Existing Industry Productivity Loan Fund, And The Milk Producers Transportation Cost Assistance Loan Fund May Be Utilized; And For Related Purposes.

2797.title: Crawfish and shrimp; prohibit misrepresentation of country of origin by restaurants.
2797.description: An Act To Prohibit A Restaurant From Misrepresenting The Country Of Origin Of Shrimp And Crawfish; To Provide A Penalty For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2800.title: Mississippi Tax Collectors Education and Certification Program; revise reimbursement allowed for attending.
2800.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Reimbursement Of Certain Expenses For Attending The Mississippi Tax Collectors Education And Certification Program; To Amend Section 27-1-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Method Of Collecting The Fees Used To Fund The Program; And For Related Purposes.

2801.title: County court administrators; salary paid directly by county.
2801.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-17-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Salary Of The County Court Administrator Shall Be Paid By The Participating County Directly To The Administrator In The Same Manner As Other County Employees Are Compensated; And For Related Purposes.

2802.title: Emergency Telecommunication Standards and Training Board; revise composition.
2802.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-351, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add A Representative Of The Mississippi 911 Coordinators Association To The Board Of Emergency Telecommunications Standards And Training; And For Related Purposes.

2806.title: Bonds; remove repeal date on provisions that allow the Bond Commission to negotiate the sale of bonds.
2806.description: An Act To Amend Sections 57-75-15, 65-4-25, 65-4-29, 65-4-31, 65-4-33, 69-2-19, 69-2-23, 69-2-25 And 69-2-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Bonds Authorized To Be Issued Under The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act May Not Be Issued After June 30, 2011; To Extend Until July 1, 2014, The Repeal Date On Provisions That Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Bonds Issued Under The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act, The Economic Development Highway Act And The Emerging Crops Fund, And That Remove The Requirement That Notice Of The Sale Of Bonds Issued Under The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act, The Economic Development Highway Act And The Emerging Crops Fund That Are To Be Sold On Sealed Bids Must Be Published In Newspapers Or Financial Journals With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Sections 1 Through 21, Chapter 522, Laws Of 2002, Section 3, Chapter 580, Laws Of 2007, Section 6, Chapter 580, Laws Of 2007, Section 7, Chapter 580, Laws Of 2007, Section 1, Chapter 590, Laws Of 2007, And Section 1, Chapter 602, Laws Of 2007, Which Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Acquire, Reclaim And Preserve Deer Island; To Pay The State's Share Of Constructing A Grand Gulf Access Road; To Pay The Cost Of Constructing Certain Community Group Homes, To Pay The Cost Of Construction Of A Crisis Intervention Mental Health Facility For The Department Of Mental Health And To Pay The Cost Of Constructing A Controlled Access Interchange At The Intersection Of Highway 6 And Jackson Avenue, To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Remove The Requirement That If Such Bonds Are Sold On Sealed Bids Notice Of The Sale Must Be Published In Newspapers Or Financial Journals With A Large National Circulation; To Further Amend Section 1, Chapter 590, Laws Of 2007, To Remove The Provision That Limits The Amount Of Bonds That May Be Issued In Any One Fiscal Year For The Construction Of A Controlled Access Interchange At The Intersection Of Highway 6 And Jackson Avenue; And For Related Purposes.

2807.title: Urban Renewal Law; authorize bonds issued under to be sold at private sale.
2807.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-35-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Bonds Issued By Municipalities Under The Urban Renewal Act May Be Sold At Private Sale Under Such Terms And Conditions As May Be Determined From Time To Time By The Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

2808.title: Trailer tags; owners of rental utility trailer fleets may register them as a fleet.
2808.description: An Act To Provide That The Owner Of A Fleet Of 50 Or More Rental Utility Trailers, Each With A Gross Vehicle Weight Of 6,000 Pounds Or Less, May Register Such Trailers For A Period Of Five Years Or Any Number Of Years Designated By The Commissioner Of Revenue; To Provide That The Registration Of All Trailers So Registered Shall Expire In The Anniversary Month Established By The Commissioner Of Revenue For Trailer Fleets; To Provide For The Application For Registration Of Trailer Fleets; To Provide A Fee For The Registration Of Trailer Fleets; To Provide That Upon Approval Of The Application For Trailer Fleet Registration And Payment Of All Privilege And Ad Valorem Taxes And Fees On All Trailers In The Fleet, The Department Of Revenue Shall Issue A Trailer Fleet License Tag For Each Trailer In The Fleet; To Provide That The Commissioner Of Revenue Shall Annually Issue Decals To Evidence The Payment Of Ad Valorem Taxes And Privilege Taxes Which Shall Be Affixed To The License Plate In The Manner Designated By The Department; To Provide That The Department Of Revenue Shall Issue A Registration Certificate For Each Trailer Registered Under This Section To The Owners Of The Trailers That Shall Be Kept In A Place Prescribed By The Department; To Amend Sections 27-19-3, 27-19-31, 27-19-43 And 27-19-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2809.title: Farmers' markets; require the Department of Human Services to install EBT equipment in 6 counties selected by the Department of Health.
2809.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Human Services To Install Equipment To Facilitate The Utilization Of Electronic Benefit Transfer (ebt) Cards At Farmers' Markets In Six Counties Selected By The Department Of Health In Order To Enable People In Underserved Communities In Those Counties To Regularly Obtain Fresh Produce; And For Related Purposes.

2810.title: Small Municipalities and Limited Population Counties Fund; establish program for grants to cities with a population of 2,000 or less.
2810.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That 20% Of The Money Deposited Into The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund Shall Be Utilized To Provide Grants To Municipalities With A Population Of Two Thousand Or Less According To The Latest Federal Decennial Census; And For Related Purposes.

2812.title: Alcoholic beverages; allow direct shipment of certain wines, authorize a wine only package retailer's permit and allow wine tasting.
2812.description: An Act To Authorize Certain Persons Domiciled Outside This State To Lawfully Ship Directly To Package Retailers Those Manufactured Wines That Are Not Listed By The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division As A Part Of Its Inventory And Distribution Operation; To Provide That Such Manufactured Wine Must Be Purchased Through The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division Of The Department Of Revenue; To Require Package Retailers To Pay The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division For The Manufactured Wine And Pay All Taxes, Fees And Markups Imposed On The Manufactured Wine Prior To Any Such Shipment; To Require A Person 21 Years Of Age Or Older To Sign For Manufactured Wine Shipped To A Package Retailer Under This Act; To Require Shipments Of Manufactured Wine Into This State Under This Act To Be Made By A Duly Licensed Carrier; To Make It Clear That All Taxes, Fees And Surcharges That Are Imposed Upon The Sale Of Wine Shipped By The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division Of The Department Of Revenue Apply To Wine Shipped Under This Act; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Amend Section 67-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Issuance Of A Wine Only Package Retailer's Permit Under The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law; To Authorize The Holder Of A Wine Only Package Retailer's Permit To Offer Wine Samples To Customers Pursuant To Regulations Established By The Department Of Revenue; To Amend Section 27-71-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish The Fee For A Wine Only Package Retailer's Permit; To Amend Sections 27-71-15 And 67-1-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2813.title: Forestry; enact Forest Product Fairness Act.
2813.description: An Act To Enact The Forest Product Fairness Act; To Require An Open Process For The Approval Of Incentives For The Support Of Forest Products; And For Related Purposes.

2814.title: Sixteenth section school land; Secretary of State shall manage mineral leases, etc.
2814.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-3-99, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Office Of Secretary Of State Shall Manage And Approve The Leasing Of Sixteenth Section School Land Subsurface Minerals, To Provide Minimum Royalty Provisions For Such Mineral Leases, And To Clarify Compensation For Any Damage To The Lease As A Result Of Mining, Developing Or Easements; To Codify Section 37-17-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Office Of Secretary Of State Shall Manage The Leasing Of Sixteenth Section School Land In School Districts Which Are Under The Control Of The State Department Of Education Due To Emergency Circumstances And To Authorize School Districts To Voluntarily Divest Sixteenth Section School Land Management; To Amend Section 37-7-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Local School Districts To Acquire Easements For Access To Sixteenth Section School Land Under Its Jurisdiction; And For Related Purposes.

2815.title: Sixteenth section school land mineral leases; conform minimum royalty.
2815.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-3-99, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Minimum Royalty Provisions For Sixteenth Section School Land Mineral Leases To The Minimum Royalty Required On Other Public Land; And For Related Purposes.

2816.title: State highway system: add certain segment of Highway 301 in DeSoto County and Highway 6 in Pontotoc County.
2816.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Highway 301 In Desoto County As A State Highway And To Place Such Segment Under The Jurisdiction Of The Mississippi Transportation Commission For Construction And Maintenance; To Designate A Certain Segment Of Old Mississippi 6 In Pontotoc County As A State Highway And To Place Such Segment Under The Jurisdiction Of The Mississippi Transportation Commission For Construction And Maintenance; And For Related Purposes.

2817.title: Wildlife; place certain conditions on duck stamp funds used by nonprofit organizations for migratory waterfowl projects.
2817.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-167, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Place Certain Conditions On Nonprofit Organizations Receiving Duck Stamp Funds From The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks For Migratory Waterfowl Projects; And For Related Purposes.

2818.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for supporters of Jackson Preparatory School.
2818.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of Jackson Preparatory School; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For Such Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

2819.title: State or federal credit unions; fiduciaries may deposit funds in without a court order.
2819.description: An Act To Amend Section 91-13-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Trustees, Guardians, Administrators, Executors And Other Fiduciaries To, Without Court Order, Invest Or Deposit Funds Held In A Fiduciary Capacity In Accounts In Any Financial Institution Whose Deposits Are Insured By An Agency Of The Unites States Government; And For Related Purposes.

2820.title: Ad valorem taxation; revise the manner of determining the value of affordable rental housing.
2820.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-35-50, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Manner In Which The Appraisal Of Affordable Rental Housing Shall Be Made For The Purpose Of Arriving At The True Value Of The Property For Ad Valorem Tax Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2821.title: Tax sale; allow second sale of property in public improvement districts if no bids are received at first sale.
2821.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-41-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If Property In A Public Improvement District Is Struck Off To The State, The County Tax Collector, With The Approval Of The Secretary Of State And The Governing Bodies Of The County Or City In Which The Property Is Located, May Offer The Property For Sale For A Second Time; To Provide That If There Is No Purchaser Of The Property At The Second Sale, The Property Shall Mature To The State As If No Second Sale Had Occurred; To Provide For The Redemption Period After The Second Sale; To Repeal This Provision On September 1, 2013; To Amend Sections 27-41-79 And 27-41-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2823.title: Real Estate Appraisers Licensing and Certification Act; revise to place appraisal management companies under the authority of.
2823.description: An Act To Place Appraisal Management Companies Under The Authority Of The Real Estate Appraisers Licensing And Certification Act; To Require Those Companies To Register With The Board Of Real Estate Appraisers Before Engaging In The Business Of Real Estate Management; To Provide For The Minimum Registration Requirements; To Require Each Company Applying For Registration To Submit An Irrevocable Uniform Consent To Service Of Process Designating The Secretary Of State As The Agent To Receive Service Of Process For The Company; To Prescribe The Requirements Of Owners, Controlling Persons And Employees Of An Appraisal Management Company; To Place Certain Restrictions On The Authority Of An Appraisal Management Company To Contract With Independent Appraisers; To Require Those Companies To Certify Annually To The Board Its System Of Verification For Additions To Its Appraisal Panel And Review Of Work Done By Independent Appraisers; To Require Disclosure To The Board, As Part Of Registration, Any Use Of An Appraisal Fee Schedule; To Make It Unlawful For Any Person To Influence The Development, Reporting Or Review Of An Appraisal; To Require Appraisal Management Companies To Make Payment To Independent Appraisers For The Completion Of An Appraisal Within Sixty Days Of Receiving The Completed Appraisal; To Prohibit The Removal Of An Independent Appraiser From The Appraisal Panel Of A Company Within The First Thirty Days Of Being Added To An Appraisal Panel; To Provide Due Process To Independent Appraisers Removed From An Appraisal Panel For Misconduct And Certain Other Violations; To Amend Sections 73-34-3, 73-34-9, 73-34-13, 73-34-25, 73-34-27, 73-34-29, 73-34-35, 73-34-41, 73-34-43, 73-34-45, 73-34-49 And 73-34-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2824.title: Sanctuary cities; prohibit.
2824.description: An Act To Prohibit The Establishment Of Sanctuary Cities; And For Related Purposes.

2826.title: Youth court; may order parents to attend parent training.
2826.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-619, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That A Youth Court Judge May Order The Parent Of A Child Under Youth Court Jurisdiction To Attend Not More Than 6 Parent Training Sessions At A Cost Not To Exceed $20.00 Per Session; And For Related Purposes.

2827.title: Wildlife; reduce fee of resident lifetime sportsman license for members of the Mississippi Army or Air National Guard.
2827.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Fee For A Resident Lifetime Sportsman License For Any Member Of The Mississippi Army Or Air National Guard; And For Related Purposes.

2828.title: Public defenders; clarify authority over employees of the office.
2828.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-32-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Authority Of A County Public Defender Over The Employees Of The County Public Defender's Office Regardless Of The Source Of Funding For The Office; To Repeal Section 25-32-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Repeal Of Sections 25-32-1 Through 25-32-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Upon Implementation Of The Now-defunct Statewide Public Defender System; And For Related Purposes.

2829.title: Coastal wetlands; conform application hearings to the Administrative Procedures Act.
2829.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-27-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Hearings On Coastal Wetlands Applications To The Administrative Procedures Act; To Require Applicants To Pay Actual Cost Of Public Notice And Publication For The Hearing; And For Related Purposes.

2830.title: Puppy mills; prohibit.
2830.description: An Act To Create The Puppy Mill Cruelty Prevention Act; To Prohibit Cruel And Inhumane Treatment Of Dogs In Puppy Mills; To Enact Definitions; To Create Exceptions; To Enact Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

2831.title: Marine Resources; revise definition of saltwater minnow.
2831.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include The Scientific Name Of The Family Of Fundulidae Minnows In The Definition Of Saltwater Minnows; And For Related Purposes.

2832.title: Scenic Byways; designate certain segments in Hancock County as "Beach Boulevard Scenic Byway" and "Scenic Byways to Space."
2832.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Road In Hancock County As An Official Mississippi Scenic Byway To Be Known As The "beach Boulevard Scenic Byway"; To Designate Certain Segments Of Highways, Roads And Streets In Hancock County As Official Mississippi Scenic Byways To Be Known As The "scenic Byways To Space"; And For Related Purposes.

2833.title: Urban renewal agencies; authorize certain municipal property to be conveyed to.
2833.description: An Act To Authorize A Municipality With A Population Of 100,000 Or More To Convey To Its Urban Renewal Agency, For A Nominal Price, Land In A Slum Area, Blighted Area Or Urban Renewal Area To Which It Holds Title; And For Related Purposes.

2834.title: Public trust tidelands; authorize Secretary of State to convey contaminated sites.
2834.description: An Act To Authorize The State Of Mississippi To Divest Itself Of Contaminated Public Trust Tidelands In Exchange For Certain Real Property As Mitigation; And For Related Purposes.

2835.title: Mississippi Delta Workforce Training Project; extend repeal date on.
2835.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 57-107-1, 57-107-3, 57-107-5 And 57-107-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establish The Mississippi Delta Area Workforce Training Project, A Pilot Program Aimed At Implementing Coordinated Strategies For Improving The Retention And Expansion Of Jobs In The Mississippi Delta Region, That Is Administered By A Delta Workforce Coordinator For Job Retention And Expansion, And Create The Delta Workforce Cabinet; To Amend Section 9 Chapter 471, Laws Of 2009, To Extend Until July 1, 2016, The Repeal Date On The Mississippi Delta Area Workforce Training Project; And For Related Purposes.

2836.title: Alcoholic beverages; revise definition of qualified resort area for purpose of sale in certain municipalities.
2836.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Within The Definition Of The Term "qualified Resort Area" Under The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law, Any Facility Located In Certain Areas Designated By The Governing Authorities Of Certain Municipalities; To Amend Section 67-1-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Election To Be Held Regarding Such Resort Areas And Allow The Qualified Resort Areas To Be Established If A Majority Of The Qualified Electors Voting In The Election Vote In Favor Of Establishing Qualified Resort Areas; And For Related Purposes.

2838.title: Memorial highway; designate certain segment of MS Highway 366 in Tishomingo County as "Roger D. Moore Memorial Highway."
2838.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 366 Within Tishomingo County, Mississippi, As The "roger D. Moore Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

2839.title: Regional Railroad Authority; allow to accept associate members outside its jurisdiction.
2839.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-29-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Regional Railroad Authority To Accept Associate Members Outside Of The Authority's Jurisdiction; And For Related Purposes.

2840.title: Marine Resources; exempt fishing license sales from definition of state-sources special funds.
2840.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-104-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude Funds Derived From Fishing License Sales Of The Department Of Marine Resources From The Definition Of State-source Special Funds; And For Related Purposes.

2841.title: Marine Resources; clarify marine waters where commercial fishing is prohibited.
2841.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-315, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Boundary Of Marine Waters Where Commercial Fishing Is Prohibited; And For Related Purposes.

2842.title: Marine Resources; clarify the taking of shrimp for personal consumption.
2842.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-64.2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Shrimp That A Person May Take For Personal Consumption From Certain Locations; And For Related Purposes.

2843.title: Marine Resources; special license tag funds deposited into seafood marketing account within Seafood Fund.
2843.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle Tags Supporting The Department Of Marine Resources; To Provide That Marine Resources Special License Tag Fees Shall Be Deposited Into A Seafood Marketing Account Within The Seafood Fund; To Amend Section 49-15-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2844.title: Coastal wetlands' revised review periods for amended permit applications.
2844.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-27-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Review Periods For An Application For A Coastal Wetlands Permit If The Application Is Amended; And For Related Purposes.

2846.title: Bonds; increase the amount that may be issued under the Economic Development Highway Act.
2846.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-4-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $20,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds Authorized To Be Issued Under The Economic Development Highway Act; And For Related Purposes.

2848.title: Department of Finance and Administration; authorize to sell certain real property at the USM Gulf Coast Campus.
2848.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, To Sell And Convey Parcels Of Certain State-owned Real Property And Any Improvements Thereon Under The Possession And Control Of The University Of Southern Mississippi Gulf Coast, Located In The City Of Pass Christian, Harrison County, Mississippi, Known As The "huckleberry Hill"; And For Related Purposes.

2849.title: Topix.com; ban.
2849.description: An Act To Ban Topix.com In Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2850.title: State budget; exclude rent paid by MS Department of Archives & History from budget cuts.
2850.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-104-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude Any Funds Budgeted By The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History To Be Paid For Rent To The Department Of Finance And Administration From Budget Cuts; And For Related Purposes.

2851.title: Rural water; transfer loan program from Department of Health to DEQ.
2851.description: An Act To Transfer The Administration Of The Local Governments And Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan And Grant Program From The Mississippi Board Of Health To The Commission On Environmental Quality; To Amend Sections 41-3-15, 49-17-81 And 49-17-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Create Section 49-17-91 To Authorize The Commission On Environmental Quality To Administer The Program; To Create Section 49-17-93 To Establish The Local Governments And Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan And Grant Fund; To Repeal Section 41-3-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Established The Local Governments And Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan And Grant Fund Under The Mississippi Board Of Health; And For Related Purposes.

2853.title: Mississippi Health Information Network (MS-HIN); clarify responsibilities.
2853.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-119-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That The Mississippi Health Information Network (ms-hin) Board Shall Make An Annual Report To The Legislature; To Amend Section 41-119-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Peer Committee To Conduct A Performance Evaluation Of The Ms-hin Board By December 31, 2013; To Amend Section 25-53-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish Certain Oversight Standards For Procurements Of Information Technology Or Service Contracts Exempted From Department Of Information Technology Services Procurement Regulations; And For Related Purposes.

2854.title: Public Interest Lawyers' Loan Repayment Assistance Program; establish under IHL.
2854.description: An Act To Establish A Public Interest Lawyer's Loan Repayment Assistance Program In The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Provide Definitions For Eligibility For The Assistance Program; To Create A Public Interest Lawyers' Fund And Specify Sources For Funding; To Authorize The Board Of Trustees To Create A Corporation To Administer The Program; To Provide Conditions For Participation In The Program; And For Related Purposes.

2856.title: Department of Rehabilitation Services; may borrow from financial institutions for capitol improvements.
2856.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-33-157, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Rehabilitation Service To Borrow Money From The Mississippi Development Bank Or Other Financial Institutions For The Purpose Of Construction, Repair And Renovation Or Furnishing And Equipping Facilities Owned Or Under The Supervision Of The Department; To Provide That Prior To Entering Into Any Loan The Department Shall Certify The Available Revenue That The Department Intends To Utilize To Repay The Loan And That The Department Does Not Intend To Request An Additional Appropriation From State Source Funding To Pay Debt Service On Any Such Loan; To Amend Section 31-25-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Rehabilitation Services To Borrow Money From The Bank In An Amount Not To Exceed $7,000,000.00 For The Purpose Of Construction At, And Repair And Renovation, Furnishing And Equipping Of, The Department's Office Building Located In Madison, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2857.title: Department of Rehabilitation Services; may borrow from the Development Bank for capitol improvements.
2857.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-25-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Rehabilitation Services To Borrow Money From The Bank In An Amount Not To Exceed $7,000,000.00 For The Purpose Of Construction At, And Repair And Renovation, Furnishing And Equipping Of, The Department's Office Building Located In Madison, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2858.title: Electronic Government Oversight Committee; revise membership/ITS Board members may serve after expiration of term.
2858.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-151, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The Electronic Government Oversight Committee; To Amend Section 25-53-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Each Member Of The Information Technology Services Board May Continue To Serve For A Certain Period Of Time After The Expiration Of His Term If His Successor Is Not Duly Appointed; And For Related Purposes.

2859.title: County supervisors; shall not meet before certain time if business affects private property.
2859.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Board Of Supervisors Shall Not Meet Before Five O'clock P.m. If The Matter Of Business To Be Transacted Affects The Use Or Development Of Private Property; And For Related Purposes.

2860.title: Eligibility of children in certain licensed residential facilities to receive federal education funds; provide.
2860.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-23-63 And 37-23-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Children Residing In Licensed Icfmr Or Prtf Facilities To Be Eligible For Federal-funded Education Services And To Require That Such Children Shall Be Placed In The Education Setting Based On The Recommendation Of Two Physicians; And For Related Purposes.

2861.title: Littering; prohibit in waterways.
2861.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-15-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Littering In Flowing Streams And Public Waterways; And For Related Purposes.

2862.title: Congressional districts; bring forward section that provides for.
2862.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 23-15-1037, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Number And Composition Of The Congressional Districts Of This State; And For Related Purposes.

2863.title: Commanding officer's disciplinary punishment; remove option of trial by court martial for minor offense.
2863.description: An Act To Amend Section 33-13-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provision Allowing A Soldier To Demand Trial By Court Martial Before Commanding Officer's Disciplinary Punishment For A Minor Offense; And For Related Purposes.

2864.title: Homestead exemption; repeal Section 27-33-79, which limits amount of reimbursement increases or decreases.
2864.description: An Act To Repeal Section 27-33-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That No Taxing Unit Shall Be Reimbursed More Than 106% Or Less Than The Amount Of The Reimbursement Made To The Same Taxing Unit For The Next Preceding Year, Unless The Reimbursement Is Reduced As A Result Of A Reduction In Approved Homestead Applicants; And For Related Purposes.

2865.title: MS Auctioneer's License Act; clarify appeal procedure and repeal grandfather clause.
2865.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-4-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Appeals Of Decisions Of The Mississippi Auctioneer Commission Shall Be Filed With The Circuit Court Of Hinds County; To Amend Sections 73-4-27 And 73-4-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Certain Grammatical And Nonsubstantive Changes; To Repeal Section 73-4-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Allows Certain Persons With Auctioneering Experience To Apply For An Auctioneer's License Without Taking An Examination; And For Related Purposes.

2867.title: Marine Resources; designate a free fishing weekend in marine waters.
2867.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-313, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate A Free Fishing Weekend For Marine Waters; To Amend Section 49-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete Incorrect Reference To Marine Waters; And For Related Purposes.

2868.title: All-terrain vehicles; require certain safety requirements and prohibitions.
2868.description: An Act To Place Certain Requirements On Persons Under A Certain Age When Riding All-terrain Vehicles; To Mandate Certain Safety Requirements; To Prohibit The Use Of All-terrain Vehicles On Public Roads; And For Related Purposes.

2869.title: Parentage proceedings; correct Title and Chapter subject heading references in the Mississippi Code of 1972.
2869.description: An Act To Amend Sections 93-9-73 And 93-9-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove References To Bastardy; And For Related Purposes.

2870.title: Corrections; bring forward Section 47-7-3 to review definition of nonviolent crimes eligible for parole.
2870.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Review The Definition Of Nonviolent Crimes That Are Eligible For Parole; And For Related Purposes.

2871.title: Transportation; revise requirements for certain vehicles to stop and cross railroads.
2871.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-1011, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Drivers Of Motor Vehicles Carrying Passengers For Hire Or Carrying Explosives Shall Stop, Look And Listen At Railroad Crossings For Approaching Railroad Vehicles And Railroad Maintenance Machines As Well As For Approaching Trains; To Delete The Provision That Exempts Such Vehicles From Having To Stop At Street Railway Grade Crossings Within A Business Or Residence District; To Provide That The Driver Of Every School Transportation Vehicles Used To Transport Pupils, Upon Approaching Any Railroad Crossing, Shall Comply With The Requirements Of Section 37-41-55; To Amend Section 37-41-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Certain Additional Duties For Drivers Of School Transportation Vehicles Used To Transport Pupils Upon Approaching Railroad Crossings; And For Related Purposes.

2872.title: Students with disabilities; findings in parental complaints shall be sent to local school board members.
2872.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-23-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Findings And Decisions Of The State Department Of Education Office Of Special Education Relative To A Parental Complaint Shall Be Forwarded To Each Member Of The Local School Board; And For Related Purposes.

2876.title: Continuing care; prevent involuntary denial of treatment necessary to prevent death.
2876.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-41-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add A Definition Of "continuing Care"; To Create Section 41-107-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create An Exception To The Mississippi Health Care Rights Of Conscience Act To Prevent Involuntary Denial Of Treatment Necessary To Prevent Death Based On Age, Disability Or Terminal Illness; And For Related Purposes.

2877.title: School/Head Start influenza vaccination program; State Department of Health establish.
2877.description: An Act To Direct The State Department Of Health To Establish School-located Influenza Vaccination Programs In Elementary And Secondary Schools And/or Head Start Programs And To Provide Certain Standards For The Program; And For Related Purposes.

2878.title: Consumer freedom of choice for pharmacy services; extend to members of the State Health Insurance Plan.
2878.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-9-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Freedom Of Consumer Choice For Pharmacy Services To Members Of The State And School Employees Health Insurance Plan; And For Related Purposes.

2879.title: MS Building Codes Council; may adopt a statewide building energy code for residential and commercial construction.
2879.description: An Act To Amend Section 17-2-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Building Codes Council To Adopt, In Its Discretion, A Statewide Building Energy Code For Residential And Commercial Construction; And For Related Purposes.

2880.title: MS Building Codes Council; shall not require installation of fire protection sprinkler system in certain dwellings.
2880.description: An Act To Amend Section 17-2-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The Mississippi Building Codes Council, And To Provide That The Council Shall Not Enact Any Ordinance, Bylaw, Order, Building Code Or Rule Requiring The Installation Of A Multipurpose Residential Fire Protection Sprinkler System In A New Or Existing One- Or Two-family Dwelling; And For Related Purposes.

2881.title: Mississippi Educational Television operations; transfer to nonprofit corporation.
2881.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-63-1 Through 37-63-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Mississippi Authority For Educational Television Shall Be Organized Under The Laws Of The State Of Mississippi As A Tax-exempt Corporation, And That The Operation Of The Public Educational Television Program Shall Be Transferred From The Authority For Educational Television To The Board Of Directors Of That Corporation On July 1, 2012; To Amend Section 37-63-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That State Funding Of The Mississippi Authority For Educational Television Shall Be Reduced By 20% Annually And That There Shall Be No State Funds Appropriated For That Purpose After July 1, 2016; To Provide A Tax Credit For Any Contribution To Support A Public Broadcasting Corporation Which Provides At Least 50% Of Its Programming To Educational And Public Service Programs; To Provide That Sections 37-63-3, 37-63-5, 37-63-7, 37-63-8, 37-63-10, 37-63-13, 37-63-15 And 37-63-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Of Which Provide For The Operation Of The Mississippi Authority For Public Television Shall Stand Repealed On July 1, 2012; And For Related Purposes.

2882.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for the Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund.
2882.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $3,640,000.00 To Provide Matching Funds For Federal Funds For The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 49-17-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Interest And Investment Earnings On Money In The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund To Be Utilized To Pay Debt Service On The Bonds Authorized To Be Issued By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2883.title: Sales taxation; exempt the sale of property and services used in the improvement of realty for churches or religious association.
2883.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Purchase Of Tangible Personal Property For Use In The Performance Of A Contract For An Improvement To Realty For A Church Or Religious Association And To Exempt The Sale Of Services For Use In The Performance Of Such A Contract; And For Related Purposes.

2885.title: Bonds; authorize for mechanical upgrades at the Alexander Center at Jackson State University.
2885.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Upgrading The Mechanical Systems Of The Alexander Center At Jackson State University; And For Related Purposes.

2886.title: Bonds; authorize for the replacement of Dansby Hall at Jackson State University.
2886.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Replacement Of Dansby Hall At Jackson State University; And For Related Purposes.

2887.title: Bonds; authorize to acquire and improve property for Jackson State University.
2887.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Acquiring And Improving Property For The Campus Of Jackson State University; And For Related Purposes.

2888.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of tangible personal property and services to the Military Veterans Association, Inc.
2888.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property To The Military Veterans Association, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

2889.title: Nonsettling manufacturer cigarettes; increase fee imposed upon.
2889.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-70-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fee Imposed On The Sale, Use Or Consumption Or Distribution In This State On Nonsettling Manufacturer Cigarettes; And For Related Purposes.

2891.title: Ad valorem tax; local governing authorities may grant an exemption of homesteads of certain residents serving in Iraq or Afghanistan.
2891.description: An Act To Create New Section 27-33-76, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Any County And The Governing Authorities Of Any Municipality To Grant An Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes, Except Taxes For School District Purposes, On Homesteads Of Residents Of This State Who Are Serving On Active Duty Pursuant To Military Orders In Iraq Or Afghanistan; To Provide The Amount Of Such Exemption; To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Adopt And Promulgate Rules And Regulations To Administer And Implement Such Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-51-42.3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The September 30, 2012, Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Board Of Supervisors Of Any County And The Governing Authorities Of Any Municipality To Grant An Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes, Except Taxes For School District Purposes, On Motor Vehicles Of Residents Of This State Who Are Serving On Active Duty Pursuant To Military Orders In Iraq Or Afghanistan; And For Related Purposes.

2892.title: Bonds; authorize for upgrades for the fire suppression system of the Alexander Center at Jackson State University.
2892.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Upgrading The Fire Suppression System Of The Alexander Center At Jackson State University; And For Related Purposes.

2894.title: Tobacco Tax Law; provide for the tax on little cigars.
2894.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-69-3, 27-69-13 And 27-69-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Little Cigars For Purposes Of The Tobacco Tax Law; To Provide That Little Cigars Shall Be Taxed Under The Tobacco Tax Law At The Same Rate As Cigarettes; And For Related Purposes.

2895.title: Income taxation; allow a deduction for amounts contributed to accounts established to pay for uninsured wind damage to homesteads.
2895.description: An Act To Authorize Owners Of Homesteads To Establish Catastrophe Savings Accounts And To Utilize Money In Such Accounts To Provide Reimbursement For Deductible Amounts And Other Uninsured Portions Of Damage To Homesteads From Windstorm Events; To Authorize An Income Tax Deduction For Amounts Contributed To Catastrophe Savings Accounts; To Exclude Interest On Such Accounts From Gross Income For Income Tax Purposes; To Provide Limits On The Amount That May Be Contributed To Catastrophe Savings Accounts; To Provide That A Distribution From A Catastrophe Savings Account Must Be Included In The Income Of The Taxpayer Unless The Distribution Is Used To Cover Qualified Catastrophe Expenses; To Provide That The Income Tax Shall Be Increased On Taxable Distributions From A Catastrophe Savings Account; To Amend Sections 27-7-15 And 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2896.title: Local improvement taxing districts; authorize and levy tax on property within.
2896.description: An Act To Authorize Certain Municipalities To Create Local Improvement Taxing Districts; To Authorize The Levy Of An Ad Valorem Tax Of Up To Six Mills On Certain Real Property Located In Such Taxing Districts; To Provide For The Duties And Powers Of Such Taxing Districts; To Require The Dissolution Of Such Taxing Districts Under Certain Circumstances; To Specify The Use For The Proceeds Of The Special Tax; To Allow Such Districts To Levy Less Than The Maximum Allowable Tax Levy; To Authorize The Issuance Of Bonds; To Provide That Bonds Issued Shall Be Payable Out Of The Special Tax; To Allow The Inclusion Of Covenants For Issuing Bonds; To Authorize The Delegation Of Certain Authority Under This Act; To Allow The Acceptance Of Contributions; To Provide That Bonds Issued Under This Act Shall Be Legal Investments; To Exempt Bonds And Income From Taxation By The State; And For Related Purposes.

2898.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for establishment of the Mississippi Civil Rights Trail.
2898.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Civil Rights Trail Fund; To Provide That Money In The Fund Shall Be Disbursed, In The Discretion Of The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History, To Pay The Costs Of Purchasing And Erecting Appropriate Markers At Sites That Are Significant In The History Of Civil Rights Movement In This State And To Pay Other Costs Associated With The Establishment And Maintenance Of A Civil Rights Trail; To Establish A Mississippi Civil Rights Trail Advisory Commission To Advise The Department Of Archives And History On Appropriate Sites To Include In A Civil Rights Trail; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Civil Rights Trail Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2900.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to purchase a research vessel for the Gulf Coast Research Laboratory.
2900.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purchase Of A Research Vessel For The Gulf Coast Research Laboratory; And For Related Purposes.

2901.title: Bonds; authorize for drainage projects in the City of Ocean Springs.
2901.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Pay The Cost Of Drainage Projects In The City Of Ocean Springs, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2902.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to fund replacement of a bridge on the Oakland School Road in Alcorn County.
2902.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Replacement Of A Bridge On The Oakland School Road In Alcorn County; And For Related Purposes.

2903.title: Nonsettling-manufacturer cigarette fee; transfer payment of fee to cigarette distributors.
