2903.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-70-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Certain Definitions In The Law Relating To Fees Imposed On Certain Cigarettes; To Amend Sections 27-70-5 And 27-70-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer Payment Of The Nonsettling-manufacturer Cigarette Fee From Manufacturers Of Cigarettes To Distributors Of Cigarettes; To Designate The Fee As The Tobacco Equity Tax; To Provide That The Tobacco Equity Tax Shall Not Apply To Cigarettes That Are Sold, Purchased Or Otherwise Distributed In This State For Sale Outside This State; To Provide That A Person May Not Transport From This State Certain Cigarettes For Sale In Another State Without First Affixing To The Cigarettes The Stamp Required By The State In Which The Cigarettes Are To Be Sold Or By Paying Any Other Excise Tax On The Cigarettes Imposed By The State In Which The Cigarettes Are To Be Sold Unless This Practice Is Prohibited In Such Other State; To Provide That The Tobacco Equity Tax Shall Be Imposed, Levied And Assessed On Each Distributor Of Cigarettes And Shall Be Due And Payable On Or Before The 15th Day Of The Month Next Succeeding The Month In Which The Cigarettes Are Sold, Used, Consumed Or Distributed In This State; To Provide That Cigarette Distributors Shall Be Eligible For A Credit Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide Penalties For Cigarette Distributors Who Violate The Provisions Of This Law; To Amend Section 27-69-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Information In Permits Issued Under The Tobacco Tax Law May Be Disclosed To The Holder Of A Wholesaler's Permit And To Law Enforcement Agencies Of The State Or Any Political Subdivision Of The State; To Amend Section 27-69-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If Any Wholesaler Subject To The Provisions Of The Tobacco Tax Law Shall Cease To Do Business In The State Of Mississippi, He Shall Be Allowed A Refund Of The Tax Paid On Cigarettes In His Possession; To Repeal Sections 27-70-7, 27-70-11, 27-70-13, 27-70-15, 27-70-17 And 27-70-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Impose A Fee On Nonsettling Cigarette Manufacturers, Provide For The Computation, The Rate Of Increase And Notice Of The Fee To Such Manufacturers, Require Such Manufacturers To Certify Their Compliance With The Fee Requirement, Provide For A Directory Of Certified Cigarette Manufacturers, Require Certain Cigarette Manufacturers To Prepay A Fee And Require Certain Cigarette Manufacturers To Register With The Attorney General; And For Related Purposes.

2904.title: Small Municipalities and Limited Population Counties Fund; authorize issuance of general obligation bonds for.
2904.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That 20% Of The Money Deposited Into The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund Shall Be Utilized To Provide Grants To Municipalities With A Population Of Two Thousand Or Less According To The Latest Federal Decennial Census; And For Related Purposes.

2905.title: City of Pascagoula; extend the repeal date on city's hotel and motel tax.
2905.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 1005, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, As Amended By Chapter 923, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law Authorizing The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pascagoula, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel, Motel And Bed-and-breakfast Room Rentals In The City; And For Related Purposes.

2906.title: Bonds; issue for construction of the Wellspring Center for Professional Futures.
2906.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Constructing, Furnishing And Equipping The Wellspring Center For Professional Futures In Union County, Mississippi; To Amend Sections 37-31-71, 37-31-73 And 37-31-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize School Districts, Community Or Junior College Districts And Local Governments To Enter Into Agreements To Establish Regional Education Centers; And For Related Purposes.

2908.title: Forrest County; authorize contributions to various organizations.
2908.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Forrest County To Contribute Funds To The Association For Retarded Citizens, Big Brothers/big Sisters Of Southeast Mississippi, The Boy Scouts Of America, The Gulf Pine Girl Scout Council, The Hattiesburg Downtown Association, Inc., The Neighborhood Education Enhancement Development Services, The Salvation Army, Pearl River Valley Opportunity, The Pinebelt Association For Community Enhancement, The Hattiesburg Little League Baseball Association, Petal Optimist Club Baseball, First Tee And The Aids Services Coalition; And For Related Purposes.

2909.title: City of Ripley; remove repeal date on tax on hotels and motels.
2909.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 956, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Delete The July 1, 2011, Repeal Date On The Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Ripley, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants; And For Related Purposes.

2910.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for repairs and renovations at Buccaneer State Park.
2910.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Repairs And Renovations At Buccaneer State Park Necessitated As A Result Of Damages Sustained From Hurricane Katrina; And For Related Purposes.

2911.title: City of Sardis; extend repeal date on the city's tax on hotels, motels and restaurants.
2911.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 945, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Extend Until July 1, 2015, The Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Sardis, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants And Utilize The Revenue From The Tax To Enhance Tourism, For Industrial And Economic Development And For The Provision Of Parks And Recreation Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2912.title: Bonds; authorize to assist the City of Meridian in repairing its storm drainage infrastructure.
2912.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Meridian, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Incurred By The City In Repairing Storm Drainage Infrastructure; And For Related Purposes.

2913.title: Bonds; authorize to assist the City of Meridian in constructing Freedom Park.

2934.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security For Fiscal Year 2012.

2945.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Massage Therapy, For Fiscal Year 2012.

2946.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Pharmacy For Fiscal Year 2012.

2947.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Professional Counselor Licensing Board For Fiscal Year 2012.

2948.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Veterinary Examiners For Fiscal Year 2012.

2954.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Department Of Agriculture And Commerce, For The Fiscal Year 2012.

2955.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Egg Marketing Board, For Fiscal Year 2012.

2957.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Fair Commission, The Mississippi Livestock Coliseum And The Industrial Showcase And Trade Mart Building For Fiscal Year 2012.

2958.title: Appropriation; Fair and Coliseum Commission - Livestock shows.
2958.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Fair Commission For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Dixie National Livestock Show; A Roundup For Junior Exhibitors Of Livestock And Goats; Supplemental Funds For Livestock Premiums; County Livestock Shows In Offering And Paying Prizes Or Awards To Competitors In Approved County Livestock Shows; The Five District Livestock Shows; The Five State Dairy Shows; The Mississippi High School Rodeo; And To Provide How Said Money Shall Be Paid Out Of The State Treasury For Fiscal Year 2012.

2959.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Tennessee-tombigbee Waterway Development Authority For The Purposes Enumerated In Section 51-27-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Fiscal Year 2012.

2960.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Finance And Administration For Fiscal Year 2012.

2961.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For Expenses Of The Executive Department, Being The Governor's Office And Staff, And For Expenses Incidental To The Proper Operation Of The Governor's Mansion And Residence Of The Governor, For Fiscal Year 2012.

2962.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Department Of Audit For Fiscal Year 2012.

2963.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services For Fiscal Year 2012.

2965.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Office Of The Secretary Of State For Fiscal Year 2012.

2966.title: Appropriation; Treasurer's Office.
2966.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The State Treasurer's Office For Fiscal Year 2012.

2967.title: Appropriation; Debt service and bank service charges.
2967.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Payment Of Service Charges To Banks For Acting As Agents Of The State In Paying Full Faith And Credit Bonds And Interest Of The State Of Mississippi, From The Effective Date Of This Act Until Such Bonds Shall Be Paid Or Until June 30, 2012, Whichever Shall First Occur; And For The Payment Of Maturing Bonds And Interest On The Full Faith And Credit Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi Falling Due During Fiscal Year 2012.

2968.title: Appropriation; State Government Agencies Special Fund; Additional FY 2011.
2968.description: An Act Making An Additional Appropriation Of Budget Contingency Funds And Other Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The District Attorneys And Assistant District Attorneys For Fiscal Year 2011; The Department Of Finance And Administration For State Property Insurance For Fiscal Years 2011 And 2012; The Office Of The Attorney General For Certain Legal Expenses, Judgments, And Settlements For Fiscal Year 2011; The Department Of Human Services For The Division Of Family And Children's Services For Fiscal Year 2011; The Joint Committee On Compilation, Revision And Publication Of Legislation For Fiscal Year 2011; The Board Of Nursing For Fiscal Year 2011; State Fire Academy For Fiscal Year 2011; The Department Of Revenue For Hiring Temporary Employees; And The Board Of Examiners For Licensed Professional Counselors For Certain Expenses For Fiscal Year 2011; And For Related Purposes.

2969.title: DeSoto County; authorize the extension of the qualifying deadline for certain offices.
2969.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County, Mississippi, To Extend The Qualifying Deadline For Primary And General Elections Occurring In Calendar Year 2011 Until June 1, 2011, For Candidates For The Office Of County Board Of Education, Constable, Justice Court Judge And Board Of Supervisors; And For Related Purposes.

2970.title: Kemper County; authorize a contribution to Mississippi Community Development Empowerment, Inc.
2970.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Kemper County, Mississippi, To Make A Contribution To Mississippi Community Development Empowerment, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

2971.title: City of Grenada; extend the repeal date on the Grenada Tourism Commission and the Grenada tourist and convention tax.
2971.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 879, Local And Private Laws Of 1992, As Last Amended By Chapter 958, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, To Extend Until July 1, 2015, The Repeal Date On The Provisions Of Law Which Establish The Grenada Tourism Commission And Authorize The Imposition Of A Tourist And Convention Tax; And For Related Purposes.

2972.title: Sales tax; exempt sales to certain organizations coordinating a professional golf tournament played or to be played in this state.
2972.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Industrial Sales Tax Exemption For Sales Of Supplies, Equipment And Other Personal Property To An Organization That Is Exempt From Taxation Under Section 501(c)(3) Of The Internal Revenue Code And Is The Host Organization Coordinating A Professional Golf Tournament Played Or To Be Played In This State And The Property Will Be Used For Purposes Related To The Golf Tournament And Related Activities; And For Related Purposes.

2974.title: City of Hattiesburg; extend the repeal date on the Hattiesburg Tourism Commission and the city's hotel/motel tax.
2974.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 878, Local And Private Laws Of 1990, As Last Amended By Chapter 925, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Extend Until September 30, 2015, The Date Upon Which The Hattiesburg Tourism Commission And The Tax That Is Levied On Hotels And Motels In The City Of Hattiesburg To Provide Operating Funds For The Commission To Promote Tourism Is Repealed; And For Related Purposes.

2975.title: City of Bay Springs; authorize the expenditure of certain funds for promotion and effectuation of the Annual BayFest Celebration.
2975.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Bay Springs, Mississippi, To Expend Certain Funds Annually For Promotion And Effectuation Of The City's Annual Bayfest Celebration; And For Related Purposes.

2976.title: Local Government Freight Rail Service Project Revolving Loan Fund; increase bond authorization to fund grants from.
2976.description: An Act To Amend Sections 57-44-7, 57-44-11 And 57-44-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $3,000,000.00 The Maximum Amount Of Grants That May Be Made To Counties From Money In The Local Governments Freight Rail Service Project Revolving Loan Fund; To Increase By $3,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued To Fund Local Government Freight Rail Projects; To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Bonds Issued For The Local Governments Freight Rail Service Project Revolving Loan Fund; To Delete The Requirement That Notice Of The Sale Of Bonds For Such Fund Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; And For Related Purposes.

2977.title: Bonds; authorize for the Montgomery County Performing Arts Center.
2977.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Repair, Renovation And Refurbishing Of The Performing Arts Center For The Montgomery County Arts Council; And For Related Purposes.

2978.title: Lafayette County; may contribute to the Oxford-Lafayette County Economic Development Foundation.
2978.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lafayette County, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually To The Oxford-lafayette County Economic Development Foundation For The Next Three County Fiscal Years; And For Related Purposes.

2979.title: Jackson County and the City of Pascagoula; may jointly create the LaPointe-Krebs Foundation.
2979.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Join With The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pascagoula, Mississippi, To Create The Lapointe-krebs Foundation, Inc. For The Preservation, Maintenance, Upkeep And Operation Of The Lapointe-krebs House; And For Related Purposes.

2980.title: Franchise tax; exclude from the apportionment ratio certain sales to Mississippi facilities by major pharmaceutical suppliers.
2980.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-13-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For Purposes Of The Franchise Tax Law, Receipts For Sales To A Mississippi Distribution Facility Of Pharmaceutical Products By Certain Major Suppliers Are Not Included In The Mississippi Receipts In Computing The Apportionment Ratio; To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Income Tax Deduction For Certain Contributions Of Human Pharmaceutical Products By Certain Major Suppliers; And For Related Purposes.

2982.title: City of Jackson; remove the repeal date on the Jackson Convention and Visitors Bureau.
2982.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 909, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, As Last Amended By Chapter 958, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Remove The July 1, 2011, Repeal Date On The Provisions Of Law Which Create The Jackson Convention And Visitors Bureau And Impose A Tax On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants, Hotels And Motels For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Bureau; And For Related Purposes.

2983.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of state general obligation bonds for state agencies and institutions of higher learning.
2983.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For State Institutions Of Higher Learning, State Agencies And Community And Junior Colleges; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $20,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Program; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $3,640,000.00 To Provide Matching Funds For Federal Funds For The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 49-17-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Interest And Investment Earnings On Money In The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund To Be Utilized To Pay Debt Service On The Bonds Authorized To Be Issued By This Act; To Amend Section 65-4-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By Section 2, Senate Bill No. 2923, 2011 Regular Session, To Increase By $60,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds Authorized To Be Issued Under The Economic Development Highway Act; To Amend Section 25, Chapter 533, Laws Of 2010, As Amended By Section 4, Chapter 30, Laws Of 2010 Second Extraordinary Session, As Amended By Section 1, House Bill No. 403, 2011 Regular Session, To Increase By $73,000,000.00 The Amount Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The Mississippi Industry Incentive Financing Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 57-61-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $323,100,000.00 To $331,500,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $32,500,000.00 To $40,100,000.00 The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Utilize Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act To Make Loans Or Grants To Counties And Municipalities Through An Equipment And Public Facilities Grant And Loan Fund To Aid In Infrastructure-related Improvements, The Purchase Of Equipment And In The Purchase, Construction Or Repair And Renovation Of Public Facilities; To Increase From $750,000.00 To $1,550,000.00 The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Utilize Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act For The Purpose Of Making Payments To Loan Loss Reserve Accounts Established At Financial Institutions That Participate In The Capital Access Program Established By The Authority; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $1,500,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Rural Impact Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 For The Mississippi Existing Industry Productivity Loan Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 For The Ace Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $200,000.00 To Provide Funds For Improvements To The Jackson Zoo; To Amend Sections 6 Through 20, Chapter 521, Laws Of 1995, As Last Amended By Section 47, Chapter 533, Laws Of 2010, To Increase From $26,143,000.00 To $28,843,000.00 The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued For The Local Governments And Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan Fund; To Amend Sections 136 Through 151, Chapter 1, Laws Of 2004 Third Extraordinary Session, As Last Amended By Section 48, Chapter 533, Laws Of 2010, To Increase The Amount Of Bonds That May Be Issued For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Supplementary Rural Fire Truck Fund And The Rural Fire Truck Fund; To Extend The Authority To Issue Such Bonds Until July 1, 2013; To Amend Sections 37-31-71, 37-31-73 And 37-31-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize School Districts, Community Or Junior College Districts And Local Governments To Enter Into Agreements To Establish Regional Education Centers; To Amend Sections 97 Through 118, Chapter 1, Laws Of 2004 Third Extraordinary Session, As Last Amended By Section 1, Chapter 511, Laws Of 2010, To Revise The Use Of Certain Bond Proceeds Allocated To Mississippi Valley State University And To Extend Until July 1, 2013, The Date After Which No Bonds May Be Issued Under This Section; To Amend Section 1, Chapter 533, Laws Of 2010, To Authorize Bond Proceeds Allocated To The State Veterans Affairs Board For Correction Of Roofing Deficiencies And Correction Of Smoking Room Ventilation Systems To Be Utilized At The Veteran's Home In Kosciusko; To Clarify The Use Of Bond Proceeds Authorized To Be Utilized To Convert Capitol Street In Jackson, Mississippi, Into A Two-way Thoroughfare; To Authorize Bond Proceeds Allocated To The Mississippi Sports Hall Of Fame To Be Utilized For Furniture, Fixtures And Equipment; To Clarify The Use Of Bond Proceeds Allocated For A Highway Lighting Project; To Amend Section 5, Chapter 538, Laws Of 2006, As Last Amended By Section 17, Chapter 511, Laws Of 2010, To Clarify That Bond Proceeds Allocated For The Southern Arts And Entertainment Center May Be Utilized To Purchase Real Estate For Such Center; To Amend Sections 1 Through 24, Chapter 522, Laws Of 2003, As Last Amended By Section 21, Chapter 580, Laws Of 2007, To Authorize The Use Of Certain Bond Proceeds Allocated To The Department Of Mental Health To Be Utilized For General Repairs And Renovations And Completion Of Previously Authorized Projects; To Amend Section 1, Chapter 580, Laws Of 2007, As Last Amended By Section 56, Chapter 557, Laws Of 2009, To Revise The Purposes For Which The Proceeds Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The Mississippi Industries For The Blind May Be Used; To Amend Section 57-1-221, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By Section 3, House Bill No. 403, 2011 Regular Session, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "approved Business Enterprise" For Purposes Of The Mississippi Industry Incentive Financing Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 65-4-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend Until July 1, 2013, The Repeal Date On Certain Projects That Are Included Within The Definition Of "high Economic Benefit Project" Under The Economic Development Highway Act And To Revise The Definition Of The Term "private Company" Under The Economic Development Highway Act To Include Tourism Enterprises; To Amend Section 9, Chapter 580, Laws Of 2007, As Amended By Section 4, Chapter 533, Laws Of 2010, To Increase The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued To Provide Funds For The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A Children's Museum In Hinds County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Be Utilized As Matching Funds For Roads And Parking At The Mississippi Craft Center; To Authorize The Issuance Of $750,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Construction Of A New Cabin And The Repair And Renovation Of The Mississippi Future Farmers Of America Center In Raymond, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $200,000.00 For Repair And Renovation Of Old Eureka High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $750,000.00 For Repair And Renovation Of Old Hattiesburg High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of $1,250,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Mississippi Community Heritage Preservation Grant Fund; To Amend Section 39-5-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds To Pay The Cost Of Repair And Renovation At The Greenville Higher Education Center; To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Military Housing Units And Ancillary Supporting Facilities For The Units That Are Acquired Or Constructed Pursuant To The Military Housing Privatization Initiative; To Amend Section 27-33-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "home" Or "homestead" For Purposes Of The Homestead Exemption Law; To Reenact Sections 57-107-1, 57-107-3, 57-107-5 And 57-107-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establish The Mississippi Delta Area Workforce Training Project, A Pilot Program Aimed At Implementing Coordinated Strategies For Improving The Retention And Expansion Of Jobs In The Mississippi Delta Region, That Is Administered By A Delta Workforce Coordinator For Job Retention And Expansion, And Create The Delta Workforce Cabinet; To Amend Section 9 Chapter 471, Laws Of 2009, To Extend Until July 1, 2016, The Repeal Date On The Mississippi Delta Area Workforce Training Project; To Designate The Mississippi Development Authority As The Agency To Implement A State Program And Participate In The Federal State Small Business Credit Initiative Act Of 2010; To Authorize The Issuance Of $1,750,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Proceeds Of Certain Bonds May Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority To Reimburse Certain Costs Related To The Administration Of The Fund; To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Sell Advertising And Other Tourism Promotional Information Through The Mississippi Development Authority Internet Website And Other Marketing Outlets, And To Enter Into Agreements With Tourism Associations And Similar Entities For The Purpose Of Making And Facilitating Sales Through The Use Of Such Entities; To Create The Mississippi Railroad Improvements Fund; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Establish A Program To Make Grants From The Mississippi Railroad Improvements Fund To Assist In Paying A Portion Of The Costs Associated With The Repair, Rehabilitation, Construction, Reconstruction, Upgrading And Improvement Of Railroad Lines And Related Facilities, Including Projects Necessary To Ensure Safety And Structural Integrity Of Rail Lines, Rail Beds And Bridges; To Provide The Manner In Which Entities Apply For The Grants; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Railroad Improvements Fund; To Amend Sections 25 Through 40, Chapter 522, Laws Of 2003, To Provide That Certain Bond Proceeds Issued For Moon Lake State Park In Coahoma County Shall Be Utilized To Retire Such Bonds; And For Related Purposes.

2984.title: Suffrage; restore to Chris Mathis.
2984.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Chris Mathis, Of Tippah County, Mississippi.

2985.title: Income tax, jobs credit; aggregate jobs created by qualifying business in entertainment dist. for purposes of minimum jobs req.
2985.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-73-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "business Enterprise" For Purposes Of The Income Tax Jobs Credit To Include Entities That Are Qualifying Businesses Under The Mississippi Entertainment District Act; To Provide That For The Purposes Of Determining Eligibility For The Income Tax Jobs Credit, All Net Full-time Jobs Created Within An Entertainment District By Business Enterprises That Are Qualifying Businesses Under The Mississippi Entertainment District Act Shall Be Aggregated Within That Entertainment District And That All Qualifying Businesses In An Entertainment District Shall Be Eligible For Such Tax Credits When The Aggregate Number Of Net Full-time Jobs Created In That Entertainment District Meets The Required Minimum Number Of Jobs; And For Related Purposes.

2986.title: Bonds; increase amount authorized for a children's museum in Hinds County.
2986.description: An Act To Amend Section 9, Chapter 580, Laws Of 2007 As Amended By Section 4, Chapter 533, Laws Of 2010, To Increase By $600,000.00 The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued To Provide Funds For The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A Children's Museum In Hinds County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2987.title: Madison County; may allow certain types of gates on county roads.
2987.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Madison County, Mississippi, To Allow Gates To Be Placed On County Roads For The Purpose Of Enclosing A Neighborhood If The Gate Opens Automatically Upon Approach Of Any Motor Vehicle Without The Use Of A Key, Code Or Other Device; To Provide That Such Gates Shall Not Be Considered An Obstruction To The Road Of The Type That Is Prohibited By Section 65-7-7; And For Related Purposes.

2991.title: Indianola Tourism Commission; remove date of repeal.
2991.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 931, Local And Private Laws Of 2003, As Amended By Chapter 959, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, To Remove The July 1, 2011, Repeal Date On The Law That Creates The Indianola Tourism Commission, Provides For The Composition Of The Commission, Prescribes The Powers And Duties Of The Commission And Authorizes The Governing Authorities To Levy A Tax To Fund The Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2992.title: Pike County; authorize extension of the qualifying deadline for candidates for certain county offices.
2992.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Pike County, Mississippi, To Extend The Qualifying Deadline For Primary And General Elections Occurring In Calendar Year 2011 Until June 1, 2011, For Candidates For The Office Of County Board Of Education, Constable, Justice Court Judge And Board Of Supervisors; And For Related Purposes.

2993.title: Kemper County; authorize contributions to East Mississippi Community Development Empowerment, Inc.
2993.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Kemper County, Mississippi, To Make A Contribution To East Mississippi Community Development Empowerment, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

2995.title: City of Vicksburg; may authorize transport of goods with a width in excess of the maximum otherwise authorized by law.
2995.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Authorize A Motor Vehicle To Transport Goods Within The Corporate Limits Of The City With A Width In Excess Of The Maximum Authorized By Law If Certain Requirements Are Met; And For Related Purposes.

2997.title: Suffrage; restore to Billy Gene Barnes.
2997.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Billy Gene Barnes Of Tippah County, Mississippi.

2998.title: Franklin County; authorize to construct jail anywhere in the county.
2998.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Franklin County, Mississippi, To Construct A New County Jail Anywhere Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

2999.title: City of Greenwood; authorize the levy of a tax on hotels and motels.
2999.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Greenwood, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel And Motel Room Rentals In The City; To Provide That The Revenue From Such Tax Shall Be Utilized To Promote Tourism And Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

3000.title: City of Greenwood; extend repeal date on the Greenwood Tourism Commission.
3000.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 813, Local And Private Laws Of 1989, As Last Amended By Chapter 937, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Revise The Membership Of The Greenwood Tourism Commission And To Extend The Repeal Date On The Commission And The Taxes Levied To Support The Commission Until September 30, 2015; And For Related Purposes.

3001.title: Benton County; authorize contributions to the United Community Action Agency, Inc.
3001.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Benton County, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually, Through Calendar Year 2015, To United Community Action Agency, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

3002.title: City of D'Iberville; authorize a tax upon hotels, motels and restaurants to be used for certain purposes.
3002.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of D'iberville, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants; To Provide That The Revenue From The Tax Shall Be Expended By The City Of D'iberville To Promote Tourism And Parks And Recreation; To Provide That The Tax Shall Be Collected By The Department Of Revenue And Paid To The City Of D'iberville; To Provide For An Election On Whether The Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

3003.title: Harrison County; authorize contributions to the "Feed My Sheep" program.
3003.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Harrison County To Contribute Funds To The "feed My Sheep" Program; And For Related Purposes.

3005.title: Marshall County; create the Cayce Community Sewer System.
3005.description: An Act To Provide For The Creation Of The Cayce Community Sewer District In Marshall County, Mississippi; To Provide That The District Created Pursuant To The Provisions Of This Act, Acting By And Through The Board Of Supervisors Of Marshall County, Mississippi, Its Governing Authority, Shall Have All Powers With Respect To Wastewater Facilities Granted To Districts By Section 19-5-151 Et Seq., Mississippi Code Of 1972; And For Related Purposes.

3006.title: Forrest County & City of Hattiesburg; expand areas in which may acquire property for industrial purposes.
3006.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 855, Local And Private Laws Of 1978, As Last Amended By Chapter 946, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, To Grant The City Of Hattiesburg, Forrest County And The Forrest County Industrial Park Commission Additional Powers Relating To The Funding Of Certain Projects In The Industrial Park; And For Related Purposes.

3007.title: Lafayette County; authorize contributions to the Interfaith Compassion Ministries Homeless Shelter programs and facilities.
3007.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lafayette County, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually To The Interfaith Compassion Ministries Homeless Shelter Programs And Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

3008.title: Warren County; authorize contributions to various organizations.
3008.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Central Mississippi Prevention Services, Inc.; Mississippi Food Network; The Initiative, Inc.; Triumph Ministries, Inc.; Vicksburg Family Development Services, Inc.; Vicksburg Main Street Project; Warren Washington Issaquena Sharkey Community Action Agency, Inc.; We Care Community Services, Inc.; And Women's Restoration Shelter Of Mountain Faith Ministries; And For Related Purposes.

3009.title: Tippah County; authorize contributions to the United Community Action Agency, Inc.
3009.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tippah County, Mississippi, To Contribute To United Community Action Agency, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

3010.title: Oxford & Lafayette County; authorize termination of Oxford/Lafayette County Comm. Health Foundation if hosp. facilities are sold.
3010.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 849, Local And Private Laws Of 1989, As Amended By Chapter 939, Local And Private Laws Of 1994, To Authorize The City Of Oxford, Mississippi, And The Board Of Supervisors Of Lafayette County, Mississippi, To Terminate The Oxford/lafayette County Community Health Foundation Upon The Termination Of The Lease Agreement Related To An Amendment Of The Lease Agreement To Include An Option To Purchase The Oxford Lafayette Medical Center And Subsequent Sale Of The Hospital Based On The Exercise Of The Option So That The City And County No Longer Hold Any Title To The Hospital; To Provide That The Assets Of The Fund Shall Be Liquidated And Distributed In Equal Amounts To The City And The County; To Provide That The Liquidated Assets May Be Appropriated And Used By The City And The County For Any Purpose; And For Related Purposes.

3011.title: City of Oxford; establish the City of Oxford Municipal Reserve and Trust Fund.
3011.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Oxford, Mississippi, To Establish The City Of Oxford Municipal Reserve And Trust Fund; To Provide That All Proceeds Received By The City As A Result Of The Termination Of Lease And For The Sale Of The Real And Personal Property Related To The Baptist Memorial Hospital-north Mississippi Facilities Located On Lamar Avenue Shall Be Deposited Into The Fund; To Provide For The Establishment Of The Board Of Trustees Of The City Of Oxford Municipal Reserve And Trust Fund And Provide For The Appointment Of Its Members; To Provide For The Powers And Duties Of The Board Of Trustees; To Provide For The Investment Of The Assets Of The Trust Fund; To Provide That The Fund Shall Be Divided Into A Corpus Component And An Earning Component; To Provide That The Corpus Component Shall Remain Inviolate Except As Otherwise Provided In This Act; To Provide That The Earnings Component Shall Be Transferred From The Trust Fund To The General Fund Of The City And Shall Be Available For Appropriation And Spending By The Governing Authorities Of The City; To Authorize Money From The Corpus Of The Trust To Be Expended By The City Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

3012.title: Suffrage; authorize restoration of suffrage to Lynn Terry.
3012.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Lynn Terry Of Oktibbeha County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

3014.title: Mayor-council form of government; council members of certain may have offices in city hall.
3014.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-8-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Municipal Population Threshold Below Which Councilmen And Councilwomen May Not Have An Office In City Hall In Those Cities Operating Under A Mayor-council Form Of Government; And For Related Purposes.

3015.title: Issaquena County; authorize participation in a project to install turbines in the Mississippi River to generate electricity.
3015.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Issaquena County, Mississippi, To Participate In A Project To Design And Locate A Turbine Or Turbines On Barges Or Other Devices In The Mississippi River Which Will Generate Electricity For Sale By The County Or The Nonprofit Corporation Authorized By This Act; To Authorize Issaquena County, Mississippi, Or The Nonprofit Corporation Authorized By This Act To Finance The Cost Of The Project By The Issuance Of Revenue Bonds Or A Similar Financing Arrangement Utilizing The Proceeds Of The Sale Of The Electricity Generated By The Project And Other Legal Sources; To Authorize Issaquena County, Mississippi, To Participate In The Project By The Incorporation Of A Mississippi Nonprofit Corporation; To Provide For The Compensation Of The Board Of Directors; To Exempt Contracts Related To The Project From The Bid Laws To The Extent Allowed By Law; To Authorize The Employment Of Legal Counsel And To Provide For The Compensation Of Such Legal Counsel; And For Related Purposes.

3017.title: Senate Rules; authorize appointment of a Chaplain for the Mississippi Senate.
3017.description: A Resolution To Amend The Senate Rules To Authorize The Appointment Of A Chaplain For The Mississippi Senate.

3018.title: Senate Rules; limit number of resolution presentations on the floor of the Senate.
3018.description: A Resolution Adopting Senate Rule 28a To Limit The Number Of Resolution Presentations Which A Senator May Make On The Floor Of The Senate.

3019.title: Senate Rules; authorize bills and resolutions to be prepared on letter-size paper.
3019.description: A Resolution To Amend Senate Rule No. 73 To Provide That Beginning With The 2012 Regular Session All Bills And Resolutions May Be Prepared On Letter-size Or Legal-size Paper.

3020.title: Amend Senate Rules to limit private discourse on the Senate floor while the Senate is in session.
3020.description: A Resolution To Amend Senate Rule No. 34 To Provide That Senators And Senate Staff Shall Not Be Permitted To Engage In Private Discourse On The Senate Floor While The Senate Is In Session Except At The Sides Of The Senate Chamber.

3021.title: Senate Rules; amend to require an unedited copy of the Senate Journal from the previous day available to any Senator.
3021.description: A Resolution To Amend Senate Rule 25 To Direct The Secretary To Make An Unedited Copy Of The Senate Journal From The Previous Legislative Day Available In The Senate Lounge And On The Senate Floor Upon The Request Of Any Senator.

3022.title: Commend Clarkdale High School Cheerleading Team for winning Class 3A Large Division State Championship.
3022.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Clarkdale High School "bulldogs" Cheerleaders For Winning The 2010 Class 3a Large Division State Cheer Championship.

3023.title: Commend life of business and community leader Terry Wray.
3023.description: A Resolution Commending The Life Of Mr. Terrance M. (terry) Wray, Respected Jackson And Rankin County Business And Community Leader.

3024.title: Commend life and educational service of Dr. Arthur Kinnard, Jr.
3024.description: A Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Educational Leadership Of Dr. Arthur H. Kinnard, Jr., Former President Of Utica Junior College And Associate Professor At Mississippi Valley State University.

3025.title: Recognize Scott Sisters for Mississippi Workers' Center for Human Rights "Fannie Lou Hamer Award."
3025.description: A Resolution Recognizing Jamie And Gladys Scott (the Scott Sisters) Upon Their Receipt Of The Mississippi Workers' Center For Human Rights "fannie Lou Hamer Award."

3026.title: Recognize Dollie Creath for Mississippi Workers' Center for Human Rights "Fannie Lou Hamer Award."
3026.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Saluting Dollie R. Creath Of Greenville, Mississippi, Upon Her Receipt Of The 10th Annual Mississippi Workers' Center For Human Rights "fannie Lou Hamer Award."

3027.title: Welcome Turkish Delegation.
3027.description: A Resolution Welcoming And Recognizing Visiting Members Of The Grand National Assembly Of Turkey.

3028.title: Recognize contributions of Republic of Turkey and of Turquoise Council of Americans and Eurasians.
3028.description: A Resolution Recognizing The Contributions Of The Republic Of Turkey And The Turquoise Council Of Americans And Eurasians, Including The Value Of Mississippi's Positive Relationship With Them, And Recognizing The Mississippi-turkish Hospitality Leadership Network.

3029.title: Salute US Secretary of the Navy and former MS Governor Ray Mabus on the occasion of "Mississippi Navy Week."
3029.description: A Resolution Saluting United States Secretary Of The Navy And Former Mississippi Governor Ray Mabus On The Occasion Of "mississippi Navy Week."

3030.title: Commend Jesse Smith on retirement from MDOC.
3030.description: A Resolution Commending Jesse O. Smith, Jr., Upon His Retirement As Human Resources Director From The Mississippi Department Of Corrections.

3031.title: Commend Ralph Barnes for service to the State Board of Public Contractors.
3031.description: A Resolution Commending Mr. Ralph Barnes For His Committed Dedication To The Mississippi State Board Of Contractors And The Construction Industry.

3032.title: Commend Morgan Wesson for 2011 MHSAA Lindy Callahan Scholar-Athlete Award.
3032.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Commending Gulfport High School Star Soccer Player Morgan Wesson Upon Her Receipt Of The 2011 Mhsaa Lindy Callahan Scholar-athlete Award.

3033.title: Mourn the loss of Jobie Martin, Jackson television personality and civic leader.
3033.description: A Resolution Mourning The Loss Of Jackson Television Personality And Civic Leader Jobie L. Martin.

3034.title: Commend public service of Senator Lee Yancey.
3034.description: A Resolution To Commend Senator Lee Yancey For His Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

3035.title: Commend public service of Senator Walter Michel.
3035.description: A Resolution To Commend Senator J. Walter Michel Iii For His Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

3036.title: Commend public service of Senator Cindy Hyde-Smith.
3036.description: A Resolution To Commend Senator Cindy Hyde-smith For Her Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

3037.title: Commend public service of Senator Tom King.
3037.description: A Resolution To Commend Senator Thomas Edward (tom) King, Jr., For His Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

3038.title: Commend public service of Senate President Pro Tempore Billy Hewes.
3038.description: A Resolution To Commend Senate President Pro Tempore Billy Hewes For His Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

3039.title: Recognize UMC as one of the largest economic development generators in the state and for diversity supplier initiative.
3039.description: A Resolution Recognizing The University Of Mississippi Medical Center As One Of The Largest Economic Development Generators In The State And For Its Diversity Supplier Initiative.

3040.title: Commemorate legacy of Marshall County Sheriff Osborne Bell.
3040.description: A Resolution To Commemorate The Legacy Of Marshall County Sheriff Osborne Bell Who Was Lost In The Line Of Duty On May 7, 1986.

3041.title: Commend career and public service of Moyle H. "Butch" Surrette to Yalobusha County upon his retirement.
3041.description: A Resolution Commending The Career And Public Service Of Moyle H. "butch" Surrette, Yalobusha County District 3 Supervisor.

3042.title: Commend public service of Lieutenant Governor Phil Bryant.
3042.description: A Resolution To Commend Lieutenant Governor Phil Bryant For His Distinguished Service As President Of The Mississippi Senate.

3043.title: Recognize Dr. M. Christopher Brown II as the 18th President of Alcorn State University.
3043.description: A Resolution Recognizing Dr. M. Christopher Brown Ii As The 18th President Of Alcorn State University.

3044.title: Salute Mississippi's "The Band Perry" for winning Academy of Country Music Top New Artist Award.
3044.description: A Resolution Saluting Mississippi's "the Band Perry" For Winning The Top New Artist Award At The Prestigious Academy Of Country Music Awards In Las Vegas.

3045.title: Salute Chief Master Sergeant Harold Wilcher on retirement after 40 years in the Mississippi Air National Guard.
3045.description: A Resolution To Salute Chief Master Sergeant Harold B. Wilcher On The Occasion Of His Retirement After 40 Years Of Dedicated And Faithful Service To His Country In The Mississippi Air National Guard.

3046.title: Commend Governor Haley Barbour for service to State of Mississippi.
3046.description: A Resolution To Commend Governor Haley Barbour For His Distinguished Service To The State Of Mississippi.

3048.title: Constitutional amendment; reduce the size of the Legislature.
3048.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 254, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Reduce The Size Of The Legislature.

3049.title: United States Constitution; urge Congress to call convention to amend relative to a flat-rate income tax system.
3049.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Call A Convention For The Sole Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To A Flat-rate Income Tax System And Urging And Requesting The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Apply To The Congress To Call Such A Convention.

3050.title: Urge Congress to adopt legislation addressing clean energy development and climate change.
3050.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The United States Congress To Adopt Legislation That Promotes Jobs And Innovative Energy Development, Heightens National Energy And Economic Security, Positions The United States To Be An International Leader In The Field Of Clean Energy, And Addresses The Consequences Of Climate Change Without Preempting States' Rights To Control Emissions And To Promote Renewable Energy.

3051.title: Recognize Larry Houchins on 30th Anniversary as Executive Director of The Mississippi Bar.
3051.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating Honorable Larry Houchins On The Occasion Of His 30th Anniversary As Executive Director Of The Mississippi Bar.

3052.title: Constitution; authorize alternative forms of county government.
3052.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Add Section 260-a To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Providing For The Creation Of Alternative Forms Of County Government By Majority Vote Of The Electors Of Any County In A Manner To Be Prescribed By Law.

3053.title: Recognize legendary Mississippi football star Marcus Dupree on the occasion of his ESPN documentary.
3053.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Legacy Of Legendary Mississippi Football Star Marcus Dupree From Philadelphia, Mississippi, On The Occasion Of The November 9, 2010, "espn" Documentary On His Career.

3054.title: Recognizing William "Lex" Taylor as new Chairman of Mississippi Manufacturers Association (MMA).
3054.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating William A. "lex" Taylor Of Louisville, Mississippi, Chairman And Ceo Of Taylor Machine Works, For His Appointment As Chairman Of The Mississippi Manufacturers Association (mma).

3055.title: Commend the life and judicial legacy of Judge Robert G. (Bob) Evans of Magee, Mississippi.
3055.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Passing And Commend The Judicial Legacy Of Judge Robert G. (bob) Evans Of Magee, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

3056.title: Commend life of Afghanistan casualty U.S. Army Sergeant Eric C. Newman.
3056.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Mourning The Loss Of United States Army Sergeant Eric C. Newman Of Waynesboro, Mississippi, Who Died On October 14, 2010, From Wounds Received In Action In Afghanistan, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

3057.title: Congratulate "MasterChef" grand winner Whitney Miller of Poplarville, Mississippi.
3057.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating Miss Whitney Miller Of Poplarville, Mississippi For Earning The Title "master Chef" In The Fox Television Network's Reality Cooking Competition Series.

3058.title: Mourn the loss of Afghanistan casualty Lance Corporal Joshua Ose of Hernando, Mississippi.
3058.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Mourning The Loss Of United States Marine Lance Corporal Joshua Ose Of Hernando, Mississippi, Who Was Lost In Action In Afghanistan On September 20, 2010, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

3059.title: Remember the gallant service and mourn the loss of Afghanistan casualty U.S. Army Private William Brandon Dawson of Tunica, MS.
3059.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Mourning The Loss Of United States Army Private William Brandon Dawson Of Tunica, Mississippi, Who Died On September 24, 2010, From Injuries Received In Action In Kabul, Afghanistan.

3060.title: Mourn the loss of Chancellor James H.C. Thomas, Jr., of Hattiesburg, Mississippi.
3060.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Public Service Of Chancellor James H.c. Thomas, Jr., Of Hattiesburg, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

3061.title: Commend St. Stanislaus "Rock-a-Chaws" Baseball Team for Class 4A State Championship (third State Championship for 2009-2010).
3061.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The St. Stanislaus "rock-a-chaws" Baseball Team And Coach Mark Logan For Winning Its First-ever Mhsaa Class 4a State Championship, The Bay St. Louis School's Third State Championship For 2009-2010.

3062.title: Mourn the loss of former State Senator, U.S. Attorney and World War II Veteran Thomas R. Ethridge of Oxford, Mississippi.
3062.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Career Of Public Service Of Former State Senator, U.s. Attorney And World War Ii Veteran Thomas Ramage Ethridge Of Oxford, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.
